5RdeCL-9RnUeN-q6Frr4KA.text: Sometimes you miss the hidden gems in your own back yard.  Nestled in a small plaza on lake mead and rampart this restaurant offers a casual but intimate with a bistro style ambiance.  Menu items include tapas which are well priced and amazing flavor. The garlic edamame is wonderful with roasted garlic and Shoshito peppers.  The vegetable potstickers were also very good.  They serve cucumber water and have a superb wine list - with half price (select) wine on Thursdays!   They have vegetarian options as well as great dinner entrees with meat and seafood made  with fresh ingredients and sauces.  Staff was all very friendly and attentive which made the Experience well worth the visit. Would definitely recommend it and will add to my list of regular places to dine!

NkNN_4kYUKgVhvLNkxcEjQ.text: Arawan has been my favorite Thai restaurant for a while but I think I have a new favorite.  We ordered: Chicken Satay Chicken pad thai Mussels  Garlic rice Mango and sticky rice  We didn't leave anything on our plates lol. Everything was so amazing. My favorite thing was the garlic rice and it was paired perfectly with the mussels! The broth on the mussels was so good by itself.  I would come here again and again and again. The decor is cute, food is great, and the service was good.

xtg2f8LRzWU4TPbxPcYdQw.text: We have loved Nittayas since it opened for business. Have taken many a friend. It was always fabulous , until the last 3 times. The food is greasy. Not the same. As all the other times. Also there is change in staff. What's going on? We would have given it a 5 until now. Does Nittayas still own the place? Sami

F4M-sO_XF9ONaR6LFnqStQ.text: Liked it.   Super small place. Sat at the bar (didn't make reservations). Overall service was good. Food was great. Didn't really care for the Thai chicken wings but the mussels were delicious.   What we had Thai chicken wings Mussels Ahi tuna Bacon wrapped shrimp  Over all good. I will be back. Bedtime with a reservation. Lol.

Yu_k1rrgb8P0vyqK_jfLRw.text: Wow. I've been here so many times in such a short time and it is my all-time favorite restaurant. The service is always amazing and the food is out of this world. I've tried many thai restaurants in Vegas and this has by far the best food. Try anything here, and you will not regret it!  Everytime I come, I always make sure to order the chicken pad thai, crispy pork belly, and of course, the mango sticky rice.  The chicken pad thai is very flavorful and it is bottom line AMAZING. The flavors really come alive once you squeeze the lemon on top. The noodles are always well cooked so there is a little chew to it.  The crispy pork belly is a hit or a miss with the portions. The difference in sizes vary with a big difference depending on the chef. But regardless, it is soooo good. I usually don't like foods with a lot of fat, but my goodness.. It just melts in your mouth with that very light crispiness. The sauce that it comes with on the side complements it very well. It is a tangy spicy sauce.  And my favorite... The MANGO WITH STICKY RICE! This place was the first place I've ever tried this dish. I will not eat this at any other place because my taste buds are spoiled! When I went a couple weeks ago, there wasn't any mangos ripe yet because it's not the right season, so we got the deep fried banana and it was just as delicious. The outside of the banana is not your typical tempura; it's coconut shavings! It added a crispiness that's almost like a chip. The banana is also topped with coconut ice cream, which has actual coconut in it! I asked for a side of sticky rice and it paired well together with the banana and ice cream.  Definitely recommend this place to anyone and everyone! Don't miss out on this gem!!!

Service is efficient and friendly.  Setting quite nice although a bit cramped in some tables. Overall a great choice in the area. Definitely a level above even the good local Thai places around Summerlin.

MejZuGlWilouX593r2JirQ.text: We just thought this place was just the same old Thai Food but... when we tasted this place. OMG!It was the best place ever. ji94b7v0KhvBEmsF0ZE1iQ.text: Food was fantastic, service was pretty good, but I have never been asked to leave a restaurant because there were people waiting for our table. Unbelievable! Very rude! Never in my life have I had this happen. Our feeling was that once we paid our check we were no longer valued. Very disappointed.

UehI8gTSHTjV3gUcyeleIg.text: It's a small but very well decorated spot. The menu was easy to read and went into enough detail so we weren't stuck asking 100 questions. The wine list was also very good and impressive. We sat outside in the middle of October. It wasn't very chilly when we sat, but as the night went on... It became rather cold. We asked the server to put on the heat lamps, but they were out of propane. The food was delicious. They were able to modify certain items and make them vegan for me. Everything tasted wonderful. The food did take quite some time to come out, close to 45 min. Luckily it was worth the wait. I thought perhaps they forgot us, but apparently they were just slow or backed up. My dad said the lamb was the best he has ever had. The seating was comfortable and the staff was nice for the most part. The bathroom was also clean and nicely decorated. I will definitely be back.

BSWet27r74_Z3X0nkqbO0A.text: I don't usually give out 5 star ratings but this one kind of deserves it. We got 4 different dishes and I loved them all. 2 tapas, 1 curry, and 1 dessert. I've been to a few tapas joints but none are worthy of my 5 star rating. This is as best as it gets for both Thai and tapas :)! It's also definitely 2 $$s.  Absolutely no complaints about service either. This is also a very cozy little place so there's not a lot of room. It'll be a lot more busier during dinner time because of the small space. It's got dim lighting but it's a very peaceful environment especially with the soft music. The servers are ultra polite, professional, and friendly. You also get a special type of water but not sure if you can really taste it. If they didn't tell me at the beginning I don't think I would have noticed it at all. Ours had apple and something else (not sure) but I really couldn't taste it -- but that's not really important, I suppose :b.  WHAT WE ORDERED: Cilantro Steak Skewers (BBQ) Thai Wings Duck Breast Curry Family Style Coconut Ice Cream (has sticky rice)  THEY'RE ALL GOOD :)! So feel free to try them. Good as in I'd totally get them again. Heard some good things about the mango shrimp so I'll give that a try next time!

TSdEgfcDipdrhY3d5kpD-Q.text: This is a great place to come have some wine and food during Happy Hour, the atmosphere is great, I loved this place the decor is perfect and the Wine & Thai mix theme very interesting concept unique place for sure, I will be visiting again soon for Happy Hour

oL2E6CvF6EfOSIPKaRv4Lg.text: My husband and I had some good friends in town, and wanted to take them somewhere for dinner that they couldn't experience where they live. Nittaya's certainly fit the bill!  Speaking of bills, I'll start there - we were shocked when the bill arrived, and were anticipating it to be about 30% more than it was. For $120 (before tip), we ordered:  The famous tempura spinach salad Corn fritters  Wontons  Spring rolls Shrimp pad Thai Chicken pad Thai FOB rice Emerald rice  a Thai iced tea  If you've been here before, you know that is a lot of food! We took home leftovers for sure!  My friend is a pescetarian, and our server was happy to have our dressing for the spinach salad prepared without ground chicken. She also pointed out that the corn fritters contained pork when she brought them to the table, which I thought was nice since we were sharing, and my friend hasn't seen the item description.   My heat level here is 1-5, I ordered a 3 and was happy with that...their 3 would be a 4 at Le Thai. My FOB rice was astounding - full of tender chicken, and juicy pineapple. All the shared tapas were fantastic also!   Our friends have been to Las Vegas many times, and we love taking them different places each visit, but they have already requested we come back here on their next visit this fall! So glad we decided to let them in on one of Las Vegas' best Secrets.

We shared a few plates so we can try a variety and we all thought the boat noodle was a little too salty. But the red curry was delicious! Also the sauce for the spinach chips and the raw shrimp was very flavorful. Would definitely return and recommend!

p0g63BxvD_vMLAtTxt11yw.text: One of my all time favorite restaurants. I come back time and time again, pleased with my meal each time. There has not been one thing on the menu that I have tried and been disappointed in. I highly recommend this restaurant to friends and have only gotten positive feedback from those who have gone.

wx1DOtzoFQQGkuZEfcw82g.text: One of mine and my sisters favorites! The staff is amazing and this place seriously got me hooked on coconut soup! It's super cozy and perfect for a date night or just hanging out with friends.

AollKsP9S61oMX9Kvr2lAA.text: Food this good should never be a secret. Me and my wife had date night with a couple of friends. As we walked up to the venue we noticed that a considerable amount of people were already neatly tucked into their out door bistro style seating. We went in and immediately to our left was this kickback bar with a wall decorated with various wines. To the right was table and semi booth seating. The ambience was great! It was a mix between a hip dive bar and chic and exclusive eatery. This is a very cool place to take a date. The menu has plenty to choose from. We tried the corn fritters which were yummy, super delicious chicken lettuce wraps, green curry, avocado steak, volcano shrimp that was soo good I can still taste it and I  special requested a coconut curry chicken. To my delight, my curry was served in a roasted coconut bowl with sweet coconut lining the inside of the shell. I love love love loved it! The servers were attentive and accommodating. I'm looking forward to returning. If you love tai food or are looking for a great first time experience you should totally go here. It has an upbeat atmosphere that's great if you don't mind crowds.

KuyXaVpzWl5JhstJbqZA9A.text: I've eaten in plenty of Thai Restaurants, here and even in Thailand. This was some of the finest I've had. We had Drunken Noodles, a spinach salad that was done as tempura and a Cornish hen....excellent!!! I definitely recommend this establishment

c4G1brTe3pyuyYDxyk6suA.text: I got the Shrimp Pad Thai. The shrimp was rubbery and didn't taste fresh at all.  Also, $20 dollars is overkill.   I didn't know that this was a fancy sit down place.  They looked annoyed when I asked for something to go.  Overpriced food, extremely small, and full of Summerlin snobs.  I don't recommend going if you're a family or want to have an experience that was worth every buck you earn.

wo8KbBGmaRZoObdCuyIu2g.text: Food was delicious. I didn't try any of their wine, but the flavors of everything else were spot-on. Be aware, however, it's a tight space, and rather classy, so it was awkward having our toddler there with us. It's rather far from our house, so we probably won't be back anyway.

HVkv5rwR4noympriFK0W1w.text: Small, intimate, great service. Good selection of wines. Spinach salad and soft shell crab are my favorite dishes! The small plates are all delicious and great for sharing!

OhRI3qULMx3XRKfKjYF4Lg.text: Thai food in vegas can be quite difficult to find.  Next to Lotus of Siam, Nittaya's is my favorite.  They have some interesting dishes such as the spinach salad and the charred peppers and are also willing to account for those of us with dietary restrictions.  In addition to the above mentioned dishes I also had the basil eggplant with tofu.  I wish I had ordered it a 5 spicy, as I got the 3 and tasted no spice at all.  The flavor was great, and would get it again, just order a higher spice level.  The decor is great, the waitstaff is nice.  The place is tiny so reservations are recommended it was packed when we went.

gsqQ8CXKG2ohxomUpZ70hg.text: This is a good Thai restaurant. Prices are on the high side.  They serve  dinner only and are not open late. The menu is limited.

5DZMGhuj_nV5LhLHg7-pEg.text: Nice, small, cozy place. Has dinning room seating as well as a bar. Food is fantastic with good portions as well as good service.

FQpP62yw328cI-DfOt9H-w.text: I've had a restaurant.com GC for this place for awhile, and my girlfriend and I finally gave it a shot tonight. The place was a lot smaller than we had expected... it only had a few tables, and it was dimly lit. The service was fantastic, though! Our waitress Tatiana told us so much about the menu and about everything they do. We tried to order the ahi tuna and another tapa, but they were out of those. So we ended up getting the spinach salad, the minced shrimp puffs, and the shrimp pastry, as well as a dish of drunken noodles. The shrimps dishes were OK, but not great. The spinach salad was delicious! No wonder this is their most popular item. The drunken noodles was good, but the chicken wasn't in pieces and was kinda weird to me. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised, and the service will probably get me back in through their doors. Hopefully I can try their ahi tuna next time. Mmmmm.

c8YgLSKLkp0VVAp1iv1hSQ.text: There's a reason why they take dinner reservations, this place is tiny. Also it's not very well laid-out. The food was ok, my dinner companions and I decided to do tapas but it took a very long time to get everything we ordered. Twice they sent us the wrong plates (figuring it's such a small place, it should have been easier to get out order correct!) and twice we had to remind out server what we were still waiting for. Gauging the value of the meal by balancing out service and atmosphere vs price leads me to conclude that I'll not be making another visit here.

UX081ir1QttpwBoY_h3Heg.text: The food was tasty, however, the small portion size does not warrant the oversized price. $18 for a tiny portion of crab fried rice ......ridiculous!  There was so much sauce in our chicken dish but just a tiny portion of chicken, again, $18.  They have to lower their prices.

mpER_8V9VUWVhu3FnZN92Q.text: Loved this place so much- great local little hideaway with great food, excellent presentation and great service. We will definitely be back!

5kCkGeCnMDBF5BJ9HtOV4w.text: Nittaya's Secret Kitchen won't be a secret much longer, as this tiny neighborhood gem in Summerlin has a lot of potential. Tucked back in a small strip center off Lake Mead and Rampart, it is a little tricky to find, but is worth the search. They describe themselves as a Thai tapas restaurant, implying there may be some fusion going on, but in actuality you can just expect a lot of Thai appetizers - really good Thai appetizers - and some traditional favorites. Most things on the menu taste healthy and clean, and there are plenty of vegetarian dishes. The tofu preparations here are better than most, and the eggplant dishes aren't heavily saturated with oil as they often can be. You can't leave without ordering the unique Spinach Salad ($9). This isn't really a salad at all, but rather a mound of lightly tempura battered spinach leaves that serve as chips for a tangy 'dip' made from ground chicken, whole cashews, cilantro, carrots, and onions. The leaves are delicate, yet pack a crunch, and the spicy, sweet, loose dip is like a meat-fortified salsa. Sounds a little strange, but it's to die for. The Chicken Ginger Salad is similar to the Spinach Salad, except the spinach is replaced with iceberg lettuce, you get a lot more chicken, and you have the addition of tender julienne ginger ($9). Skip on the 'Shrimp in Pastry.' Though tasty, and dramatically presented, there is no pastry to be found (just wonton wrappers). The shrimp are overwhelmed by the cream cheese, and the jalapeno and leek don't come through enough. It's also a culinary no-no to put inedible items on a plate, i.e. pineapple rind (see below). What the 'Shrimp in Pastry' lacked in cohesion of flavors, the 'Thai Bouillabaise' made up for, though the mucky color was off-putting. They also use frozen green lip New Zealand mussels, an ingredient I feel there is no excuse for in good places. Though I loved the broth, that was the break in the 'make-or-break' of the Bouillabaise for me. I love that they have outdoor seating with views of the mountains in the distance, but the best kept part of Nittaya's secret is that you can get a $25 dining certificate on restaurant.com for as little as $1 when you sign up for their email list. Although I'm annoyed by their almost daily notifications, the discount codes are incredible and I save about 80% off their regular restaurant certificate prices on any given day. Plus, it encourages me to try new restaurants I otherwise wouldn't, even if I do defeat the purpose of the discount entirely by over ordering. If you go to Nattaya's make sure you visit restaurant.com beforehand, even if you don't have a code, because it will still save you $15 as a visitor. Finally, go knowing that the service at Nittaya's is slow. Your food arrives promptly once you order, but everything else seems to take forever. The staff is friendly enough to compensate for this shortcoming, though it is worth taking into consideration if you are short on time or don't particularly like to linger. Hopefully this is just part of their opening pains.

ZjDi9yoRzR3bPfZW3LDT-Q.text: The food here is absolutely incredible!  I have been here a few times, and made a reservation for Valentine's Day.  We were seated quickly, and the service was well-timed and unobtrusive.  The waitstaff have always made excellent recommendations on wine every time I have been here, prices are very reasonable for the serving sizes and quality of food, and extra steps are taken on presentation.   A perfect date night thanks to Nittaya's.

AI21GUPPwN8aP9jCLbbPYw.text: this place is phenomenal for a sit down Thai meal. the service was paced a little slower but it was a nice change from the hustle-you-out-the-door you can get at a lot of chains. would definitely suggest a reservation, we got lucky to find a table as walk-ins.

EIf6zM-MlNq7rfWSTGXpGA.text: This is one of the best kept secrets in Las Vegas.  The spinach salad is unique as it is fried in tempura batter and served with a cashew dipping sauce that will knock your socks off!  Im going back here!

Tqlyz8E4evlC-_xrBWM1bQ.text: Great ambience and atmosphere. Small cozy restaurant with great decor. Very welcoming service staff. I was introduced to this restaurant by a good friend of mine who is Thai herself... and when she says the food is delicious, it it must be good!  We went for lunch, (it was a total of five of us) for a birthday celebration. Even though we made reservations, it was nice to go when we didn't feel rushed by a dinner crowd and the food came out very quickly.  I will definitely be back! Worth a try, I would highly recommend coming.

MPC9by5XJ-qkU0bXrnb_iw.text: I went here for lunch.  I walked in and the waiter was extremely nice and seated us. They had some wonderful infused water.  The waiter explained the items on the menu and gave us his recommendations.  I had the red curry, my girlfriend had the pad thai and my friend had the drunken noodles. I tried them all and they were all excellent.  You get to choose on a scale of 1-5 for spice level and it can get very spicy.  I can't wait to come back and try more items off their menu.

OY4pTlHHOo3alrexfdsr-w.text: I went here with my friends one evening who were ecstatic about showing me their new favorite Thai spot. The ambience is 5 star, super elegant and quaint...not usual for a Thai restaurant. Super awesome, though! Food was all great. We ordered multiple appetizers, dishes, desserts, etc. I was very impressed. The only part that wasn't five star to me was the service. I wish our waitress had been more attentive and paid attention to what was going on at our table. Other than that, I can't wait to go back!

AygkqQrjwrYDrnGPdsADaQ.text: HIGHLY recommend !! So delicious! Great food and service. We made reservations. It's quaint and popular. We ordered from the small plate menu: spinach salad, fried avocado, volcano shrimp , and crying tiger steak. Everything was so good. Nice wine selection.  A gem in Vegas!

r-LvDi8LLEjUG-HrHVyOhg.text: I enjoy this place every time we go. Great service, the entire staff is very friendly and personable and they always have good suggestions. Food is the just great. I recommend the Lamb chops, the Golden Pouches and the Tempura Spinach Salad.

-xLnzOljI0PxJLf04HT6oQ.text: What a delicious surprise!  Loved the warm cozy restaurant with the attractive bar area. Glad we made reservations as place was packed and we had to wait a few extra minutes.  The fried spinach appetizer was outstanding as were the curry puffs and veggie rolls  Veggie rolls were so good that we had to get a second order.  We also enjoyed ahi tuna, tofu Massaman curry, and homestyle shrimp pad Thai. Wish we had room to try the lettuce wraps and other good looking dishes coming from the kitchen.  There was a nice wine list but being the only wine drinker in the group had to settle for a glass instead of trying a bottle.  Will definitely return!

urhTivKWp_Szvfnf8-0yLA.text: As its name implies,Nittaya's Secret Kitchen is located in an easy to pass strip mall on Rampart near Lake Mead.  Their expanded dining area makes seating more spacious now and easier to get up and move about. Service at Nittaya's has been consistent for me for years...regardless of whether it's lunch with friends, a romantic dinner for 2, or a gatherings of a large group of people.    On my most recent visit we ordered Red curry chicken with brown rice (+$1) and stir fried mixed vegetables with white rice from the lunch special. There are 14 dishes on the lunch specials  menu to choose from and all come with both house salad and a pot sticker for $11...a very good deal for a clean establishment, with yummy food, in a nice setting.   As soon as you sit down, they will bring you cold, infused water with fruits and herbs...today it was with strawberry and cucumber...or you can go ahead order a glass of wine from their nice selection of wine.  I always try to make a reservation, even if it's two of us since Nittaya's Secret Kitchen's secret is out and well loved by locals.   I thought about 5 stars for this review, but for me, it's a strong 4 stars.

5FgqLn8i9hdkR5Ngf9AYVA.text: Amazing place with very fresh ingredients that meld your senses into an oblivion of experiences.  Service is beyond belief and always try to exceed expectations.

AkxHGTkHpTaia7nzE-npaQ.text: Tucked away hidden gem! Finally was able to try this place and thoroughly enjoyed it. So many items I wanted to try so I'm dying to go back (spinach appetizer being #1). Pad Thai and Curry was excellent such flavorful dishes along with the dumplings. Great ambiance and friendly service.

vbzFCOCS6I2Eke89Li8j4g.text: It's a cute, cozy romantic place in my opinion. My boyfriend and I came here for lunch today. We saw this place last night when we were at the French restaurant nearby. We love tapas so he surprised me by taking me to this place today.  We had three small dishes: Golden Pouches that's potatoes inside an egg pastry with curry sauce, the potatoes was fresh and I like the curry sauce;  E-Saan Sausage which is pork sausage with lemongrass in it. I love the crispy pork belly. The pork belly was quite different the way they were prepared. It had a thicker breading but nonetheless they were so crispy and mouth watering.  The service was good.  We also enjoyed the hot teas. They have a separate hot menu so don't forget to check it out. They also have happy hour from 3-6, and half priced select bottles on Thursdays.  The only drawback is the place is very small with tables so close next to each other. We could hear all the conversation to our dislike. Anyhow, we enjoyed our lunch and experience.

on1Q_IJwU_WvvG74Ed2uEQ.text: Secret?  The word is out.  Built for locals, this place is worthy of the drive for our-of-towners.   If you're looking to get away from "Las Vegas" we suggest this place.     The decor is nicely appointed.   The menu is extensive so give your time to decide.   Our food was very fresh and made with care.     Hint.  If it's "your thing", check out how the better half live, drive around the surrounding area.  This secret kitchen appears to be in one of the best areas of Vegas.

SoXh6nhEUVrKeqXffwzGWA.text: I really really enjoy this secret kitchen... it is no longer a secret as it tends to always be busy every night.  The wine selection is amazing, the food is always so fresh and mouthwatering. They always serve infused water, which here in the desert is so nice and satisfying as it refreshes you and cleanses your palate.  I am embarrassed to say that I am one of those that cannot handle too much spice when it comes to food, I have tried and tried to no avail...my friends and family have a running joke that even ice is too spicy :) for me.  Here they always listen to my request when I say p,ease make it a 0 with no spice and I have never been disappointed  My family likes the 5-8 spice range and they also are always satisfied.. if we share a dish they always split it and make sure that my "ice" spice is separate from the better seasoned (ha ha) Food.  We always get the same order and then try one new dish. Our favorite appetizers: chicken lettuce wraps, yummmmmmy .. they come in orders of 4 wraps and yes, the sauce is on the side, I can handle a little bit of it but you really don't need much sauce as the flavors are wonderful. The crispy spinach and the secret stickers or potstickers.  Main course we get an order of massaman curry Chicken with you guessed it, no spice  And the Basil chicken. Pineapple fried rice which is served inside half of the pineapple  They always bring extra spices for the table which is usually kept at the other end of the table. We also get one other dish to try each time and have never been disappointed with the experience   I usually pass when it comes to desert, my suggestion here... Don't! Their deserts melt in your mouth, the ice cream is creamy and yummy... the fried banana is done to perfection and the fried donuts are scrumptious.  This is a place that we go to often, yes it's in a strip mall (not a big deal)  but so adorably decorated.. it is a bit on the smaller side, but so worth the crowded feel..they do have patio dining I have never tried that but it looks comfy... they have excellent happy hour items and great offerings for happy hour.  Always a great meal.

OoE0SzwTNsJNVKKvNuI6Tg.text: Awesome little secret place. When we walked in it was dark and we noticed it was super nicely decorated. It looks more like a romantic place where you can get a little privacy. Food was good and the owner was around making sure everyone was happy. My husband wanted a lemonade and she heard when he asked the waiter. She quickly came to let us know they had their own home made lemonade (I think lavender) and we decided to go for it - it was delicious. They had no high chairs (I guess it is not really a kids place) but the tables are ok to sit kids at. We had both our kids in and while we were dining another family came in with 2-3 kids. We did not get any dirty looks :) Overall great experience and I hope to make it back soon without kids for more of a romantic meal.

uUWmWNN_tSxQBKDmlKDkrQ.text: One of the best Thai places I've been to in Summerlin area. The food was absolutely delicious. We have the chicken basil entree which was fantastic and perfect flavors. Opted for level 3 spice, which wasn't too spicy and would probably increase next time. The garlic rice with the chicken basil... you must try! The spinach tapas was really good along with the garlic edamame. There was no wait on a Sunday night at 7:00pm. Service was just okay. The server forgot one of our entree orders and bartender brought our bottled beers over, offered and suggested we use one of their cold beer glasses, we said yes.. then he never came back. It's okay though, it didn't change the fact that the food was delicious and I'd come back just to fulfill my Thai food fix!

NIazqmQ9w1HCKQJ_EDrAwA.text: Wow, this place is a keeper, will definitely be back, service and food were both on point, the best thai place i know of in Las Vegas at the current moment, and I lived here for 7 years!

eoDYDOOYZLy46e3O0RAT1Q.text: This is the best Thai food around without a doubt. We've been going here for over a year and everything is excellent, every time. They use high quality ingredients and the preparation, flavor, texture and presentation are superb. If you haven't tried it, don't wait!!

5jLJry6TGLZAaMExqh5Pxg.text: Normally I love this restaurant until today. I had reservations at 5:30 but after dinner with friends (and hour and 20 minutes) we were asked to leave for another reservation.  I've never had this happen at a restaurant and I am embarrassed that I suggested to my friends we eat here.  There were other tables there for much longer-maybe they shouldn't over book.  This restaurant is off the list.

6NMZ3oAqCDK4V1lp26ur4g.text: Went to this place for lunch today and I am glad I did! This place is really a secret because it took me about 5-10 minutes of driving around the parking lot to find the place. The restaurant name is small so it is easy to miss, but place is located on the corner of the plaza with the dry cleaners.   Upon walking in, I was impressed with the decor and atmosphere. This place has a more upscale feel to it compared to other Thai restaurants. Kind of reminds me of a winery (and they do have quite the selection of white and red wine!).   I ended up ordering the massaman curry with chicken (I don't think you get to change the meat, but I didn't mind) which came with a small salad and one vegetable potsticker. The salad was really good because of the light dressing and the ingredients were a nice change from just the standard iceberg lettuce with carrots (they actually had cucumbers and some other veggies). The potsticker was really fresh and I really liked how the outer shell was crispy which gave a nice contrast to the contents. My curry was really good as well. The potatoes were fresh and had a strong flavor which I haven't really experienced in other restaurants. The chicken was nice and moist (not chewy like some other places) and the serving was pretty good considering the quality as well. I also ordered a glass of thai tea which was pretty good, but not the best that I've had.  Overall I would definitely recommend checking this place out. It has a nice, intimate atmosphere and the staff are really nice and attentive. Their water is also fancy! Today the water was infused with strawberry and some other fruit which I thought was pretty neat. I will be back to try some of the other dishes!   FYI, the lunch specials are around $11 which is a couple of bucks more than other places, but it is worth it! Do it and treat yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad and dumpling that comes with the lunch special
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close up of the dumpling lol
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad that came with my meal. Love the dressing, just wish I knew what it was. Really refreshing and light.

pDtv4rLS5Z15eYUo4qzyLw.text: Cozy, Relaxing & Intimate Spot, Perfect Place To Enjoy A Glass Of Vino!   PROS Fried Spinach Salad With Chili Lime Dressing - YUM!  Also, the ahi tuna appetizer was delish.   CONS Drunkin' Noodles - Most disgusting thing I've ever tasted. Has a licorice flavor, I couldn't even finish a single bite.    Overall, this place is great if you just avoid the drunkin noodles.

Wgp7U4ZuH1T6oHT0o10FOA.text: Great service and they had a variety of delicious Thai Cuisine. This is my fiancee's and I new spot! Would recommend to family and friends.

betaDYT8tsC-iEPEU-vzvQ.text: we sat at the bar to eat because it was crowded and had not reservations.   Curry salmon was excellent , as were the spinach salad...but the cornish hen was  just ok.-dry(no juice)

cvvoUE6pIOGQA_j9Dz7tAw.text: Absolutely love this place! The spinach salad is so good and is a must try. We also love the muscle appetizer. Although we don't live in the area anymore, this is our stop when we are in town.

Oe6MOTwDzDzX6lXxVB6z2g.text: This is a great place for a date night out. The tapas are great. Thursdays are half off select wine bottles. Reservations are a good idea.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared ahi with avacado.

lY0aHwXQlqs3eV_E8YMhwg.text: We love this place. Order a ton of different things. The noodles, the shrimp, the fiery noodles. Can't stop eating!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice wine rack, pretty good selection
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1djpFfAaTOzAmguewrxCSw.text: Awesome dishes and consistent everytime!  Service is impeccable plus the restaurant is decorated tastefully!!  Make sure to make reservations for dinner on weekends.

V-85VheuTAA37q4J_p4koA.text: I am teetering between a 3 and 4 star review and because of the rocky start to our evening, I am going to have to go with the 3 star for the moment.  When we arrived on a Thursday afternoon, around 5:30p, this very cute and intimate restaurant was pretty much empty. However, the host asked if we had a reservation (we didn't), and said that he wouldn't be able to seat us because it was 1/2 priced wine night, and they'd fill up. Um..okay.... (looking around empty restaurant)... Well, can we sit at the bar? Long pause. How about outside? They hesitated, but said they'd set up one of the outside tables. That was a process that took awhile. Because it was a bit breezy outside, we asked if they could set up the outdoor space heater. Another process.  That finally being settled, we sat down at the somewhat shaky table.  From that point forward, things went well enough. The sangria is delicious and beautifully presented. We ordered the fried avocado, the veggie potstickers and the mango bacon wrapped shrimp. All of these offerings were very good and again, the presentation was lovely. Service was friendly and pleasant.   As the evening progressed, the wind picked up, and even with the space heater, I was downright cold. I asked our server if it was possible to move us inside to finish. We went inside, and while it was busy, there was a small table right by the bar. She said that the reservation wasn't until 7, so we would have plenty of time to complete our meal. So...why weren't we just seated there in the first place?  The seating issues did put a bit of a damper on the meal, but I am willing to give Nittaya's another try.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sangria
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZOQFbikpcvdeeqdKAWN38w.text: Stopped in here for lunch and got their chicken Pad Thai lunch special.  It came with a pot sticker, a small side salad with this fantastic vinaigrette, a nice size portion of Pad Thai.  I also had a glass of Riesling to round out my lunch.  While it was nice outside and they have patio seating I sat at the bar for lunch.  Service was quick and pleasant.  Before I even ordered the bar tender had poured me a glass of their strawberry and cucumber infused water.   My order was taken and he poured me a little carafe of the wine and then poured half into the glass leaving the rest next to the glass.  The dumpling came out first and was a nice start.  the salad came out next closely followed by the main dish.  The only complaint I had was that the Pad Thai had a little too much soy sauce in it but it was still good.  I can definitely see myself coming back and trying some of the tapas and some more wine.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice wine selection.
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Pad Thai

Ivv8I-Xhegsrq5jAcslSug.text: Yum! Came here for a late lunch, and just in time for happy hour, and it was delicious! It is a secret kitchen because from the outside, it looks dark -- almost like it's closed. There isn't an "open" sign, so at first, I actually thought that they were closed. The door also sticks a little bit, so you really have to yank hard to open the door. I thought that I was the only idiot to get tricked by this, but while sitting inside, it looked like several others were also fell for that trick! Guys, the secret is that Nittaya's Secret Kitchen is actually open!  I'm glad that I was able to make it for happy hour, as I got to try some of the appetizers. They definitely have more of the "common"/"less exciting" tapas on happy hour (e.g., dumplings), but I was satisfied with everything I ordered. For tapas, I shared the bacon wrap shrimp, the garlic edamame, and the fried avocados. You can't really go wrong with bacon-wrapped shrimp, but I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the shrimp. They definitely weren't shrimpy shrimp! The garlic edamame was REALLY good. It was really garlicy and had a nice kick to it! I think that they might have pan fried it, instead of steaming it, to give it an extra crisp. The fried avocado was really good! Again, most things are good when fried, but what really made it above and beyond was the cilantro sauce.  I also got the kao soi to share for an entree: the kao soi is really good! It's a bit pricey, but the portion is generous. I was worried that there wouldn't be enough to share, but there was plenty. The curry had a rich, spicy, coconut-y flavor, with a few large chunks of pork.  I ended up sitting at the bar. The bartenders were friendly and willing to make recommendations and help explain some of the items on the menu.  I would have loved to see some of their other more tapas on the happy hour menu.

3HhHUPSr3IznIBGOqLroSQ.text: This place is hands down one of the best spots in town. Visit Josh at the bar, he's the man.  #baconwrapedshrimp #catfish #springrolls

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Party time.

1TQqN2aUNpWR60VaTIki0A.text: Good food hidden off of Lake Mead!  Big variety of food to please everyone.  Make a reservation on the weekend, it is busy!

LTCBIZkVVGtw8AJW1hpQkQ.text: I came here on my 40th birthday with my husband and friends. Very nice and intimate place to eat.  I had the Salmon which was tasty and delicious.  Everything we ordered on the menu was amazing! The pad thai, calamari, satay, pineapple fried rice and curry chicken was all delicious! They also have a wide variety of wine.  The mango sticky rice with coconut ice cream was a great finish to our meal. I would definitely recommend this to my friends and family!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pEQlMdMWfct4q0_N7U3nwA.text: I hate writing a bad review but my experience was unpleasant and I felt compelled to vent.   First let me start off with the fact that it is New Year's Eve and the restaurant was packed and I placed a to go order.    The food is expensive for what it is, the portions are small but it tasted good (not amazing) based on the reviews I was expecting the best Thai meal of my life.  The total was $78.95 for potstickers, Bouillabaisse, Cornish hen, Pad Thai, bread pudding and fried banana.    I was told that my order would take 1 hour to be prepared but since this was my first time driving there I wanted to make sure I was there with enough time.  It only took me 7 minutes to get there - so here is the breakdown I placed my order at 5:51pm and I picked it up by 6:27pm hardly 1 hour.    The place was packed,  and the place is very well decorated.  I must say I'm a little bummed that I won't be returning because I really think I would have enjoyed my dinning experience there.  But coming from the service industry mistakes are all about the recovery.   Ok now on to the negatives, my chicken Pad Thai was missing I called them right away to let them know and they said I can come back pick it up.  At this point I just want to sit and eat so I called them back and said that I was going to eat my food first so it wouldn't get cold and I would call them when I'm on my way so they could re make it.  Ok so this where I think it just went down hill for me, my food was cold!!!  The portions are already small for the price but the being cold on top of it?!?!   The Bouillabaisse was tasty but cold, the Cornish hen was a  dry but tasty, the potstickers were a little  raw, the bread pudding was hard and the fried banana was soggy.  Just a really expensive bad meal.   So recovery--  hardly I call to them and stated that I just wanted my money back, the girl who answered the phone said she would give me a credit since they messed up, I told her that I most likely won't be returning and that I would like my money returned to my card.  She said that there wasn't a manager available tonight and she would take my information down and someone would reach out to me in the next couple of days.  As I was asking her for the managers name she had already hung up on me.  I tried calling back twice but no one answered.    So unfortunately I have to give this place 2 stars and I probably will never return.  I read so many things and so many friends have recommended it that it truly breaks my heart that I am the one who had a bad experience.  Update went back last night to get my refund and a manager never came to talk to me, they took my card gave me the refund and ushered me out, no apologies.  I know that one bad review will affect the place but hopefully this won't happen to anyone else.

0uNvh3Pqm2KzYXbDKtmYUg.text: Loved the spinach tempura salad and wine list. The tapas portions are large. Will be back!

HZFvXdvQOzCYUVJsK9n0nw.text: Our favorite hidden local gem! We love the bar service and date nights at Nittaya's. You know this place is good because I once called for a reservation and Nittaya herself answered the phone! Thanks for the delicious food and wine pairings!

xg5HZxeUpKRVOIxm2ITwQQ.text: Wow this place is amazing. It's a small hidden place located in Summerlin. It's so hard to find a delicious authentic Thai food, I love Thai food but most places I've been, I don't usually go back because they are not very clean. This place is just very clean, great fresh food and beautifully served. The detail is everything when they serve the meal. They are always very busy so make sure to make a reservation before going. (Not very cheap) If your a Thai food lover then it's a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach chips must try

-bro1PMwKolwNM4G4IZieA.text: Not bad but nothing too memorable. The food was good, the atmosphere was quaint. The wait staff was excellent though. The food was good but nothing we had was something that stood out.

Sc0fbj-SUY15bQOQTzYEvQ.text: I'm very disappointed. I drove here 40 min this evening in 5 o'clock traffic to find out when arriving they don't have high chairs at all ! Don't plan on dining here if you have a child ! Who needs to sit in a high chair ? What day in age is this ?

CSwmvvYGAz0qajv81hvLxg.text: Best Thai restaurant we have ever been to! Went three nights in a row. Tried half the menu and loved it all!   Must have Starters: coconut soup, spinach salad, crispy pork belly, secret stickers,   Entrees: the grilled skirt steak avocado, Pad Z-U noodles (incredible), Panang chicken curry. Wow!   (Special mention to the wonderful servers. So thoughtful and helpful. 5-star service too.   Prices are excellent. You can't go wrong.

EKaX3AsYm879SezEA5hzpg.text: Great place.  Excellent staff and service. Cold cold STELLA beer! Tasty dishes - all very yummy. Great atmosphere Highly recommend  Go every week So many amazing APPs....try them ALL! PS - coconut ice cream is to DIE for!

QnUdaxC3hS36b2k5_iIsiQ.text: Finally made it in! It was worth the wait!   I had tried to dine here previously but it was just too  busy. I did my due diligence and made a resi this time. The process was pleasant.   Our reservation was respected and we were promptly seated. It was packed and service was notably slow. We were in no hurry so this was not an issue. I believe it was at least 30 mins before we even ordered apps. Plates were promptly cleared and water always filled so we were not abandoned but we barely saw our actual server.   We had mussels, volcano shrimp, soft shell crab, and sausage. The mussels were life changingly good. The coconut broth was divine. They were perfectly tender and I literally ate remainder of the broth with a spoon. The sausage was pungent with lemongrass and very tasty. It was served in whole sausages but with all the fixings to make lettuce wraps. Yum. The shrimp were cooked nicely and tasty but nothing special. The soft shell crab was delightful.   We had the signature fried spinach salad which was tasty and unique.   We had the duck curry and avocado strip steak with green curry. I didn't dislike the duck but would not order it again. The combination of lychee, pineapple, tomato and curry ultimately did not work for me. I think warm pineapple freaks me out a little. The steak was phenomenal. The avocado, eggplant, zucchini and green curry were all perfect. The curry was the perfect thickness and texture. Absolutely delicious.   We had a bottle of wine and our bill was just over $200 for 4 of us. We were uncomfortably full. My co diners had a dessert and a glass of dessert wine. I didn't partake. I would return tomorrow and order the mussels and steak and refuse to share.   Go try this upscale yet affordable Thai treasure.

8D5u8qkF0MDz6xSIl9vrqA.text: The BF and I went here for date night last week and we had a great experience. This restaurant is located in our neighborhood and so we thought we would give it a try. The ambiance is well decorated, cozy and nice. Good for a dinner where you'd like to have conversation and not have to talk loudly. We had the deep fried spinach salad which lived up to the hype of being a signature dish here. We split that as an appetizer, and we ordered the Kow Soi noodle entree. Our server mentioned that the entrees are big, so that should be enough for the both of us. And she was right. This entree was HUGE! Prices were a little more than your average Thai place, but you get your money's worth. We were too full for dessert but the items looked great.   The only area of improvement I would suggest is that in the main dining room there is a huge chalkboard mentioning happy hour, yet we were told it was only available in the bar area. I would suggest maybe not posting it in the dining room as we were confused as why it would be in there and not maybe featured near the bar area. Just my two cents. Happy hour ends at 6pm and when we asked at our table they mentioned it was over and only in the bar. (The time was 5:50pm). Again, just a preference to ensure a great dining experience. Other than that, it was really good and we can't wait to come back.

ZPpfb8cFJCYwQme8HEtSDg.text: I really like this place I have been here many times. Food is tasty and atmosphere is cool and in the summer you can eat outside .

Z4U-eyhVAEBHhIi6n8bvLw.text: My girlfriend and I needed a girl's night out. I had never been here but had read good reviews.  It was a small place with less then 15 tables and a bar area. There is a tapas menu as well as a dinner menu.  We arrived around 4:45pm on a Friday evening- they did ask if we had a reservation (we didn't) but they said they could seat us anyways.   They wine menu is not large, but some well chosen bottles. They started us with a strawberry cucumber water- very unexpected and refreshing drink.  We ordered a bottle of wine and some tapas plates to try different things since everything sounded good. We ended up with the garlic edamame, secret dumplings, Phuket poppers and steak skewers.  The garlic edamame were phenomenal.  I foresee ordering these for takeout often!!  The steak was good- nothing to write home about and the dumplings and poppers were delicious.  The portions were good size for tapas, but we still decided we wanted something a little more. We ordered the Pad Z U (pad see eww) from the dinner menu. It was delicious as well.    The edamame was reason alone to come back, but the dishes that others ordered look delicious as well.  Thrilled to have found this hidden gem of a restaurant and look forward to my next visit!!

o6iF8yb23fd1V0KwCCtkyQ.text: Had the take out for dinner tonight. Everything was delicious! We got the chicken potstickers, the chicken pad Thai, basil chicken and steak! Everything was great and the portions were larger than I expected. We had plenty of food leftover to enjoy tomorrow. I haven't experienced dining inside, but it's pretty small and intimate inside. Will definitely be back again.

8OM-5EuG5iopKluv3pvwvQ.text: The interior of this restaurant is very elegant, but the furniture is too big for the small space. All tables are way too close to the others, leaving little room for some privacy. Altough the decor might be called intimate, it appeared a little to dark for my taste, with black table linen. Service was excellent though and restrooms were immaculaty clean. The food was tasty, but not extraordinary. Avocado rolls were delicious, but so are those at other places (Cheesecake factory, BJ's in Henderson). The spinach salad was fried, but that was our mistake as we did not check. Komol serves a similar dish that is just as good. Drunken noodles (flat noodles with ground chicken and veggies), was great, although Dangee Thai on Pecos makes them better.  Overall a very enjoyable lunch but the Eastside of town has just as many enjoyable places. Komol is great, but StickErice is still my favorite Thai!  Update: I received a nice email back from the owner, explaining some of the dishes I tried and I really appreciated the effort. It showed they really care about their food and their customers. Maybe a second try might be worth it when I am in Summerlin.

Lh8VplAsDGYScjX2JLulYg.text: Visited for dinner on a Thurs night. We chose to sit outside, as the weather was nice. The restaurant is very small, but I didn't feel that the tables were too crowded. We ended up ordering about 8 different tapas, and they were all delicious! The one standout was the tempura spinach. I didn't even know there was such a thing! It was light, crunchy, delicious, and worked really well. I will be back.

XEI9wTtplc1WQTh6nt3I0g.text: Almost everything we got was great!  The dough on the Curry Dumplings was just a bit to heavy and seemed to suck in all the oil.  They were kind of thick and the presentation was a bit odd with them served on a very skinny dish all in a row.  Maybe a different serving presentation, dough and a sauce of some sort would help.  The seared tuna tapas was wonderful and dinner of skirt steak avocado curry and garlic saffron rice was amazing!  The place is a bit small for the type of seating they use so when its crowded you really have to plan your exit.  Would I go back?  Yes, there are many more items i can't wait to try!

OSlZjJnJ4iS9uzEa8xAbfQ.text: Some of the best Thai food in Vegas. We've eaten here many times and will continue to visit. Lunch yesterday was excellent as expected and the service was spot on attentive. The Secret Salad is fantastic (cue the dipping sauce... and one to go please:) as is much of there delicious & creative offerings.

Jf1x11Vk-hRTMYupzgI8XA.text: This place was perfect in every way.  The service was the best service I've received in a long time. The  fried spinach salad is a must!  It is a smaller restaurant but I really liked that about this place. I'm sure on a busy night it's a wait to be seated but I don't mind..  I'll be eating here a lot more!

05z5pPAH31pcs1k4Hoq7XA.text: Attentive and friendly staff. Josh, behind the bar, was my server.  Food is beyond expectation. I started with the coconut soap that was a surprise of perfect pieces of chicken. Then had Massaman chicken that is very good, stick to your ribs and filling. Ended with Thai Donuts that I thought I would not be able to eat them all but had no problem empting the plate. Small space for the well to do locals without busting the wallet. I will go back for more.
