Peuj4Se8fRNtTfzoA69BAg.text: Love this Thai place! The food is so fresh! You can tell they use organic and local ingredients in their dishes! My boyfriend and I love this place and have started eating here at least once a week.... This week it has been two times :) its also very pretty and romantic inside. Not your typical local thai delivery joint. Great place to have a romantic night out with wine and great thai! We Love the seared ahi tuna app and the crab wontons!!! Oh and the salmon curry with the avocado on top is a must have, cooked so perfect!

EB-vFgEJe2P7rBXHoPAtCw.text: Very good Thai food, thought I didn't think it was amazing, it was still really good. the Atmosphere is all really nice and cozy. I would definitely go back.

KfLoazJ2Vum9D_egdO1J1A.text: How can I keep this restaurant secret but still write a review on Yelp about it?  OK, I'll pretend I didn't write this review if you pretend you didn't hear about it from me.  Deal?    Let me just preface this by saying that I've been around my share of delicious Thai restaurants.  I mean, I'm from Hawaii, where we have an abundance of delicious Asian cuisine and Thai food restaurants galore.  With that said, I have to tell you that this place is a little gem.  Everything from the decor of the place where it has a nice, intimate setting yet plays pretty hip background music, to their furniture and coziness...just adds to the experience.    I've had some dishes here that I have never had any any other Thai restaurant.  Sure they have your typical pad thai or Tom Yum Soup but the delicious tempura spinach salad was truly magical.  This place is definitely a place that I'd like to come back to again so I can try even more of their dishes.    Shh...now go erase my review from your memory because I didn't write it.  ^_~

OfHUuHhZd_wZJKrAksD_NA.text: Started off with a pitcher of sangria, which was great. The presentation of the dishes were great.  They were beautifully prepared. There was 6 of us eating so we ordered several items and shared them. Quaint atmosphere. There's not a lot of tables and it is a bit tight. Reservations are a must. It gets very busy. The food was so amazing, we will be going back. Delicious!!!

c-nU_cbc84UuEEMXIekuXg.text: Wonderful food and exceptional service. The spinach salad is a must have! Love the cozy ambiance.

4ObTlSAwu2sjzCmwYBiLbg.text: Wow! This is not a Thai restaurant, it's a Thai palace! I am originally from Vancouver BC, and this is the first time I have experienced authentic, delicious Thai food since I left that city!! And on top of it- it's a wine bar!! I was in heaven! My husband and I ordered the fried spinach which came with a spicy/fish sauce dip (delicious). It was an unexpected treat, so tasty!! Warning- it's enough for four people, so it was a big dish for the two of us! We also had a dried rib appetizer, which was very good. The big surprise was their curried avocado salmon. OMG!! Out of this world! The ambience was super cozy, clean and beautiful decor... right down to the fresh exotic flower popping out of wine crates. Very friendly, knowledgeable service. The menu was very extensive, and good wines by the glass. So excited to find this gem! Can't wait to go back, and we will be back a lot!! I LOVE Las Vegas!!!

-DjQaYwx1S8m6z7N3hNjsQ.text: My #1 fav place! I know it's selfish and wrong of me to think about not telling people how great this little restaurant is, in fear of not getting a table, but that  would be so wrong of me.  So you should know that everything is great but I especially love the crispy spinach salad and the salmon with avocado sauce!

v-56u8_dRgsKUx7wY63rKg.text: Absolutely, hands down the best Thai food. I enjoyed every bite of it. Great service!

s7GvLtueSXZcS0iYqx59Rw.text: Great food. The spinach salad is great. Price is a little on the high side.

PuHcwB8gkoRLV7HRE4plKw.text: Great service, excellent happy hour, very nice selection of wines, and an extremely unique and inventive menu. Try the Riesling and mango shrimp.

jpfCljIBkqtulttJVbHgAQ.text: Very expensive for so-so food. Try the tapas but avoid the crying tiger steak. $24 for a small unseasoned ribeye is outrageous.

hiIQ1-_1uaIXt7UO-NFj9w.text: My only regret here is that i wasn't able to try more of the menu. My personal favorite is the fried avocado wedges. Theres also a great wine menu too. All in all a good place to take friends or someone special.

BLVHDxfOmkTu0VY7kE-kdQ.text: This place is about 20 minute or so away from the strip. I been searching and wanting to try something different in Vegas. This came up in my search and decided to bookmark it to try. I ended up making reservations about two weeks in advance. It was really busy when we got there so it is better to have one than have to wait.   The parking was super easy. I really like the feel of the place. Nothing too fancy, kind of remind me of a regular Thai place.   What we ordered:  World famous spinach salad-this thing was so good. It was just spinach tempura but the sauce is so good. It has a little kick to it. The spice and the limey taste really made the dish stand out.   Crab roll-these were good. I thought the price was kind of high for the four rolls we got, however, they were yummy.   Salmon-Avocado Curry-I really enjoys this dish. It had a green curry with a big piece of salmon with eggplant, zucchini, and avocado. You can change it to any protein you like. I decided to stick to the salmon cause that's what they are known for. This was worth the $24 price tag.   Crying Tiger Steak-grilled rib eye steak was just okay. We would pass on this dish next time.   Service-Great   Overall, I would come back for the spinach salad again!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach salad-yummy yum yum
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab roll
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon avocado green curry

WSk-fkBs1usmAXi9Udd68A.text: Awesome food here we got the Tapas!!   Fried avocado was awesome!! Beef Jerk was good as well sauce had a little jalepeno. We also had the Bacon wrapped shrimp with pineapple, pork belly, and the garlic short ribs all are yummy!!   For desert we the bread pudding and fried banana with coconut it was so good!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6_yZPXZlpvxHApidbrvwXA.text: Just amazing food. Nittayas kicks up Thai to the highest level. The setting is understated so the food shines. Always fresh. Innovative updates on the classics.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bf-dxrd1IYs3yLc79wi78w.text: Food is good. Service is bad take out even worse. Very expansive for what you get. Good atmosphere just don't sit next tot be door on a cold night.  We have tried multiple times to pick up food from their take out service and each time they have messed up the order. Last time we had to wait 45 minutes and the order was still wrong. They offered to fix it again but we would of had to wait another 45 min. Yes they charged us every penny still.

RdE0dLEktl7Ap9v5FWZJ_w.text: I've been here 3 times now and it still hasn't disappointed!  Generous portions, even for tapas. Here are the things I've tried so far:  Spinach appetizer: duh, get it, listen to your fellow yelpers. So. Good. I dream about this. I want to know whatever the dipping sauce is made of, because it's life.  Calamari lime/chili (not sure what it's called, but it's on the tapas menu: naked calamari with tasty marinade, red onions, cilantro ....just be careful or you might eat lemongrass   Panang curry beef: super good, no surprises if you had it at other Thai places  Beef jerky: better than most run-of-the-mill Thai places. The ginger dipping sauce is legit.   Pork w chili and green beans: my brother ordered it, not something I would order but very tasty   Basil eggplant lunch special: slightly sweet, tender eggplant with onions.  $12 lunch specials come with a salad, white rice, and potsticker. Good deal, as honestly if I only came for this I could make 2 meals out of it for myself.   I will keep coming back to try things but I will never pass up that spinach.

LMpWwwkkuBgwy3q67r9JDg.text: The food is absolutely unreal! The freshness and creative blends are off the charts! It is an amazing place to come on a Sunday afternoon to  enjoy a bottle of wine for under $40 and tapas to die for! No joke! Our new Sunday hang out for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crying baby tiger
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef jerky
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adorable ambiance, cozy and really chill!

th2LBqEGeNptCDjuqWfSlA.text: Enjoyed a few appetizers, Thai tea, lemongrass soup and sampled a few main dishes. Everything was very tasty, especially the soup and garlic rice!Atmosphere was quiet and relaxing, and we had a very enjoyable dinner away from the Vegas Strip, eating with the locals.

zwgmDSPej7qrgtypAG6vQA.text: We've been going to Nittayas for years and the food has been consistently good.  The spinach salad, tamarind shrimp and five spice ribs are stand out appetizers. The coconut chicken soup is terrific.  However on our last few visits we've noticed a slight change in quality. The steak with green curry and avocado has changed from a nice large piece of sliced flank steak to strips of what seems to be lesser quality meat like chuck or round.  Why only thee stars? The service has been consistently lacking. I'm not sure if it's an issue with the kitchen or servers placing the order.  On our last visit we ordered soup and ribs plus separate entrees for all. We were just starting to eat the soup when the ribs arrived. Ok not a big deal. Then the server immediately returned with the entree plates and started shoving our appetizers to the side to make room for the entrees which were coming out of the kitchen!  We told them to take them back to the kitchen where I'm sure they sat under a heat lamp.  I know that people were waiting to be seated but there is more to a good meal than the food. We don't want to be rushed out the door within 45 minutes.   Maybe they should stop over booking.

NHzGfpVgrJk0h6nKK8JApA.text: Best thai food in Vegas!!! Highly recommend and the hostess was great at getting me a last min group table during lunch hour :D

jbo_NuuZzOF8ya_88Sq7bw.text: My fiance and I are huge fans of Thai food. I have been to Thailand over 7 times and am very familiar with Thai cuisine. The restaurant is quite elegant and the staff were pleasant. We were quite disappointed in the food though.  We ordered the following dishes:  1.) fried calamari. The crumb coat of the calamari was not adherent to the calamari. The crispy exterior was as if it has fallen off the calamari. It was very disappointing as when you want to eat friend calamari you look forward to biting into a tender crunchy ring. Instead we got calamari with a lot of loose fried breading on top which was very disappointing  2) Drunken Noodles- was very salty. A few bites in and it tasted as if I was just eating and overwhelming amount of soy sauce. Other than the large amount of saltiness, the Thai basil was flavorful to the dish   3) Massaman Chicken Curry with potatoes - the curry was ok. The favors were not as prominent as they could have been. I feel like the curry paste they used needed some more flavor. The chicken was over cooked and the potatoes were undercooked.   Overall, considering the price we paid and the lack of quality of the food we were disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari. You can see the calamari had been separated from the crumb coat.
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodles and Massaman Curry

O5ZLsaJJGpZ7bOlwzfKaDQ.text: This place is ok.  Over rated. Food was just ok. The only thing that was good was the world famous spinach. That was very good. It's totally different from other Thai restaurant. No other place make it. The sauce to dip with it was very good.

rW842KBv_YvDH4Fxeacihg.text: Let me start by saying I'm from the Midwest and good, authentic Thai food is difficult to come by. A lot of "Thai Food" restaurants but mostly are just your average Chinese places with a little basil here and some curry there and bada bing! They claim it's Thai. False.   The food is amazing. We took an adventure off the strip for more of a stereotypical meal opposed to a casino full of smoke and hook pieces. Was not disappointed. The tapas selection was robust and the servings were large enough that we could've taken an entire meal home had we not been staying in a casino / hotel.   I'd honestly stay in Summerlin just to go to this place again!  Bravo!

CDCAx5HDLUUlvdd1MNkc9Q.text: Traditional Thai flavors with some modern culinary twists?  Hmmm?... could go very, very wrong.  But, the chef here blends it all together well.   The biggest problem I have with this place is price.  $19 for a small serving of pad Thai?...steep!  Rent around this area must be a doozie.   And sorry to say, but service  isn't always great.    We tend to stay away from dishes that aren't anything special and that we can get elsewhere for much cheaper (like pad Thai).    We do enjoy the Grilled Salmon-Avocado Curry (in green curry with eggplant, avocado, & zucchini), Fried Spinach, Eggplant with Thai Basil, & Garlic-Basil Lamb Chop.   Give it a try.  But expect to pay twice as much as you would at other Thai restaurants for small portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch specials
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad that comes with lunch special
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Issan sausage - yum!

SlLRoa4vlcUeVRPX4wVqVw.text: Went by the reviews on yelp , as always.Womp, womp ,womp. So I am giving this place two stars based on thier one great dish I had which was  avacado curry salmon... It was very different from anything I have tried at a Thai restaurant , but excellent! Ok , so the reason for the low rating... I have no idea if there was something up with the chef this night , but everything else , and I mean EVERYTHING had a extremely over powering taste of soy sauce. The place is very nice and was pretty packed.... I'm assuming the food is usually good here. I am always looking for a good Thai food spot when I am on vacation , this place was a let down.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This avacado curry salmon is truly different and sooooooo delicious! Must try !
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Overwhelming taste of soy sauce
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried spinach, skip this.... Did not like the sauce at all !

diq-7GhxUQRusfaShS_HSA.text: I've been wanting to try this place for some time and I was so DELIGHTED!! the food was excellent and the staff charming! My sister and daughter will be in town the week of Christmas I can not wait to take them here. Summerlin is lucky to have this little place!

Busijh60BsTha5ceU08zeg.text: First time there.  Heard food was very good.  I agree. The cleanliness and ambiance brought me in too. Servers are pleasant, service great. I had Pineapple fried rice with chicken. Marina had broccolini with chicken. Check out the pictures. Delicious! Bread pudding next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch menu is  reasonable.
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Broccolini veggie with chicken.
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple fried rice.

pP83LAf9P0BnfVIhAd4Pxw.text: The signature dish here is the spinach salad, which not really a salad, but fried and lightly breaded spinach that you dip into an addictive dressing. This appetizer is so good you want to rub it all over yourself, but won't unless you want to end up in jail.   The decor is tasteful and modern reflecting the Thai fusion style of the restaurant. The wait staff and knowledgeable, friendly, and attentive.   We had the drunken noodles and the  the coconut seafood curry. Both dishes were delicious, with complex, rich, and spicy flavors. The drunken noodles were tasty, different, and unique with the addition of basil and Chinese broccoli. The coconut seafood curry was an amazing combination of fish, shrimp, mussels, clams, and scallops in a sumptuous curry sauce, just flat out fantastic!

R25beTVK7wJ7Y9r0cZUxnA.text: I took my two teenaged children to dinner. At 8pm it was full and the hostess asked if I had a reservation. I did not and although the place was busy she stayed very calm and friendly while getting a table prepared for us.  It being Father's Day it was busier than normal for a Sunday night I suppose. We had tapas, a rice dish followed by a desert. Everything was very nice, nice ambiance, nice food, nice waitstaff. Best experience so far of any restaurant in the area! Recommended! I would suggest calling ahead for a table as it's a small place. Enjoy!

bIoyPZ5FvjkID638phnC2Q.text: Amazing! Fresh and sooo tasty!! The staff was so helpful and always on top of water and dishes that were done. Great service and yummy food!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried goodness
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried tofu
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai

tnljBY9Eml5NU3GmznovIw.text: Great food and affordable prices. Sometimes the parking is a bit limited, but it's located in a busy shopping center. Love going there for lunch.

WUqORln6hu5-ejMsIU0pXw.text: Nittaya's is very good, but with Thai food price is very important to me.  I don't think any dish should ever be more than $12 unless there's crab or duck or some expensive protein in there.  You can find outstanding Thai food in Chinatown or Eastside for less than $20 for a full meal.  At Nittaya's you struggle to find an item on the menu for less than $20.  Even the salads are almost $15.    Now that I got the price issue out of the way, I'll say that the venue is quite nice and romantic.  The staff is great and there is even a nice outdoor area.  The food was hit or miss for me. The chicken panang curry was outstanding.  But the bok choy wasn't even cut in the dish.  The chef just threw an entire piece of vegetable, root and all, into the dish so we had to cut it ourselves.  The dish could also have been better with more veggies and less chicken in my opinion, but it was tasty nonetheless.  The papaya salad was a nice dish and had a good kick.  The drunken noodles with chicken were fresh.  The chicken had a nice larb taste to it and the noodles were slimy as I like them.  I don't think I'll be back.  Way too expensive when I can go to Chada, Arawan, Lotus, etc. and get a better quality meal for 2/3 of the price.

WsybEK0Fs-jpNdoSg2w8ig.text: The food here is very good, portions are large, but it's pricey for a single diner.  I had the eggplant dish with chicken added.  (24.00)  Not many peppers, would have liked more, but tons and tons of eggplant--best tasting eggplant I have ever had at an Asian restaurant.  Sliced chicken breast was OK, but nothing special.  Really could have shared this dish it was so large and I am a tremendous eater.  Don't think anyone will have a bad meal here.  Service is very friendly and efficient.   Nice place--fine for a romantic diner.   Give it a shot.

YrC2wZna8DZDjc15kFfM8g.text: Amazing. Just go. Everything is delicious. My favorites have to be: Spinach Salad, Fried Avocado, Beef Jerky, Red Curry, Salmon Curry, and their sangria. Honestly, I have yet to have anything here that was less than excellent. Go now!

_mq50VojOgLddTufz9Hvaw.text: Very much enjoyed our dinner. It was really busy but our server was so accommodating, helpful and nice to us! So was the bartender and everyone worked together to ensure a favorable experience. The food was super fresh and the flavors were distinct; a delicious fusion on traditional Thai dishes. They do quite the take-out business too, without skipping a beat. The name "Secret Kitchen" fits because it feels like a hidden gem.

XenbVOKxXZyEBFvCAfHxIQ.text: Super impressed with this little gem! Everything was amazing. We had the lamb entree and the beef jerky appetizer. Both were amazing!

yB2Ft_u2MUVjR-eFx_Ojog.text: This restaurant has good service but no AC in the hot summer of Las Vegas heat!!! It was a 110 degree day. My husband and I were sweating profusely during  dinner. We asked the waiter to make it cooler but he said the AC was  at the maximum setting. It literally felt like we were in Thailand .

iPz8LhskLWdY02PH0A4uxg.text: Best Thai food I've ever had, and I've had a lot of Thai food!   Perfect pot stickers. The pork red curry noodle dish was my heaven. My husband had a basil pork dish with rice and devoured it.  It's a lovely little restaurant tucked away in a shopping center. Open for lunch and dinner. Depending on the night, you might still need a reservation.  Happily we live close to it, because while this was our first visit, it won't be our last!

nBz7-yhdehdAS2Q7PzrHqA.text: Its ok. Food and service are ok...For appetizer we ordered crispy pork belly...a little too salty for my taste but the sauce is good. I ordered crying tiger steak and my friend order drunken noodles. the steak wasnt bad but nothing special...took a while for the steak knife to come but the waiters are very polite so its a plus for them..the drunken noodle has a weird taste so my friend didnt eat it. Were suppose to try their pudding but weve been sitting and waiting so we kind of lost interest ordering dessert. My friend said maybe its worth a second chance..well try other food nexttime and different day maybe we can get a better service.

-aH17D2y5AIXlwtiDvsjAw.text: Thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant. Can't wait to go back.  It's so good, there's always a line.

msiIYeQAZZF_Dd9dyarDCw.text: Delicious food in an upscale atmosphere but absolutely comfortable and welcoming.   Love all the small plates but always have to order the spinach salad.   I've taken friends here multiple times and everyone raves about this hidden gem.  Something for even picky eaters.

XzXS8Y6Dq1WbownJYBhJNQ.text: What's the point of making a reservation when they seat you 30mins late and don't even have the decency to apologize for the wait. Food maybe good but service is horrible!

3LmRjIikca_SIZLOk6Ig4w.text: Have been here twice. So good. The go to place if you want great Thai food and a great experience. Always super busy. Make reservations. A little pricey but quality and well worth it. You will not be disappointed.

ILBinGA8Am-q9LwEvPTP6Q.text: This is a gem filled with good food! This place is very conducive for get together with family and friends! Love the crispy spinach salad and Drunken noodles, pineapple fried rice and the massaman curry! Not my first time in this lovely place and will be back for more!

DIF-y8CKJFBZnVZOxtWyZg.text: Meant to get this out there as we went a few weeks ago! Service is amazing and the food is even better! Great selection and everything was amazing! Make sure you order the lettuce wraps

_ZfVp3FRo90DOYC5XWQINA.text: Amazing Thai with a twist, great wines, went here twice over a weekend because the food was so good. Go early and book a table before you go if possible, this place is always humming and you could have a long wait if you don't. Also don't be shy, order a few dishes and try them all they are great and what you can't finish, box and take home, it tastes just as good the next day for lunch

ry_pndVIWZ2oL_K1g_Wo2Q.text: The place was so much smaller than I originally thought, but we came after the dinner rush so it wasn't too crowded. We made reservations and they saved a nice booth in the corner for my boyfriend and I.   We ordered the spinach salad and a large sake to start off with. For our entrees we got the salmon avocado curry and garlic basil lamb chops. Sooo flavorful! Although we were pretty full we decided that since we don't know when the next time is that we'll be able to stop by, we might as well try their dessert too. It was mango coconut rice with Thai mangos that are only in season for a few months. Next time I want to try the banana chocolate beignets!   Overall, I was thoroughly impressed with everything. Food, atmosphere, and service. I would definitely suggest this to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic basil lamb chops, salmon avocado curry, spinach salad, secret sangria, and a large sake.
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach salad that we decided was a MUST based on Yelp :p

Lba34xiTP6dIESzXw0Wj7Q.text: Really great service food and atmosphere. The waiter was super nice and food came out quickly for lunch. We love the Thai boullibaise soup and chicken satay. The spinach salad also amazing. Fresh ingredients and great taste. Even the water tastes great and infused with orange and apple.

JQGBJTsi7mVxaWCpDt622A.text: Best hidden secret in Las Vegas. This is by far our favorite place to eat out. We are always treated to kindly by the staff and the food is beyond amazing and excellent.   The meals taste fresh and you can tell are made to order, with everything having it's own unique twist to it, and it works.   Thank you Nittaya for giving us years of enjoyable dinners and evenings !

5fRKQtoX1rN_A_1VonNxNw.text: Amazing food and great date night or even special occasion spot. Service is always very pleasant and food is always tasty.

s6lr79QSeU1sYuSbcoBVEw.text: I live in Chicago now but used to go here often when I lived in Vegas. It's truly a hidden gem. Every time I come back to visit my parents, who still live in Vegas, the trip is not complete without an amazing meal at Nittaya's. Simply put, amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ws1MA3JuJEUkq0kdl8atmg.text: I love everything about this place. From the edamame appetizer to the different dishes that make my mouth water. I can't wait to go back!!! My sister found this place and when she visits we go every time.

BUfbv_159lRQYbbumXXDYA.text: Excellent cuisine with a friendly staff and owner.  The dessert menu is aptly titled "Happy Endings".  For a Thai restaurant, its utterly hilarious!

M9UEkkLy8sPPFr--VRKwSw.text: This is the mother "The hair that I gave your server was in the food that was served to me. I pulled it out of my mouth. The hair was grey, not blonde! I then placed it on the tablecloth next to me to give to your server. We did not expect you to comp the entire meal. We did expect you not to try and charge us for the dish with the hair in it. Not only did you charge for the dish, you offered us a free dessert and yes, we ordered two. So what did you do? You gave us the cheaper one for $7.00 and charged us for the dish that cost $12.00. The right thing to do would have have been for you, the chef/owner to come out, apologize and make it right. We have enjoyed our other meals at your restaurant and have recommended it to our friends. This kind of experience leaves a really bad impression and does not excite us to come back or recommend you. With such a small venue, it seems to me that you would want your customers be leave happy. As an aside, my dish was shrimp with baby bok choy as was my daughters. Both dishes came with broccoli (substitute) , with no discussion or notice from the server! Sincerely, the mother who had the grey hair in her mouth."

KOwuq-CnLe1pyFec9HcYFg.text: The restaurant is rather small and constricted in space for the tables but we managed to squeeze in one of those side tables but another customers chairback was right up against mine. The menu resembled a clipboard with a number of papers attached. Half the menu was dedicated to the food and half  dedicated to wines. our interests were focused on the Chinese dishes advertised and those were presented as tapas rather than like dim sum which in a Chinese restaurant they would've been. We ended up having three tapas plates and one entree dish. Each of the Tapas plates were tasty and imaginative. The entree was a smartly presented dish of fried rice with pineapple chicken onions and cashew nuts. I think the key to the Tapas dishes is to make sure you have the proper sauces to accompany it with. In most cases, the default sauce worked well but I would recommend asking them for whatever other kinds of sauces you happen to prefer like a soy sauce or a hot sauce. The entree dish was a pineapple fried rice with chicken onions and cashew nuts. The dish was presented in a pineapple half shell which allowed you to take it home and eat the remaining Fried rice and cut some additional pineapple from the edge. My wife loved it. in closing, I would recommend coming early because it appears to be a very popular nighttime get together place. It's a little pricey with each of the Topos dishes being about $10 each and the entrees between 11 and $18. I will be coming again!

FuAXNLqKYMTyBgyQQrHxhA.text: Not Lotus. Not Komol. But a nice addition to the Thai choices in town. Decor is weird; sort of formal which does not suit the vibe. And they charge $20 a bottle for corkage! I do, however, love the name. It conjures up intrigue and exclusivity like the famous "secret japanese steak house" in Los Angeles.  I would go back, but it's a long drive and Lotus is just down the street.

tPx76I-zjaL21vpeV8X2jA.text: If there is any one cuisine that I would say I could be considered a reputable critic on, it would have to be Thai food.  My fiance and I visit at least once a year and I lived there for a short time a couple years ago, while doing a scuba diving internship.  I've taken a coupe cooking classes  there as well, with a wonderful teacher named Miss Ya.  I'm very fond of a couple dishes that I learned during my first course, one is one of the spiciest dishes there is....PAPAYA SALAD!  And seems to be showing up on more and more on menus here in Vegas recently and the other is Massaman Curry, and we get both almost every time we eat Thai.    After reading about this place in the Weekly and then reading the reviews on here, I've been wanting to go.  Two of my favs, Thai & Tapas, YEA!  Our first impression, like a few others have mentioned, is that the decor was a little off.  After careful consideration, we decided that we should offer to donate some of our Thai artwork, perhaps in exchange for some food, lol!   Anyway, here's what we got: Papaya salad- my fiance even commented on it being quite authentic Lemongrass soup- was pretty tasty, but I needed to spice it up some more with leftover papaya salad juice :-)) Massaman Curry- we both thought it was savory and had very good quality ingredients.  Although it could've been spicier and we were never asked what level of spiciness we wanted on anything. Spinach Salad - I had to save the best for last even though we ate this before the curry.  It was simply AMAZING!  If you go here, you have to get this!  SERIOUSLY, this is not to be missed!      Overall, the food was all pretty darn good and I will definitely call in orders, but the atmosphere is a little funky, however we'll see if we can't help change that :-).     Oh yeah, I almost forgot, I LOVE the fact that they serve fruit infused water, nice touch!

C6_UVFbgNUVxsqLTyJG5fw.text: This place is really hit or miss.    My friends and I were invited by John's uncle.  And he even told us this place was really hit or miss.    And we ordered a lot of different tapas.  I mean, it's a tapas place.  You've got a large group of people.  So of course you're going to order a lot of different dishes.  So we got the fried tofu, the fried avocado, the summerlin rolls (chicken), the fire cracker prawns, the steamed mussels, the famous spinach salad and some salmon dish that I don't see on the menu now.  What was interesting.  The spinach salad was really interesting.  It's like tempura spinach with a dipping sauce on the side.  Really unique taste.  And I've never had crunchy potato-chip like spinach.  So it's pretty fun to eat.  The mussels weren't bad.  The sauce it was cooked in was a little bland but the mussels were perfectly cooked.  Fried tofu is good.  But I love fried tofu.  But then again, the fired tofu's not amazing.  The fried avocado is different.  Not bad.  Never had fried avocado so if you like avocado-I definitely recommend it.  The salmon dish was possibly the best thing we had.  Excellent.  Made me wonder if ordering tapas might have been the wrong way to go.  So what was terrible?  The summerlin rolls.  Garbarge.  The fire cracker prawns, almost tasteless.  Pricey.  Worth it?  Meh.  Food wasn't bad but I wouldn't go back.  Too many misses and not enough hits.

0TRouRUsLU6O-y8LSylZaA.text: Best Thai food in Vegas!  In my opinion way way way way way better than Lotus of Siam, puts them to shame actually.  Satay, Tao, and Lemongrass is also very good, but I like this one the  best, not sure how it was rated 10th and Lotus was #1, other than the god awful press in this town barging about it.  Honestly if you have not tried this place, give them a try, great food, good prices, however it is very small and sometimes hard to get a seat inside.

x36mPjWfL8axLAJ13KmwPQ.text: truly the best thai food in las vegas!!!  that atmosphere is fabulous - the service incredible!  nittay the owner is absolutely adorable and takes such pride in her cooking!  she sent a plate of her special fried spinach - so we have everytime we go there - which is now about 3x a week!  a definite must if you have not been there!!! make sure you make reservations at dinner time!

mMpGs5QP4MGPLdpJQOPNRQ.text: Best Thai food I've ever had; and I eat Thai food almost every day. Their Secret Stickers are amazing. I'm obsessed with the Avocado Salmon Curry and Pineapple Fried Rice. Soooo good. I crave it all the time and my mouth is watering writing this.

Saqbhv2nihCuNr6QbokBqw.text: Checked out the website today, looks like they updated it and it looks great, plus they've taken out the prices and added some tempting lunch specials.   Fully upgrading to the 4 stars that the food deserved.  Everything seems A OK now!

PiOv4vMRLaJJoqt_Eyebvw.text: When my book club suggested we try a new thai tapas place as the venue for our book discussion, my eyebrows shot up in excitement. Thai? Tapas? Two of my favs, together for the first time? The thought was blissful enough for me to trek it up to Summerlin for a taster (well, the intrigue of thai tapas and, of course, my fab book club!) Sadly, I was a bit disappointed.... but maybe it was because my expectations were set too high.   The venue itself is a bit of a surprise... the dark, somewhat seductive decor and lighting are nice... but don't really spring to mind when you think thai tapas.   Service was extremely slow, though the servers themselves (two servers kept trading responsibilities throughout the night) were very nice.   The food itself was hit or miss. Hits: White Fish Cake (the dipping sauce was awesomeness), the mango coconut rice (the bomb), and a visit by the chef/owner to our table at the end of our meal. Misses: Papaya Salad (especially after tasting some of the other fantastic papaya salads that Vegas has to offer), Panko-crusted avocado, and crab wanton (oil factor was out of control).  We tried several other tapas which were MEH.    To be fair, we went when this resto was only a few months old... so, maybe the kinks have been worked out since I dined there. I hope so because the concept itself gets 1 star!

ikDaZKMDIXCSGboqV7Q2bQ.text: Amazing! We must've tried 8 tapas and a red curry, all were delicious.  I can't wait to go back.

gcnQsmuZSbwbCGr_qemsYg.text: I was in the Summerlin neighborhood, and had this spot bookmarked, so thought I would give it a try!  I've read earlier reviews, and it looks like they have established themselves nicely now.  The interior is very upscale, which wine glasses and fancy wood furniture.  The dining area is small, but nicely designed.  Wine bottles are fancily displayed in wooden shelves behind the bar.  There is even a small outside dining area, which might be nice on a summer night.  The easy listening music would have touched my inner yuppie, if I had one.  I had no issues with the service.  I made a bit of small talk with one of the waitresses, and she explained that Nittaya's has only been open for two months.  My water was always full, and they asked me how my food was.  This also was the first Thai restaurant I've been to where the waitress folded my napkin over my lap.  I wasn't even with anyone!  Can't complain there.   My order: Thai tea, Crab Wontons, and Curry catfish.   Overall impression: descent, Americanized Thai.  Thai tea was average, very creamy, but not very flavorful.  I would go ahead and skip the Thai tea at Nittaya's.  The water though had fruit in it!  This is how my old stoming grounds, Thai Grill, does their water, and it makes for a very refreshing, slightly tangy drink.    The Crab Wontons were a little bland on the inside.  They used some sort of either immitation crab, or low quality crab, mixed with cream cheese and a couple of herbs.  The fried shells were nice though, thick and well prepared.   They came with two sauces, a sweet sauce and a spicy one.  Both were good sauces, particularly the spicy one, and they made the crab wontons definitely more doable.  Overall though, I wasn't too impressed.    The curry catfish was alright.. not great, not bad though.  The curry sauce was thick, and on the sweet side, but in this case that was ok because catfish is always a little better with sweetness to offset the "dry" catfish taste.  The portion was a little small for the $13 price tag.  The curry came with a nice change of pace though: baby bok choy.  This did give the curry a little bit of a unique taste, I and enjoyed it.    Overall, due to the sweetness of the curry, and the not-so-thrilling crab wontons, I wouldn't go out of my way to eat at Nittaya's again over some of the better, more authentic Thai restaurants in Vegas (see my List), but it would be a good spot to bring a date or the parents maybe.

7Nx3NFesiFfhUE8D4qBFBQ.text: I absolutely love this place! The food is amazing, service is perfect and the atmosphere and presentation make you feel like you are at a 5-star restaurant but their amazing lunch combo is only $12! They have different infused water available each day, like mint cucumber, and it's always so yummy and refreshing. They just hit every single detail here and I could eat their drunken noodles every day!

2sFNaFbjIgf2j5xfFK_XuA.text: My mom was overly jovial when we left the restaurant and this is a rare sight to see. The service was quaint, cute and on-point.  The food also delicious of course. Attention to detail, cleanliness and relaxed atmosphere.... I would undoubtedly recommend

h_ENzY0LKJTE04KaymRcSg.text: Just all around awesome. My friends and my favorite spot. Hidden and hopefully not everyone finds out about it. Will definitely keep it our secret.

0f8JzM3g3dbki7AFetoosQ.text: This place is exceptional. It's a small bistro setting and the food is excellent.  Customer service was first class.  Small portion size but gourmet presentation, and incredible flavors.  The night we went the house special was Ahi Pokey, OMG, delicious!

RhCSZIKxP2YMilzaYUq2UA.text: This is one of the best little gems in Las Vegas! Quaint, charming, intimate setting with incredible Thai food. I have always been a lover of Thai food but Nittaya's is taking it to the next level. It is inventive, creative and sexy! This is a great place for date night or to come have Thai tapas with friends and enjoy their happy hour. ($5 tapas $5 glasses of wine) You MUST try the spinach salad. It's individually tempura fried spinach leaves with an amazing Thai cashew dipping sauce! Also the Basil Tofu is fantastic as is the Coconut Curry Chicken! WOW I cannot say enough great things about this place!

2DisRESojAUSioOSr3_rnQ.text: I'm so obsessed with papaya salad and had not found one to die for since I was in highschool in Oregon. I've been in Vegas two years now and just came across this place. I was happy to see they had the papaya salad on the menu (as many Thai places if been to don't) so I ordered it with sticky rice. You have to eat the salad with sticky rice, with your fingers....it's the only way in my opinion. Do it. It was perfect! The perfect amount of peanuts and spice. In love- so happy. I ordered the pad Thai, because---u just have to. And it was great- although I could only eat a few bites. Too stuffed from the salad. I am looking forward the trying the mango/coconut dessert and some curry dishes. When I first started eating Thai food those were the best...all I ever ate. So thankful to have found an authentic Thai place to eat. Ps- I just ordered take-out. The staff was super nice and it was ready right when I got there.

O8D541aQNnAlI1YaLbagjA.text: Such a fun and different taste. I highly recommend a reservation as it is very small. Perfect for dates. Cilantro steak skewers are a must and literally the best curry puffs ever.

69gIR_5iEwbWsLeHBljdew.text: This little gem of a restaurant has won me over after only 2 visits. Most Thai places I've visited feel too cold, too sterile, too kitschy. Nittaya is a comfortable space that feels elegant without feeling stuffy.  The food is the True star. Nittay's Secret Kitchen serves "Thai Tapas". I was skeptical that this was just another marketing term for "not enough food". I was pleasantly surprised. Generously portioned, beautiful and tasty creations graced my table. The World Famous Spinach salad is a revelation. Deep fried Avocado with panko crumbs and two sauces will make you swoon.   I plan on eating my way through the menu :)

TV6HneWhHNHUR5ePgw75uQ.text: So earlier, I had a higher review of this restaurant (only 3 starts) but after a whole fiasco of incorrect credit card charges unfolded after my visit, I must give this place a much lower rating.  I went with my friend, and we wanted to split the bill down the middle, which is easy enough, but they double charged her and then were very rude about the whole thing, refusing to refund the money.   This was to top of an already mediocre to poor evening of service.  I am so embarrassed to have invited my friend here for what was supposed to be a fun girls' night out.

kmAPvuWTljdsS6eC6bt3TQ.text: Must try their world famous Spanish salad, it's probably not what you expect.  Thai tapas are usually what I try.  Love most of them, some even "just like mama makes it".    I've tried curry which they ask between 1-5 and we had a 5 (which my friend asked for a thai 5 not a white guy's 5, since he's had some places skimp thinking he can't handle it) and it wasn't that spicy at all.  Although he did get the Duck Curry, which too spicy might overpower the dish.  So it's understandable.  My other friend got a 3 tofu curry.  TO DIE FOR!  I loved it and I am normally not a curry fan.  Although eatting a whole dish by myself I don't know (that's just not my dish nothing against the food)  I prefer Pad Thai.  They have tofu and chicken, but we asked for Duck.  They made it for us.  It was heaven! I would ask them to make it again!    They also have wine there...and are pretty knowledgeable and will let you try some of the wine if you were interested in trying it.  ((We spent more in wine than our dishes...we had 7 people and our bill ended up being 150 for food and 170 for wine))  I say with that many people, it was a good deal :)

TTexD1sJ0boYY5iK5Qpbmg.text: Wow what a treat! A friend recommended I try this place and I'm glad I did. I ordered the seafood medley but in Penang curry. The dish was beautiful with the clams, mussels, shrimp, fish etc. spice was good. I prefer so hot that it makes me cry. Not quite that but just right to taste it without over powering the other flavors. Friendly staff, great atmosphere, wonderful food. What else would you want.

esPAhCu41IauSXOIZ9HRaw.text: What a great concept, my husband and I enjoyed the small plates Nittayas has managed to put a fun and creative way to eat authentic Thai food. The place is very pretty nice atmosphere, the owner and chef happened to stop by are table we  where telling her we are enjoying the taste treats, she said she uses her mother's recipes and also adds her own style to the dishes. I would definitely be going back maybe bring some of my friends on girls night out!!

eQ79fnKW5Or-edNgBI384A.text: I've been here a few times and I must always order the spinach salad... so so good! who doesn't like friend spinach with a yummy cashew sauce?  I tried the fried avocados, not as amazing, the curries are delish! The restaurant is small and doesn't have a lot of tables so if you go on a Friday/Saturday be prepared to wait... but its so worth it!

XT043AYHEdF9iH0EFiycXg.text: We had driven by this restaurant many times but never saw many cars and were hesitant to go in for dinner.  On a recent Thursday night we arrived there a little early,  which was a good thing since its a small restaurant with few tables that really fills up.  Our waiter was very helpful with the complex menu.  Her recommendations which included the fried spinach didn't disappoint,  the food was great.  The prices good, and the portions ample.  The atmosphere was also lovely, so unexpected from the outside.   We will defiantly make this a neighborhood regular

vQ2zjw-LXgNxFIvFgiE8_w.text: All I can say is WOW is this place good!!  My husband and i stumbled on this spot and we are hooked.  It is VERY small inside but it lends to the cool vibe.  Service is EXCELLENT and very attentive.  The food is off th ehook.  Be sure to ask for specials, we learned that trick on visit #3.  ALso, you should try the tempura fried spinach salad, it is remarkable!!

WpNKSkv9RHqa9gOcHGFChQ.text: Nittaya's is a diamond in the rough. I've been here twice and have had a sampling from the tapas and happy endings (dessert) menus. I would recommend particular dishes, but so far everything has been delicious...so try everything! The service is top notch, the decor is beautiful, and the aroma of fresh flowers only adds to the ambiance.  This is the type of place to have a relaxing dinner with friends, to bring a date or out of town guests, or to go just because.   P.S. Half price bottles of wine on Thursdays!

cXZ3Zf_6Y1UVyaQSNWmMPg.text: Went for dinner on a Thursday night abs had a great experience. First of all, wine is half off the bottle on Thursdays....can't go wrong with that! Outside patio is nice (minus the bench seat very uncomfortable) and perfect when the sun is setting. Overall one word for the food....amazing. The spicy catfish is delicious and the shrimp pad Thai is amazing. Will be back again....and again.

jJMuU9-aMwoNmHqGhMJjzw.text: Wow, wow and wow. It has been years since I've been impressed by a restaurant other than one other. This place really deserves 5 stars. Every dish we had was excellent. You can see from my other reviews I'm not so easy to please.  They do an excellent job of taking spices and adding flavors that are new and delicious without over doing it. I can't wait to try other things on their menu. This trip we tried the spinach salad (what a shock it's so good), the chicken masaman, the eggplant curry, a noodle dish that was top notch and the Phucket poppers (the most disappointing and still excellent).  If I had one complaint it's time to replace the chairs unless it's just the one I had. It was extremely uncomfortable. No reason to downgrade restaurant, just a note. A little cramped, but hey, what can you do. It's excellent food, popular and limited in size. I own a restaurant and hope that my customers enjoy my shop as much as I enjoyed this one. I can't say enough about it. Thank you for a great night out.

mayf74S6w8foV5J5IqAXYA.text: Gf liked the boullabaise, spinach tempura interesting at first...fish cake rubbery but flavorful.  Very nice decor. Great napkin folding.  Waiter hawked a phlegmball just as we were taking our first bite in an otherwise quiet restaurant.

ahNX-4oGuP21cmGSzG9TUg.text: This recently opened Thai restaurant specializes in small plates though regular sized entrees are available.  We started off with the tempura spinach salad with ground chicken, shrimp and lime dressing (4.5 Forks) and white fish cake with lettuce, Thai spices and a sweet chili sauce (2 Forks).  Our second order was a stuffed chicken wing (4) and a crab cake in shell (3).  For dessert we enjoyed the housemade coconut ice cream (4).

bBskOUf3cO632fUmnDbIMw.text: Spinach salad is a must try.  Pad thai is good, not as good as Lotus of Siam.  Pad see ew tastes similar to Pin Kaow.  Really good thai iced tea.  Pricier than most thai restaurants.  Service is good and fast.  Decor is lovely.  I will probably go once in a while but since Pin Kaow is nearby, this will not be a regular place for me.

K0M1WC70cYa5iFxfNzoMdA.text: The Spinach salad is actually more kinda like Spinach "nachos" -- spinach dipped in tempura so they're like crunchy chips that you can dip in a delicious sauce. The tofu Pad Thai and Beef Pad See Ew were also good. The prawn tapas was a little dry / not recommended.

UfHwPEZxPd50oQnq4pxcjA.text: Nitayyas is one of our favorite places however, last night left much to be desired.  The person that waited on us did not present the service we are accustom to receiving at Nittaya's.  We did overhear him as he advised other patrons that he is the manager, if that was the case why was he semi-serving us?

0eQVzm9OF5BKlC9XhS6jlg.text: We were pleasantly surprised about this hidden gem. The reason one star is missing is because they were out of each wine we tried to order on their half off night- which was frustrating.  However, the rest of the meal pleased us.  Never would I think a fried spinach salad would taste so good.  We also enjoyed the drunken noodles and  red curry. The dining room is small, so a reservation is highly recommended.

Ru9P2ul3JS9da8p8Hmt0dg.text: Another Thai favorite to my list. This is a hidden gem. Great tasting food and drink menu

JUgbWDVoLJ6Hk905kCqbwg.text: Thai food is my number one and Nittayas made it difficult for me to enjoy the fast food Thai selections in Korea town that I've been use to. From the minute you enter the cozy setting dim lights and amazing customer service sets off the night in a great mood. This restaurant came in well over my expectations and every single dish was full of surprises. I tried several dishes. The pineapple fried rice bacon wrapped shrimp as well as the pad Thai Ended with the rice and ice cream inside the coconut. I am very excited about planning my next visit!

HxHRPBLMJdZ8qV0uDrj-jg.text: This place has mediocre Thai food comparing to others in the area and price tag is expensive for the taste and quantity. Curry is served in a small soup bowl and taste is just bland. Will never come back here.

fMpaLnTFVoxIBCMAMXe7uQ.text: This was a fantastic experience. The appetizers were so beautifully presented and delicious besides. Happy hour is between 3-6 pm. Such wonderful ambiance. I would totally recommend to Thai foodies. So good!!!

aYkcqrDXtNfhKrWEM_BnDQ.text: This place is amazing, my favorite Thai restaurant nationwide.  Fresh, delicious authentic recipes in a sincere and personal environment.  You wont be disappointed.

8HWxfteMVpKBaHz0saFgjA.text: Crying Tiger Steak hopelessly overcooked.  Second attempt, same result.  Waitress possessed ZERO customer service skills.   Surprised as previous experiences had all been excellent.  Asked tonsoeak to owner.  First waitress claimed to have spoken to owner.  Second waitress claimed owner was at another location all day.  Poor service AND lying to the customers?  Will never go back.  Strongly suggest you choose another restaurant.

_kUMqMjapK9S5lModxBE2Q.text: Wow.... the food is absolutely amazing...nothing Else to be said.... best in vegas by a mile... staff is awesome..

DmZ3YLsKjgD1sbHrOzeUUg.text: I hate to give only two stars but it's way over priced for the quality and quantity good you are getting. Plus the past two times we ordered to pick up. We ordered no heat & it's like they purposely made it extra spicey, so it was a huge waste of $$ past two times. Bummer because this was a family favorite since the day she opened. There is a great hole in the wall Thai place rampart/lake mead area by smiths!! Check it out!!

g63lMy4FnurbqNBFPOwqAw.text: Went here to try for lunch today. Going through Yelp photos just now at home, I realized the wait staff deliberately did not give us the lunch menu.   What a shame. So deceitful.

SZtz0I4V2Te3319kF9ZssA.text: Gently flavoured Thai food, not to much spicy also  with smooth of coconut pulp. Good ingredients (I had seafood) but too persistent sweet sensation in any plate. Service level fair. Honest check.

ZUh8A_kfdWZwdSknHXz-4w.text: Nittaya's is my new Thai restaurant to go to! So far everything I've ordered is fresh and delicious! From yellow curry to their Tom yum soup! Definitely recommend it!

7wK3fuBl2SJY-TwXFyG28Q.text: Great little intimate restaurant. Seriously great. Love their appetizers and their wine list. We haven't had their entrees yet just because we love to get their appetizers which are seriously delicious.  One night we'll venture into those; they alos look awesome.

7pjXMPvVVMz9beYth8wdaQ.text: Went here after this place was highly recommended, we ordered the following: 1. Duck curry with Lychee: good sauce so I enjoyed that but the duck was so hard.  2. Coconut soup with noodle: Bad, it was sour 3. Pad Thai : Really good probably the best thing we ordered  4. Bacon wrapped shrimp; it was decent too 5. Cashew shrimp: Ok, too much soy  6. Chocolate mousse: average 7. Banana chocolate Bignet ; good 8. Coconut ice cream: good 9. Egg rolls: good I probably would not return, hope this helps :)

9LzSwjG7y7QEfw5fzPXegg.text: Fell in love with the tapas menu! Tried a few things, want to go back to try more. Everything was great. The service, the food, the wine. Will definitely be back, especially for half price bottle wine night! Cheers!

Mh0jEudFTIw76Pe-O3ke-g.text: #latereview 08/09/2015  I enjoyed my time more being with friends than being here. I will give them a chance again but for now I have other go to places for Thai.  Now I know going in that I should be more prepared and check to see if reservations were needed. My friend suggested this place without a reservation. So we ended up being sat at the bar. No worries there. Completely our fault.  To start off the dinner with friends I ordered my usual papaya salad. Theirs had shrimp so I said why not? I enjoyed the flavor more than the dish itself. The dressing was on point, but the usual crispness that you would expect from a green papaya was just not there. The peanuts did lend to the crunchiness but it was not the same. I appreciate seafood but for some reason to me it did not pair well with the salad. I don't know how the shrimp was handled during preparation but it did not have a good texture. Like it sat too long in the dressing maybe? It was just off putting. I didn't get sick after the dinner so I'm not saying the shrimp was spoiled, but it did not have the usual characteristic of something fresh.   The Duck Breast Curry was okay. Well, better than okay. I appreciated the fact that it was a duck breast which meant no bones to pick through, but it was just not the same as other duck curries I've had at other restaurants.   By the time I got to the dessert, I was impressed by the presentation... Then this happened. This is more of the chef in me so I don't know if it goes unnoticed by most people, but seeing that same garnish (purple edible orchids) throughout all my courses... I think it's enough. Yes there's a time and place for it but not through every single course.   All in all, I felt the food was okay. Would I go back? I would not actively do it but if friends suggested it I will still go.

FfnT_pho8eI5tafcNcjzkQ.text: This food (from what I ate was) was some of the best meat I have ever eaten the restaurant is small but it has a cozy feel to it and has exceptional food. The appetizer that I ate was the fried pork belly and it was amazing, crispy on the outside and delicious on the inside 8 out of 10 overall,  also there is a good Selection of vegetable dishes and wine as well as beer on tap

cmD2d7cz_CzWnj0mU8SpJQ.text: WOW!!  This was our first visit to this restaurant, and we were amazed at the food, the service, and the ambiance.  The dining area is cozy and intimate without feeling crowded.  I've never eaten Thai food this good.  Each dish tasted freshly-prepared, was garnished beautifully, and had a tasty sauce served with it.  We started with the lemongrass soup - it was fragrant, well-seasoned, and had many large, perfectly-cooked shrimp in it.  We decided to stick with the tapas - the soft-shell crab was perfectly-cooked and served with a bright, crunchy apple salad - the perfect pairing.  I can also highly recommend the ribs and the coconut shrimp.  The service was attentive and pleasant.  We'll be regulars here, and next time I will save room for dessert!

gtv_tDSruX2jljCx5xu0dw.text: This place is like no other Thai restaurant i have ever been to. It's modern and upscale but still has the flavors that are True to Thai cuisine. This place is ran incredibly well and probably my new favorite Thai restaurant ever!

9Rb-bivEp_8nNVexDCp5iQ.text: TL;DR Don't get the drunken noodle. Don't get any noodles. Stick to fried rice or curry. Get the world famous spinach salad, but stay away from the thai ice tea.  This place for me was meh for me. Everything was great until I had the thai ice tea then it started going downhill.    World Famous Spinach Salad: Rating: 5/5 The best part of the meal. Really good. If you com here, you have to get the world famous spinach salad. Come with an appetite as it will fill you up. Who knew spinach would be so good deep fried.   Thai Ice Tea Rating 2/5 I expected better. It came in a wine glass instead of a tall glass. Honestly it wasn't that great, but at least it wasn't fake thai tea made from powder. I always get thai ice tea as it is a staple drink for any thai place. Meh #1.  Crying Tiger Steak Rating: 4/5 The sauce was very good with the steak. Medium rare. I feel like one of the best thing here is the sauce.  Drunken Noodle Rating: 1/5 Honestly this ruined my entire dining experience. Not only did it come out last and late compared to the crying tiger steak, but it was soggy and falling apart. I would stick a fork into the noodle and it would fall apart from it's own weight. Not only that, it was too salty, and the sauce flavor destroyed the entire dish. The only thing you could taste was the salty sauce. I talked to a waiter about it and he said it should be like that. What it tastes like is like leftover drunken noodle plates were recycled and recooked into my plate with some extra sauce to cover up the recooking process. I wouldn't even feed that to my dog. He might die from the sodium overload.

wVveqpVzfOhCj29YFs93CA.text: This place is a hidden gem in Summerlin, seating is a little cramped but that's what gives it quirky appeal. The Thai cuisine was amazing, with a Asian fusion twist.    A+on the cool 'secret door', love it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This dessert was loved a lot!!!
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute presentation !!
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jcvvYX5cA5M536wbv4GzvA.text: The "Not So Secret Salad" is one of my favorite salads in town! It's more of an interpretation than an actual salad, but I don't let that pesky detail get in the way. The dish is tempura-fried spinach leaves with a sweet-and-spicy dressing slash dipping sauce. You can dip the leaves as you go and eat it like nachos, or dump on the dressing and attempt to use a fork. Either way, your taste buds will be quite delighted. You can share this as an app or order it as your main, like I do.  Nittaya's Secret Kitchen has $11 lunch specials that include a salad and potsticker, as well as a Happy Hour (Mon-Thurs, 3-6PM). The Not So Secret Salad is also $11 though, so I find myself ordering that instead of branching out to try new things.  Small neighborhood place, classy decor and local art, lots of wines available. They have a small section of patio seating, and some day I'll actually try something else on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not so secret salad

IQyb5e5MfOcksxF9QcRwsg.text: I enjoyed Nittaya's Thai on many levels...   Food.  Not strictly traditional Thai, as some of the dishes are made with a twist off of traditional dishes, but tasty nonetheless.  Great portions at reasonable prices.  Each of our items, including the spinach salad could've easily served four.    Loved the cozy, modern back dining room.    Very nice servers.  Being new employees here, a couple of new servers didn't have the answer to several of our detailed questions, but repeatedly said they would go back and get the answers for us.  They did. All servers should be trained to provide this kind of service!  Management here knows how to both hire and train well.    And the food...  Spinach Salad - This is unlike any spinach salad you've ever had.  Firstly, don't mistakenly think for even a moment that this "salad" is going to be a healthy option.  That said, it's really delicious, and one of the non-traditional Thai items with a twist. Each individual spinach leaf is perfectly deep fried in a light tempura batter, and this massive mound of fried spinach tempura is served with a light fish sauce you can use as "salad dressing".  The fish sauce dressing is more like something you'd find at a Vietnamese restaurant, but was really a perfect super light topping for the delicately individually fried pieces of spinach.  Frying each of the individually tempura dipped spinach leaves sounded like such a labor intensive dish, that I had to order it.  I didn't devour it like a salad, but rather as an appetizer, dipping the pieces of spinach into the fish sauce.  They're addicting and would be a great appetizer for a crowd.    Vegetarian Green Curry - You can select a spice level between 1-5.  We asked for a 3, and it was perfect.  Definitely spicy, but not so crazy hot that you can't actually taste the food, and end up blowing your nose like you have a bad cold.  The portion was huge, and could've easily served four.  It was a tad saltier than I would've preferred, but I really enjoyed the curry, which was on the creamier side.  The eggplant and tofu were both delicious.  I would've appreciated more tofu though, as they were cut into pretty darn tiny pieces.   Thai Doughnuts - Just had to try these, as I've never had Thai doughnuts.  That said, I wouldn't get them again.  They were nicely fried, but somewhat dense, and nothing like I imagined a doughnut to be.  Unless you like your doughnuts completely drenched in sugar, ask for the caramel sauce on the side.   It's always a great feeling to leave the restaurant wanting to try other dishes you've eyed on the menu, or on a neighboring table.  This was that kind of a place for us, so we definitely plan on returning.

Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu Specials
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

G5XH2QEiKjXLqcqVyS03Hw.text: I ate here with some friends from work and enjoyed every bite of my food. I ordered the Crying Tiger Steak and it was perfectly cooked. The steak was tender, juicy, and practically melted in my mouth. It was even yummy when I reheated the leftovers. The crab won tons were delicious too. My coworkers ordered the spinach salad and the pork bellies and I had a bite of both. Let's just say that I will be ordering both of those dishes when I go back. For dessert I finished up with the Island Sunday Fool and it tasted like Heaven. The staff were friendly and provided excellent service. I can't wait to take my boyfriend to this delightful little place.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crying Tiger Steak and rice. Delicious!

Zi_98uYqqzk7fxvqakIggQ.text: This is our favorite great little neighborhood Thai restaurant. Conveniently located just off of Lake Mead and Rampart. We love the atmosphere and enjoy eating a leisurely lunch or dinner. I would highly recommend coming and discovering this hidden gem in Summerlin.

7TI2lv-EmxrFES5wn4TiXA.text: This spot is so good!   I've been on three different occasions, but can't seem to go without ordering the salmon topped avocado! They have been busy each time, but I've gotten lucky in snagging a seat without having to wait.   The tempura spinach wasn't everyone's favorite as it is a little heavy, but the fish sauce it's served with is really good. The crab fried rice was perfect, and I wish I lived closer so I could order it daily.   As the man-friend pointed out, it's not a place where the portions are small so that you can order a few appetizers AND and entree and still have room to finish it all. Doesn't mean I don't do it...just sayin' the portions are pretty generous. Aside from everything being really amazing,  the bread pudding was the perfect way to end the meal.   Highly recommend, would come back!!

VkUj_eB2ICGZmPs2BzgOuw.text: Perfect place for a date night. The staff is friendly and the food is excellent. I really recommend calamari and kaosoy

3hufaN7MadUC3JQl3bOTHQ.text: The definition of a hidden gem.  When my friend and I walked in, he immediately said he felt like he had been transported to a different place than Las Vegas.  The atmosphere is great.  Very dark, chic and kind of romantic.  The service was pretty good.  We ordered fairly quickly and we were never lacking for water.  The food came out quickly with the exception of one dish that basically came after we were done eating.  Now lets get to the food.  Very high quality with intense flavors.  The entrees and tapas are expensive but you get quite a bit for your buck and seriously the flavor is so good you won't care how much it costs.  The spinach salad is a must have.  YOU MUST GET THIS.  The sauce it comes with I could drink.  The mussels are pretty good too.  We added the coconut sauce it comes with to our soup, it was so good.  I did not like the homemade ice cream.  It was flavorful but very icy and grainy.    Definitely worth a try.  You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut ice cream
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is how much we liked this
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodles

TAGaFxHf5iMzao1eZl9IaQ.text: Thanks to my sister for this recommendation. My fiance and I came here for lunch this time around at 1pm in the afternoon. Only a few others were here, and the perfect time to take  your time to eat. If you plan on coming in for dinner highly recommend to make reservations as they get packed.   For our second visit, I noticed the menu is more expansive. They do have lunch specials going for $11 with salad and chicken potsticker from 11am-3pm. The rest of the menu has appetizers, tapas, entrees, a huge list of wine, cocktails, and alcohol and desserts.   What we ordered: the famous spinach salad w/the lime sauce, thai beef jerky w/the green sauce  (beware, this green sauce is soooo addicting), pork belly w/the spicy chilli sauce, shrimp, secret stickers (basil chicken flavored) and the muay thai fried rice. Everything we ordered came mostly off of the tapas menu and the muay thai fried rice we decided to get from the dinner menu.   Everything we tasted has been the best thai food we have tasted in so long.  Spinach salad is enough to feed a party of 4 to 5 ppl. Spinach also has been perfectly cooked. Adding the lime sauce adds a bit of the kick. Definitely recommend for first timers. Pork belly with the chilli sauce and the pork was tender. This is the thai version of the Filipino version of lechon. Shrimp was on point with the chilli sauce. The chicken basil pot stickers, were different. Crunchy on the outside and juicy, tender when you bite right into it. Last, the fried rice was fluffy and evenly seasoned and enough to feed a whole family.  The service: by far one of the best. They were attentive, suggested other options, on point with refills.   Overall: we enjoyed our service and definitely recommend if you want to enjoy dinner or lunch. Will be back soon.
