Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Famous spinach salad

tT3KUpQeivQtyfvvOiBdJg.text: First date with my girlfriend!  Unforgettable!  We were there for 3 hours until close and the staff never said a word!  I feel kind of bad but not really!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PtZ84OxihnYhbDY4X-HHhg.text: This place is over rated and over priced! Took forever for them to wait on us. When they did and the food arrived we didn't see them again until we were almost done.  The chicken was over cooked and the soup was lacking in flavor.

I_itrJ4ljB5iM-9t8AX9oA.text: This is my FAVORITE Thai restaurant. If you are looking for some amazing Tapas and Wine, this is the place to be. Highly recommend their worlds best spinach salad, served with an awesome sauce with chicken and cashews (can be substituted with tofu for the veggie lovers) Some great veggie tapas choices are golden pouches and curry puffs. My husband loves their Phuket poppers, with shrimp jalapenos and cream cheese. The main course has all the traditional Thai curries, very good portions. I ordered spicy basil tofu and it was excellent.  Every Thursday they do half price wine by the bottle. They have a select menu to choose from and has a really good selection of wines. You can get a nice bottle of Chardonnay (original price $36 for $18!!) it's a steal.  The service is always awesome. For extra heat I request their Thai chilies which the staff is happy to serve.

tYiSrti4n5eOy6Yofu9GGg.text: Food was so good! Its definitely a place you should probably get a reservation for of your going during the night on the weekend otherwise youll probably have to wait but its worth it. The service was good but the food was even better. One of the best Thai restaurants Ive been to in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iTPEiilKP5sI82L3tSWOGw.text: It looks like "secret" because it is located in a small shopping center that won't impress you. Then you get to walk in and experience amazing atmosphere. The food is matching the decor... maybe the food is even better than decor, you must decide for yourself. This "secret" is no "secret" to locals, so you must make reservations. It's packed lunch and dinner. Attention to detail here is world class! We love Nittaya's so much that it is our regular "date" place.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tk-10tWdoakzfs4iEw-26A.text: Pricier than Lemongrass at aria, which is somewhat crazy to justify. But the place was good. Panang duck was great. And they have some "world famous" fried spinach appetizer that was shockingly tasty.  Nice wine assortment.  Will definitely go back. But again, possibly priciest thai food in Vegas.

gjChbflpvXsOemSBAGfoPw.text: Such a hidden gem, very intimate. Seems like recently they've added more stuff on the menu. I've had the pad Thai chicken and the drunken noodles, which were really yummy! I recommend the spinach salad and the green tea creme brulee. Oh and we also saw David copperfield having lunch there As well. They are also linked to block 9 streets.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio of Creme Brulee
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. David copperfield

tsncOs_MKHC9w_PkwdHD7g.text: Went here for our Valentines Dinner with another couple. This restaurant is very good. From the greeting when you first walk in, the service and the great food this place is incredible. All of our dishes were delicious and well presented. The selections were vast quite interesting. The Spinach Salad was very unique and delicious. The beef jerky, the pork belly and Thai fried rice were all delicious. Our entrees were all delicious. I feel we could have ordered anything on the menu and we would have not been disappointed, the restaurant was packed so obviously a lot of people also love this place.

lj3BRvH0tzNcs8C6qNqjoA.text: I have long been a fan of Las Vegas' Lotus of Siam, often cited as the top Thai restaurant in the US. Years ago a friend recommended, Nittaya's Secret Kitchen... and I discovered the West Side's best kept secret.  Nittaya is located at Lake Mead and Rampart and is a west side local favorite. The decor is thoughtful and warm with wood and fabrics and an intimate even romantic feel. The restaurant feels small with two adjacent dining rooms and a wine bar.  The food is undeniably delicious with the usual variety of a top notch Thai restaurant. As good of Thai food as I have ever had, including Lotus and Thailand! While I dine here alone at the bar or as a couple often, I prefer going with a group so I can over order and get deeper in the menu.  My favorites are the citrus steak salad and the Kao Soi. The FOB pineapple rice is a great addition to any meal and the chicken dumplings are excellent. Actually, everything is delicious.  The service is warm and friendly, Josh has been there for years providing exceptional service. Thank you!  The wine list is decent, I highly recommend a bottle of Reisling to compliment your meal. Try the Schloss or Monchoff. Thursday, they have 1/2 off wine bottles.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Citrus Beef Salad
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. FOB rice!
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kao Soi. The Best.

DFr-gPmqTrrt1otxzn_kzQ.text: Upscale Thai food   I must admit that this place appeals to me from the outside alone. It's a great way to set the mood and prepare you for what's about to take place inside.   The decor is beautiful and I'm the type of person who really appreciates the little details like fresh flowers at each table and complimentary infused water.  The food is fantastic, packed with bold flavors. I'm a big fan of the sweet & sour coconut soup, pineapple fried rice served in an actual pineapple and the famous spinach salad! I could drink the dipping sauce straight for the salad! I also appreciate that every dish is so beautifully prepared.   Prices are higher here and of course you could get cheaper Thai food but no other Thai place looks like this one. It's about the overall experience here and it's a great one.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pineapple rice is AMAZING
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The world famous spinach salad
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut soup ~ perfection

yQng-a25TW6xCPYfeKumPA.text: This is a great restaurant.... the reason I gave it 3 stars is because my experience tonight did not live up to previous visits by a long shot. I noticed the orchid flowers on the dishes are gone ... not a bid deal by itself but the portion sizes got much smaller too ... the chicken Penang had plenty of chicken just no sauce, the drunken noodles tasted good, fried salad was smaller but still a great dish ... the shrimp pad Thai was the exception as it seems better than before. The service was friendly but rather slow. This is my wife's favorite restaurant in Las Vegas so I hope they get back on track soon.

6GhakxGTthx8p1EKnTchSw.text: Delicious thai food! It's a little spicy, so when they say spicy, they mean it! The place itself is really cute and they have great customer service.

fL_K2eZ0toiB2zDOF5Dqng.text: If you're looking for some great Thai food this is definitely the place. Great prices and amazing quality. Much healthier than others around as well with the way they cook and ingredients used. Love the pad Thai. For sure a great choice.

p4vdAaqCRdmUO8fXrQqnRA.text: I found myself in Nittaya's the other day after asking Siri for Thai nearby me.  I have lived in this area for almost 8 years, and I am embarrassed to say I have never stopped by.  I stopped in and placed an order for take out, but was immediately taken back by the very intimate and sophisticated interior decor.  I know Thai, and this was much more White Orchid. Very classy, very inmate.    For sure, there were still classic Thai accouterments adoring the walls, but it was not overdone.  I really wish I could rate the wine bar, because it looked above-average, and who doesn't want to rate a wine bar?   I can rate two things: a few of the dishes and the service I received.   I ordered Curry in Young Coconut, Basil Beef, and Tofu Pad Thai (always have to try the Pad).  The Basil Beef was excellent (similar preparation to Mint Beef), sweet and savory.  The Pad Thai was also excellent.  Not overdone, not too sauced, and the waitress asked if the included egg was OK - as a Tofu dish, I could see how egg may put some people off and this was a nice touch.     The Curry Coconut?  Oh my.  It was the perfect dish. Amazing curry spice sauce, mussels, clams, scallops, and whitefish all roasted inside a coconut.  My son hasn't stopped talking about it for two days.  This is a definite must-do.  The service was very polite and professional and did not lack.    I can't wait to go back after finding this gem for a proper sit-in dinner.  Maybe I will get  to review the wine bar, too.  For the sake of review only, of course.  I'm holding off on 5 (or 3) stars until I get a full sit-in experience.

Tz9qeaCYRgYItOeE5pRhYg.text: The best thai around! Love this little gem

f3iK128FsI9wai0aqk-F5g.text: Really 3.5, this place is super cute and cozy. Perfect for a date night, but keep in mind it's very small. Decent wine selection. The food had more of an Americanized Thai flavor, but still good. The Thai tea was waaaayy too sweet. I would stay away. They have great lunch specials. Service was ok, not great but not bad.

91HroFEGtXOJgHhLXbI84A.text: Food was very tasty. Large portions . Great value . Loved the decor . Small but VERY charming . Service was good until the end. We waited a long time for our check.

gedbNRPcugvLnQuavQ5UAQ.text: Excellent cuisine with a friendly staff and owner.  The dessert menu is aptly titled "Happy Endings".  For a Thai restaurant, its utterly hilarious!

pL8cetmUdWc1hPjLK4vJ5Q.text: 4 stars doesn't do this place justice. This is a 5 star place!!!! The ambiance, quality of food, and prices are unbelievable!!!! Better than high end places in downtown Las Vegas

zPM-RshpqstP-D0ZcqZ6lg.text: Shhhhh...don't tell anyone because this is a secret kitchen.  I have had this restaurant bookmarked for awhile because I kept reading about the world famous spinach salad.  I love spinach.  And I love anything deep fried.  It is a match made in heaven.    I met a friend for lunch here and upon entering we were impressed with the elegant and serene atmosphere. We decided to start off with the spinach salad to share, and each ordered from the $11 lunch menu.    I now understand why this spinach salad is "world famous".  It was delicious.  Perfectly crispy, and the larb/lime dressing that accompanied it was fantastic.  I would eat salads (even non deep fried ones) everyday if I could pour that dressing on it.    I ordered the Basil Eggplant and it also came with a small salad a potsticker, and my friend went with the classic Chicken Pad Thai. Everything was beautifully presented. And more importantly, tasted delicious.  I had stuffed myself silly with the spinach salad, but could not resist licking my entree plate clean.  My dish automatically comes at a spice level of 1 (on a scale of 5) and I upped to a 3 to give it that perfect kick.   The service was sweet and friendly. Our fruit infused water glasses were never empty.  Thanks Nittaya! I'l be back! Can't wait to come back and try the tapas and wine!!

SrzcNoThSIYbLfIaDw44bg.text: I love this place. Me and my wife are huge fans. It's a real small restaurant with a sheik ambiance. I love that the restrooms are really clean and decorated tranquil. But the food is what makes this place. We ALWAYS order the Spinach Salad. It's tempura spinach with some yummy Thai dipping sauce. It's a must. I also usually order a curry dish and a noodle dish. So far everything I've ordered is awesome. This is great place to take a date that you really want to impress. I recommend getting a reservation because it's a tiny restaurant. Also if you're into wine go on a Thursday, because it's 1/2 off wine night. This place is as good as it gets. Enjoy!!!

RVh4jT03_8NdjaoeAZNOwA.text: I dream of the green curry. This place is super tasty. I wish the dishes were a tad cheaper for sure, but overall very yummy. Everyone I have taken has very much enjoyed it.   I can not order above a 2 for spice- and I'm not a spice chicken by any means... this mess is HOT! Husband ordered the pork and green beans at a 4 and it was so hot I could barely eat it, but so yummy that I sure kept trying!   Definitely worth a try!

Nni33F_v-Mbq2JJMDvAeeA.text: Five stars everytime!  We've been coming here almost weekly since we found out about this place.  Never had anything I didn't absolutely love and the food is always consistent! Amazing service, small and intimate.  Nittaya's cooking is an art form.

meZUrh8cp6ZAk1D-dqdOjQ.text: Hands down! the best Thai Restaurant in the city. The service and food is exceptional, very high standards.

bYpZ8OzLURU_ZiOYXQg4JQ.text: After many friends have recommended this place, my husband and I finally decided to come here for dinner earlier this week. The food was so good we came back today for take out. The drunken noodles are by far the best I've ever had. Switch out the chicken for shrimp. It's perfectly sauteed and tender, not rubbery. My husband ordered the rain forest fried rice, which was lightly flavored and full of veggies.

8H1vtROnFnBBw8ZsPEJc1Q.text: Ask for Dante Marcy, he's an adult blonde male. He will service you so good and hard you'll be begging for more. We once toured the Italian countryside together sharing wines and cheeses as we sunned ourselves along Tuscan country roads. But what is sweet in life is fleeting and impermanent. Such Is life. He soon grew tired of me in favor of his lover Pablo and I was cast aside like day old scones in Vatican City. Heartbroken as I am I would still request him by name to wait on me and fondle my taste buds into a world of ecstasy so rapturous and sinful even the most hedonic among us would blush. Tip him generously, but as you do whisper the name Juan Pablo.

5bly5U_1rG5t_dY-YMJsIg.text: Ate here for the first time yesterday.  Service was prompt, got seated immediately for lunch.  It was a typically hot Vegas day, and they never let my water glass get empty. Food was excellent.  I'm a wimp about spicy foods, so I was pleased to find lots of non-spicy selections on their menu. I had pot stickers - done perfectly, and served with a delicious sauce.  Then came the chicken fried rice, also delicious.  I finished up with a chocolate mousse dessert the called Pot of Cream.  I'll definitely be back, and plan to bring friends.

I6KjvpRL-dL12Szb3kbR6Q.text: I came to Nittaya's for a quick meal on a Friday night. We chose to sit outside on the patio & it was like out of sight out of mind because the service was painfully slow!  After 20 minutes I went inside to complain & it took another 10 minutes after that to be served! The inside was not even full & the service was so slow. The food was good but the service was so lacking I doubt I will be back!

IeYyjnWo3eT2cVIudqFV4A.text: Delish! My boyfriend and I tried 10 tapas, including 2 desserts. Here are the outstanding: Spinach salad: OMG. Must try. Fried spinach with cilantro lime dressing, diced chicken, and cashews. Our favorite. Secret stickers: delicious pot stickers with house dipping sauce. These are hard to explain but amazing Golden pouches: potato puree, sweet golden curry, deep fried crispy pouch. Must try. Mango sticky rice: fresh mango slices, sticky rice in a sweet coconut cream. To die for. Mussels: steamed mussels in coconut broth with lemongrass sauce on side. Must try!   Still good, but not favorites Crab wanton: needed more crab and maybe a little bit of green onion.. Still delicious Esaan sausage: little sausages, good flavor but not the best Naked shrimp: shrimp in a Thai sauce, a little too fishy Sweet corn fritters: our least favorite, needed more corn. Mostly ground pork with corn here n there deep fried.  Thai donuts: large order! 5 donuts per order. Still very good but could have used another sweet component.   Service is amazing.. Best I've gotten in a really long time.

eI4gzoXS3OjDnvPtOyA8tQ.text: AMAZING! When traveling you search for the accommodating bar with interested people and delicious food. You found it! This is the best thai food in Vegas

b4jsTIAnO3Vl28Xdrl3kgg.text: We originally booked for 7:30 but got a call that the table won't be ready until 7:45pm. When we got there at 7:42, we were told there will be another 20-25 minute wait. If that was the case, they could have just booked us at 8:15 instead of promising a table at exactly 7:45. The servers obviously didn't want to be there, they looked so miserable that empty plates were not cleared until you point them out to them. The lady who took the credit card payments also had some attitude problem (even if it was her fault), she charged the wrong amount for the credit cards. So we told her why was that the case? Instead of her being apologetic she raised her voice at us and even moving her arms about to make herself heard. I was a little uneasy when that happened since I've never had that kind of experience before especially from an establishment such as this. Overall the food was good, except that the curry was really dry and the sauce was like eating sea water. But other than that dish the catfish came out well. After such a long wait, we would have expected a really good service at least, but nothing, nada! Not even a good explanation. Don't know if I wanna come back and definitely not recommending this to peers. Too bad! It was our first and most probably our last time as well! Don't come here if you have hypertension, you're highly likely gonna get some serious issues! Ha ha!

sWuCYajWQPtPXZYLxQt2bg.text: Took our dinner 50 min. To come . Lousy service. Will not come back.  Ask for Hot sauce, took 10 min, fish sauce, another 10 min. My husband was livid. Green curry was lousy. Padtai  noodles ok. They are really short of hands. Bad experience.

gSRWaTClWSzEIPUQt1AqpA.text: This is a hidden gem. By far the best thai food ive ever had. Cant go wrong with anything starting from appatezier to dessert

WkB5vk5xs9OXfan-OxhetQ.text: This was such a tasty place, with really nice ambience. The massaman curry was fantastic, the best I've ever had. We also tried the Thai donuts with rum caramel sauce and homemade coconut ice cream. Both delicious:)

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm Thai donuts with rum caramel sauce and coconut ice cream

PZhUsPpNiwu_hNM8PL2khw.text: I enjoy this restaurant and am glad that they expanded. Be Forewarned that the website is not updated and they are CLOSED on Sundays.

wtm3AOOMd0-YA_O4fwva9g.text: Delicious!! Checked  out this place while picking up clothes from my dry cleaners in the same shopping center because the parking lot was always packed. I was not discipline kitchen grease delicious the service was great. Little pricey but well worth it

vq05qL4vi3qnKQ85Xghkkg.text: I don't know how I didn't hear about Nittaya's sooner. I loved the atmosphere. The service was good the food was quality. I'll definitely be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Rice
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Lettuce Cups
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut shrimp. (We ate a couple before the photo)

iRJirbHD5dhUCSTed_YAWA.text: What a total surprise.  This place came highly recommended but I didn't know the Thai food background of either person recommending the restaurant.  I have had Thai in several countries including those down under.  Just had exceptional Thai in San Diego soooooo when I got here I anticipated a good Thai meal & instead I had a meal that beat all the others.  The drunken noodles we're with broccolini & ground chicken (thought it wasn't going to be a good choice). This was cooked to perfection!  The eggplant dish was so good though I'm not a vegetarian I'd come back to just have this.  The red curry chicken was so flavorful & smooth.  While we were stuffed you simply can not leave a message like this without Mango & sticky rice....WOW.  oh I forgot to mention the infused water was refreshing.  Gorgeous atmosphere & I'd absolutely make sure to come back.  Hell I'd drive 6 hrs just to eat here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango sticky rice

tikIwczewMLvXJElkvs-HQ.text: I can't believe it's taken me this long to write a review of Nittaya's secret kitchen. This is absolutely, by far, the best Thai restaurant in Las Vegas. My favorite meal here starts with the lemongrass coconut soup with shrimp. It's a flavor explosion in your mouth. Then I follow it up with the panang catfish. The baby bok choy are super tender and the sauce on the catfish is terrific. Last time I was there I switched it up and got the salmon with the avocado sauce. Avocado sauce turned me off at first but I tried it anyway. It was spicy and delicious. The only thing that reminded me of avocado was the color of the sauce and a sliced fresh avocado on top. The Thai Michelin star cheff over on the east side is not even close to as good as this restaurant. Well Don Nittaya!

2XEqGjD41-W9kajuRNpWOw.text: This is Thai food elevated to the next level. When you enter, it doesn't really have a Thai look at all, but it is still great, authentic Thai food. What really makes this place different is that they serve tapas, which are what the real stars of the menu. You order a bunch of little things and you will still end up full. We got the Volcano shrimp, which come to you on fire, the Spinach salad, which is just tempura fried spinach with a life sauce, the garlic ribs, the Pineapple fried rice, which is served in a scooped out pineapple, the chicken satay, and the curry potato puffs. I also got the Thai iced tea, which I think is one of the best drinks in the world. All in all, the restaurant had a great interior, great food, friendly staff, and I will come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The spinach salad. Shows that you can tempura fry anything to make it better.
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The volcano shrimp, which arrive the part around the bottom of the black bowl on fire. Very good and spicy

UnNHsQtqdjyzxZyv5Lzljw.text: Great amostohere but kinda of dark. Service is always on point.  Fresh infused water with fruit/herb every day The avocado steak if AWESOME The spinach salad is great but it's more like spinach tempura vs a salad, salad. Spice level is only 1-5. So if you like super spicy you will be disappointed, but you can ask for the spice tray which has sambal, siracha, and cayenne pepper blend

oRbpP0LH3s-Cj2g3l_ROtg.text: I have been going to this restaurant for several years.   I moved to other side of town and had not been back for at least a year.  I returned again recently and must say I still love their dishes.         It's considered by some as gourmet Thai food!  You must have the fried spinach and shishito peppers to start.       My favorite dish is the avocado curry salmon. I simply can't get enough of this delicious combination.  I also still think it's one of the best Pad Thai in town.       They have a great wine selection.       One thing I will say and perhaps it was on off night when we went, but service was slow , floors were a bit dirty and setting wasn't as polished as I had remembered it to be. None the less, their food is so very flavorful.

R4KmzcN5Ohp5lTtgUsjo7A.text: HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED!!! The food was spectacular, unfortunately we had a major issue with services. We were celebrating a birthday and brought some bundtlets to celebrate since most Thai restaurants will serve an array of desserts, but not necessarily cake. This restaurant was no exception. All was well, we even ordered dessert from the menu. Upon receiving our bill, we had been charged a service fee for cutting the cake(which the cakes are small and no one brought anything extra out except for forks). I am completely under the impressions of BYOB, but to not even be told ahead of time or even aware that a fee was to be charged if we were to eat it there. I would have gladly celebrated at home. In addition to all of this I spoke with the manager on duty and he simply apologized and blamed his staff, saying she must not understand protocol she must be still training. She served us completely fine all night with no assistance, knew the menu very well. Unfortunately will not be returning, and would recommend better professionalism as a manager.

WSoQoshv7SPaMD20rLmRPA.text: My boyfriend and I drive to Vegas from Phoenix to eat here - often. Granted we're there to visit friends and stuff too but like, look guys: come with us to Nittaya's or get wrecked because we're going.   The atmosphere is fantastic. It's a quiet place with low lighting and friendly staff. Basically everything I'm looking for in a restaurant. Loud, bustling, bright places are fine but I have to be in the mood to interact with large groups of people. The only thing worse than people is large groups of them, amirite?  No words I can say will do the food any justice. You just need to try it. Any of it, all of it. Each dish brought to you has a quality that is indicative of the fact that the person who created the dish loves to cook. Their passion for cooking shines through this food in a way that's enjoyable in and of itself. There's a profound joy in taking part in a thing that someone clearly loves, and this is the place to experience that.   I really hope this restaurant is doing and continues to do well.

1cyW2qeZc1A8xioJc0jRjA.text: I am a big fans of Thai foods . I was a regular customer in one of Thai restaurant around the corner for years . But since I found this restaurant I have been coming here . The foods are so good , place is clean and the staff are friendly

yEPtgS0K5hnShNQ5lv2YLA.text: After our fifth visit we didn't think the food and service could get any better, yet somehow it always does. Just a very pleasant place.

ZIJVD4B0JE2lDerTmlc-sQ.text: Interesting decor , good foods. I enjoyed every dishes at the restaurant. But the only things that disappointed me was the coconut ice cream dessert. In the menu it say " coconut ice cream for family " so I thought it big or at least good for family like it said but it didn't . One plain coconut on the white plate ..if they just add  one flower on the coconut or an small Umbrella will make it look better. Little bit ice cream ( it's alright ) and sweet rice on the bottom ..it cost $13-$16 ( don't remember the price ) so OVER PRICE for just that. Everything else was perfect.

Khf0cPsVxm1SxdrVZd8CYA.text: What a great find for lunch and luckily we got there before noon because it filled up fast. We sat at the bar and received great service. As first timers we wanted to try several dishes knowing we could take home what we couldn't eat. We tried the dumplings (great) and satay (excellent) and then I had spicey pork noodles while wife had the bbq ribs. Mine was good but hers was Outstanding. We had one of the coldest Sapporo beers ever. A perfect match. We'll go back. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qWfDBa58GoKuoBiZaGG1nQ.text: When we 1st got in it took like 5 mins before anybody acknowledged us although it was busy in this small space they had plenty of seating outside which was really a nice vibe. The service wasn't good at all the server lacked confidence and messed up the order and forgot to bring my friend his wine.  I love Thai food Tofu pad Thai is my favorite and compared to most places it was pretty GOOD but a little over priced. Overall I like the food and the decor was very chill just wish the service was better because If I'm spending $17 for a dish I would like the experience to be as good as the food. Also the infused water was really good was good and refreshing

ijNKlvJc4-gNsXzlYf7U8w.text: Bland. Chewy. Very busy. Flavors were mediocre. Price was very high for the quality of food.

DtxeSdzSHKJHiuNh3FfiMQ.text: Great atmosphere, but more on the high end quiet restaurant type vs take out. I prefer it, but opted not to bring my 3-1/2 year old grandson (to spare others).   My first visit there was a great experience, the food was tasty and cooked to perfection. We did have some miscommunication on the level of spice in my Pad Thai however. They offer a level of heat between 1-5. When I asked my waiter her opinion of the heat, she wasn't of much help and kind of insinuated that they don't make their food too hot. So I ordered a 5 (I like my food hot), but not so much that I can't taste the food! That said, I requested a 5, and told her if I wanted to go hotter, I could always add some in on the side- sort of determine that level on my own.  When she returned with my food, she said, "I ordered you a 5, but I had them add extra to spice it up". Hmmm. Well, that extra spice they added made the food intolerable. It was beyond what any restaurant should serve if they want their patrons to actually taste their food. It wasn't enjoyable at all (and I can eat hot chili peppers for breakfast) :)  Overall, the other food we ordered was very tasty. So we returned another night for take out. This time I ordered a level 3 for my Pad Thai. The second time around was not as impressive as the first. The Pad Thai had almost no flavor, spice or otherwise. Even after adding an entire container of chili paste they provided on the side. It was just bleh.   The eggplant dish was absolutely delicious though, totally worth trying!

C70nSpuev5P4kgsQUKd4qw.text: Love this little local restaurant. Low key, great ambience. I love the appetizers. Pretty good wine not a huge selection but this isn't a huge place. Perfect way to end a date night. We have only done the bar experience but we found this is the perfect way to start or end a evening.  I personally don't care for Thai food ( in general)but the BF loves it, and he enjoyed his entree there. As I said the Appetizers were wonderful

wZUiBbpjgcYqvclgbXgmrQ.text: Food was amazing!! I would order stuff with the intent in sharing. The food portions are very generous. You have to order the fried spinach and the off the boat rice!

HLkk4jJ_ePYxEb2tqdVskA.text: I have been to this place several times and truly feel it's the best Thai food I have ever had! Not just because of the flavor of the food, but the presentation is thoughtful, the service is above and beyond, and the atmosphere is inspiring. The quality of the ingredients is very fresh. The consistency of which they cook everything perfectly is apparent. I can't get enough of the coconut ice cream!

zg7Ub2NRTnlyh9U-adypSg.text: The appetizers alone are a good reason to go. Me and friends come here every few months or so and it's never a bad meal. The Spinach Salad is amazing and actually the only way spinach should ever be eaten, especially with the "dressing" they make that has just the right amount of kick. The only thing I've ever been slightly disappointed in was the Capon, it seemed bland end comparison to everything else which is full of flavor.

dv9guN31FFUE-U5A4kizLg.text: Yep it us worth every penney! My husband and I love this place but had been avoiding it due to my peanut allergy. We have now been twice and it has been thoroughly wonderful both times. The service is impeccable, the food great and they have modified dishes for me. I consider this a top five of my faves in Vegas! A real treat, always get Reservations.

rwd4OxzabV9VTFKnIX-JKQ.text: The food honestly looked extremely promising and my friends and I were so excited to come and dine in for our first times. Judging by the other reviews and word of mouth from friends and family, the food is absolutely amazing. Unfortunately after being seated and told by the server that he would be right back, we never encountered  another colleague again.   Maybe it was because we chose to be seated outside but several other guests who were seated outside well after us received their waters and menus immediately whereas we only received the menus from the hostess who sat us. Our server was nowhere to be found and when he eventually came out, he proceeded to provide service to another couple that had just sat down.   It is a shame that we were not able to taste the food, but the lack of attention and bad service quality were too much to bear for us. After 15 minutes of waiting and even as we walked out of the restaurant, not one service person batted an eye.   I am sure this restaurant will continue to be successful but I don't feel inclined to return if this is the type of treatment that even only a small percentage of guests will receive.

ARlJaf2TpTzkcAxM3CX_vQ.text: I adore this place! Without a doubt one of my top five favorites in Las Vegas. The Thai infusion that is happening here is brilliant. Today the weather here in Vegas was a bit chilly, so I ordered takeout and I was not disappointed! I opted for my favorite Spinach Salad and Salmon Avocado Curry, SO DELICIOUS! The service is always phenomenal and the vibe is cozy. If you're planning a Friday or Saturday night, call in advance for reservations as it does fill up quickly. If you haven't tried this place, you need to!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ba6zeBbXZV9tqOEZJhKrwQ.text: Ambiance & Food are phenomenal. Friendly Staff who were attentive to detail. I loved their Secret Sangria. Definitely a place I would visit time and time again. Well done Nittaya! Well Done!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Island Sunday Fools. Out of this world! Coconut Ice Cream, Carmelized Pineapple, Coconut Rum Caramel Sauce
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Home Style Shrimp Pad Thai. Yum!
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Phuket Poppers (jalapeno. Cream cheese. Shrimp) Just okay for my taste. Rich &amp; Creamy.

dwdB9rrNuq5y3p2oMplj-w.text: Wow, what a wonderful surprise right in my neighborhood. This is such a charming and welcoming little restaurant. The atmosphere is so cozy, and the staff so friendly, I can't believe it took me so long to break away from my favorite Thai restaurant on Durango and give this place a try. I know this echoes most all of the other reviews on Yelp for Nittaya's Secret Kitchen, but the "Secret Spinach Salad" is a must!!!! It is delicious, and now one of my favorite salads! I also will highly recommend the Volcano Shrimp. The spices were fabulous! The Short Rib Curry was a special, not on the regular menu, and very good. Just the right amount of spice to not overwhelm the flavor of the beef. I will definitely be returning to Nittaya's very soon, gotta add this to the regular rotation!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. short rib curry (special)
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. volcano shrimp

Rid9-K9ujvmU1v-xJr_J5w.text: Very elevated Thai food. I absolutely love the ambiance of this place. The food was better than any other Thai place in Vegas. Great for a date! I had the eggplant and bok choy panag curry and it was so perfect!!! I can't wait to come back and try more of their signature dishes. So many vegan vegetarian and gluten free options here

h-0s9bEqOahrqHKQViuOzA.text: "To be alive is to totally and openly participate in the simplicity and elegance of here and now." - D. Altman  Nittaya is one of the sweetest and nicest owners that you will probably not actually meet. The secret on Nittaya's has been out for a long time...almost as soon as she moved up Lake Mead, transitioning from take-out to one of the nicer Thai restaurants in town. So, unless you knew her from her previous incarnation years ago, or you are a True regular at Nittaya's Secret Kitchen, then the amiable chef and owner is probably the only secret left at Nittaya's.  The World Famous Spinach Salad with tempura spinach, lime dressing, and chicken has lived up to its name. I had loved Nittaya's curries before, but this was the dish that brought heightened interest and demonstrated that there was a lot more than traditional curries and noodles  to be had at Nittaya's. It used to be a staple anytime I came and I will still return to it from time-to-time.  These days I am just as likely to branch out and try something new, or return to something that I haven't had in a while. One of my favorites is the Salmon-Avocado Curry--green curry with eggplant, avocado, and zucchini. I don't see myself getting tired of this dish anytime soon.  Nittaya's can hold their own against most of the Thai restaurants in town. Certainly one of the better options, but what separates them is that they are one of three elevated Thai restaurants in town that incorporates great food with a lovely ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QPkBToosgsEbUe0-ybRpXg.text: We were looking for an awesome Thai restaurant, and my friend suggested Nittaya's. It's a cute little spot off of lake mead, that is quaint but decorated so nice.  Make sure to make a reservation before coming as they were booked up. We had to eat at the bar, but we don't mind ! Tony was our bartender/ server. He was very nice and helpful. The service was just as amazing and the food was delicious.  We ordered chicken pot stickers, pork egg rolls, chicken lettuce wraps and chicken pad Thai. All of the food came out hot, fresh and delicious. The prices were reasonable for the amount of food they serve and the quality !   We will definitely be returning to Nittaya's in the near future !

eEqCzskjAVwM6ts0wJ9KHw.text: I went because of the stellar reviews. Very beautiful inside & all the front staff were spot on. I had the tiger steak as a starter, Namasu(sp), curry & took a container (to go), of Drunken Noodles. I told them I was going back to my hotel to have a second meal & for tomorrow and as I didn't finish anything (completely), asked for the DN & others to be boxed up & taken. Later that evening I opened bag. I guess they assumed I would eat from the container as they had, no napkins, no utensils, just the containers. (Utensils were not in containers). I went down, begged the front desk to open kitchen & eventually got a fork/spoon. The Drunken Noodles had Broccoli & spinach? which were both so bitter I had to push aside. The Drunken Noodles were at best a 6 out of 10. Something tiger steak was very tasty but the Namasu(sp), curry was also not memorable. The three items (with a sprite), was $55.00. Bit pricey for the quality

7zUPrhVLnBoQh296t2KWvQ.text: Great service, atmosphere and food. Went there for the first time with my wife and son and everyone was happy. The spices in the curry were amazing so flavorful, definitely  come here again. Wine selection was also good

GkD4f8ZNf_qg1XdGSEDKuw.text: Beautiful dining experience, very dim lights, intimate place, perfect for a date night. Seating at the bar is available, very clean and well put together. The presentation of the venue is great and pretty. The food prices? lunch take out is $12 half of a "regular plate" full dinner plates price Is $18!!!! HOW? All regular Thai places I've been to have regular plates for lunch and dinner $11-16$ How much more food can they give you for a dinner plate? LOL I mean its nice but its not fine  dining, why would regular HALF pad Thai noodles during lunch be $12... Never has happened to me. As far as the food I ordered, it was whatever a normal pad thai meal, nothing that blew me out of the water..  I asked for level 4 spicy out of 5, NO spice what so ever. Man idk if the dinner would even be worth it here. Would not order lunch again, ill just order from another thai place that has regular dishes at $12 all day then this place. $12 for half of pad Thai and ONE dumpling is NOT a special to me. That's just regular lmfao  Food was tasty good had flavor but it wasn't anything out of the ordinary.  I would NOT spend money on dinner here.

7kqrZ-6xlRof9s0Wo54Fpw.text: Only two words can describe my latest experience here... Oy & Vay.   The food that I had was quite delicious (lettuce wraps, pineapple fried rice, chicken skewers, garlic edamame) so that's why they earned 3 stars.  The deduction, however, comes from the HUGE communication problem with the chefs when it comes to making changes due to food allergies. Lost in translation, maybe?   Listen carefully, if you can not eat shellfish, dairy, gluten, etc. you may want to pass on dining here. Two of the friends I came with have severe (life threatening) food allergies and have never felt so frustrated, annoyed and disappointed while dining out before. It was made crystal clear about the allergies and yet two dishes were still served to them with the allergic ingredients in them. The server seemed to think it was funny, but we didn't find the humor in it. Then our food was cleared away before we were even finished eating it. To make matters worse, when I mentioned it to him, he just laughed it off again. Sadly, nothing was ever compensated from our bill, and two of the girls ordered pizza when they got home. Dinner fail.

raIy_dAniKopK6cUI3zXfQ.text: Great place. Probably offers the best Thai food in Las Vegas. Mr. Wynn, one of our senators, zdogMD (sorry zdog, but I've seen you there twice), and other famous locals like to dine at Nittaya's. My favorite dishes are: tuna tartar, basil eggplant, catfish, and naked shrimp. Thai doughnuts is a good dessert choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This happy customer was allowed to be in the restaurant @ lunch time
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

B8d2kmlzpQRJ9dVt_JIf8w.text: Nittaya's Secret Kitchen is almost like walking into the novel Secret Garden. A nice little tucked away restaurant on the corner of a shopping plaza, Nittaya's Secret Kitchen gives you a vineyard like feel upon entering. Just a little cramped for space - your neighbors will definitely hear your conversation at your normal inside voice. From the professionalism of the servers to the well executed presentation of your meal, the ambience and the food are a little more gourmet than you find most Asian family style restaurants. Just a little pricier than other Thai restaurants, but a great option for a romantic date night.

GCZJwmlVelm_djvdvCTRtA.text: Really good food. I tried this with my aunts from out of town. Clean place & slightly small but cozy feel. We loved this spinach salad, rice, veggie rolls and crab rolls. I can't wait to come back. Good find

EDuGd9noPhQ_NzJXFzc48g.text: One of my favorite places to go! I love the decor, service and the food is always presented like a piece of art! Everything is amazing! Try the fried spinach salad, the fried rice pineapple boat, or anything else on the dish. Great date night place. Wine selection is nice also.

8X067yY9BcrO1qM7nfTgQg.text: I had never even heard of this place until we were specifically looking for Thai food one night nearby. I was really pleasantly surprised by how cute and intimate the setting was and how delicious and diverse the food items were as well. They have a good selection of beer and wine and I found their prices to be affordable for a pretty nice restaurant. I think it would be a perfect date night spot or even just a place for a casual weekday dinner or drinks.

S6_q5hKQcCRvk3TQ877QSQ.text: I've visited this restaurant on five occasions. Three were very good experiences, one was poor, and one (the latest) was downright atrocious.   The poor experience consisted of a 20-30 minute wait for our first visit from wait staff but was normal thereafter.   The last time I visited it took a full 30 minutes before we were acknowledged and another 20 minutes to receive our bottle of wine. The food is a solid four stars, but nothing is worth a nearly hour wait for a pre-dinner drink.   In short, I used to enjoy this restaurant but will never return.

5wyUa_cSlhSQnL6L4K_Org.text: I wanted to go somewhere on St. Patrick's Day where I would least likely find beer chugging party goers. I just wanted to go somewhere that served Coconut Soup for my sore throat and some place very quiet because I also had a headache. I wasn't feeling too great as you can tell. When we stepped in it looked very cozy with the brown, gold and brick walls. The tables were draped in white it was very calming.   I started off with the Coconut Soup it came in soup dish. The dish was a little shallow meaning that there was only one serving. I'm used to places like Thai Barbecue that serves it in a big silver server which comes with more than enough to take home. I was sick so I was hoping for more. I know that this is a Thai tapas place but my soup wasn't on the tapas menu so I thought it would be bigger. The soup still had a nice taste and the chicken pieces were not too big which was perfect. The only thing is I wish the soup was served hotter.   My husband had the Citrus Steak Salad which had cucumbers, tomato, red onion and spicy lime dressing . That was really good and the meat was nice and tender.   I tried the Grilled Mango Shrimp that was served with a Spicy Mango Sauce. I was afraid the dish might be too salty because of the bacon wrapped shrimp but it was a perfect balance of salty and sweet. It reminded me of the shrimp I used to order at Tom Ham's Light House in San Diego years ago! It was delicious!   We also ordered some fried rice. It was good but I don't recommend taking it home because it doesn't taste good the next day . The rice is too mushy that it just doesn't keep well.   My husband and I shared the Thai buttermilk donuts with Coconut Rum Caramel sauce . It was a sweet ending to a great meal.

xQObxFpD93tfZ9Y4AUzD1g.text: It's for me, the best thai restaurant I've been to here in Las Vegas. So many thai restaurants in town but this one is so good. Very cute and cozy,  more expensive than the other thai places in town but who cares when the food is delicious?....I don't care to pay more if the food is worth it. My boyfriend and I got the fried rice which was absolutely wonderful, very tasty and not greasy! and also the shrimp curry and their awesome pad thai......They served water infused with fruit which was uhm uhm uhm...This is like a gourmet thai restaurant so don't expect big portions. I looove this place!

ihvr5dzWs1V8PRf5_gfVmg.text: Horrible horrible horrible horrible service. I like to think that I'm pretty patient and understanding but even this tested my patience. We came in with high hopes driving all the way from south Las Vegas to eat here. When we entered we waited about three minutes then we were seated. This is where everything starts... We waited 5 - 7 minutes for the server or anyone and nothing then a group of 3 came after us and immediately got water. We still hadn't received water or even eye contact at this point. About 13  minutes later I had to flag down the Asian busser to take our order he said he would bring the waitress again we waited and nobody came out. When the waitress went to fill the group next to us water she finally noticed we were staring at her and she came to fill our water. I had to ask her if she would take our order. So finally after all that we ordered crispy pork, crispy spinach salad, and avocado curry.. The group who came after us and ordered after us got their food. Finally when our food came it was delicious and we ate everything. But we had to flag the waitress down for EVERYTHING! Water, sauces, extra rice. Like wtf? Not even once did they come up to us and check us and make sure we were okay. We basically had to beg them to help us. Then later I asked for the check because once again nobody came to check up after they took all our plates away. I asked a white waitress for the check, then a group was next to us and water was spilt all over my purse and the group who was reviving the water. I mean that's okay but I had to clean up the water after he spilt it. Yeah.. Not cool. After another fifteen minutes of waiting for our check we had to ask another person to get it. Then we had to wait another 15 min to get our check and finish everything. I was so done by then. You guys were lucky we left I tip I felt like walking out and not paying because this was the worst service I have ever received in my life. I will not recommend this place to anyone. Food is not worth the hassle.

VyZndJ9-EOZaFPxeerX52w.text: Great food, but was a little slow on the service and a tad expensive for what you get. i think there are better places in town that have the same menu or close. If you live in the Summerlin area and want to a short trip with good food, Nittaya's is a safe bet. But if you live elsewhere, use the gas to hit up other places around town.

tueFvCdr2NQeaRNNezerRg.text: Worst customer service experience ever!! My sister and i went to have lunch here, everything was good, server was good. But one of the lunch specials tasted off, the chicken tasted almost not fully cooked. We told the server, and he acted weird about it. We didn't have time to wait for anything else, and had a two year old.  And not to mention, he offered us to have dessert like in replacement for the meal. During us explaining to him our issue... He was never sympathetic or tried to say sorry about what had happen.. I'm sorry but if chicken doesn't have a right texture I won't eat it nor will I give it to my 2 year old son. So I sent it back.. Never was asked to remake it... Nothing was said ... Just if we wanted anything else or the dessert.. I get the bill & I'm still being charged for the whole meal... So I walk in there to ask why I'm still being charged for something I didn't touch and he tells me that "there is no return policy" "it was still made" "the chef tasted it and said its fine" so I walk out feeling very frustrated.... & my sister goes in from the patio to talk to a manager.. She was so rude!!! She said she would not take it off the bill what so ever and that the chef tasted it and it's fine... & if we want they can box it up for us ! WHAT? After your chef tasted our food and I just told you the chicken wasn't right! We will never come back ever again! I had this dish before here and I know this one wasn't right. And the server should think about how he handles his customer problems and maybe find a different job because now it's hurting him. So here's your warning... If it doesn't come out right, they simply don't care....

yrftK9cwLNpp3Om_neK8Sw.text: What can I say, I really like this place. It's not traditional Thai, but what do you expect with Thai tapas. Everything I had was really, really good and inventive. My husband and I were starving so we started off with three "tapas" - the shrimp patties, stuffed angel wings, and spinach salad. I love the spinach salad! It's tempura spinach leaves served in a big cone (like French fries) with a yummy dressing on the side. The shrimp patties and stuffed angel wings were also very good, but the spinach salad stole the show. The shrimp patties were pretty much what you would expect. The menu says "Thai spices" but the patties aren't spicy at all. Decent size and the plum sauce drizzled on top tasted great. The stuffed angel wings are a little different than what I'm used to, but still yummy. A lot more chicken than "stuffing" and with cilantro. For entrees, we had the spicy green bean pork and the basil beef. Their spice rating system is from 1 to 5. The spicy green bean pork can only be made a "2" or higher. Hence the word "spicy" in the name. We got the pork as a "2" and the beef as a "4." The "2" was just perfect for me and the pork with green beans was delicious. The beef was also good but I could tell it had more oil on it and I would probably break into a sweat if ate too much. The entrees come with white rice, which was cooked properly. All the plates come with little orchids on them and are served family style. I liked the presentation of all the dishes, especially the spinach salad. For beer, they have Peroni, Blue Moon, and Coors Light on tap. We ended up having two Blue Moons, which went really well with the food. They do have some more interesting beers by the bottle, such as a Joseph James stout. They have a very nice selection of wines but all the red wine is stored on shelves, so it might be too warm. But they did have a sign outside offering 50% of wine by the bottle on Thursdays so I may have to check that out. They also carry some sake. Most of the desserts have coconut. It's a Thai restaurant so I expect that. We ended up having the Thai donuts, which were really tasty. The caramel sauce is supposed to have coconut in it, but I didn't taste it. They took my restaurant.com certificate, no problem. Service was great - very attentive and helpful. Small, cute place. A little dark, especially in the bathroom, but the decor is nice. Looking at the reviews, I think this restaurant has been paying attention and making adjustments because I didn't have close to the same experience other reviewers had. This restaurant is definitely going on my regular rotation.

UyEWNlMpV_gp5KlIB4pM7A.text: The food and wine are so good. Everything is reasonably priced for quality that tastes like it should cost way more. The intimate atmosphere is perfect for a date or small celebration. My husband is not a huge fan of Thai food but the menu is varied so it doesn't matter. I usually get a curry with tofu and it's always delicious, the tofu is expertly cooked. The appetizers have been good as well and they do have a small bar so it's also a good place for drinks and apps.

jnjsTgeA_uA2FiqA8rhZAQ.text: Favorite Thai restaurant in town! Super chill atmosphere. Love the infused waters and I've never had anything I that wasn't excellent on the menu!

LtZmhj8dKzYln6isGJDa2w.text: The food here is amazing. Very expensive but fresh and very very good. Best Thai food in Vegas.

fL4fE3oFNn2luDCIIQAcAg.text: Food is great; tastes fresh and authentic.  The curry is amazing.  The service is great too.  The average price per dinner is about $21.

9cbC7Pe-eDrLqkh2DhbEXg.text: This place is so flipping awesome. In December, Ruben and I took our friends visiting from England based on a recommendation. I called for a table and all they had were four seats at the bar, which was more comfortable than we expected. It was a rounded corner, so it still allowed us to be facing each other and it was still intimate. We enjoyed everything we tried and the service was wonderful. Great atmosphere!  We tried the Lettuce Wraps, Fried Avocado, Curry Puffs, Esaan Sausage, World Famous Spinach Salad, Five Spice BBQ Ribs with Citrus-Ginger Glaze, Emerald Fried Rice, Calamari, Housemade Coconut Ice Cream, and Thai Donuts. My favorites were the EMERALD FRIED RICE (I mean, phenomenal), SPINACH SALAD (they'll warn you that it's not really a salad, but it really doesn't matter because the flavor of the lime dressing and the tempura spinach is amazing), ESAAN SAUSAGE (the flavors that they manage to pack in here is so great, you'll be wanting more than the three served), and CALAMARI (wonderful batter and delicious dipping sauce).  All of us truly enjoyed our meal and had so much fun with all the dishes. Because it's such a small space, definitely plan ahead and come with a large group to take advantage of trying a little of everything! They're very accommodating and I'm so happy we were able to dine with them. I can't wait to go back!  Edit (03/01/13): Ruben and I went back for a date night and made a reservation earlier in the day. We had a rocky start; they were really busy and since we were in the back, we felt ignored. No one even acknowledged us when we walked in the door, actually. It took a while and when I said we had a reservation, they just pointed to the table in the back. Once our order was taken, it was smooth sailing (well, it also started to die down from when we first arrived) and everyone was attentive throughout our meal. It's a hard restaurant to be in if you're claustrophobic because you're in extremely close quarters to EVERYONE seated around you. I didn't enjoy being sandwiched between two other parties and unfortunately, hearing their entire conversation. So although it's an intimate space, it's definitely not for an intimate evening. I will probably request the corner bar seating next time since we had a much nicer experience there.  The food was phenomenal again and that definitely solidified my love of Nittaya's. We ordered the same four dishes that stood out last time and it was just as good as I remember. We also ordered the Coconut Soup and Spicy Basil Eggplant as well. Both were delicious, but neither favorites of mine. Since they were out of their bread pudding (I really want to try this!), we opted for the Creme Brulee trio of Green Tea, Coconut, and Ginger Lemongrass. YUM! We're not big fans of creme brulee, but these weren't overly sweet and the unique flavors were fun. Oh, and their Sangria is great! I'll need to go back to redeem my free glass!

hrGQePFRrQ-QcIHKd5W7fw.text: Transported upon entry, this cozy dining room with a wine bar suggests a more European feel than a Thai restaurant.  Two menus are presented - one a conventional Thai listing with adapted names for American tastes, like "Pad Z-U".  The other is a tapas menu with an Asian bend.  The papaya salad with prawns tasted authentic but a touch spicy for my dining partner.  We were not offered the '1 to 5' spicy range, but notice the reviews include such a choice.  Nonetheless, I enjoyed the salad 'kick' without complaint.  The catfish was presented with a tasty curry-like sauce that worked very well.  We considered tapas, but our two dishes satisfied.  The wine list demonstrates a competent selection with an adequate variety by the glass.  However, our Pinot Noir must have sat in the bottle at least overnight and lacked character.  It's truly awkward to send back glasses of wine during a first visit as these glasses were "borderline" in my opinion, so we shifted gears for 2nd glasses and commented politely to the waiter about the 1st.  I suggest tasting before committing until they cycle their by-the-glass bottles properly.  Service was capable and polite.  Reservations are recommended as the size of the dining room is limited for your pleasure and comfort.  I'll be back.

cv3TV3yJNgrH8aY28B0p-w.text: You must try Nattaya's, and give your usual restaurant hautes a break.  This is for the guys, if you want to impress your wife, first date or someone really special, take them to Nattaya's.    You'll feel you're at an exclusive establishment, and only you and a few friends were invited.  The food is amazing, so work your way through the menu as I have on three visits.  The staff is very professional and polite.  It is what dining should be, relaxed, inviting and not forced.   You will lose track of time there, best dining experience I've had in years.

vYkRl-wstXQNb0sMKM7yKA.text: This is a good Summerlin find, especially if you're a Thai and wine fan (thats me).  They have a great selection of wine to choose from, along with some really good red sangria. I definitely recommend the sangria.  I ordered the basil chicken and the muay thai fried rice. I liked that the basil chicken wasn't over sauced and had a bit of a kick to it for me. I can't handle too much spice, so this was just enough. But you can step it up asking for a spiciness from 1 - 5.  I liked that the fried rice had a bit more to it, with peppers and basil.  Overall, this is a good place for lunch or dinner, or just a glass of wine.  ProTip: on the weekends, be sure to make a reservation for dinner.

5xYV3rEL8G0MmXXcRvksDw.text: Great tapas and great lunch specials.  This is a nice little hideaway with great ambiance and great food.  I recommend the lettuce wraps and the green curry with chicken.

wojKrIpY4LaToKdJP34YEw.text: Nittaya makes the best Thai cuisine I've ever had. I used to go to Pin Kaow until I found Nittaya's secret kitchen. Reservations are recommended. This place fills up fast!

4h0OUNuVVaCxp-9cbYPGNA.text: Hands down, one of the best places in vegas! I recommend the salad, avocado steak curry, drunken noodles and bread pudding. Great place for a date.

zgJpuvJU0uco2kwIG5CcZA.text: There is no restaurant in Vegas that makes me happier than Nittaya's. From the intimate setting to the incredibly tasty dishes, they consistently hit it out of the park. If you like Thai food you have to try it. We go here for every major celebration that comes up and the spicy catfish and Thai donuts are a must have. Call ahead though, or you may not get a seat!

b7krucOSW2MqDnEjEv1ZVg.text: I was visiting my boyfriend in Las Vegas and instead of acting like tourists on the Strip, I thought it would be fun to have a culinary adventure around town.  I had read an article about Nittaya's Secret Kitchen in a local magazine and decided to give it a try.  The atmosphere was great and the food was delicious!  As an appetizer, we ordered the "spinach salad" and the potato pouches in curry sauce.  Both were amazing.  I had never had tempura spinach before and I quite enjoyed it, especially when dipped in the accompanying sauce.  I think the measure of any Thai restaurant can be found in what their curry tastes like, and this one did not disappoint.  I look forward to coming back and ordering a curry entree next time.  The third dish we ordered was the drunken noodles.  It was a little on the sweet side, but still very tasty.  The reason why I knocked off a star, despite the phenomenal food, had to do with the snooty attitude of the hostess/waitress as we walked in.  My boyfriend and I decided to bike to the restaurant (so we were both in casual/sporty clothes) and the hostess/waitress seemed surprised when we said we wanted a table to eat there.  Nittaya's has a nice, intimate vibe, but I don't think we were so out of place as to deserve that reaction.  Especially since two women in yoga clothes walked in ten minutes later.  Despite that setback, I would definitely return to enjoy more delicious Thai cuisine!

Rem15tlmmFVUcfISr4hGNQ.text: Fine dining Thai in Summerlin! It's a pretty small place but that just makes it so intimate..Everything I had was delish! Tamarind shrimp, lettuce wraps, and drunken noodle. We went on a Monday night and it was a full house. I suggest making reservations. It's a perfect spot for a low key date night!

vWiE5VcHEfddm2HJ6qTekw.text: My measuring post for whether I return to a Thai restaurant is the Green Curry, so I ordered that as a lunch special. I found Nattaya's green curry chicken to be delicious, with a hint of spiciness, though not at all overwhelming. And here's the kicker...like many Thai restaurants, Nattaya uses ample bamboo shoots in their version, but like very few, they cook it in a way so as not to distract from the rest of the dish. Delicious!  All in all, I enjoyed my lunch, which also included a refreshing house salad and potsticker as part of the special. Their wait staff was very attentive and friendly, and this surely enhanced my dining experience. Will I be back - absolutely. Now that Nattaya has made me a believer with their Green Curry, I'm ready to explore the rest of the seemingly delectable menu, which includes ample "small plates" by the way.

XqIg2W7BKIi0TK2E4EKDDw.text: Second time in two months I had lunch with a friend at this restaurant and once again, same bad service.  First off, seems if you order off the lunch menu, they assume you are in a hurry and rush to place the order and bring out the food.  The problem is that the food arrives before the salad and potsticker that is included in the lunch option. The food was not very hot either.  Asked the wait staff about the salad and potsticker and they just gave a rather blank, "huh?" kinda look.  Five minutes later, the salads came out and were strangely bland with a lot of vinegar on the lettuce.    Another issue is that you are given two forks and a napkin, no knife.  So because we ordered noodle dishes, we asked for knives, again, blank look from the wait staff.    We were not in a hurry, we do not work, bad assumption on the part of the staff, however, no excuse for the lack of manners and bad service for the second time.  We will not be back, ever!

ki3VS_kcsCegbbw07yD41A.text: I was thoroughly impressed! Great service. Superb food. Ambiance was great. We had the chicken curry (hot), this was super tasty. Perfect sized serving. The spinach was TO DIE FOR, the sauce was just the cherry on top. I will be back, for sure.

gpNEzg0OSpgKt5vPknjr_w.text: We were in town visiting friends and looking for an amazing Thai restaurant and this hit the spot dead on!  This place was delicious. All the appetizers to main courses had delicious flavors and had the right amount of spice.  The service was great as well. They continued to check on us and asked if we needed anything which is what I expect from any type of customer service. We will definitely come back the next time we are in town.

8S0SZvXV5UN_LDI4gc55Pg.text: This was a rare find. Loved every little bit of this place. The Servise was impeccable. The food was five stars. They even put the napkin on your lap

Xhk3nwDJAjrAMsFRXb8R_g.text: The food was amazing!! Service was great.  We went in their for lunch and everyone loved every dish except the Tofu dish which they asked to be on a heat level of a 4 and it was not very hot.  I did not try that dish because it was not what I normally eat but there was 10 of us and I tried 8 of the dishes and they were amazing.  The spinach appetizer was fabulous.  It was like the best French fry you could imagine with a secret sauce that was out of this world.  When back in Vegas I would love to go back to this restaurant and try more dishes out.  You will not be disappointed.

bTv6VYJ-Mp0WbRjX5dSBfQ.text: All in all, food was excellent...Service was so so. They lost our reservation and we squeezed in at the bar, then 40 minutes later they found it and we finished our dinner at a table. Bar tender was not friendly and seemed overwhelmed. The rest of the staff has nice and hospitable and apologetic. The spinach salad was amazing and the eggplant Panang was excellent.  Pad Z U was above average. I'd go back but make sure they repeat back to you your reservation so you don't have any problem.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i2tjROdqQMsTX_9tnyoGRA.text: This is hands down, our favorite local restaurant--not just for Thai food, but in general. The food is great, consistent, and the menu selection is awesome. They recently remodeled to be larger, which was a must because they used to get really cramped. It's still tight but the decor is adorable and cozy.  Menu faves: beef jerky and crab rangoons (both from the tapas), and Massaman curry.

51Ylo2Gte7hkc_W5_T7SQA.text: Went there tonight for the first (and last) time and the first dish (Thai wings) was so bad, it ruined our night. See pic below - a feather in the skin! My fiance tried to return them at first because she saw chicken HAIR. They claimed it was lemongrass - really?! So we each had one wing and then the feather. We promptly returned them and were able to get a refund.  The main dishes weren't so bad - Shrimp Pad Thai and Seafood Madness. But the price - $19 each?! There's better Pad Thai for half that price at a dozen other places around town.  Surprisingly this place was near-packed, though it's also quite tiny. I can mainly attribute the crowd to the fact that there are few other quality restaurants in the area.  Which brings me to my conclusion. We have basically a South Summerlin and a North Summerlin. Both have wonderful homes in beautiful neighborhoods. But a big difference - FOOD. We live in the South and are truly blessed to have a ridiculous amount of tasty restaurants in our area. Down the road from us (near Ft Apache) there are THREE Thai restaurants that are all a better value than Nittaya's.  To you North Summerlin folks - I feel sorry for your limited food options - please feel free to drive out to the South side for some REAL food!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. FEATHER and lots of hair in chicken wing. Groooosss!

pzwhgvWEkuux4EnqbsDJRQ.text: Very friendly staff. I've been there 4 times now (every weekend) since I found this place. Very authentic Thai food and the staff is great. I would recommend you make a reservation because the restaurant is a bit small.

uXGIa3e3xDHhdeSQGQA07w.text: I didn't think I'd find a massaman curry better than the one at Chada Thai. But, I did at Nittaya's Secret Kitchen. Located in a small strip mall on Rampart, this is definitely no secret. If you come on the weekend be prepared for a long wait. The interior is tiny with tables too close together and a bar area that has almost no separation from the dining room. The massaman curry ($16) is excellent, as is their "World famous" spinach salad ($11). Crispy, light tempura batter covers a heaping mound of spinach. Add the chicken  and lime dressing to it and it's unforgettable. For more subtle flavors, the coconut soup ($9) is the way to go with a thin, smooth broth bathing chunks of chicken, tomatoes and mushrooms.  If you can get a table, dining at this modern Thai place is worth the trip to the westside suburbs. It may not get the press that other popular Thai places get, but they are more than capable of challenging the heavy hitters in town for the title of best Thai restaurant.

DPrnGmReTj403JkQ85VMHQ.text: The edamame seems overpriced if you eat it as much as I do, but it's dressed up nicely here.  YES to the avocado curry thingy. Sounds gross, I know, but just go with it. It's interesting. But I'm an avocado freak. I enjoyed their version of Drunken Noodles, and the Pad See Ew with chicken.   It's a small and quant place and perfect for a date night or lunch date. Soft lighting and mood music.

lPLKhiD4-KK_lHMPaIx0mQ.text: Spinach salad is a must try. That alone should make anyone a "return customer". But give the menu a shot.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A must try.

y-JPzvSbr4-eJgtPgx4Ufg.text: I love Nittaya's Secret Kitchen! :D The Calamari is spicy, and delicious, and the dining area is cozy. The staff, too are friendly, and treat you like family. Look no farther for a great spot to relax with friends or celebrate a special occasion, or just relax after a long day at work.

3dGaJ_Bk3r04967KAGToTw.text: First look, it's a nice cute cozy little place. Feel nothing like your regular Thai restaurant. More relax. Staff are really nice, informative.   We ordered fried Spinach tempura salad. The sauce that comes with it makes it awesome and balancing the tempura taste.   We dined for two. So we ordered "Crying Tiger"-ribeye charbroiled then sliced up with this Thai amazing sauce. Also Thai Basil Chicken, this is a Thai style, uses ground chicken. Portions are generous. If you like to try something new, order the garlic rice to go with your entree!

0IA93lUY-5qyLDm_b7ln7g.text: Stopped here for grabbing a quick lunch. Ordered two appetizers recommended by our server, the tempura spinach was good while the volcano shrimp was way too sour. I wanna try their duck curry dish but unfortunately they ran out of duck that day. They have a lunch special menu so we opted for pineapple fried rice and massaman curry chicken. Both weren't impressed. Service was good.

We had muay thai rice, ginger mushroom chicken, and drunken noodles with potstickers and salad. The drunken noodles were the overall favorite but all were fabulous.

QrlF1Yer1jsfV5A4066awQ.text: ouch $8.00 for an order of edamame !! ouch highway robbery other than that food was good.

6bTtNHWx08rkWQ4_4G5aDQ.text: I can see what all the hype is about.  The restaurant has a nice cozy atmosphere, definitely a place to go with friends after work.  The staff was amazing. Everyone was so friendly and courteous, which can definitely go a long way to making a dining experience worthwhile.   The food was good. It wasn't great, like some of the Thai places in Chinatown or Lotus, but it was definitely good. Nothing we had tasted bad.  We had the Thai beef jerky, the spinach salad (this, alone, would be 5 stars), crab fried rice, drunken noodles, and the Cornish hen.  What's great is that this is just off rampart and lake mead, so it's a lot closer than other Thai places. Will probably back again to try more of the menu.

Tj3qUEGwpMyOcl4s7uAykQ.text: Steak avocado curry amazing. Service was awesome and spinach salad amazing as well.  This place blows Lotus of Siam away!  You have to try this gem.  Probably get a reservation as the place is pretty small

B2LoH_0NiNI5xWTjGAOr9Q.text: I have loved Nittaya's for years! Of course, the spinach salad appetizer is AMAZING, and everything else is perfect, too. I usually get the pad see ew, and it is great. I am happy they expanded into the space next door and there's more space to move around now!

CUlsoU2U595uGml7Psbjnw.text: I LOVE this place! I have been there several times, and I have never had a meal I didn't love.  They have small plates as well as full meals, but I am a fan of the small plates... that way I get to taste more things! Their Spinach Salad is really fun - it is actually tempura battered spinach leaves. They also have this yummy dessert with mango slices and sticky rice... very simple, and the perfect end to a perfect meal.  Anyhow - I recommend this place - I think you'll enjoy it!

2ZmU0dXJQbvzGZlQ1DmktQ.text: The service here better than we expected! They had a beautiful seating area outside. We were served infused water. Definitely very fancy, fusion Thai food!! Our server was very informative and full of suggestions. He really made us feel welcomed.

1bxkaITwL2fSZEgDVrSW8g.text: We love this place - both for sit down service and carry out. Tonight we had carry out (and we drive 25 minutes to pick up) and it was fabulous as always.   We ordered the green chicken curry, glass noodle salad, fried avocados, pad thai, and chicken fried rice. So good. So good!

s3KctX8leVNNkGNmesUsdQ.text: Best Thai in town! The staff is phenomenal- especially the bartender. She always remembers us and has great recommendations. The food is amazing and never disappoints! Love Love Love!!!!

jZTYLEELzdjlEmpP2_3UAQ.text: As usual the best or nothing, first time at lunch and what a great deal. Had the green curry chicken salad and appetizer $11 I'm happy!

px4B0j_Mf4cV1azYCOSEZg.text: Amazing amazing amazing. I highly recommend this place. It was so good. They have great inside and outside searing. I had the Massaman chicken. It's the best curry I've ever had. The service is a great and the food is outstanding. Go try it!

3JGKCPeHWt5SjGiD58ZiPw.text: The decor is nice, rustic, Napa Valley-like exposed brick and wood with concrete floors making it seem you are in CA. The food is outstanding in flavor with just the right seasoning, not too spicy or pungent. Good portions and selection with a twist on traditional Thai flavors. The service on the day we went was terribly slow and the waitstaff did not pay attention to customers, reacted slowly to requests and seemed to lack a sense of urgency. It's the only reason the review earns 3 stars. Otherwise it would have been a 5 but 2 hours for lunch is excessive.

eiMex5979PUxTG4r2lORbQ.text: Loved the beef jerky and the Spinach salad!  Great lunch specials too.

36pBh44ZV5f0s1d_xB-hyw.text: The service was attentive and fantastic. The food was great and this is a very nice hidden gem. I found this location by accident while searching for a lunch spot on Yelp

vKlL9BrXYe5xRz1jrjrcRw.text: Cute mellow date night type of scene. Food was great and the Plum wine is a must have!

0-2OgKDJeSUCaQDbF33S3g.text: I just ate this place looks kinda small but i think i didn't really look at the other part of the restaurant i think We came at the end of happy hour literally minutes And was offered dinner was a little out of budget cause we only go out for lunch cause of the prices We let the server know that we were going to leave But then was offered a lunch menu which made us stay The service was really good  and nice But the main entree was real bland I had the same dish at another place and tasted exactly the same So maybe its just the type of food Or i should try something different

aKtxFyP-zrxkte5KFRIrqg.text: Great Pad Thai, lettuce wraps, and pad See ew. All in all a delicious restaurant with great service hidden in a little strip mall.

t-9GETqJo_anQIt7JvBCGA.text: Quiet, small, intimate restaurant. Dishes were yummy, not disappointed.  They have a lunch special which is more than enough, but we wanted to try out other dishes, so I'm over stuffed.
