2WcD0eleAxfPpUhhNvRk6Q.text: I ordered pad Thai with chicken and fried bananas and coconut ice cream to go. Will say that the food was 5 stars but the pad Thai portion was a little too small for $18

WQNyV2zqBhb98Tz7zVN4yA.text: My friends and I decided to try this place out tonight. I thought it must be bigger at first when we arrived, because the parking lot was 2/3rds full. So while we're waiting for our 3rd, we step inside and see a podium that isn't being manned. The place looked cramped, and they had a table everywhere trying to maximize the space. So I looked around real quick, there's no one ready to step up to the podium. Someone is performing bus boy duties 3 feet away from us at a table, but he can't even look up to us. So, turning around to see the bar tender, she makes eye contact and then wanders down to the farthest point of the bar, away from the door. The two of us stood there for close to 5 minutes, and actually turned around to leave when we were boxed in by 2 more customers coming in the door. Now the podium is right in front of the door, and there's a table in-between the bar and the wall, so there is no where to go. 4 people at the front, and the area is so small, we can't even shut the door.  Finally, the bus boy walks into the back, and our waitress/hostess finally comes up and asks who was first. My friend and I took her attention and asked to sit outside while we wait for our 3rd to show. A table we wanted outside was unmanned when we arrived, but had yet to be cleared off. She said it'd be 3 or 4 minutes for them to clear, and so offered to step out to wait. After those 4 minutes, she brought us a menu to look at, but the table still wasn't cleared. (I really hope they had half the crew call in or something, because she was all over the place.) After dropping off the menu, the waitress/host steps back inside; finally coming out a few minutes later to clear the table herself as the guy who was performing bus boy duties before is now nowhere to be seen. So she tells us the table is ready, and we take a seat.  Our 3rd person shows up right after the waitress brings us water, and then we waited. And waited. About 15 minutes have gone by, we've all looked at the menu 3 times, and she finally comes back and asks if we wanted drinks. So, not to miss out again, we place our drink and meal orders all at once. And then it seemed like ground hog's day, because we waited some more. And more. Almost 10 minutes later, the other 2 with me get their meals, which was surprisingly quick for meal prep considering how slow everything else had been. About a minute after that, the bus boy finally makes another appearance by trying to give our 3 beverages to the couple sitting next to us (who are almost done already, mind you). And then we waited some more. I still haven't gotten my food. My friends and I have been talking for about 5 minutes now, and I still don't have my food. I finally tell them to start without me, and then after nearly another 5 minutes, my meal finally arrived.  Now, I have to say, the meal was awesome. The dish presentation was on point, and the food tasted better than it looked. But for the 3 of us there that night, only one of us got rice with our meals, even though the menu showed all of them coming with it. And once you start eating hot, you burn through your drinks, so they couldn't get refilled fast enough. Our latecomer to dinner mentioned her curry was much hotter than the menu suggested, and mine was as well (luckily, I prefer hotter.) We ended up being there for over an hour and a half, and once we finally got our rice, we had to get up from the table to ask for drink refills after about half an hour had passed without an employee in sight.  We finally got to see our waitress come by again at closing, and she asked if we wanted any deserts. We declined and just asked for our check, and then we saw her right back. Not surprisingly, they're making a mad dash now to close the place down. We had our bills inside of two minutes, and before she can turn around, we put our cards in and handed them right back. The bus boy decided it was time to make another appearance, and he starts clearing off the cushions from all the outside furniture while we're waiting for the cards to be processed. We chatted for another minute or two after signing our receipts, and you can see he's getting impatient for us to go so they can clear the table and snatch off the tablecloth. I quietly suggested to our friends we should go, and before we can step off the sidewalk to the parking lot, the table is cleared of all remnants and he's back inside the door.  All in all, the food was amazing. But as I hopped back into my jeep for the short drive home, I was relieved I came here with friends inside of bringing a date. I can't say it's a place I'll ever go back to unless they decided to move to a bigger location and hire some more staff to help.

R8_xV5b_4CuDcchDv9iEHQ.text: Super good but expensive. I would give it 5 stars if it was a little less expensive. My go to for Thai is Basil Beef and Chicken Pad See Ew and Veggie Egg Rolls. I was not disappointed at all. Everything was great, hence the great reviews. I got my order to go so I didn't get the basque in the ambiance of the cute little setting and scenery that is so popular. The employees are extremely friendly.   Everything here is great like I said before, just pretty expensive. I would just go across the street to Thai Style Noodle House and be just as happy for less money.

IwjkD5Bqnzvzrd8h7v7lvA.text: Their spinach salad (which is not really a salad, its more like a fried spinach that you dip in their special sauce) is to die for !!!! Oh and their chicken pad thai is a MUST try.

VFMgjISRpnu2Vq5QnvAfTA.text: To this day, the absolute best food in the valley! You have to try the spinach salad! Everything about this place is worth a letter home!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HIEYEK5Qi_7wopzg_wny1Q.text: FINALLY went to Nittaya's after hearing rave reviews year after year after year. Hooo-leeeee Cow!  This place is amazing!!!    We had the Spinach Salad (I'm already craving more), volcano shrimp (yum!), seared ahi tuna (least fav) and golden pouches (the curry!).  Every bite better than the last!    All the rave reviews are True!  Already planning next visit (tomorrow).

U7hz88N5EwS1625XzvAJbw.text: Let me first start off by saying that Thai food is my top two favorite culture food, so anytime I hear anyone saying that they know a good Thai restaurant I want to try it. One of my girlfriends recently told me about this place, so we had a girlfriends outing there. All I can say is that it is definitely one of my favorite Thai spots now. It's a bit small, but it makes it cozy and makes you want it all the more because you have to make a reservation to get in. The fried spinach or kale appetizer (can't remember) is delicious, the veggie egg rolls, and Pad-Thai are amazing dishes to try. Since the food was so good and the place was such a jewel to find I have since taken my family there to eat and a date on a separate occasion. They all loved it, and loved the quaint atmosphere.

C6x0ZUhL6jbK--WPLgqsbQ.text: Was looking at apartments in the area and stumbled upon this little gem.  When i first walked in, my initial thought was... "ah man... just another mediocre americanized/fusion thai place" but boy was I wrong.   The pad thai here was great. It had lots of flavor and had good sizable portions. The green curry was a bit more on the bland side but the chicken in the curry was juicy and tender. I would skip the curry next time and stick with the pad thai.   The service was great and there was at least 2 or 3 waitresses making sure we were good at all times. Most of the people here were a part of the older crowd with a few young people sprinkled in.   All in all, a nice little restaurant to stop by for a date or if you are showing people around. I happened to be lucky and was able to snag a table before the dinner rush, but I would suggest making reservations beforehand.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fEkSd-ngIeb0aOR-HMy8lA.text: So big shout out to Terri C for inviting me for lunch with the girls. I kind of heard about this place but never think about checking it out cause pretty far away for me. It thai spot that definitely would make the drive again and check out more of the menu items.   I meet the girls for lunch. We got there soon as they opened at 11am. It kind of good idea if going for lunch because the place only got more more packed. Just like past reviews the place is pretty small even with the extra dining area (guess it was recently or not all new for first timer). We got couple appetizers to share the famous spinach salad and golden pouches. My friends mention the spinach salad MUST every visit! I can honestly tell you more times then not hype never lives up to reality. BUT......in this case the spinach salad was spot on amazing!! It dish never seen at other Thai spots around town. The concept may soon simple tempura batter style fresh spinach leaves. Everything about it is divine intervention. The spinach perfect balance cause nice light, refreshing, and then at crispy batter golden brown on the outside. It reminds me of good vegetable tempura. The kicker in this case is the vinaigrette or sauce come with kicks it up notch to divine. Addicting. Like you pop one in your mouth and can keep going and going and going. I could seriously order two of them be happy! The pouches just never worked for me. I love the presentation. ALL the food at Nittaya has beautiful presentation definitely more upscale feel like past reviews and the flower is nice touch. The curry sauce that had no problem with really good tasted it by itself. The combination of potato bland the outside pouch. I would recommend getting that same curry sauce in entree dish.   I had the drunken noodle lunch special. It was awesome. The portion size for lunch special was nice!  I figured more on upscale might be opposite.   I am sure the rest of the menu is just as solid all around. Nittaya Secret Kitchen is not much secret anymore. It in the top five lot of sites for Thai food in Vegas. Well deserved. Definitely looking for Thai place off the strip, amazing food, and cool little spot. Nittaya winnah!! Make sure you get that spinach salad!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken Noodles

M9nfItBycsTreRRfd4SvGA.text: Whoever gave this place one star Has to be high you obviously don't know what good Thai food taste like Best Thai food in Las Vegas

gXlc8g_u27aWjM_HTPAxtA.text: This place is a hidden secret and highly addictive.  The flavors of everything are incredible.  Hands down the best thai food in town!

0f5wd3s8ZgEn521ZRts20A.text: This place really isn't  a secret anymore but back in the day it was little known. It's so busy some evenings that they expanded to now include two dining rooms. Neither one is that large so it's got a great little atmosphere going on. Nittaya's is undeniably the best Thai tapas and restaurant in town! This little gem in tucked in the corner of a small plaza just off the corner of Rampart and Lake Mead, behind the B of A.  The key to its success, you can most likely find Nittaya cooking in the kitchen herself on any given evening. That, and the expansive selection of tapas along with the right combination of spices on just about everything. Fabulous selection of curry dishes, pad thai options and unique entrees. May I suggest you try the lamb chops if you're not vegan. I personally think they are the best item on the entire menu! This is always a glutinous affair for us but we kept our will power in check this visit. Had an order of the five spiced ribs, crab rangoons and some pot stickers for appetizers followed by those amazing chops I suggested accompanied by a bowl of white rice.  If you don't live in the area it really is more than worth the drive! Happy hour starts at 3 Monday -Thursday for those who like to sit at the bar top.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Five Spiced Ribs
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potstickers
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Chop Entree

CvXjLtbwdTEjINZ0SvSMwg.text: I don't really eat Thai food but this was my friends lunch pick & it was a great one! I had the Pad Thai chicken noodle lunch special. Came with a small salad & pot sticker. Salad was ok, the pot sticker was amazing! The pad Thai chicken noodles was really good! A little sweet. Chicken well cooked. Very flavorful! I also tried my friends fried rice, yum! The service here was excellent. Very attentive. I'd absolutely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai Chicken Noodles. Delicious!

GE-UoXyPS8_f3g2r_nweJQ.text: Was so excited for this place after reading so many amazing reviews!m- but it was pretty thoroughly disappointing. Better called the House or Deep Fried Foods We Call Thai. And we tried a LOT of things.   The World Famous Spinach Salad was the only notably good thing. But $13!? For a few handfuls of breaded fried spinach? No.   The decor is romantic and lovely.   everything was overpriced and mediocre.   Chicken larb- did not taste like larb. Just ground up chicken on lettuce leaves. No noticeable flavor occurring. C  Crab Rangoon- was good and fresh, an A, but the price makes it a B.   Curry puffs- average. Tiny portion for the price.   Fried avocado- are the theme here? These people are making $ hand over foot for basically selling burger joint fried food In a fancy environment.   Phuket poppers- jalapeno cream cheese and shrimps deep fried. C-  boring and all fried and good luck finding the smidgens of shrimp in there.   Chicken veggie fried rice w an egg- fine. B. Nearly $20/plate makes it a C  Basil tofu- this plate was a huge pile of tofu w some onions and a few pepper slices and a nondescript sweet sauce. C+,  but price tag makes it a C-    Drunken noodles w tofu- we got these bc pad Thai is so variable but drunken noodles are always good. $18 worth of oh it is actually possible to make drunken noodles boring. C+. Price point and the fact that this dish is so hard to make bad makes it a D+  Pad Thai w shrimp and pad Thai w tofu- big portions, but again, not big or flavorful enough to warrant the price tag  Thai donuts- yes we decided to order more fried food.  There was a birthday happening and the person likes donuts. Overly sweet. Overpriced.   Mango Thai sticky rice- was delicious.   We had a birthday and an anniversary in our party of 8. They added candles but didn't comp anything.   And the service was weird- 1/2 the table got all courses of their food before the others got anything. They clearly forgot one person's order, meaning she got nothing at all to eat until most others had finished apps and entrees, but they didn't apologize or give any sort of discount.   Disappointing. Even more so when we were paying the huge bill. Bummer.

W05MkAWGWfwQ_OZzZjHLFw.text: I visited this small restaurant that is packed with so much flavor. I would put it up against some of the best Thai restaurants i have ever visited. It truly lives up to its name as a secret but I fear the secret is getting out.  I went with a friend on the recommendation of a colleague. Our server was Devon and she knows the menu cold. She guided us through the northern thai section  all we had to do was listen to her descriptions and we knew what we wanted.  We started with the ESaan Sausage. The flavor and fragrance of this lemongrass pork sausage was amazing. We moved to the fired crispy garlic ribs. The coconut soup with chicken was delicious. Flavor on top of flavor. The sweet eggplant over rice was accentuated by a wonderful sweet plum wine. The grilled octopus salad and fried crab salad were leading to the best entree ever. The Kao- Soi. Slow cooked pork shoulder with egg noddles and curry broth. Devon carefully mixed in the dry noodles to the soup and it was all we could do to not fight over the broth that was left over. If you get the opportunity you must try this restaurant. I know it will not be a secret for long but it's one of my favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hqfpv0be-5LNXcL3_Y0jQA.text: Always good for Nitayas Secret kitchen!  Great wine list!  Awesome home cooked Thai Food in Summerlin!  A little hideaway but call ahead it could be busy!!!

KTJihfU40efuRtjQVKhsaw.text: When entering Nittaya's, it really feels like you've stepped into a "secret" establishment. With the dim lighting and wine laced walls, it has quite the romantic feel. It does not look like your average Thai restaurant in Vegas that's for sure. And to be completely honest, there's nothing average about it, from small plates to wine it impresses me on every angle.  My go to plates are usually the volcano shrimp, the flavored edamame, the tiger steak, and even though this is a small item to brag about, the cream cheese crab ragoons are literally the best I've ever had. Don't skip on things like the garlic rice or drunken noodles though, they're just as fire as the rest.  I've learned to make reservations. I've been turned away once from them being booked, and once told I had one hour to eat. It's a very small place so I didn't mind the honesty. A few times they fit me in at the bar, which was just as nice as any table.  There's infused flavored water daily, and half price bottles of wine I believe on Thursday's.  I'm hesitant to write the review because I don't want to give away the secret!

4V-yLQBOASilHVBMcAfRGw.text: This place was so cute and interesting. The atmosphere was so cozy.  The food was great. I love the concept of tapas because you get to try many things and the portions are sharable.  The poppers were my favorite and the ahi tuna on crisps the bacon wrapped shrimp we were good, but I could of lived without it.  They have many things on the tapas menu to choose from, but they have bigger portions on the menu as well. This is a must try for all! Recommended 100%.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5sTjIHEmvyrRSQw5X1tWmw.text: Please.   Back off the salt.   Otherwise.   Omg it's great   The food. The atmosphere.  The service.   But pay attention it's too salty - At times

Hq5-zrxZmDNxD__5nXM4TA.text: Wonderful date night option!! It's so beautiful and romantic inside. Dressed up a little and blended right in. They have a GREAT wine list! I got Riesling and my fiancee got rose. Even the water they served was infused with orange and apple. The food is so good, you can tell everything is made with quality/care. We got panang curry with chicken, tofu pad thai, seared ahi and fried avocado. For dessert, HIGHLY recommend the coconut bread pudding. I've been thinking about it since. ALL so yummy!!! Not a single disappointment. We will be back again! And again. And again!

VrBoXVhEjk177vobl47Vuw.text: Nittaya's is a great date Thai restaurant with an upscale vibe. While the entrees are more expensive than your typical Thai place, the serving sizes are huge and more than enough to share between a group.   Start off the meal with their famous spinach salad. As the parentheses on their menu implies, this is not really a salad, but delicious nonetheless. Spinach leaves are individually coated and battered in tempura and deep fried. It has a great spicy lime dressing dipping sauce that accompanies it. This dish is surprisingly large and filling, and probably should not be shared between only two people.   For main courses, we shared the popular basil chicken, crabmeat fried rice, and drunken noodles. Of the three, I loved the crabmeat fried rice as it had a generous helping of real crabmeat. The drunken noodles also had ground chicken and basil, which made the order of basil chicken somewhat redundant.   No meal is complete without a happy ending and the family style coconut ice cream is perfect to share. I love the house-made coconut ice cream, but the coconut sticky rice at the bottom became quite hard from the cold ice cream and I wasn't sure if that was the best use of sticky rice. But for coconut fans, you can't do better than coconut, on top of coconut, inside a coconut.

y4gvc5GOMrd1kLf743fLfw.text: Very good thai food. Location is beautiful inside...very intimate, perfect for date night. Staff have always been excellent and professional. Slightly pricier than other restaurants but still good quality.

ZZTUqoqgHO1awiohJoaTaA.text: Had a side of potstickers with the shrimp tomato soup and the Pad Thai it was very good and the service was amazing.

1Zv2NtV2M4K9Q8mXa0rIpQ.text: The food was phenomenal. I got the garlic rice and basil chicken. So good I couldn't stop eating it. Highly recommend this place. Must make a reservation or you will be waiting a long time for a table

IE8dCC7BhjQPQq5fOPkw3A.text: I'm unsure how this place is still in business. The food is absolutely tasteless, I'm not exaggerating and the prices are one of the highest in The Valley, outside of the strip area. Not worth it all. There are a handful of other Thai places I can think of that are 1/2 the price and 100% tastier.

m1WyAVZcan57R0FBqPv_Bw.text: After a long day getting my home ready and a visit to the DMV, I was hungry but too lazy to cook for myself. I haven't had Thai food in a long time, and it turns out Nittaya's is less than 2 minutes from my house. So I drove there to get my grub on, only to find that Nittaya's is packed to the gills.  Fortunately, there was a spot at the bar that I was able to squeeze into, and had a good conversation with a Vietnam veteran that I had a lot in common with. Having been to Thailand, my favorite dish is a chicken massaman curry, so that is what I ordered. Plus, I got some chicken pot stickers to whet my appetite. I will say that the menu is quite large, and there is a whole lot to choose from.  The pot stickers were excellent. Slight crisp, juicy inside, and the soy dipping sauce made for a perfect bite.  Then came my curry. The portions were very generous, and included a big bowl of white rice. Everything tasted exactly as it should, and the curry was the right consistency and flavor. The only thing I could gripe about was that it was not spicy at all, and could have used some heat. Next time I was ask them to bring it. :)  Besides that, it's a bit on the pricey side for Thai food, but I enjoyed it and will come back for more.

IJ-7-QofMhM5723XkUw6Kg.text: It was my mine and my husbands first time here and we absolutely loved it. The atmosphere was so nice. It was very clean and the service was amazing. The food was very high quality. We have the beef jerky, panang with chicken and the red curry and for desert we got the mango and sticky rice. It was all so good and so fresh. Probably the best Thai restaurant I have ever been to.

STSVn_w2TEUeI3hCIZcKhw.text: This is a great hidden treasure in Summerlin!  Nice ambience with the prices to match but worth the visit!  My favorite is the Red Curry with Chicken and Crab Fried Rice.

wH6nwO0Gz6edkYxl3mmpXg.text: Met some friends here on a Tuesday night when I was in Vegas (the restaurant is located in Summerlin, NW of the strip) & it was quite busy.  We made reservations and they are definitely recommended because seating is limited.  I had the tofu pad thai, spicy edamame, fried tofu & veggie pot stickers which were all spectacular!  The flavors were excellent, service was on point (considering how busy it was) & ambiance is definitely upscale.    Definitely a worthwhile trip--good thai is hard to find in Vegas!

hje_tsiAhT__WTPPDvVeLQ.text: Have you ever eaten at a place and loved it so much you didn't want to review it to prevent others from finding out of your little secret. In comes Nittaya's Secret Kitchen. This place is phenomenal and during every bite I knew I had to leave nothing but outstanding remarks.   It's in a little corner barely visible from the street but when you walk through it's False door you enter a space that captures an atmosphere all it's own.   For starters, I recommend the Lemongrass with shrimp soup. It it to die for. If this is the only thing they did well, I would keep coming back for it. However, that's far from the truth. Everything we had was fantastic. Truly a restaurant I hope to see expand.   Kylie ordered the citrus steak salad. She wasn't in a spicy mood but thankfully, there are plenty of options for those who either lack the pallet or the tolerance for spicy foods. The steak came out perfectly cooked to medium rare next to this beautiful bed of salad with a citrus sauce along the bottom. Never too overpowering.  I've been in a seafood kick as of late. The polite staff recommended the seafood madness mix 3. Although, a huge fan of spicy food, I decided to not over do it the first time to keep the balance of the dish. A simple 3 on their 1-5 scale of spicy is sufficient to keep most happy. Out came a wonderful presentation of mussels, shrimp, and fish next to a flower and a plate of steamed white rice. Dig in because you won't want to share.   On the drink side, they offer wine by the glass or the bottle.   I highly recommend this place.

vH5yzn4ktCf1SImbJzMQ0Q.text: Amazing food! We have been to a lot of thai places and this is THE BEST. We ordered the papaya salad, pad thai, pad ew, panang curry. All of the food tasted delicious and authentic. I ordered spicy level 10 and it's good heat like how asians like it! The place is newly opened, you should give it a try- you wont regret

5f-qX_Wlywh1AWwa1XDddg.text: By far, this is the most unique, cozy yet classy atmosphere. The food is great and authentic. I love the presentation. My friends and I went there for lunch and we were on love with the vibe there. I will totally take my husband back for dinner date.

Ho0i8NkfNtkJhmwXxKwXkQ.text: Excellent every single time- not your typical dinning experience so do expect that...and don't tell your friends- I want to make sure I can always get a table :)

rQQ7GzKA76d6qca1u3yEIg.text: Looking for a fancy night out with some thai food? This is the place! When I walked in I was not expecting it to be super dim and so pretty. The workers there were super nice! We ordered quite a lot of food and shared it family style. We ordered pineapple fried rice, which came in a pineapple, papaya salad, green curry, catfish curry, and pad thai. The curry was probably my favorite just because it had the perfect amount of spice to it! Everything was super yummy, but each dish is a bit pricy.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Catfish curry
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple fried rice

qcIb94zYNouVElH946e3Zg.text: I have been to Nittaya's on a number of occasions after my first visit and it's as good as it's always been.  My first few visits were exclusively for dinner and they serve great options, but recently I've tried their lunch menu and they offer some exceptional meals at a good value. My favorites are the drunken noodles and any of their curries but I haven't had one thing at Nittaya's. The fried spinach salad is always a favorite and despite not usually liking deep fried food, this dish is always a treat.  The restaurant is small so reservations are always suggested.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach salad
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green curry lunch special
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly

ZNS6iCYs-lulYY_fT_-Wow.text: I had high hopes for my take out!!! First off when I called to put in my order, the girl who took my order didn't ask once what level of heat I wanted on any of the entrees. Second she didn't give me my total, she just said our order should be ready in 15 minutes. When my mother and I arrived for our order. No one greeted us as we entered. I said I was there for a pick up the lady behind the bar went to get our take out. She came with a receipt and with her had out expecting the payment without even telling us our total until we asked. My mother handed her debt card. She returned with the receipt and didn't even say thank you for coming and just handed it like "sign and go about your day" with no words!   The food was decent for Thai food. It is very overpriced for the amount of food.   The service I expected for a place with such great reviews what totally unacceptable!

XN8zbBDO1ghitjTSknm6GA.text: This place was recommended by a friend of mine. I was a little skeptical at first, because my wife likes good, flavorful food.  I was very impressed with the flavor, the PORTIONING, and the price. They also have a nice wine selection.  The service was great and Leah is an excellent waitress. I will definitely bring my friends here.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rvwDI-Ritew4oDTubv-3Rw.text: Someone let the cat out of the bag, since lots of people seem to know about this hidden gem.   They were able to accommodate our party, even though I made a last minute reservation on Christmas Eve. Sadly, I did not get one of the white cushy chairs; they brought in an outdoor table and chairs, in order to squeeze us in--literally. By the way, the restaurant was super busy that night, and I was just thrilled to be back.  Our server was sweet and very witty. She made the best recommendations, and made us feel well taken care of.  We ordered Pad Thai, Pad Si Ew, fried tofu, green curry chicken and their signature spinach salad. The salad was the perfect appetizer for our party of four. We enjoyed it so much that I ordered it for dessert (for the entire table of course). Be advised, this is a savory, deep fried salad, with a sweet sauce on the side.   Normally, we order several desserts and tea, but we were stuffed. Their pastry chef does a fine job, so please don't skip dessert.

h0kBjTa603NoBaQvzO25EA.text: My husband took me here for our 5th year "first date" anniversary. We always do a Thai place, and he really switched it up this year with this place which was nice. I loved the medley of wine and tapas with Thai food. The fusion was genius. We ordered the fried avocado, which I keep thinking about! It was sooo delicious  and I ordered their steak salad. I would order it again for sure!! And my husband ordered the drunken noodles, which I tried it and I would sooo recommend that too. It was really cute inside. I had such a good time. You are sitting pretty close to other people in there. I could see that not being people's jam, but I definitely didn't mind. Oh, how could I forget, so I started doing this to my water because it tastes AMAZING, they infuse apples and cucumbers in their water. I've never heard of that combo. I'm familiar with cucumber and lemon infused water, but apple and cucumber water?! Sooo bomb!!

_ekUca3xZyIZkviIsLM6WA.text: The food is delicious however I wouldn't come here to celebrate your birthday. They don't do anything for birthday people. It was tasty birthday dinner. Desserts are too over priced almost 20 dollars. Overall good tasting thai food 2 thumbs up. My baby tiger came in a baby tiger plate. Lol

KwxZFLwsItbulf4rPtWknQ.text: I was there during lunch time and I waited 35 minutes for service. Very expensive $$$$

5Niy5DRgffogUL5474gbvw.text: The food was outstanding. This little place is a gem, it's wait is hot or miss. Sometimes pleasing and other times they ignore you. The food more than makes up for the inconsistent staff. I highly recommend it and make sure you get here early or have reservations.

kPbOuzqYNuifrrQObvQxiw.text: Very good Thai place in Summerlin  Got the Thai seafood bouillabaisse in a coconut curry broth  Pineapple fried rice  Fried tofu  Will definitely come back again and try other dishes on the menu

aYvOdBIYWWSCDAaobZWvbQ.text: This is one of our favorite date night restaurants!  They have great food, wine, and ambience.  We love the coconut seafood curry and the coconut shrimp.  We will definitely miss this place when we move from Vegas!

w9mD4SIoC3MuszVwIikusw.text: Treasure in Summerlin!  Cozy atmosphere.  Authentic Thai cuisine served by very friendly staff.  Thursday night is half of wine bottle night.  The menu is extensive enough that you can eat there regularly and always have something different.  They did this place right!

KmAyo7DJtW0nO8_yQelEww.text: We've eaten at just about every Thai place in Las Vegas.  Nittaya's is probably the best. Exceptional quality. Unique menu and flavors.  I've yet to find a menu item I dislike. Nice setting as well.  People always talk about Lotus of Siam, but this place is much better and more interesting in my opinion.

wSVD4LXKNZqHO7osOwkk3A.text: This place is a hidden gem. I have seen this place while driving by so many times and the sign was just intriguing right off the bat - Thai * Tapas * Wine.... 3 of my favorite things!! Well how stupid am I for waiting so long to try it? This place was SOOOOO good. It was unique, very small dining room, cozy feel... We tried everything that was recommended to us for our first time and we were not disappointed. We did the chicken skewers with the peanut sauce, salmon avocado curry (which I wasn't too keen on from the description, but once I actually tried it I was so thankful I listened), we did the world famous spinach salad.... Not a salad at all, but the sauce was to die for. I checked in on Yelp to receive a free sangria... DELICIOUS and beautiful presentation! This place is a MUST GO TO! Recommending you make a reservation because we showed up at 5:30 and we were the only ones in the dining room - but 30 minutes to an hour later there wasn't a table available!! LOVE this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Check in for a free sangria! Delish!!

cHfPNkZXM0d4Zufbl6EOOA.text: Excellent food and service, amazing place! Try the Spinach Salad, pad thai and Kai soi.

Le--TRMJG5EoanioOmFh3Q.text: Pleasantly surprised....you must try the "World Famous Spinach Salad" no other Thai restaurant has this!  I've eaten Thai food in the best city(San Francisco) and the food at Nittaya's is really that good! Try the Spicy Basil Tofu or the Seafood Curry prepared in a real coconut (my partner had this one)  Don't just take my word for it...go there you won't be disappointed.

BQLG5iLXW1DKpBsCZDlwiQ.text: came here for valentines day. had a lovely evening. the restaurant itself is very small, cosy and intimate. perfect for a romantic meal. the service was good and the food was really nice. I had the basil beef and it was very tasty. portions arent too big, nor too small,just right. recommended.

LQzGK_wGIHP1gHO5WaQHdw.text: Really liked this place. Great flavors. Decent pricing for tapas. Amazing service! And the desert was beyond yummy. Had the creme brulee trio. Go! Soon!

nYcf0wfaW3Z0wRvjk9KD0g.text: love the small space and the food is good too.  similar concept to raku on spring mountain.    we started with the crispy spinach.  it lived up to the hype and the peanut dipping sauce is a nice compliment.  we then had the glass noodle salad.  I didn't care for the texture of the noodles and the taste profile was too similar to the peanut dipping sauce.  for an entree we ate the salmon with green curry and avocado.  i'm not a huge salmon or curry fan but the dish was really good.  the curry had a nice spice.  the avocado added nothing to the dish, nor was it very eye appealing.  for dessert we shared the sticky rice with mango.  it wasn't my choice and I really didn't care for it at all.  service was good and the beer was cold.

J9RLZPfAlDoBChIq3qWLUw.text: We loved the spinach salad and the soups! The entree were good, but the rice was below average. Could have been an off night for the rice. The service was good and they let us have our dog join us on the patio. There are no patio heaters, so it might be a better to do with your well behaved puppy during the spring. We will definitely return, good wine selection too.

VGEc0upZWh8ITf7MCg6ZnQ.text: Great great place.. Must try tapas.. Spinach salad is spectacular..Although this place has the traditional thai dishes.. This place is has the tapas.. It's not a typical size tapas.. its more like appetizers, so 2 is more than enough.. They also have an fruit infused iced tea.. excellent service.. must try if you're in the area..

nqPV37zxMoMfhbydfsBnJw.text: We have started to add this restaurant in to our rotation.  Most nights there are tables available but if you are with a big crowd I would suggest calling.  The food is very good.  Our favorite dishes are the spicy catfish (we get it not too spicy and it still has a kick to it), grilled salmon avocado curry (this dish is to die for and I will steal this idea of crispy grilled salmon in a green curry sauce with avocado on top and try to make it at home),  crab fried rice.  We have gone with friends who have enjoyed the pineapple rice, fried avocado, chicken satay.  I have not gone on thursday nights but they have all their bottles of wine at half price.  The restaurant is small but I like the decor and the wait staff is good.  Definitely a good addition to the neighborhood.

6wezD80cFDKtJ6t6tAH9ew.text: I liked this place, but it is TINY as in you have to literally squeeze by the table next to you, to sit down. The Thai food was more Thai fusion, the presentation was beautiful the prices a little high. Is it the most authentic place I have eaten? no. But it is a nice place for date night (don't let the price point fool you). The food was good, but I cant get over how cramped the tables. I think in reality it deserves a 3.5 rating.

azz2kRq7GkMriALaZJBlUA.text: great thai fusion cuisine. very inventive and flavorful. great atmosphere and friendly service. definitely worth trying.

TmoZ9LJyzdhpCScixEil6Q.text: Omg Becky!  I am in love with this spot!  Everything on the menu is fabulous!!  Cannot eat here without ordering the World Famous Spinach Salad, Cilantro Steak Skewers & Fried Avocado!!!!  Those 3 are a MUST!!!!!

0gTzMM2b6u0eyWnTTwAmtA.text: I went to school across the street here so I've been itching to try the food here! The food was a definite success but the prices and portion sizes were less than great. The cost to size ratio is definitely off, but if you are just looking for taste, the quality is excellent!

9ERScTcNR0XPSCV6TMkwJA.text: I kind of wish there was a half-star rating, since Nittaya's falls between 3 and 4 stars for me. I rounded up based on the expectation that my next experience will be even better.  We went to Nittaya's for dinner last night and it was quite busy. We hadn't thought to make a reservation (our fault) but there wasn't a long wait, which was nice. The dining space is tiny, but elegantly decorated and comfortable. You get quite friendly with your neighbors, which is good if you are social, or if you just want to look at their food. They do have some outdoor seating, which looked pleasant, and we'll definitely try next time.  On being sat, we were offered a fruit infused water. I thought it was very nice, subtle, and something a little different.  Before I go any further, I have to admit that I am NOT a Thai food expert. I have actually actively avoided Thai food for years because I couldn't handle spice. I only recently began developing any spice tolerance and  I was hoping a "fusion" place like Nittaya's would help ease me into a heretofore unexplored cuisine. I was definitely not disappointed on that count. My husband ordered the fried avocado as an appetizer. Unfortunately, it took a REALLY long time to come out of the kitchen. We kept watching food for the table behind us whiz past while we could only stare longingly at it. Finally however, it did come out and oh, it was worth the wait! The avocado was a brilliant green, with just enough coating to give it a delicious crunch without being oily. The sauce that came with it was bright and flavorful and just a little spicy, perfectly cutting through the creaminess of the avocado. For entrees my husband ordered the duck curry and I ordered the tofu curry, and here is where we came to another service problem. My curry came to the table roughly ten minutes before my husband's ever made it out of the kitchen. The waitress was extremely apologetic and offered us comped desserts to make up for it. Again, the food was totally worth the wait. The tofu was nicely seared (which many places don't bother to do) and the sauce, although a bit on the sweet side, was very delicious. My husband thoroughly enjoyed his duck curry, saying the duck was very moist, tender, and perfectly cooked. I tried one of the cherry tomatoes from his dish and though it was a little spicier than mine it wasn't overwhelming. Then it was dessert. I chose the Thai Donuts, while my husband got the fried banana rolls. Both came out piping hot and absolutely delicious. The only complaint I would make about the donuts is that I would have liked a ramekin of some kind of sauce to dip them into.  The waitress apologized again, and assured us that the kitchen normally runs much smoother. We told her we appreciated her candor, and that we would definitely be back. And we will!

iu9OL-I_3scDoGP2I5b8Ew.text: Honestly one of the worst food experiences I have had! Ate here when it first opened and was not impressed, sub par Thai tapas. After many people telling me I have to give it a second chance, I did. Worse than the first. Yes the spinach salad was good, but you can fry a sock and it would be tasty. Got the seafood madness and that is exactly what it was. The frozen shrimp tasted like mussel and the mussel tastes like shit! The restaurant should spend less money on flower garnish and more on fresh ingredients. And that was only my meal my husbands was pretty bad too.

YMdouKOg0-nPwq7uQSmH5g.text: My friends and I decided to have dinner at Nittaya's  as we wanted to try a restaurant we had never been to before and Nittaya's menu of Thai inspired tapas was intriguing.  Nittaya's is a small, nicely appointed restaurant on the corner of Rampart and Lake Mead.  The restaurant has a long bar with comfortable looking leather stools and just eleven tables set with little oil burning candles, white table clothes and fresh flowers. When we arrived on a Monday night, at 5:00 pm, we were the  first guests to be seated, but by the time we left two hours later, the place was nearly full.  Service was wonderful.  Our severs were friendly, knowledgeable of the menu items, prompt, and unobtrusive.  Our server even asked if we'd like to sample the wine we decided on before we committed to order it.  Nittaya's has two menus, one for traditional choices of appetizers, salads and entrees, and a tapas menu featuring a vast selection of Thai inspired little dishes. The restaurant also serves a decent selection of wine and beer. My friends and I decided to order several dishes from the Tapas menu and share them.    We ordered the "World Famous Spinach  Salad", bbq ribs with five spice, curry potato puffs,  mango shrimp, beef jerky, pork egg rolls, and crab wontons.  The True winner in all of those selections was the spinach salad which wasn't really a salad.  It was tempura fried spinach leaves served with a tangy sauce that contained cashews and chicken.  It was absolutely delicious and I highly recommend anyone who dines at Nittaya's to try it.  The beef jerky was also good and not like traditional tough dry slices of beef.  The jerky was tender, tangy marinated pieces of  beef with a good amount of heat.  I enjoyed this dish very much, but one of my dining companions thought it had a little too much heat.  The mango shrimp were ok.  They were small size, shelled shrimp wrapped in bacon and served with a creamy mango sauce.  They were good, but would have been better if the shrimp were bigger and the bacon a little less overpowering.  The crab wontons and egg rolls were good but did not stand apart from those sold at chain take-out restaurants.  Two of the dishes we had were disappointing, with the ribs having a nice flavor, but being so tough they required a knife to eat, and even then took a little work to get the meat off the bone, and the curry potato puffs (curry flavored mashed potatoes, shaped into little semi circles, battered and deep fried), being so sweet they bordered on being candy.  For dessert we tried the Thai donuts and coconut ice cream.  Both were heavenly.  The donuts were little fried rounds of fluffy light and incredibly delicious dough that was not overly sweet, and were served with a caramel sauce which added  just enough sweetness to make them one of the most delicious donuts I've ever eaten.  I would love it if Nittaya's sold these exceptional little bites by the bag full with a generous dusting of powdered sugar as I would.buy them daily.  The coconut ice cream was served in a pretty little covered pewter bowl.  The  texture was  somewhere between an ice cream and a sorbet, and was so delicious and bursting with coconut flavor that I wished I could have bought a quart to take home.  The price for dinner for the three of us, which included several rounds of wine and beer, was $130.    Overall, I liked Nittayas and will return to try other dishes on the menu and to have those incredible donuts and coconut ice cream again.

Mljif3tvxK0bYxlmWJPWqg.text: I really enjoyed the tapas. We ordered the fried spinach, fried avocado, steamed mussels, bacon-wrapped mango shrimp, and chicken with peanut sauce. The first two dishes were novel and served with excellent dipping sauces. The mussels were fresh and maybe just a tad over cooked, but still pretty good and without that stale salty taste.  The shrimp and chicken were also delicious.  The one aspect I would recommend is to order the food a little at a time because it came to us quickly, but it was a Tuesday night.  I can't wait to go back-and I've lived in NYC and travel abroad (including Paris) and so I recognize a good thing when I taste it!

E5y_PyWD8Zfp_I3hB7ErwA.text: First time here.  Food and server James were excellent. However we almost left before we were even seated....  made a reservation as we knew that was a must.  Arrived at 6:15 for our 6:30 reservation. Hostess offered us a high top table next to the bar.  We would have had everyone standing and waiting to be seated practically on-top of us. So we asked for another table.  She told us that we could have another table however we would need to finish by 7:15.  .  It was 6:15. When we questioned that she left to ask someone else. Came back and pointed to a corner table across the room and stated " you can go sit in that corner". Never walked us over. Just pointed.  We almost walked out at that point. Glad we didn't as James apologized numerous times and provided a great dining experience. He inquired what we liked and made some wonderful recommends. James saved the day.  Would have been a 5 star except for experience with hostess.

i4lku1trhlL2qKfF5gC8bw.text: I am completely enamored with this hidden jewel. It is the most contemporary quaint restaurant I have seen in Vegas. The restaurant holds about 9 tables and a tiny bar. You almost have to disturb fellow patrons when you are being seated to your table. The decor is very cute and they have art work on the walls that can be purchased.   But, enough about the ambience. The food. Where do I even begin. The favors. The presentation. The aroma. It's all on point. This place definitely delivers a great experience. We ordered the Volcano Shrimp, Drunken Noodle, and the FOB Rice. The Volcano Shrimp was fried shrimp with Serrano peppers and a delicious sweet sauce. The shrimp arrive to your table on fire. Such a cute and fun presentation. The Drunken Noodles were noodle with chicken and basil. This dish has just the right amount of spice to it. Lastly, the FOB Rice was similar to fried rice but it had pineapple and cashews. I have always wanted to try this but thought that the cashews AND pineapple would throw everything off. Man, was I wrong. The presentation of this dish was absorbable! The rices was placed in the shell of a pineapple. For dessert we had the bread pudding. Simply delicious!

Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. FOB (fresh off the pineapple boat) Rice
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken Noodles

I_XWhFNmbFwpKLVs03lgrg.text: Nittaya's is always one of our go to places! Love their food and the service is always great!

4ZUS0AWsSMKmHKjgu8s4dw.text: Always such a great experience at Nittaya's!!   Always start with the not so secret salad, seriously it's a must to try!! Game changer for salads! Typically, I do the tapas so I'm able to try a few different dishes while I'm dining. Last night we had the crab wontons and firecracker shrimp. Both were amazing dishes! I really have NEVER had a bad dish at this restaurant!  Always love their infused water, last night was orange and cucumber.. delish and so refreshing.   Be aware that this is a very small and intimate restaurant. If you're looking to be loud, this is not the place to be. Also, make a reservation for dinner if you're hoping to get a table. Otherwise, decent sized bar to sit at without reservations.   I will always recommend Nittaya's and will always be back for more! :)

7UhP2LgTOranUqSTrzxMLQ.text: One of the best restaurants I've eaten at in Las Vegas. The atmosphere is very nice, the service is attentive and quick, and the food is delicious. We got the tofu lettuce wraps, Siamese corn fritters, and fried avocado. All of it was great, but the tofu lettuce wraps in particular was incredible.

JzLZ4r_tfs-N8ngwAeAhJw.text: Great food! Great service! Great decor! Love this little gem.  Cozy and refreshing. Beautiful and simple. Nittaya takes great care of this restaurant and all the details. I felt comfortable here, no snootiness. Fresh flowers inside and as some beautiful well plated designs. A nice small patio. Feels like a romantic escape. Very flavorful food, great use of spices. All the servers were kind, helpful, and attentive. I will be back for sure!!!! :)   I had the 5 Spiced Ribs, the World Famous Spinach Salad, a Thai tea, a Lucky Budha, and a water infused with stawberries and oranges. Can't wait to come back and try more.

Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p5wGRYCr9uAUWVeuweHwGA.text: Met up here with some fellow brokers for a work lunch, and I love the place. I tried the Crying Tiger Rib-Eye steak, and I loved it! Meat was cooked more on the rare side (it's the only way to eat meat right?), and it was fantastic! I thought the prices may have been a little steep per quantity served, but perhaps maybe that's just me being a typical over-eating American.  Also, love how they decorated the place. Creativity always counts! I'll be back for sure. Next time I'll probably hang out at the bar and check out some of their cocktails. Until next time!

Y-ArmBDvifdLzv3ORIZn-g.text: This is a very comfortable, upscale, Thai restaurant. Decor and environment are nice. Wait staff is excellent. Food in general is quite good.    We visited this place last nite. For a party of three, we ordered the following dishes:  Spinach tempura salad - great idea. Dipping sauce is excellent. Grade A. $11 each. Volcano shrimp is excellent. Grade A. $12. Avocado skirt steak is super. Meat is slighly over cooked. Grade A-. $24 each. Crab Fried Rice is the best I have had. Grade A+. $15. Shrimp Pad Thai is OK - shrimp is overcooked, not tasty. Pad Thai is too saucy and spongy ( over cooked ).  Grade B-.  $19.   Pricing for this restaurant is on the high side. Can't really compare to the ordinary Thai restaurant.

QZx9rMUBn4lbIZAKpTH3yg.text: A group of us decided to try Nattaya's for Happy Hour. We found upon arrival that the Happy Hour menu for restricted to the bar seating. Since sitting at the bar is not conducive to group conversation we decided on table seating.   The dining room is small and cozy. Seating is very comfortable. The walls are nicely decorated with art. The room was very conversation friendly.   The menu has many choices of tapas as well as full size entrees.  Our server Josh was helpful in explaining the choices as well as his personal favorites. We started with several tapas:  Chicken Satay with a peanut sauce Garlic Edamame which was a larger portion Secret Stickers served with a side cup of soy sauce Volcano Shrimp served in a bowl of sauce with sliced jalapenos  The entree was Basil Chicken which was served in a platter along with a large bowl of rice. Also a large House salad with mixed greens, cucumber and onions.  All of the choices were perfectly prepared and had great flavor.   The wine prices are a little high but on Thursdays bottles are half priced and is the way to go.

Je3tJY4SHg-u-F2lJHZq4g.text: Great little find. The food is always amazing. My favorite is the Spinach Salad. Tempura spinach leaves with a flavorful dip.

ufU0_Bo5a5isDSwS0EftOQ.text: I went to this restaurant for lunch and found it to be very cozy and warm the food was delicious and the service was very good.

hor2odyb7ptUybESD2Mk3Q.text: This place was cool , cozy, mood lighting was awesome... The food by far was amazing.. AVOCADO FRIES ARE YUMMMMMMMMM AND SECRET DUMPLINGS... The waitress was cool and nice.   The only problem was the couple nxt to us, they were arguing about non-sense and making small scenes (go home and do that)  Overall i will def. go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Always a MINION

XY7D1LiRUIcL9uwMauby6g.text: Ate at our favorite Thai spot last night. Food was really good. Flavor, texture, temperature, of everything was perfect. My wife loves their lime flavored Tiger Cry steak and I love the buttery yellow curry chicken. Kids like the chicken fried rice. Very attentive and friendly service. Atmosphere is great.  It is a little bit higher priced than some of our other favorite Thai restaurants, but in this case you get what you pay for. We always pull up thinking it's closed because of the lighting and the way the front wood door looks...  well done Nittaya!

syrsZzx3dU9x5oQ12C3LWw.text: why would you want to keep this place a secret???  Naittaya is completely amazing. i went with some family has we had a few appetizers then each got our own meal. the fried avocado was amazing. i could have had that and left and been completely happy. but it continued. they also had some bacon wrapped items, OMG, perfection. we also got lettuce wraps which were crisp and tasty. I ended up getting the FOB (fresh of the Boat) rice. it came in a pineapple and had cashew and pineapple piece. it was delicious. my uncle and cousin got some steak that was delicious. we also got some dessert as well, they have a couple choice for ice cream and the green tea was the best in my opinion. i left completely satisfied. hoping to go back very soon.

-0iWDM0HTH_Gk1SHEjRNFg.text: By far the best Thai restaurant in all of Vegas. We are never disappointed whenever we go. It's a lot of fun trying different items on the menu.

wIcrGq6kAPp9Fi9l7DJ8-g.text: Quaint and cozy little restaurant. Excellent food, reasonable prices, lovely atmosphere, attentive staff who were readily available for recommendations. Enjoyed our time here and we will be back!

woJztUa95mbFa_cNzh7Eqw.text: Tai do it's for desert they are good and I don't even eat sweets. The order is large and comes with 5 per order.   My only complaint is all the chicken dishes come with very little chicken. If you don't order extra chicken in the chicken friend rice you get 5 pieces and same with the curry. It's very little chicken and all potatoes. Substitute the potatoes for veggies and order chicken extra.
