0nDCoIdzanpwZx5bGpHKcA.text: Delicious mango desert. Enjoyed lunch with frie nds. Staff is extremely friendly. Great selection of wine.

UTqUc4gIV34EFjdCQlgG6A.text: Very nice atmosphere. Our server was delightful. We only had tapas on this occasion and found that Four items were plenty for the two of us. Each one was tasty and well presented. We will be back.

ZRnc4Fabk2WV0SScvLPRQg.text: While staying in Summerlin over the summer on our last night in town we discovered Nittaya Secret Kitchen Thai restaurant. What a fabulous find. This is the best Thai that I have had in a long time. We had the Coconut Seafood curry and the Drunken Noodles with chicken. Both excellent. It's a really nice restaurant, the service was terrific and the waiters were great. We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qbnDHWIvx6uJs0HAHBAzRA.text: Oh yeah gurl, you want to go to there.  *Calamari Lemongrass Salad *Spicy Green Bean Pork *Crying Tiger Steak *Spicy Catfish *Green Curry *Eggplant with Thai Basil *Fried Banana  I didnt eat all of that myself. I went with 3 other people and my 13 year old daughter. 2 of the guys own a world famous restaurant and they were super impressed as well. We brought a bottle of our own wine and they allowed us to do that and we were glad to pay the nominal corkage fee. We even ordered a bottle(or two? ) from their better than average wine list.  The wait staff was amazing. My daughter kept saying, "Hey Josh, could you bring us some lettuce bowls for the pork? Can you bring me some shishito peppers?" He catered to her like the foodie queen that she is. That in itself was impressive. Most waiters approach teenagers with a bit of awkward disdain, glancing at the mother before they feel the child's food request is valid.. Josh was amazing.   They are willing to accomadate almost any request to the best of their ability. Helpful, not hovering. It really is a secret, special place.

X0z5xKnkJeqcLz9IYJdxDA.text: Very very delicious soft shell crab apple salad & amazing coconut shrimps!!! As for noodles, I loved their pad thai but their drunken noodle was okay (I'd like it a bit more spicy). But really, this place had a great servers & ambience, so I highly recommend this place to others!

ICIWaUQtsZrm1j9AbA6kOQ.text: Just love this place. Consistently excellent food. We had the spinach salad the drunken noodles and the Penang shrimp. All delicious. Best Thai in town

1sFtwDFUhu-dDeIuAanVPQ.text: If you can stand the taste of avocado even only somewhat then get the Avocado Curry, it. is. a. mazing! I got the Avocado with steak (med-rare) curry and it was amazing. The other food is also really good and it's cheaper than what I expected such a fancy looking restaurant to be although I wouldn't say it's cheap either but it's worth it. Since I go with family and friends and we always taste each other's food I can honestly say that I have yet to taste a dish that I don't like. Service is good, they infuse strawberries with the water though so if you have an allergy to it TELL THEM. Overall though it was really good.

LLUsqB15-MnBXH470IGcfw.text: I went to Nittaya's twice before and my wife and I sat at the bar. The food and service were both good. We recently went back with another couple and sat in the dining area. The food tasted different but that was not the problem. It was the service in the dining area. Everyone was nice and helpful but management apparently has them stepping over one another. The servers take the orders are are knowledgeable.THEN, they are basically finished as the bussers deliver the food! So what - right? No, not all right because the bussers don't know who ordered what and have to ask everyone what they ordered and are not able to answer questions. God help you if the order is wrong. They need to get the server to solve the problem. I feel bad for the bussers as they are not trained on the menu and shouldn't be expected to be knowledgeable on food and wine. Others in the room had quizzical looks on their faces as they tried to get answers before their food got cold. Too bad really. I won't go back with a party of three or larger.

NvrmHmAtQ713C2jvlT1Igw.text: Such a romantic place! Small, intimate, and cozy. It was almost dream like. The prices are a little high for Thai food, but the portions are good sized and the presentation is beautiful. We had three of the small dishes: five spice ribs, secret stickers, and garlic rice. Each dish was very flavorful. The ribs were good sized and meaty and flavored with Chinese five spice. The secret stickers were much better than your average potsticker, stuffed with meat and spices, deep fried, and served with a delicious sauce. The garlic rice was buttery, redolent with the flavor of garlic, and a great taste of cilantro. I would have any of these dishes again. We went here on a whim and didn't expect it to be so pricey (the three small dishes were $27), but I would love to come back here for date night. They also have happy hour from 3-6, and half priced select bottles on Thursdays.

JPfCqpDRMdnOxpexX2iznQ.text: My husband found this great Thai place in our new neighborhood.  The atmosphere is cozy and service was impressive.  I really enjoyed the eggplant with basil and the Pad Z U was tasty.  The portions were large, so great to share.

6JYFv9y4M8CGeA6GCytMZg.text: So this is actually a nice little restaurant i would recommend to everyone I know especially knowing a lot of ppl that would of enjoyed the food but I'm not because I had a bad first impression and I wouldn't want what I experienced  to happen to anyone else especially since everyone I know goes out in big groups. Tonight I came with my family for dinner a group of 14 ppl , while everyone was already almost done eating I was the only one still waiting on my food as they brought me my food I asked them if i can take it to go  since everyone was already done . There apology was donuts I didn't even get to eat my food and they gave me donuts so basically I get donuts instead of my steak to eat . I'm not that type that expects things for free but my family thought that was really bad customer service and that they should have at least comped that one meal instead they came up to me a took the food back after it was packaged for me to take. When they were asked so what are you gonna do with the food they said "well the owner will take it home " when we asked to speak to her they said she wasn't gonna come out . All we really wanted was an explanation on why that even happened and to at least hear it from her but that's not what we got so I just hope that this doesn't happen to any else and they see this review as something to help them not make the same mistake .

LXJEvCoSKadeNSPnnoNfaQ.text: Shawndee was fantastic! Kept us entertained but still allowed us to have privacy. Food was fantastic as always. Couldn't believe how good the mussels were!

lnnLn0WNNDHYnEAz8pNVhw.text: Not going to lie. Very disappointed. I don't know if they changed staff but this visit was very bad. Ordered the fried rice but asked for no egg, and it was so bland, no taste at all. So switched it for the pad Thai. And waiter then said that chef couldn't comped it because we asked for no egg. But I don't understand why that's enough of an excuse for the rice to still be bland. I go to le Thai all the time and ask for no egg on top of my fried rice and it's still Amazing!!! If I would recommend Thai food I would say le Thai there is a long wait BUT there's a reason there is !!!!! Never leave yelp reviews until now. I had such a bad experience I felt like I needed to share it.

tlcj-6A_C7_4e7nEya4cpg.text: The only reason I'm not giving this place 5 stars is because of the service. The food: OUTSTANDING! The atmosphere: Cute and Comfortable. The wine list: Lots to choose from. The staff: Friendly. The service: Really slow...... We shared a bottle of Sauvignon Blanc and 2 starters, the Tempura Spinach Salad and the Calamari. Entrees were the Spicy Green Bean Pork and the Grilled Skirt-Steak Avocado Curry. I'll definitely go back (and probably order the same thing because it was so damn good). I just hope they consider hiring more staff to accommodate when the restaurant is busy. We dined at 8:45pm on a Friday.

zp3QLLKjTeqGQSUgn5qGmw.text: Great atmosphere, crab wontons and shrimp wrapped bacon on the tapas menu are delisious! Drinks also, one of the best neighborhood happy hours. Bartender is friendly and on the ball serving drinks and some awesome cucumber-lemon water!

7CD88e5fGB6jqBJscuTprg.text: Fantastic food, great wine list, exceptionally priced and nice ambiance.  The portions are nicely sized, ingredients are fresh and the variety of choices is not overwhelming but enough to satisfy anyone's pallet.  The restaurant and bathroom were clean which usually means the kitchen is too. The staff was very friendly but not pushy, they weren't constantly checking to see if we needed more wine but stopped by enough to check and refill our glasses.  By the way if you like wine with your meals this place is great because that's all the serve not hard liquors or beer.  Would definitely go back again but make sure you reserve your table, they're a busy restaurant and you could end up waiting for a one.

SsFH2i--scy7gGcu_nJDOw.text: The food was very tasty and I was happy to find that when they advertised that the food was going to be a spicy it actually was! I ordered the spinach tempura salad as an appetizer which was wonderful, the dipping sauce was flavorful and sweet. As an entree I ordered the kao soi which was absolutely delicious! The pork shoulder was tender and flavorful and the curry was spicy and plentiful! My only complaint was flat is seemed that everything we ordered had some ingredient that was deep fried.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kao Soi

Tz0etAlnkFtBkNIB6Bc8HA.text: This was the first and most likely the last time I would visit this place..When we first walked in there wasn't a host stand, very few tables and extremely tight..The look we received from the 4 people that were there and from the staff was very unwelcoming just because we had two young ones with us..it's like they were all judging us just because we weren't dressed up all fancy and had kids..One of the staff finally came up to us and asked if we had reservations and we said no..they were able to seat us right away which was nice..The server came over and he was informative about the menu and seemed pretty chipper..the busser on the other hand was extremely rude..While pouring our waters, ice cubes and water was going all over the table..Our food was as follows:  Spinach salad - something different..it was pretty good and probably the only good thing we ordered Chicken satay-4 skewers stabbed in a pineapple..very bland Lamb chops - tender but way too heavy on the sauce Tamarind shrimp - tasted nothing like tamarind..more like shrimp in fish sauce Garlic rice - it was decent Bread pudding - I don't thing it was made with bread at all..had more of a rice consistency,  too dense and no flavor..The homemade coconut ice cream was made with too much water..it wasn't creamy at all, more icy because there was too much crystallization. Also had a piece of hair but we just let it go  $100 for a couple of tapas, one small entree, and a dessert. I wish I could say it was worth it but it wasn't. To say that they're fine dining is a joke. I work in the hospitality industry at a 5 star resort on the strip and our cafe people has better standards and much better personalities than these people. To the arrogant busser who hit my hand while clearing the plates the I so neatly stacked for you just because you're too good to say a word to us like "pardon my reach" or anything along those lines, you suck! To all of the snooty people who give dirty looks when children are around: children are not a disease so please don't treat them like one..I'm sure each and every person was an annoying little child at some point in their life..Some even stay annoying in their old age..The only good thing I can say good about this place was the server faked being nice to us just enough to make me not flip out while there.

C0C_q4DUCW2eA5dOQWJkMg.text: Great Great Great thai food. This place used to be a secret but seems like everyone knows about it now. You have to make a reservation or else good luck getting in. Drunken noodles, steak salad, pineapple fried rice, and deep fried spinach are all amazing. All of their food is amazing.

4H_5YuRtlB0Sv1_mhgCYNA.text: The Secret Kitchen is all about secret family recipes from Thailand. The restaurant offers Asian cuisine served tapa's style and a regular Thai menu. The restaurant serves beer and wine. The service is outstanding an very attentive. The desert menu is delightful. Try the old style rice pudding. This is one of the BEST Thai restaurants in the Las Vegas area. I know I am hooked. They do have carry out service. The restaurant is small, clean and very romantic. I suggest you make a reservation on the weekend. Absolutely marvelous!

__WqO5B3P1y1EXscK_8aKw.text: Love, love the decor. This is definitely a perfect place for a date or someone to impress, it's very serene and tranquil and was just a complete relaxation from the usual (but I'm probably saying this because I went right when they opened so it wasn't overly crowded with noise and chatter.) The service was excellent, they were friendly, professional and had immaculate timing with food, refills, etc. (probably because I was one of the few there at the time but still you'd be amazed at how many restaurants suck at this). I also really liked the bathrooms, they weren't the usual dingy bathroom, it kind of felt like a hotel bathroom. I know ... a bathroom review is weird but sometimes it's just good to know.   I had the E-Haan Sausage, Calamari, Spinach Salad, Drunken Noodles and the Salmon Avocado Curry. The curry was recommended as the "best dish ever in the city" by the server and with that bold statement I knew it would fail to live up to expectations. It was good, not a standout but still good. The calamari was actually really good much to my surprise. It wasn't over breaded, had the perfect consistency and the sauce was spicy but sweet, a good complement.   The E-Haan Sausage was different, you wrapped it in a lettuce wrap and it had different toppings, original, good and different. The drunken Noodles tasted like...drunken noodles. Nothing outstanding, they tasted exactly what they were supposed to taste like.   I was a little confused about the hype over the spinach salad. The lime dressing is actually amazing, I love lime and I could drizzle that stuff over anything but the actual salad is just fried lettuce or tempura battered lettuce. I have an inner fat kid so anything fried tastes good, I'm not a fan of carrots but guess what's good? Fried carrots. Almost anything fried can be good so I'm not sure why this dish is overhhyped.  All in all not a bad place to check out, good environment, good wine selection, but not five stars because the food was good, but I can't see myself ever craving it or telling someone they have to go here to try a specific dish.

2gebUz26PHJQUjhfOpBosg.text: 5 Stars for sure!  The First Rule of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen is you DO NOT talk about Nittaya's Secret Kitchen! (Except to tell awesome people who love amazing food. Always tell other awesome people.)  I heard it through the grapevine that this place was amazing, and oh-WOW-uh! I knew before my meal was over that I would become a regular  & will attempt to try everything on the menu, eventually.  Extremely intimate & cozy (for now), so become one of the initiated before the word gets out and the expansion starts.  I'll say no more (for now).

C5xCmrYS9z9MTfH2b-V_IQ.text: OMG where do I start!  Cute little place.  The staff was great!  I am a rigid Pad Thai girl but the menu was very interesting!  We started with the Spinach Salad (tempura spinach), then the crispy pork belly, next the phuket  poppers and finally the drunken noodles!  Everything was awesome...in the order I listed :)  I really liked the infused water as well.

xgYoxIkUXgQEhccG2140Nw.text: Very good Thai food. Slightly differs from a traditional Thai menu but in a delightful way. After hearing about this place for years, I finally tried the secret Thai kitchen and was not disappointed. Our waitress recommended the "favorites" fried spinach salad and secret dumplings as starters. We tried both, I would not get the spinach salad again. Each piece of spinach is deep-fried although the lime vinaigrette is tasty this was extremely heavy and not my thing. The dumplings were OK but I probably would try something different next time as well. However we did order the chicken lettuce wraps and they were so flavorful and fresh definite must for next time. For Main's we got the Panang chicken curry and the rain forest  rice both were knockouts! The curry was light and flavorful slightly spicy and creamy. We will be returning here again!

W8jnHm9WkRjflGNKulLKOw.text: Have eaten here several times and everyone I bring absolutely loves it. Admittedly, restaurant is small and sometimes passing between tables is concerning, but staff is very friendly and caring.  Food plated in an absolutely stunning manner, with beautiful use of orchids and leaves.    There are wine and sagria specials available, as well as Happy Hour.  Outdoor seating can be nice during the spring and summer seasons.  Eating tapas style is our favorite.  The pace of the meal is excellent and everything is flavorful and tasty.   Go to the restaurant's website to learn more.

bQYWStqj5VcB03iJAdPgHA.text: The food was delicious and prices are very reasonable! One thing I noticed was the outstandingly friendly service from our server Leah. Thank you! We will be back

7F9vneJxenC5teHhZrnFwA.text: One of the best Thai restaurants you will ever find in Las Vegas,everything is good here and the owner and employers are very friendly and attentive to everything,the service is top!Just eat the young coconut curry my God so delicious.Thank you everyone I appreciate the great food and service :)

vPJlQAIp8D4pVnQuIKMjYw.text: This place is absolutely amazing! The ambiance is suitable for a causal dining with friends after a day of shopping or it's perfectly romantic for a nice date night. The food is also amazing! The Manfriend and I (the man in the picture stuffing his face on my profile) LOVE the noodle dishes, emerald rice, and the basil chicken pot stickers called the secret stickers. We used to go once a week but toned that down a bit to twice a month. Honestly I've never tried anything terrible - well except I was not a fan of the shrimp dishes (bacon wrapped shrimp or the shrimp tom yum soup).

WJ9RcBMzUE7ZkYK9avS8Eg.text: Items selected:  Strawberry Lemon Water Whitefish Cake - Cucumber and sweet Chili Sauce World Famous Spinach Salad - Tempura with lime dressing and chicken Duck Breast Curry - Coconut Curry Sauce, Pineapple, Cherry Tomatoes, Thai Basil, Peppers Island Bread Pudding with Coconut Rum Caramel Sauce and Coconut Ice Cream  Sharing a city with one of the most highly acclaimed Thai restaurants in the United States cannot be easy but with Lotus of Siam's largely traditional menu routinely garnering hour-plus waits for both lunch and dinner it could also be said that Las Vegas is an ideal locale for something small, intimate, and innovative - a description defined by Chef Nittaya Parawong and her Secret Kitchen.  Featuring a style described as "Thai Tapas" alongside traditional curries and noodles with each dish made by Nittaya herself and served by friendly Taiwanese servers in a modern yet elegant space a meal at Nittaya's Secret Kitchen is a relaxed and refined affair beginning with complimentary flavored water and although the menu featured no less than a dozen items I'd have liked to try, the decision was made to start with a variety of tapas, appetizer, and curry plus dessert - each item prepared to order, ample in portion, and served with impeccable pacing.  Intentionally incorporating fish, vegetable, and meat before progressing to dessert and focusing on the more innovative options both the crispy fish cakes and the tender duck breast would prove delicious and well prepared with light sweetness acting to temper the heat and moving on to the "famous" salad I really have no idea how the chef manages to produce a batter so light and a flavor so vegetal but whatever the method it should be embraced, the dish one of the best things I've eaten at a Thai restaurant and without a doubt the most innovative 'salad' I've had in years.  Moving on to the dessert menu there was never really a question as to what I would order and with tender pineapple pudding rife with coconut milk custard topped off with both ice cream and caramel of the same I really cannot think of a better 'Thai' dessert, traditional or not, nor a better thing ever done with a coconut.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Island Bread Pudding with Coconut Rum Caramel Sauce and Coconut Ice Cream (gone)
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Island Bread Pudding with Coconut Rum Caramel Sauce and Coconut Ice Cream
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Island Bread Pudding with Coconut Rum Caramel Sauce and Coconut Ice Cream

O_wEJKUdwMg6RED8-xSkRg.text: We discovered Nittaya's about 6 months ago when we moved to Summerlin. We have been here 6 times since (would be more but we have small children) and every single time it has been outstanding! The atmosphere is more for date nights. It's a small, romantic and intimate setting not very ideal for bringing small children but we have! Our favorite items are the braised short rib curry, the avocado salmon curry and the whole coconut seafood curry. ALL outstanding. The secret potstickers and mussels on the appetizer menu are equally delicious. They have a 1-5 spice level you can request which is amazing because we love spicy thai food. Level 4 is perfect. You can sample different wines before purchasing which makes it nice. The menu is priced accordingly. If you want crap Thai food you'll pay cheaper prices for it. At Nittaya's, you get what you pay for! It is beyond extraordinary. We would come here a lot more if we could afford to, believe me. It's definitely a treat to come at least once a month for us. We are fortunate that we live so close. IF you don't live that close, it is worth the trip! Definitely make reservations on weekends because it gets busy. We have been fortunate not ever to wait too long for a table though. Service also is outstanding. Their infused water is so good. I can't say one thing that needs improvement here. Love it love it love it!!!!!

Uko4UanpbJfLp0QneTBieA.text: After reading the reviews and menu online, my friend and I decided to try the restaurant. When we arrived and tried to order lunch, we were told that only dinner was served on the weekends. The dinners are almost double the lunch prices. This policy regarding dinners on the weekends was not mentioned anywhere on the website. Next, there was an issue on the price of substituting brown rice for white rice. The website said there was a $1.00 charge; the menu we were given stated there was a $2.00 charge; and then the waitress stated both those were incorrect. There is actually a $3.00 charge for the substitution. At that point, I was irritated, and we left. I think the restaurant needs to accurately state policies and prices, so there aren't surprises once seated at the establishment.

XeTx8qMLUOzuB6LyC9kRsA.text: Excellent! A hidden gem.  After our awesome meal, we had the thai donuts and paired it w the coconut ice cream. It was great!

dLpfyjwr_9S8JvWo9-Fa1g.text: Great service, awesome value lunch menu for 11 dollars with salad, potsticker and entree, red curry beyond amazing!  The best Thai in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Curry!

e2o59LjaQjFhQ2DkJGVQIg.text: Had an amazing dinner here tonight. Intimate restaurant - completely non "Vegas" - like. Cozy ambiance, delicious meal. Restaurant was packed so definitely make reservations.  Highly recommend the spinach salad and lemongrass soup.   Also, my compliments to the staff for handling a VERY rude couple a few seats down from us. They had one thing wrong on their meal and threatened the owner with posting a scathing Yelp review. Restaurant staff did what they could in a packed room, and honestly it wasn't a big deal.

PgK7tISRik0esEk01R_JEg.text: Lovely and tasty food. A bit pricey for dinner in this area, go for lunch instead. Fresh ingredients,  flavorful spices.

S8ToqjyvYaE0vUN9FpVNcg.text: I've come to Nittaya's over a dozen times for lunch now and have yet to have even a mediocre meal. The staff are friendly and attentive, and the restaurant itself is clean, sleek, and modern with a wine bar and two intimate dining rooms. Both the red curry and basil chicken burst with flavor, also be sure to try the spicy garlic edamame. Bottom line, if you're a fan of Thai food, you're missing out if you don't try Nittaya's. While not inexpensive, prices are still on the reasonable side and the return in the quality of food and service is evident and well worth it.

aOvsKVygayp1tm1z15LLYA.text: LOVE this place! We are regulars here and visit for a nice dinner or sometimes lunch. The food is so amazing, authentic, fresh and delicious! Service is usually great as well. You have to try papaya salad or the spinach salad. Everything on menu is delicious so you can't go wrong.

tzIMMp0CFZGkzCFP_K9ceQ.text: Everytime I go here, it never disappoints!!  The "Spinach Salad" is one of my favorite apps in the city..That dressing..OMG....My go to for lunch are any of the curry dishes or the drunken noodles.  Fantastic!!

MJAW5uetcJePNgiWXxC4jA.text: Had lunch there the other day. Had the drunken noodles, fried rice, pot stickers, and chicken satay. The food was decent, not greasy, ok flavor, but a bit overboard with garnishes everywhere. Just that non of the dishes made me say wow. For me the ambiance was a little off putting, to dark, and missing the traditional thai feel I'm used to. Feelt alittle rushed to eat and go. Just wasn't all that impressed, seemed like a overly priced thai restaurant with ok food. With all the good comments I expected more.  Probably won't go back, I'll stick with my thai mom and pop restaurant.

ldcaqDZ-so1kssAN3Wb9yA.text: Nittaya's is another one of my staples I have to hit when I'm in Vegas. It really is a secret kitchen - tucked into a small shopping complex in Summerlin, it's a great place for locals to sit down for an intimate Thai dinner. The restaurant is very small, with only 6 or so low tables, a long bar that can probably sit 6 as well, and two high tables. Because of it's size, I highly recommend making a reservation.   Their decor is spectacular and they have had many different large paintings on their back wall, I assume they change it out when it's been sold(?). I think it adds a bit of excitement to dining there, that you will typically see some new art. I can't rave enough about how much I love the atmosphere and staff at Nittaya's. It great for a date night, or dining as a family since ever dish is large enough to share.    The food here is phenomenal! I am yet to be disappointed with anything I've ordered. I usually stick to the Pad Thai, Massaman Curry, Potstickers and Rain Forest Fried Rice. The Pad Thai always comes out spicy even though I usually ask for it more mild, so watch out for that if you're not a fan of spice. Other than that, the other dishes are normally served more mild.

MRd7_ui-NN8zEoZw07A8og.text: I am giving this place 4 stars based upon the quality of the food.  It was very good. However,  the prices are ridiculous. I understand that it is supposed to be an upscale Thai/tapas/wine place, but no Thai restaurant should charge $16 - $24 an entree.  I ordered drunken noodles & the Angel wing, and my bill was $26, and the potions were small. I got 1 stuffed wing for $8. While the food is good, I will not be back.

P_BR_akMv6FdCJVWhJ5uTQ.text: This is by far my favorite neighborhood restaurant!  It is so cute and intimate!  The presentation of the food is beautiful!

6_Y9kEbUowdOmYA5fcBhiQ.text: Incredible, loved everything about this restaurant from the servers to the food and everything in between! Do yourself a favor and go. You will be so pleased that you did! One of the very best restaurants in all of Las Vegas! It is very small, so call ahead and make a reservation!

dMyXahT-8TzsOOK1iK7ptQ.text: AMAZING food. We came for an early dinner, and were so delighted by everything we ordered. Spinach salad, without chicken, is crazy delicious. Mussels were gigantic and the coconut broth w/ basil was blissfully light and full of flavor. The squid salad outshines all Thai restaurants in the area. The soft-shell crab, with apple salad...dreamy!

aEIV-56uxSFIh1szwKhhMA.text: Made a reservation here.  When we arrived no one acknowledged or greeted us.  Stood at the front by the bar for 5+ minutes with no acknowledgement.  Left without eating.

IgSey8Wo7OpXr29DFifDgA.text: This truly is a hidden gem. We went for Valentine's Day dinner and would go back again and again.  The atmosphere was quiet and romantic.  The spinach salad was fantastic! I can appreciate the amount of time between appetizers and meal. We were given plenty of time to finish our appetizers before our meal came out. The menu was unique. This is first place that I have seen that offers curry avocado.   The sangria looked amazing. It will be on my "to order" list.

G9NeeJKQJlZJYQQI8M76zg.text: To start the water is strawberry and orange flavored, The vegetable egg rolls were fried to perfection with crisp vegetables inside accompanied by the right amount of spice, the House duck sauce was amazing ! I ordered the chicken pad see ew as my entree and the chicken was tender noodles were cooked to perfection and it was plated beautifully. i will surely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NqxD-_tr05QjJXI5F1LVQw.text: Thai is one of my favorite cuisines, this place did not disappoint. I'm not familiar with this area of town, and I had no idea Rampart was closed down to one lane, I had a 5pm reservation and I ended up being 45 minutes late and they were kind enough to still hold our table, I have an obsession with time, and I'm never late, being 45 minutes late to a reservation just about threw me over the edge. They were very understanding.  Onto the review. We started out with a pitcher of red sangria, not the best I've had, lacking some flavor, but the presentation was beautiful, topped with an orchid in each glass. There were so many appetizers that I felt compelled to try, but I settled on the Koh Samui Shrimp, only because I've been to Koh Samui, quite honestly that was the only reason, coconut shrimp usually doesn't do it for me, but this was actaully really good, I liked the dipping sauce.   For my entree I ordered the young Coconut Curry, which was served inside a hollowed out coconut and served with the most amazng rice I think I've had. It was so light and fluffy, 5 stars alone just for the rice. My friend enjoyed her Tofu Pad Thai.  For dessert, or as it's listed on the website, happy endings, we shared the Ginger/Lemongrass Creme Brulee, I'm a sucker for anything ginger and/or lemongrass, the flavors really came through.   Yes you will pay a little more for the dishes here, you're not eating at Thai Food To-Go.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Sangria
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Young Coconut Curry
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Koh Samui Shrimp

II5aDYxHVO7t2MjHVdce8g.text: Went out of their way to set up outside seating for us since we had our puppy with us. The food was on point. You pay for what you get. The servings were large, spice level was perfect, and everything tasted fresh. Servers were incredibly friendly. We would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prudence!
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried rice green curry and red curry with shrimp.

SC-XnN72TBsf74l73qBS-w.text: Truly a best kept secret!!!!  The food is amazing and Josh behind the bar is an awesome bartender/server!!  Our favorite dishes are the beef jerky, Phuket poppers, crying tiger steak and my personal fav the chicken pad woon sen!!! They have a very eclectic wine list and the bar is cozy.  Whether you're on a romantic date or just hanging w friends the atmosphere is perfect and always good people watching!

IMoAvd5gRblMmnMmqgamrA.text: Wonderful experience. The staff from the hostess, to the busboy, food runner and server was outstanding. The atmosphere is dim lit and very romantic and comforting. They start you off with a strawberry mint water which was very refreshing. We started with the spinach salad because it was so highly recommend on yelp. No idea how they fry and tempura loose leaf spinach like that, but it was very good. A little heavy and a very large portion for two people, so we barely dented the plate but it was still delicious. It was served with a special sauce that is rich and decadent, so be sparing. The Thai tea was a must have. And we split the green curry salmon which was served with an avocado on top, eggplant and zucchini. It was large enough to split for two. We were stuffed but had to order the mango sticky rice for dessert which was in season, and which I will probably be craving for the rest of my life! It was superb! I appreciate the fact that They only have it on the menu when the mango is in season and is just right. To me, that Really shows that Mrs.Nittaya is very dedicated to her menu and her beautiful creations. I would love to meet this fantastic chef. Every plate was divine. Decorated with flowers and special care. I highly recommend. My favorite curry is yellow, or massaman,  but I had to try something different. I look forward to going back for their lunch specials and also the happy hour!!

qqbD5DyVVYwcGPkKfuIt_Q.text: OH MY GOSH. So happy I yelled nearby restaurants when I was bored! The food here is seriously amazing. Not like oh I think all Thai food is amazing. Like truly amazing. The spinach salad is the most ridiculous thing I've tasted could eat it all day! Penang curry was great! Papaya salad, coconut shrimp, crying tiger anything! Can't wait to go back!  One complaint is it's very busy usually. Be prepared to have a bit of chaos in the restaurant.

dCdHPyTljFmEAFuU4A56Qw.text: We always love this place!!! It's a small and cozy environment and the food is fresh and delicious!!

i0l4k-YWT8mSPlo5idMw-A.text: There food is decent however for the price it's not worth it. As well as the customer service, they triple charged me which added up to around over $300. Not impressed which is unfortunate, I had high hopes.

C3PSM0uaUWvJTcXcLqkRqg.text: Although I love this place for its cute intimate decor, I think it's pricey. I've come twice now because friends love it. Ordered drunken noodles which wasn't bad. The pineapple fried rice was not good, too sweet for my taste. There's a basil pork dish that I really enjoyed, tasted like what I expect it to taste.

tpoq4ECJmL9w6Xk32k810w.text: This is the best Thai food ever :) amazing service and great atmosphere. Definitely will be coming here again

wG2UDVViL6_6TX1lg7xuhw.text: Good food, I liked it, very upscale.   The service, however, does not even compare to a Podunk McDonalds. Service was extremely slow, do not come expecting a quick exit. Took 45 min after ordering to receive our meal. Took them 15 minutes to bring out a Pepsi. Seems like all the staff disappear into the kitchen and leave the lobby. Even the bar was unattended. I would not recommended this restaurant to any of my friends or family.   The sad part is, there were maybe 10 tables full and one individual at the bar.

m7iDPdpe1NDeGtZizmNfgA.text: I love this place. Who doesn't love 1/2 price bottles of wine on Thursday. It's hard to get a table on the weekends, be prepared to get rejected if you don't make a reservation. And they are precise about their timing, don't show up 15 minutes late cause they'll let the next reservation have it. Why? Because they work hard at delivering an amazing experience and awesome food. Services is perfect here. Salmon in the Green Curry sauce is a favorite of my family. They have a small wine selection, but they've chosen them well to pair with the food. You can taste the freshness and feel the love from the staff. Keep it up, you guys are all awesome!

K4jMaFhQcp3qV6bN0Ilv0g.text: By far one of the best food experiences I have had in a long time.  The food was spectacular!

2UuqoKWnexQJ06S8x0o8Yg.text: The food is awesome and a great place to both casual dine and have a classy get together. Their far and away best dish is there Kao Soi. It's just as good reheated in the microwave as it is there- delicious chunks of pork marinated in a beautiful sauce. Also, their charred shishito peppers are so cool and fun. The peppers are like a little lottery system - there's a small chance you might get a super spicy one! They're addictive and delicious. Their Thai donuts are also quite good. Overall, this restaurant is great for almost every occasion with delicious choices for appetizers, entrees, and desserts.

N-cwfDHQFkGzehJm5Ps0sw.text: This is a small intimate restaurant. Great food. Great wine selection. One of the top Thai restaurants I've had. The duck breast curry was a little tough but delicious. The service is great. The prices are moderate but the portions are very generous. I had a great experience. Next time I have to try the spinach salad. It looked very delicious.   This is definitely a hidden gem in Vegas!   Oh yes and half off wine bottles on Thursday!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood dish, Pad ZU, and duck curry.

hAF3nQBokGdJhGR91ZzW3g.text: Very good shrimp pad Thai. I'll be coming back. Nice atmosphere. Would be a nice date spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thursday night is half price bottles
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious shrimp pad Thai. Wasn&#39;t very spicy like one of the other reviewers said. Hit the spot

ckRjKSsW9SSJuwO1_TeODQ.text: Service was ok. It took about 20 minutes for someone to approach our table. But the food was so good. We ordered Green curry, fried spinach pokura, and thai style fried rice. The food was fresh and had so much flavor.

cDFwIaNbI5Yft_WD2PyKjQ.text: Being from San Francisco I've grown accustom to the down home style cooking of Thai restaurants back there. Since moving out here (5 yrs ago) I've been so disappointed with every single supposed Thai restaurant I've come across.   NITTAYA'S SECRET KITCHEN is the answer to all my food prayers. Her food gives you that warm feeling inside like it was cooked especially for you & makes you want to give the Chef a hug for such great food.   A must try is her "WORLD FAMOUS SPINACH SALAD" its the most DELICIOUS thing I've ever tasted. Individually tempura fried spinach served with a chicken larb... OMG! i could seriously eat this everyday.   You should also give her Pad Thai a try... its not your typical "sour, orangie looking pad Thai" It has the perfect balance of sweet, salt & sour   I could honestly go on forever about this place but you guys should check it out for yourself. If you're all the way on the other side, it worth the drive!!

ybICyTeRBIKCc_btPx1DDQ.text: very small place. The food was outstanding. i will be going back. my wife and i loved this place everything we had tasted awesome

Tc3le-00z0lwvXt1t1M3QQ.text: Love this place!  The spinach tempura salad is one of the best appetizers I've eaten in years.   The interior is small but cozy and would be perfect if you are on a date or meeting with friends.  It's not pretentious but it does however have a sophisticated atmosphere.  I would rate Nittaya's right up there with Archi's Thai or Pin Kow.

w3TXfyVIgEcMKRmI_SIKyw.text: We truly enjoyed this restaurant. We went in giving the Chef carte blanche with our dinner with the only requirement being that we are gluten free. He made a wonderful Salmon Eggplant green curry and lettuce wraps for appetizer. I enjoyed the ambiance. It was pretty quiet, but it was a Monday at 5pm, so I'm guessing it gets busier. Not Good for Kids at all....so don't bring them!

lHW-y3OwURlX6tjd6AlNCQ.text: Upscale Thai with a unique menu and super cute Summerlin dining room... I realy wanted to like this place!  I notice some of the positive reviews say Nittaya's is hit or miss, but I can't bring myself to go back.  Servers here are awkward high school boys who forgot numerous parts of our order and brought things out in incorrect order (one of our apps came after we had finished entrees, drink never came, etc.), way strange for an upscale restaurant in this part of town.  Makes no sense.  Fried "famous" spinach salad lacked any kind of heat or flavor.  The coconut soup was boring and one note, again no flavor.  Nothing wowed us, and we tried a good assortment.  With SO many fab Thai restaurants in this city (ie. Lotus of Siam where they have an expansive menu of authentic and super memorable dishes), this should be last on anyone's list.  I'm guessing they cater to people with timid palates who want a quiet and cute atmosphere for date night and food comes secondary.  I cannot imagine a lover of Thai food coming here more than once.

4gbq8Ux3yh2GKucdGya9XA.text: Husband and I stopped in on a Saturday night without reservations around 6pm and were seated without issues, which was nice because we seemed to just beat the rush that happened at 6:30 to 7:00pm. The waitress was very kind and patient in explaining the dishes. It didn't seem to have come from some rehearsed dialog, as she genuinely cared about the food and service. We chose the chicken pad thai and tapas called Golden Pouches. The pad thai was most definitely the best version of the dish that I have had in town and was a spitting image of my memory of my Thai friends' family's home-cooked pad thai. The chicken was tender and the flavors were amazing! Earthy, fresh, noodle texture was perfect and not rubbery... We ate the whole thing and when we go back again, we would easily order that dish a second time. The golden pouches are potato and curry seasoning wrapped in egg dough that is fried. They are made to look like little pouches, and they are so good, crisp, hot, and spiced! Reminded me of Christmas... Those were off the tapas menu, and were big enough to be satisfying.   The ambience was very nice, subtle decor, music from Massive Attack playing in the background... Did not have a chance to try any wines, but the selection was very decent given the size of the establishment. The bar section looked very inviting. Overall cozy feel and welcoming. Would certainly go back again to try more dishes, if only for the kindness of the staff, not to mention the quality of the food.

kBE91NIG-QgOh5G1SEtG-A.text: This charming restaurant has a nice ambiance and serves tasty meals. We were drawn to it, because it uses organic products.  After a day of hiking, we decided to give it a try.  Upon entering the restaurant, we felt our clothing was a bit too casual since most existing customers were dressed in business casual attire.  Nonetheless, we were greeted and received above average service. We did not have a reservation; however, due to the size of the restaurant, I would recommend making one.  The shrimp pad Thai was phenomenal!  It was the best I've ever eaten.  My husband raved about the eggplant curry, and our friend thought the basil chicken and crab fried rice were awesome.  The only reason I can't rate the restaurant as five stars is I asked the waitress to omit the egg in the shrimp pad Thai, but the meal was served with egg. Outside of that, the restaurant has great ambiance, clean restrooms and delicious food.  We have found out new favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas.  We WILL eat there again and again and again.

WKbNdh7diMPgG6dtGDhnpQ.text: exceptional to say the least. very relaxing atmosphere. love it. be specific as to how spicy you like it. this is a keeper. janet s.

elnUb37q11e3iZ-rFFsrzA.text: What can I possibly say about Nittaya's? Yes, it's a hidden gem. Yes, the food is SO good that I want to stand up, jump up and down, and shout to the whole world. But more so than that, it is divine. The food is perfect, and this is no exaggeration. This is the best restaurant to open off Strip in years. Worthy of note, everything on the menu, but especially the Whitefish Cake, the Lamb Chops, and the Cream Puffs. Service is outstanding, friendly, and attentive. My water glass never reached the halfway mark, and we sat on the patio. All that is left to say now is don't walk, RUN as soon as possible to Nittaya's Secret Kitchen, which as soon as word gets out, will not be so secret anymore. ;)

UrcrRfzb-eS1NgAepbX9BA.text: My first time dining at Nittaya's Secret Kitchen and it is a beautiful place.  I love the different vegeterian dishes.  The spinach salad is great.  This place is tucked away and is truly a secret.  I can't wait to share Nittaya's Secret Kitchen with others.

oqGDVavw48tydlDPtScUlA.text: What a secret!  I can't help but tell everyone about Nittaya's.  A very small, cozy space that is stylish yet casual.  Each dish is carefully thought out and executed beautifully.  The dishes are layered with flavor and it is worth making many visits to get through the menu.  Tapas & Thai, two of my favorite things done very well!

s7hYmgujnT35WTkfusInug.text: One of the best tai restaurants I have ever eatten in.  Warm decor, great staff.  The food is amasing each time I go.  I am hooked on the coconut soup.  The spinage salad is fabulous and if you like pad tai, their's can't be beat.  It is a little expensive but quality food always cost a little more.  I love it!  Can't wait to go back and try the curry.

-l-h2IRgUZM1cqpC-tEjWw.text: I have never been treated quite this way at a restaurant. We first ordered two beers and 30 minutes later the waiter told us it would be another 5 minutes before we would get our beers. Ten minutes went by and we didn't get even a glass of water. We ordered two appetizers and one came out after an hour and the other didn't arrive after an hour and a half. We didn't even bother to order a dinner as we didn't feel like being there for an additional 2 hours. Then they tried to charge us for the beers that we never did get. I checked my credit card statement a week later and I found that the waiter double charged my credit card on accident. When I called to speak to Nattaya she was "too busy" to call me back and I had to keep calling until I finally spoke to her. She told me she just didn't have time to look through her statements and she would call me back in a few days. A few days went by and a waiter ended up calling me back telling me that he would have to be responsible for the additional money that was charged on my credit card. I will never go back to this restaurant again and Nattaya should check the labor laws as she doesn't treat her staff right. Mistakes happen, but you don't make your customer feel guilty for them. Avoid this restaurant at all costs.

x1QfogIEPQCw5qt2hUp7kg.text: Simply amazing! Best thai food I've had in a very long time. I had the Shrimp pad thai. The service was prompt. No complaints! I'll be back

y3VDN9-Bbl_FS9FU18U1FQ.text: Horrible !!!!! We Spent my birthday dinner at this establishment even made reservations AND they were informed before hand this was my birthday . I WILL NEVER DINE HERE AGAIN ! When I presented a $25 dollar dining certificate from Restaurant.com ( it was purchased a few years back but clearly states it never expires) , they refused it and came back with a manager. The manager called it for lack of better words COUNTERFEIT! Called a crook on my birthday... fabulous. The worst part is, my husband and I have spent many a birthday and anniversary here and have even closed the place down drinking and eating 100 year old Eggs ( Thai delicacy ) with the owner a few times in the past . This looks to be a case of a place growing too big to care about where they are from and their original customers . I understand policies change however , if you were involved with a 3rd party business during the years purchased it should still be valued. And if NOT something else should have been offered .. I asked if their was anything they could do and they denied ... I then said I wouldn't back and they didn't care. DISGUSTED. Happy birthday to me . Angry !!

4wyHjK-V6L2MigecP9aT2g.text: This place is a hidden gem in the Summerlin area.  Food is amazing.  I ordered the eggplant basil for lunch and the food came out really fresh.  We also ordered dessert (Bread Pudding with Coconut Ice Cream) it's do die for.  Bread pudding is home made and fresh.  Will definitely will go back and try different items on the menu.  Also customer service is amazing.

wFcsFGYjTwr6srVcGFD3VQ.text: My gal pal who knows all the hot spots in LV brought me here one night and it was an authentic experience.  We started with the papaya salad which was spicy and tangy sort of like biting into a freshly rained on Thai jungle.    The fried avocado was tempura style so very light and came with the most mysteriously delicious green sauce.  The shrimp skewers were seasoned in light curry and presented atop a fresh pineapple slice.  Peanut sauce seemed homemade.  The tropical chicken rice was an earthy delight.  All the ingredients were fresh and colorful without feeling heavy.  The coconut ice cream was like an angelic glimpse into what could be if I lived inside a saccharine coconut.  Still thinking about it.

8r2lhZD6WsPHaqi_MD83cQ.text: Great ambience; contemporary and cool. Plates beautifully presented. The food vibrant and fresh. Truly representative of an eatery in Summerlin (Hawaii yeeps, think Kahala)  Authentic Thai? No. Unless you think people in Thailand eat orchids.  But a prettied up example for Western palates.  Every dish I've ever sampled has highs and lows. For example, the spinach salad that so many rave about. The tempura spinach is excellent. Crispy with just the right salinity. Perfect fresh out of the clean oil. Unfortunately a dip in the sour, herbaceous sauce muddles the flavor and does nothing but make the dish soggy.  The server recommended marinated crispy pork, very moist with deep five spice flavor, with a crisp breaded coating, tasty. When mixed with the accompanying chili sauce, the crust becomes soggy and the oil becomes pronounced.  Golden pouches, pretty, but the deep-fried wrapper is too thick to bite through, forcing you to turn it upside down and soak it in the curry to soften. All good as the pouches break open and the creamy potato taste great with the curry.  In general Curries are very flavorful. Great coconut taste well integrated spice. You won't see chili oil floating on the surface. Proteins in the curries are well cooked.  Chicken and pork are especially tender and still moist.  Conversely, sauces don't complement dishes very well. All good, it's fun getting the pork into the curry and the spinach into the chili sauce. All better flavor combinations.  Great added touches such as an orange cucumber infused water.  Service is very welcoming and off Strip friendly.  So why four stars? Simple, The food is intriguing. Take the highs of each dish, play with your food make your own combinations.  In the end, a fun dining experience.

QqwmZ0R32crXth6gYBnWAw.text: New to town and went here on first night and we were so happy with the atmosphere and the yummy food.  What a great surprise we live near.  We will most defiantly be coming back.  Thanks for your yummy food.

NSp7Z_Rs6yF_hA_Yu3MY_Q.text: This place is a gem!! The servers are really courteous and very nice.   If you want to have good Thai food and great service do yourself a favor and check this restaurant out! Will definitely be back for more.

L72xPxH0xqYhCBieh9eSXQ.text: The food is delicious, presented in beautifully decorated dishes by Executive Chef Nittaya. They have an amazingly rich wine selection from wineries around the world. The employees are very friendly, providing quick, but excellent service. You will feel cozy in the restaurant's ambience with all wooden walls, tables and wine teamed decorations. This is a must - try place. Once you visit it for a first time, you will love Nittaya's Secret Kitchen.

jRkVWcpYy_kDN4-O_duz8w.text: I found this romantic and intimate gem via Yelp! I was reluctant to drive 30min to it given the abundance of food places in Vegas within 5min of any location. Well, this is a True GEM. The food was amazing - everything was fresh, prepared to perfection and served with great presentation. I loved the short ribs and the drunken noodles. I also had the lemon grass soup. This is not your typical Thai place. Every dish has an added detail that you would not find in single $ Thai places and there are plenty of unique dishes that add to the authenticity of this restaurant. I cannot wait to go there again.  I am always focused on the quality of the food and the level of services but there one more detail that makes this place superior. The interior is very well decorated and adds to the the experience of submerging you in Thai culture. It is just perfect. Perfect for lunch or dinner.  One thing to note is that the restaurant does not have high chairs. I would not call it child unfriendly but it sure made it hard to keep the kids from digging in all the yummy food.  Did I mention that the mango sticky rice is not to be missed?!

Z4YqpnD6BPtNZTIf9p7pVA.text: Wow this place is absolutely amazing!! The food is delicious!! I had the Pad Thai and the Basil Eggplant and added chicken.  Best I have ever had and I eat Thai food all the time.  I'll kiss this place but for sure when I'm back I will be coming here.

ggqh16GhRn5WMU6itOtZAQ.text: Quaint little spot that is perfect for a date night. The Spinach Salad(not) is a show stopper with the cashew dressing.

GReasJhx2xV4_aHtv07mCA.text: Great food but a bit over priced. Overall it's a charming place no to authentic though but still delicious . Suitable for a date night in Summerlin.

u3Mnu3wcdmBfd4ANPkrgzg.text: First time visitor, lifetime customer. Crying Tiger! Crying Tiger! Crying Tiger!  If you love Thai food, if you've been to Bangkok or Phuket or Thailand at all, you will love this place. Smaller dining room, friendly servers. I have to remember to set aside 1 hour lunch time. Love it.

LQKmxIbj1addBs3mMEwLxQ.text: By far our favorite place in Vegas for Thai food.  Incredible service, people and food of course is amazing. We 've been here few times and always enjoyed it. My wife is vegan and I am vegetarian so they altered their food as we requested and everything and every time tasted great.

jDNiPM3RCXVtp4HtV5mTdA.text: Awesome food great service and exceptional management!!!! This is truly a gem in the desert.  If you like happy hour wine specials this is the upscale place for you. I ordered the worlds famous fried spinach salad and it did not disappoint!

z2dlqmlAI16bN4v3m1AfLw.text: Make a reservation if you can its rather busy.  Absolutely fantastic dining experience.  We started with the tempura spinach appetizer which was delicious.   I had the shrimp pad thai and my friend had the pad see ewe.  The food was delicious and the service and wine list were superb.  I will definately return.

iSDg_73ezCov0CPO804_tA.text: My favorite Las Vegas secret. It doesn't matter what night I go. There are always couples on dates, solo diners at the bar, and families gathered together for a meal. It's a cozy restaurant with a intimate atmosphere. The food is always delicious with great presentation. Perfect restaurant to have anything from a solo meal while reading a book with a glass of wine or an intimate group dinner for friends. It's my favorite Thai restaurant in town. I love the food so much, I order out when I'm too lazy to change out of sweatpants.

6AgRS9in6I_ozTtty0EmNg.text: Worst customer service I have ever experienced. My family and I came here a couple weekends ago and enjoyed the food (spent about $120 on the dinner, happily). We ended up, this past weekend, driving 15 miles to pick up dinner for the two of us (about $60, happily). I asked for Pad Thai with Chicken for my husband, and Pad See Ew with pork for myself. My husband is allergic to pork.  Once he started eating the pad thai, he immediately started getting sick. Throat swelled, and hives. An experience that he is, unfortunately familiar with, and is not to be mistaken. I called the restaurant, and explained to the host what happened, and was genuinely just trying to figure out what went wrong.  What follows is the most childish and sad response to a customer dispute that I can ever imagine: The self-proclaimed owner called me back, saying that she made it herself and there is no way there was a mistake. I actually began my response by saying, first off - we love your restaurant and your food. But unfortunately, he is sick and actually on his way to the hospital right now. She became extremely childish and whiny... throwing a fit and saying how she grew up making this dish in her father's restaurant (irrelevant to the situation?) and did not put pork in it. I tried to reason with her, and ask if maybe something possible could have gone wrong. She continued to be whiny and unprofessional, saying "well if he's on his way to the hospital, why are you at home?!" (To which I replied that I had an infant daughter at home, and my older son had to drive him).  She ended up saying something about how "If we are so desperate for the $18 back, she'll refund it" and abruptly hung up. I was absolutely stunned. I was not calling her for fun, or for kicks. I genuinely wanted to know what had gone wrong here. If she had been more professional and reasonable, I would not be writing this review. This entire thing was shocking, and NOT whatsoever about the money, but about the principle. We also, of course never received any sort of refund back. To the owner, I sincerely hope that you grow up, and work on your customer service skills. You can have the best food in the world, but if you treat otherwise loyal customers like this - it won't matter. Good luck to you.

VPYHIcvsH_3JNml5eXsjIw.text: We dined here last night (NYE) with a reservation. We arrived about ten mins early and were sat immediately(albeit at possibly the worst table in the house). We were directly by the door and a chatty party of 4 was huddled around our table for most of our meal, awaiting their reservation. Docking one star just because our meal became much more pleasant when they were finally seated.  The service was great, and speedy.  We ordered: Seared ahi(yum) Phuket poppers(SO good) FOB/pineapple fried rice(decent, but could've done without the cooked tomatoes & added some veggies as my personal preference. It also needed a bit more salt, which a tiny bit of soy helped with) Lamb (Hubby said it was awesome and he ate every last bite). All in all we will definitely return!

Chicken larb- 2 stars  Drunken noodles- 2 stars Chicken wings- 3.5 stars  Curry puffs- 4/5   Food was okay, and prices are quite steep.  The best part of my meal were the curry puffs. _GxvAem8UasGsjiMHD8N_A.text: This is a little Thai bistro sort of near Summerlin in a parking lot on a hill. It is hard to find. That's not just my directionally-challenged self talking. My business associate met me here and she got lost and called me for help. Tha th  with GPS. I'm tempted to say that "Nittaya's Secret Kitchen," is REALLY SECRET.  Once inside you are greeted appropriately. It did take a minute of standing there awkwardly while other patrons ogle you. It is a all space. And it is busy. The decor is like a quaint village restaurant. But it is loud and chatty. The crowd are mostly 30-40s, Yuppies. (Do people still call them that?)  Food. It is good. I got the obligatory spinach "salad" to start, which is not really salad, but a deep fried appetizer. Tasty and inventive. The fried avocado was less successful, a bit greasy. The lamb dish I ordered was cooked well, maybe a little cloying, but that's not a deal breaker. The side of rice, which is shared, was perfect.   Dessert was not memorable (literally, I do not remember what we had!)   Overall, cool spot, with the right company. I don't think I would go here alone, except to sit at the bar. The "cool kids" phenom is strong with this one.

6ZZaFnBFdRUdq9ZISeSvmQ.text: My fav thai in the city. Great thai spots are hard to find unless you head downtown or the strip. The pad thai with prawns is my favorite dish and if you like duck you have to get the curry! Oh and they have half off bottles of wine every Thursday! Highly recommended

bJCDMEWpXcniHDHRt-eS6A.text: Holy hell, I had a great dinner here. I went with my cousin who has some food sensitivities and they accommodated them. Our table had the Muay Thai fried rice, green curry with chicken, and the short rib curry special.  They were all so delicious. The flavors were layered and complex and so well combined. Everything seemed to be bursting with freshness.  The service was good overall with some minor issues. They are the reasons for the 4-star rating instead of 5. We had a reservation and they told us that there would still be a fifteen to twenty minute wait. They ended up seating us at a table that was just outside the kitchen door. Not a big deal, but disappointing. The rest of the service was great.   I highly recommend this place.

bd3Sm8qNwo5klQzcGBZafA.text: Ok Iv'e been going to this place for years,  I've given them 5 stars in the past.  However I came in here for a lovely dinner and I was humiliated by the manager (young gentleman who claims he was the manager).   My wife and I had a 740 reservation,  we showed up a little early.  We had appetizers, dinner and drinks.  We were just having a conversation and the manager walked up to us and said there are 2 seats by the bar if we can move there.   I said this was kinda rude,  he said it is a policy that they can only sit someone at a table for 2 hours.  But wait,  we were not ready to go and we were only there for 45 mins and you are kicking us out?  730-815 is not close to your "2"hr policy.     This was humiliating and poor service,  you should be ashamed of yourself.   I hope the owner reads this and take note.....  I am VERY DISSAPOINTED !!!  From a long Time customer...

-EMUh4nrtQc5ZZE71QbG8Q.text: The tapas here are amazing! They were so good, we never even made it to the entrees. 2JX5J8Q0Qe66m3tlpHuUyQ.text: I have been wanting to try Nittaya's for a long time.  I don't know what took me so long!  The food and service are so good here.  My husband and I chose to have Tapas.  Each dish was better than the next.  We had the Ahi, Calamari, Spinach Salad, Crying Baby Tiger, Grilled shrimp and our favorite, was the Mussels.  Our server was so helpful with suggestions, from choosing the wine to the actual dishes.  We will definitely be back!

tbRU91XVO0dOa7dwO_5b7w.text: Stopped in for dinner on a Wednesday night with my best friend, and our daughters (1 yr & 3yr old), let me start off by saying it was busy for a week night, which is a great sign! I've been wanting to eat here for quite some time, so I was excited that we finally made to time to do so! Idealistically we both would've preferred to have just a girls night without the kids, but that's not always the case, and let's face it sometimes you have to take your babies with you! When I looked online at the reviews and  photos I didn't see any hints that it wasn't kid friendly, if I did prior, we mostly likely would've dined elsewhere.  Upon entering we were greeted, by a hostess and asked if we had a reservation, we kindly told her no, her face was very awkward looking to say the least, that's when the gentlemen said that's ok and sat us.  She gave the vibe as if bringing our little girls was not  really cool for the environment. Clearly that didn't stop us, as I said I've been wanting to eat here for quite some time. One of the other things that I was not happy about, was the face that they they have no height chairs for kids, so I had to take my stroller inside, which clearly strollers aren't always small, in an already small space.   From there everything went smooth, the service was great besides that! Our waitress and bus boys were very prompt, attentive, and made sure to clear the table on time. They also made it a point to continue to check up on us. to  After dining here I will say that is probably not  the best place to take  small kids at dinner time, they do offer lunch though! Sadly it's just not very kid friendly. I did check yelp prior to going and didn't see anything that stuck out about kids. Nittiya's is located off the strip, in Summerlin, where many people have kids, and families.  As far as the food, I can say it was fairly   good! We  ordered a few things off the menu, pot stickers, lettuce wraps, yellow curry with chicken and shrimp, as well as the Thai noddles with basil and chicken. Not many complaints,  I will say that the potstickers were nothing special, they tasted like something you would order at Samurai Sam's. The curry flavor was different for me in pineapple fried rice , but it was still very good, we enjoyed it, as well as the lettuce wraps.  I do think the yellow curry with chicken & shrimp could've  been a bit more tender, it was dry and a little tough for my liking. Maybe it needed a longer simmer, but I'm no chef.  The restaurant is beautiful inside, I felt like we were in Thailand, from the decor all the way to to menu! Oh and there is a bar, you can have dinner there as well! Another plus is the versatile menu, there are so many options!   The food was a 7/10 for me. I would for sure stop in again, just not with my kids. Still height chairs are always helpful for people dining with kids, and I do hope the hostess is friendlier next time!

nJFStis53IlnGQw4kmBSxQ.text: This review is based on the rush hour lunch time. I give them four stars overall. The place was packed so we took the seats at the bar. The empty seats were separated so the hostess took the time to ask other people if they can move down so the empty seats would all be together and we can all sit next to each other. That was very nice of her so we got seated within 2 mins! The customer service was friendly and professional! The food we ordered took less than 10 mins, keep in mind the place was full cause of the lunch rush hour, but we didn't have to wait long for the food! The was food was outstanding! Curry, Shrimp, Lamb... all fantastic! I would love to check this place out on a Sat night and see how they do but I'm confident the service and food will probably be as good or even better!

cYxQfzeoWApSLLEKNa_Shg.text: Went here for dinner with my husband, son and granddaughter for dinner.  Everything was exceptional.   When the plates come out they are so beautifully arranged on the plates. We ordered the lemongrass soup and the soft shell crab which I had not had previously and although they were tasty they were not my favorites and I will not order them again.  Also new to us were the tamarind shrimp, crying tiger steak and the five spices bbq ribs and they all were fantastic. I have never seen my husband pick a rib bone so clean.  t.  For dessert we had the banana chocolate beignet and it did not disappoint.  Whatever you order the spinach salad (whether you like spinach or not) and the crying tiger steak are a must

KttsdwHYKTm1szKJ47k74Q.text: Nice upscale restaurant. Quite and peaceful. Service was great and professional. Glad I found this place. They also have a bar that you can grab a drink (wine) to compliment your dishes. Will continue to go here for Thai food.

1wGcZbihNny3uUg6TkhTig.text: I've had tons of Thai food and this is by far one of my favorite Thai spots!  Started off with a glass of Malbec which was already going to be a good night. Next we had the coconut bouillabaisse which had a nice creamy broth and tons of chunky fresh seafood which I was surprised with. It was delicious.   Papaya salad was next and it had some large shrimps which I appreciated. The tangy sauce is always my favorite but I was expecting a bit more of a lime juice flavor.   Crying tiger wasn't my favorite. The meat texture wasn't the best and it was a both chewy and fatty. I would not recommend getting this.   Chicken Thai wings was delicious. The skin was lightly crispy that it reminded me of crispy duck. The hot sauce paired with it was spicy!   Soft shell crab was full of flavor. Tangy from the lime and fish sauce. Crunchy from the diced apples and the red onions added a nice pickled flavor.   Shishito peppers were phenomenal. Slightly soft and blistered nicely. This dish was prepared simply but yet it was addicting.   Fried spinach who would have thought? It was so deliciously fried that you keep wanting more. I could eat my vegetables like this every day! The dipping sauce was a nice balance to the oily crispy spinach.   Last but not least we had the King noodle with ground chicken. Lots of flavor and sweetness.   Ended the night with the Thai donuts and coconut creme brulee and wasn't disappointed. Every dish here had so much flavor and it's not your typical Thai food. I can't wait to be back and can't thank our friends for sharing this hidden gem with us.

-QjqYnIt3P5nslt550C7TQ.text: I would say Thai food is my second or third favorite food. I've tried most restaurants in town and. I'd say this place stands out and is my new favorite. All the dishes I've tried have been amazing. Will def go back often I love the Kao Soi dish, big change for me as I usually go for Pad Thai. Please try it

G3cpSUTrUYceH0S3oQ9avQ.text: Great restaurant! The service is terrific and the food is excellent. The World Famous Spinach Salad, the garlic ribs, and the pork belly are my favorites. Every time I go they have a different fruit infusion in the water that the servers keep flowing. The hot sake is awesome as well. I will keep going back!

1GdDoKhwea-vlj8kO7aAPg.text: Well, this review isn't on food. It's the terrible service. Tonight my family and I walked in, was seated at a table and completely ignored. I'm not sure because they try to be "fine dining" and they saw a baby & thought, hell naw? All I saw were overpriced Thai food, terrible service & a dark funeral home. The place was so dark, couldn't even see the a-holes that didn't wanna come serve us.   Anyway, should've went to my usual Thai spot. Always great service & you don't have to spend $18 on curry.

gucehtyUSlu2D_ayXq5gWg.text: first time visit....small and quaint place on seats about 30-35..awesome for dating. ahi tuna was special, veggie spring rolls delicious, garlic fried rice oh so tasty. My love had the Bangkok fried rice and said it was good!! This spot was perfect except they need a tad bit of help w customer service. It was empty upon arrival. However, we were admonished for wanting to sit certain places because they were saving tables for "reservations".  Empty restaurant....paying customers on deck....no sit down...waiting for future customers...not cute.  That took away from their potential 5, but we will come back!  Fabulous presentation. So, give it a try for certain!

OBS6a7xIy03P3l5N0VrU_w.text: This place was AMAZING. It's a hole in the wall for sure, very small but the food was so good. I don't think they do any take out or delivery, not that kind of place. Very much a fancy Thai place, maybe even fusion? Either way it was great, but don't expect greasy takeout style food (not that there's anything wrong with that). This is a white linen tablecloth kind of restaurant, without being snooty. Would probably be great for date night too!

rCJwBotKP1hxsfMDMCFJug.text: DELICIOUS! Been here 3 times now...twice for dine in and once for takeout.  To name a few dishes...drunken noodle, volcano shrimp, and fried avocado. Flavors for all were spot on, the tempura batter was perfect.  For the take out we just reheated a little in oven for a few minutes on the avocado and shrimp and it did not ruin the tempura.  We also microwaved the drunken noodle just a little bit and did not spoil the texture of noodles. Just noting here in case you live a little distance and are concerned on reheating. Looking forward to trying some other dishes.  Thank you Nittaya for creating great dishes!! You are a gem!

43w2nEJO-l4z2BI6mgFJAQ.text: We came here for New Years and was not disappointed .. We expected to have to wait since it was a holiday but they were able to seat us right away! The food was delicious and the service wasn't bad either .. The server assistants were very quick to refresh our waters and food came on a timely manner and was very fresh.. Will definitely be back!

QXWLj74rWTbz4T53CzJYPg.text: Lovely staff. I tasted 3 wines before settling on one. Waitress was friendly, patient and informative about the food. Very unusual selections. Corn fritters made with ground pork, tempura spinach, cilantro steak skewers. All fantastic with individual sauces! Our first time but will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar has half-price bottle night on Thursday!

ZbNhlaBAQAVAKvA6CcSX4Q.text: Very unique and tasty dishes! I love that they have tapas! The Tamarind Shrimp was awesome and presentation is great! We also ordered the Drunken Noodles, Beef Jerky, Garlic Spare Ribs and the Bacon Wrapped Shrimp. NOTHING disappointed!
