eB1PEfJa-eeCZxKWq_12uQ.text: The fried avocados and spinach salad are amazing. The service is wonderful as well. I need to come back and try out more of the menu. Highly recommend.

fVgikXEOY_6epUBRtGAZZw.text: INCREDIBLE !!!  The service , the food , the vibe ..  Just perfect for a date night .. If your into real Thai food not watered down versions then this is the place to be .. Thursday 1/2 off wine is a big plus ..  The volcano shrimp are made to perfection crunchy but not oily and the sauce  full of flavor not just spicy .. Oh wait almost forgot the lemon Grass soup the best I've ever had at a restaurant ... Last but not least I Totally recommend the spinach salad .. Now back to my date night with my wife before she kicks my Ars lol . 2 thumbs up and a slap on the ass :)

roFRSmXF45IHq2_E2QcD8Q.text: It took us a year to get here but we finally did and loved our lunch experience. We love the decor and sat in the main room. There is a quieter room in the back which also looked inviting. We ordered two appetizers based on reviews and were not disappointed: the spinach salad and the spare ribs. The spinach tempura salad was perfection with an ideal lime dressing. I would say that it was the best tempura dish I have ever had. The five spice sauce on the ribs was also perfect. Both had excellent after tastes that lingered on. The lunch salad was ample with a wonderful light rice vinegar based dressing. Our main dishes were also delicious and of course, we were too full to eat them all. They tasted great the next day. One was a glass noodle dish with lots of veggies snd the other had flat rice noodles with chicken. Standard fare but very tasty sauces. We cannot wait to return to try other dishes.

uCYlldfWVfizAg65PWkEbw.text: Expensive but really good! Go there for happy hour so you can experience their cuisine without breaking your wallet. Spinach salad is an absolute must.

wwg6BqiJKfZUAKI_ZRN8DA.text: started with the coconut Soup...it is superb! the taste is awesome, then we had Spicy catfish, perfect spice cooked perfectly, the Massaman Curry .. yummy, yummy, yummy, lastly had the eggplant with fresh basil, all dishes were a 5 plus! so great she uses fresh ingredients!! a  delicous welcome to our neighborhood :) very very clean, too! a liitle pricey, but when you share, every dish is worth it ,

8nZMvhSADRslYjM1j0ne5A.text: First me start by saying this place is definitely a 5 star restaurant. The only reason I removed a star was due to the limited menu but I assure you everything on the menu deserves 5 stars. The spinach salad seems to be everyone's favorite and with good reason. I had the pad see ew, fried rice, and spicy basil chicken. This place seems to only use the freshest ingredients and the customer service was excellent. It is indeed a bit pricey but that should be expected from a place that serves only the freshest produce on its menu. The atmosphere was intriguing with the mood lighting being very dim. The comfort was tight but not crowded. I will definitely be returning back because they certainly know how to treat their customers unlike some of the other local businesses in town that I posted negative reviews for.   Make sure you check those reviews out and stay far away from them!

vl1HDkft9AMKv54kHE2ViQ.text: I went to Nittayas Secret Kitchen for tapas and drinks last evening.  It was truly a delightful experience from start to finish.  We were seated immediately upon arrival at the restaurant and were treated with respect by all members of staff.  It was clear that customer service is a huge priority for the employees at this establishment.   In regards to the food, the crab wantons were incredible. They were perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. A great suggestion from our waitress. Also, the Bangkok Fried Rice was an incredible addition as well. It had an excellent combination of savory flavors.    I would highly recommend Nittayas Secret Kitchen and will absolutely be back.

lQFcX_ApHbdkkt2wkcK4qg.text: This place has some of the best Thai food ever.  The restaurant is a little small and can get noisy when full, but the food is totally worth it.  I'd suggest trying all the appetizers so you can get an idea of how good it is.  The fried spinach plate is incredible, if you want a starter, that is the one.  I've tried about 60% of the entire menu and most of it was incredible.  The only dishes that were average were the short ribs and braised beef.  Some of the items come with a spicy sauce, but medium has a nice kick, not too hot.  They have a nice wine selection as well. Enjoy!

NzX_cYepUOde0ClAtx8W3A.text: I love Thai food and I eat it a lot. I love Nittaya's. Service is friendly, food is absolutely amazing, and ambiance is nice and secluded. I would have never expected this place to be located in a Starbucks parking lot. Honestly addicted to their spicy garlic edamame! Love it here! By far my favorite Thai spot.

clhaZHBF7KKxUUlEHC_UVQ.text: Really nice cozy place... The food was delicious and better than a typical Thai place, it felt more upscale and you can taste higher quality ingredients in the food.  The place has wine and beer also.  The service was nice and the waiter was pleasant.  The fruit infused water is a nice touch.  Definitely will be back!

wa4Fw21Ws_eTV0NmmQbOWQ.text: This intimate location has become one of my favorites. The presentation and quality of the food is excellent. The bartender staff could be more personable but the overall environment is good.

u_XhSaunVgFTwEbYZ2vvZw.text: 9 pm at night and I am still taking my time eating you amazing tempura spinach salad that I ordered around 11 am. As I ate lunch in your restaurant today, I noticed that all four tables sitting around me ordered your famous tempura spinach salad - The same one I am taking my time with. I brought the spinach and sauce into the office to share with my engineers. They all loved the taste. Absolutely divine. The curry aroma war unforgettable. The people near me order the salmon after their world famous spinach appetizer. The service was wonderful. Even the water - The simple glass of H2O water had flavor as the waiter told me that the water had been prepared that day with oranges and strawberries. Each day the water is different. Some days the water has fresh cut limes or cut green cucumbers with lemon. You can't take a drink without bringing out flavor. I have to return with my family for the curry dishes with the salmon. We never heard of you. Your restaurant is across town from us, but we were at a shredding event with Councilman Bob Beers this morning at the Veteran's Memorial near Costco and I said, "I have to cover a restaurant review today. Name a great restaurant around here. What do you recommend?" Without hesitation, Councilman Beers asked, "Do you enjoy Thai dishes? Try Nittaya's Secret Kitchen on Rampart and Lake Mead." Your menu was worth the drive. Each bite is inspirational: Spinach prepared with the texture of Japanese tempura but served with a delightful oil and vinegar sauce combining cashews, fresh shredded carrots, green onions rolls, red onions, herbs and oils. Delicious with the shrimp pad thai noodles. After eating, I still had enough to take to the office and eat now for dinner at nine o'clock at night. I wish I lived near Rampart Blvd. After leaving to see the patio dining outside, I went next door to discover the olive oil tasting at Big Horn Olive Oil Company. The bottles of olive oil and vinegar reminded me of the wineries in the Santa Barbara Wine Country. I learned about recipes from owner, Julie Young, and walked out with a gift for my friend's Purim celebration.

ESRwmm6ll7ERUu3eXNn86w.text: All I can say is wow! I agree with the other reviews.  They did everything right the food was great so perfectly on the spot for taste flavor and seasonings. Half price bottles of wine on thursday with a great selection of fine wines.

JoPz7jCCenHgP4puKeD7WA.text: I almost don't want to say how great our dining experience was for fear I will never get a reservation . It's small and a little hard to find but for those who persevere they will be rewarded with great food, great service and flavored that will bring you back time and time again.

eOFPXp8RX_jwHNdvIuSTWA.text: My fiancee, Amy and I have been coming to Nittaya for a long time because the food is outstanding!! However, tonight was even more special because of the absolutely outstanding service we received!! Our server, Zack (sorry if I misspelled) was outstanding!! He was very attentive to our needs and was always there to assist us. We told him at the table and I will say it again here that he is the best server we have ever had at Nittaya. Everyone should DEFINITELY request Zack!!  Also, we definitely have to thank Josh who works behind the bar. Like Zack, he was also very attentive and checked to make sure we were enjoying our wine and our experience. Josh and Zack are both extremely nice and humble guys who really cared to make sure we had an awesome experience!! I have to say that Amy and I visit a lot of restaurants and the service we had tonight is some of the BEST WE HAVE EVER HAD!! Thank you so much to Zack and Josh for a job well done. You both are amazing at what you do! Oh, and I also have to shout out Gus because he did a great job, too!! BRAVO!!!!

xfdylmXcayH071NDTh749w.text: This place is the BEST! I ordered this to go, but I have eaten at the restaurant and it is just as great. We ordered a ton of food tonight including drunken noodles with tofu, fried avocado, spinach salad, ribs, pad thai, edamame, and chicken fried rice. The drunken noodles were for me, usually it comes with chicken but since I don't eat chicken they were able to substitute it with tofu. My other favorite thing from here is the fried avocado. I really can't think of anything I like more than fried avocados. If you were to dine in the restaurant it is a bit nicer than other Thai restaurants I've been to in Las Vegas. It's definitely a great spot for date night or girls night. The restaurant is pretty small, so I would recommend making reservations if you were to go on the weekend. Also, this place is very vegetarian friendly!

ymvPi4CCHmGC2XdbDfYGdg.text: I don't usually leave reviews but the service here is incredible, food was amazing, and it is super nice! Definitely would recommend this place!

DtL-Njr-Q-l-KXLOJuh1Vw.text: One of the best pad thai's in town!! But make sure you call to make a reservation or do take out. They get pretty slammed due to the awesome food wine and service!

-EhqDnX0HfHRRtBn5EIvHQ.text: The Spinach Salad is a must!  I crave it all the time.  The lamb chop is amazing too.  I personally think this Thai restaurant is a lot better than the overrated Lotus of Siam.  Great and friendly service.

sg3XOhHn4zpzDC6VBobOyw.text: Best Thai food I have ever had! I will never go to Archie's again! Service is great and the food is even better. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and it is treated as an upscale restaurant.I highly recommend coming in for lunch because their lunch specials are so much cheaper and they are just as amazing! Even ordering to go is smooth. I highly recoupment the pan fried noodles, the drunken noodles, the spring rolls, and the mango sticky rice!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The drunken noodles are amazing!

amALfZho4p8NJCtYL0cXXA.text: Definitely not cheap but oh so worth it!!! The portions were generous. Really really great thai food! They have an awesome tapas selection of really tasty and unique dishes. Super cool ambiance... a hidden gem in the hustle and bustle. Great service as well. Will return for a special date night with the wife!

ysjhy9AuRONnuUoe4rPVFw.text: My favorite Thai restaurant in town! Great lunch menu! The atmosphere and decor is awesome too

YVdBFJukB_BpnbyCxysuqg.text: This for sure is a hidden gem , food was fantastic  Atmosphere was very nice and love this place and the people who work there are great

uzcobH1gkLHbyjX9jK-fBg.text: This is absolutely hands down the best Thai place in Las Vegas. If you know Vegas you'll know that means something. While the location is in Summerlin and a bit of a drive from the Strip, I promise that it is totally worth the drive.  The decor is chic, contemporary and service impeccable. I come for both lunch and dinner and it's always extraordinary. My favorite things to devour here is a long list but take note you'll want to try every thing.  So here it goes:  Coconut soup, citrus steak salad, papaya salad, shrimp pad Thai, crying tiger steak, drunken noodles, cashew shrimp, catfish, eggplant, FOB rice, the beignets, Thai donuts and creme brulee. I'm sure I missed a ton of other things but trust me when I tell you, you will be back.  LOVE THIS PLACE!

Uzdt5ZjpB4D2vXxohM68rw.text: Very good spinach salad.   Wife thought was very romantic.  Would go again ..  Like the fruit infused water too

FKB4MumhrXcOrh62NrjAGQ.text: I just recently heard about this place and have been here once a week since. The first was with friends who recommended it, the second was with coworkers I recommended it to and the third was to pick up take out for my partner who has not eaten here yet.   I am giving them 5 Stars not only for their delicious and incredibly flavorful food or the great atmosphere but specifically for their impeccable customer service.   Tonight, after coming home and checking my take out order, I realized they had forgotten the dressing for the spinach salad (which I highly recommend). The dressing that comes with this salad is one of the best things on the menu and so I called to let them know it had been forgotten. I explained that it was a 40 minute drive round trip and coming back wasn't possible so this restaurant had one of their servers drive to my home to bring it to me! I have never experienced such a service! Thank you Nittaya's for making sure my order was right and going above and beyond.   The drunken noodles, pad Thai, chicken satay, pineapple fried rice, chicken Panang, Thai donuts and mango sticky rice are all on my list of things you should try!   I'll be returning soon!

YWC5NBv5TgzQIbriP3l2LA.text: This place is delicious!  Great service, nice interiors, very clean. We got the pad Thai, thom kah soup, and pineapple fried rice which was all amazing!

75SqVHwBdqxuMxEu_EMqyw.text: My ABSOLUTE favorite Thai place. This place is so good!!! It's a cute little spot too for like a date night! On weekend nights you should make a reservation because it gets pretty busy.

5MBRtJtBTR3DdNVHllO0kQ.text: Fantastic modern approach to Thai food. Great service, wonderful food (spinach salad, crying tiger, fried pork belly, and the catfish always go over well) and awesome desserts.

oIrIVPi1Py8C304UjQzKRw.text: I can't say enough good things about my recent dinner. As a huge fan of Thai food, I was pleasantly surprised to find a nice mix of familiar favorites and wonderful modern new twists. We had the Spinach Salad (of course!), volcano shrimp, Cashew Shrimp and Chicken Masaman Curry. Every single dish was delightful. The flavors of the cashew shrimp were bright and slightly spicy. The curry was creamy, slightly spicy and rich. An OMG the spinach salad was insanely addicting.  If you are in Summerlin this is a fantastic relaxed date night spot or a great gathering spot with friends. Also, Thursday night is half price bottles of wine and they do have a happy hour from 3-6p, I believe.

hYgsLxWb-aYwBaQMA65zrQ.text: We ate here twice and both times it was excellent. They had no problem converting dishes to our vegan preferences, replacing chicken with tofu in the spinach salad and making things without egg. You definitely want a reservation though. We stopped by on a random day of the week and there was a line out the door and they were unable to serve us.

Reservations are highly recommended because Nittaya's Thai Kitchen is pretty busy (at least it was Friday 7/10)  We ordered Red & White Sangria for starters which I recommend! Delish...  *Siamese Egg Rolls (veggie) $9 were excellent *Garlic Edamame *Chicken Ginger Salad $16 *Calamari  *Shrimp, Jalapeno, Cream Cheese Puff  $80+tip  I look forward to returning in the near future and thank you Pum for you phenomenal service!

AQY6I-MCJa3zr3Vv0ii08w.text: Absolutely love this place, the food is always fantastic and the ambience is great. It's my favorite Thai place in Vegas!

jvq1g5uBfkwpFBaZOH2v3g.text: We love this place.  Food and service are great.  Such a unique fusion of flavors.  We tend to order different things as a group and then share with each other.  There is nothing that we have had that we did not like. We do recommend reservations as it not a secret anymore.

vc6_Qc6JRExgKuALojQYaQ.text: I came here for lunch yesterday with my family upon searching for great Asian restaurants in the Summerlin area. Nittaya's Secret Kitchen was on the top of the Yelp list, so I had to come here and try it myself.   We ordered the spinach salad, coconut seafood curry, fried pork belly, FOB pineapple rice, and shrimp pad Thai. It was one of the most unique Thai food experiences I've had with all the flavor in every bite as well as the dim ambiance of the restaurant.   I loved the music playlist that they had on as well, it was a bunch of pop songs covered in an acoustic style, so that was pleasant to listen to while enjoying my lunch.

w13_Xpt52QhquyXO37vkyg.text: My husband and I came here for a date night on a Saturday around 8. We were greeted immediately and sat within 5-10 mins. This place is very cozy which caught me off guard. The ambiance is very nice, clean, and modern. The wine wall is a nice touch too. When we sat down we were immediately greeted with infused cucumber/apple water, it was soooo refreshing. I think I had like 5 glasses lol. Next we ordered the following: -Siamese (pork) egg rolls -coconut seafood curry  -crab fried rice -panang shrimp curry -chocolate banana beignets Everything was soooo delicious and spiced perfectly I was in pregnant lady heaven. I enjoyed every part of our meal. I wish I can say which dish was my favorite but I really enjoyed them all. My husband doesn't care for curries but he really enjoyed the panang curry from here. Now the service, this place has the best damn service I have ever experienced in my 28 years of life!!!! My glass was never empty, they checked on us throughout the meal, took plates away when we were done with them throughout the whole course and it just wasn't one person. It was everyone who worked there taking care of us. I loved it here! Definitely give it a try I promise you won't be disappointed.

XBR7krnOTb2NSNRf0Xnv1Q.text: Awesome food. It is priced higher than what I always expect but the food is very good.   I love that it's a small neighborhood restaurant with a very nice feel.  Awesome place for Dinner or a relaxing evening.

pNarlt9azDut-uRfGnW_-Q.text: Today I've try salmon avocado curry Its very good tastes so smooth little bit spicy by chili paste feel hot from inside by the neck to stomach but it a good seem like some herbs , Eggplant and zucchini they soft fried make it shining it a little bit detail from chef I guess and it work Perfect presentation smooth taste  give 5 star for this dish!

kDidi41PCAToKU7Oq6jtoA.text: We had the hardest time finding this place. Literally driving up and down Rampart & always ending up in all the other plazas but this one. With the traffic lights and all I think it took about 15 minutes just searching. I don't know why we didn't just use the GPS lol. Nittaya you definitely have a secret kitchen.  Items ordered were:  Curry Puffs- 5/5 Secret Stickers-2.5/5 Steamed Mussels- 3/5 Garlic Edamame-5/5 Fried Pork Belly-3/5 Cashew Chicken-2/5 Lemongrass Soup (chicken)-5/5 Chicken Lettuce Wrap-2/5 Dessert-2/5  Loved the customer service here. They were very quick in taking orders as well as bringing the food out. This restaurant is very clean and I loved the ambiance. Although it felt more like a wine bar with all the wine bottles displayed on the wall instead of a Thai restaurant. I would still recommend this place if you live around the area. It's a cute little restaurant with that perfect romantic lighting and plenty of wine options.

lAvgVidLSejbIU5Qh3cCvw.text: Service was extremely slow despite there being under 20 people here and half empty tables. Our table was hardly visited. When we finally got to order, we ordered Beef Jerky, Fried Avocado, Massaman Curry Chicken, and Lemongrass Soup.  The jerky was so crispy, juicy, flavorful and amazing. We forgot we were angry about waiting so long. The Lemongrass Soup was absolutely delicious. Best soup so far among Thai restaurants in the area. It had all the traditional elements strained out as well, such as bay leaves, galangal root. The Fried Avocado was great. But not memorable. The dip was the best part. The Curry was a clear winner. DELICIOUS. The ambience is great. Very rustic. The menu is perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Avocado

eZ1iWYVKQ1SDGjG6G-FSsg.text: Yummmy in my tummy  Our first time here but definitely not our last.   Service is exceptional, everyone is so nice and helpful. Food came fast. And they just kept filling our water every few mins, never need to wait to ask everyone is everywhere ready to help.   Now the food, WOW so good!!!   Highly recommend coming and trying.  We will be back!

-klFwAXRenQJLOBIWSu30Q.text: I love going to Nittaya's on Thursday for their 1/2 price bottle night! I always get the drunken noodles but I substitute skirt steak instead of ground chicken. My friend got the fried rice and substituted tofu for the meat cause she's vegetarian. We also got the Conquista Argentinian Reserve Malbec to share. Service is good. Bar tender was great. Will go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Malbec conquista
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodles and tofu fried sauce with Malbec

PNRBnqFHrNpysZzuVGIvHA.text: Awesome neighborhood gem. Great appetizers. Had potstickers, chicken satay, short ribs and green curry. All EXCELLENT! Dinner for 3 with a bottle of wine was $95.00 very reasonable for Vegas. Make reservations . It was packed on a Tuesday night. I'll be back when I'm in Vegas. Service was good; not overly fussy. Had the fried banana for dessert.  YUMMY

LawUartAsE4Mvr8dsMfP0w.text: Great food, outstanding service, a bit pricey.  We went on Saturday for lunch and it was a good experience.  We ordered a ton of appetizers and they were all well prepared, tasty, and fresh.  We followed with entrees, which were also excellent.  The service was fantastic, with refills and plates cleared regularly.  They lost their 5th star because they do not have high chairs, that made it difficult with a toddler.  Although small kids may not be their target demographic, having a couple high chairs might be a good idea.  Nice place for Thai food.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Wontons
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crying Tiger Steak
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Larb

Jwt56eEiYXyKR4e_mVCPiA.text: If you're looking for an intimate dinner with a fresh spin on delectable Thai classics, you've hit the jackpot.  Nestled on a corner of a North Summerlin shopping center, this cozy and upscale restaurant serves up specular gourmet Thai dishes.   We've sampled a variety of dishes on our many visits.   They include:  *  Massaman 'yellow' curry * "World Famous Spinach Salad'  *  Green Papaya Salad w/ Shrimp  *  Curry with Chicken  *  Cashew Shrimp  *  Cashew Chicken  *  Fried Avocado  *  Mango Sticky Rice (offered seasonally)   Portions were generous for both lunch and dinner. Prices are very reasonable, especially for the quality, ambience, and presentation of their dishes. We've been delighted with everything we've sampled. On every visit we've experienced a friendly staff with seamless service.  Reservations (especially on the weekend) are highly encouraced.since 'the secret' is out. Hands down, this my favorite Thia restaurant - a True gem, and worth checking out.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Papaya Salad with Shrimp
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining area near entrance - 2018
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table setting - Visiting for lunch October  2018

xPSMBwaWCAaw67JM9Gw1zQ.text: I've had Nittaya's bookmarked for awhile and finally made it in for dinner. The ambiance, food, and service were all top notch.  The inside of the restaurant was really cute and cozy, much nicer than most Thai restaurants. It almost felt like a fancy restaurant.   Our waitress and the rest of the staff were friendly and attentive. We didn't have to wait long for food and someone was by with water frequently.   The Secret Stickers from the impressive tapas menu were delicious. The basil chicken filling was nicely flavored and the dumpling had a nice texture. I liked that they weren't greasy despite being fried.   Shrimp Pad Thai was my favorite of our two entrees. The Pad Thai had an excellent flavor, one of the best I've had recently. The shrimp were large, well cooked, and didn't have tails to make them easy to eat. One difference here from other Thai restaurants was that we weren't asked about spice level and the dish wasn't spicy. We didn't think the flavor needed any tweaking though.   The F-O-B Rice was good and beautifully presented. I think on a future visit I'd skip this and go for a spicy dish though. All of the ingredients in the rice were well prepared with a hint of curry. Most pineapple fried rices I've had are savory with the pineapple adding sweetness, but this dish had an overall sweet flavor. Again, well prepared and would be an excellent choice for someone craving a sweet dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. F-O-B Rice
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Pad Thai
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Secret Stickers

8dts2EhFYTP3i-xT_6VthA.text: Loved everything about this place. Inside was cozy and decorative. The ambiance was nice. Loved the company I was with :-). We ordered the spinach salad, crying tiger steak, shrimp pad Thai, and for dessert we got the ginger creme brulee with white grapefruit hot tea. I didn't feel like drinking wine tonight but I definitely will come back to drink some wine. Everything was so delicious and perfect. Our server did good too. Our water was always refilled without being asked.  The spinach salad was yummy. The sauce was AMAZING. I could just drink the sauce lol. The steak was so tender and cooked perfectly. The pad Thai was delicious as well. They gave us plenty of shrimp which was great. This is definitely my new favorite Thai restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp pad Thai
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert and tea
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Welcome :-)

I7NqYZeN02QeYs7UJU0tog.text: I went in for a quiet lunch at the bar. My waiter James was great. The menu is given to you on a wooden clip board with a bunch of papers. I didn't like the concept it was hard to get a really good look at the menu. The decor had a really homey feel and love their wine board in back of the bar. I ordered the garlic endame and basil chicken entree. The endamne was good but nothing special. I would have liked a little more spices. The basil chicken was awesome! I ordered it mild so it had just a little kick but the sauce was just right. The plum wine was good as well. Also the spinach salad is amazing especially the sauce. It is a must for your appetizers. Overall the experience was great and nice spot for lunch if you want Thai. I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These lamb chops were EVERYTHING! They were perfect
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2JFPWWUM3E36urvdY2lZfQ.text: Wow!!! This place is amazing!  I had asked a friend out to dinner and he informed me to select the location for the evening. I decided to try Nittaya's Secret Kitchen!  I was quite impressed. I arrived at the restaurant at approximately 5:50 P.M on a Friday evening. I didn't realize that you needed to call in advanced for a reservation, especially on a Friday or Saturday evening. The hostess though, was ABSOLUTELY AWESOME! She was able to accommodate us and moved a few tables around to get us in, otherwise, it would have been a hour long wait! She had asked us if we would be done in a hour and a half, which, no problem, we would be :).  We didn't order any appetizers or drinks. The main courses we selected was he Massaman Curry and the Pan Z U Noodle. I typically despise coconut flavor, but the Massaman Curry, which is cooked with Coconut was so good! I would get the dish again! The Pan Z U Noodle was flavorful as well! The first byte I took, just made me feel so happy! You can't go wrong ordering either of those two dishes at this restaurant!   We also ordered a few desserts. I let my friend surprise me. He had ordered the fried banana and the Eggnog Creme Brulee. My friend really enjoys Creme Brulee and the Eggnog was special order since it was still on their menu for the Holidays.   The Eggnog Creme Brulee was... interesting to say the least.. My friend liked it, but I didn't typically care for it. Eggnog is a acquired taste! If you like Eggnog, you'll love the Eggnog Creme Brulee!  The fried banana, my friend enjoyed as well. I didn't like it, just because the batter was deep fried in coconut. I don't like the flavor of dried coconut. If you like coconut, the friend banana is, for sure, for you!  Portion size is large and the price wasn't particularly expensive either for the food.  The ambience in this restaurant is very romantic! Great for a date night or a get together with friends/family! The customer service was out of this world!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U-B-jnv8zVcKW8Gfn_DjGw.text: Sister and I were venturing around the area and we were craving some Thai food. When we first arrived we thought it was going to be more of a take-out place, but right away I checked Yelp again, and under Ambiance, "romantic." So it turns out my sister and I ended up having a sit down, sister date that day.  We tried their pork belly under the tapas section and it did not disappoint. It was crispy and had a really good flavor. Next up where our pad thai and Penang curry. The portions are sizeable so the prices weren't as scary when they plates arrived. The pad thai was great, but I felt like the noodles were too chewy for my taste. Sister loved it though. The Penang curry was also very good, but I wished there was a little more spice/flavor to it.  Overall, I wouldn't mind coming back. The ambiance was great, and the food was pleasant.

-jE1xJzDVpYCUyLPoz0Osg.text: Nittaya's is really a secret Kitchen....it is tucked away in the back of a corner strip mall. There's not much to shout out to you...Dam Good Thai Food ...eat here!!!! But you Should. Nittaya's serves really good, really unique twists on Thai food. In a really nice atmosphere. The six of us ordered a boat load of apps and a few mains. What really stood out: Fried Spinach Salad s3-media4.fl.yelpcdn.com.... Sounds totally weird tastes incredibly awesome. Hints of parmesan. Great dipping sauce. Crunchy flavor. Get it. Bacon wrapped shrimp s3-media2.fl.yelpcdn.com.... Large juicy shrimp wrapped in bacon? C'mon the marriage of both these is fantastic. Salty, porky, crispy, juicy....you can tell I like this one....it's good!!! Thai BBQ chicken wings s3-media2.fl.yelpcdn.com.... Meaty little wings that are cooked to perfection but what really sets them apart (and why I am recommending them)....the Dipping sauce is liquid crack...hot but not too hot, spicy but not too spicy...the flavor comes through and marries well with the wing. Corn Fritters s3-media1.fl.yelpcdn.com... are a great vegetarian option and have the right balance of texture and taste. The dipping sauce is also really good. Five spice spare ribs s3-media2.fl.yelpcdn.com.... Anything five spice ( which is actually I thought a Vietnamese thing) is great but when you take a wonderful piece of meat, rub it with five spice and cook it perfectly ....get it! Actually every dish was good. Service was pleasant but not really personable. Prices are moderate. Good wine and beer list. If you are in this area check out Nittaya's!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped shrimp
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Volcano shrimp
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu pad thai

MF8VT_-Tw02a8ztwLCx_1Q.text: So this was a last minute decision to find a Thai restaurant in the area. I'd do more research if I had the time. We walked into a dark and crammed up place. I think there's another eating area to the right but I'm not sure because it was dark and we were directed to a table by the kitchen entry straight back. Not a single Asian was eating there. This usually tells me that it isn't authentic. On top of that a Thai worker there asked us if we were from out of town or local? Why would you ask that if you seen many Thai's as customers? I felt that they don't see many Thai's which simply mean it's not authentic or good enough for Thai's to eat.   We ordered Pad Thai shrimp, Pad Kee Mao drunken noodle) chicken, Pad See Eew Chicken, Som Tham (Papaya salad), Chicken Satay and Tom Yum Chicken.  Problems: Everything was over salted or bland. We ordered chicken satay, Tom Yum Chicken and papaya salad to go. Papaya salad didn't have the necessary 3 flavors that it's suppose to have. Sweet, salty and sour. Bland as hell. Chicken Satay didn't come with the usual cucumber sauce and peanut sauce. Missing or just wasn't included which would be wrong serving it in the first place. Tom yum didn't have lemon grass or kaffir leaf taste. Bland.   Only thing that was good because any monkey can make is sticky rice. You can have one star for that one. Take heed and correct.

hGLOve5QjowCQIzZw85L-A.text: Absolutely delicious. I've been wanting to try Nittaya's for a while and decided to get it from Postmates. We ordered the spinach, lemon grass soup, garlic edamame, corn fritters, and secret stickers. Seriously- it was alll sooooo good. I can't wait to go in person and will definitely order again.  One thing I did find sad- all of their curry dishes have half and half  hopefully they'll have one with only coconut milk or broth soon.

tmDB_bGNJAfxnELc2aVvQg.text: This is one of my favorite hidden food spots in Vegas. Their happy hour is the best-try a bunch of their delicious little tapas plates and order yourself a sangria! (Must sit at the bar to order happy hour).   As a pad Thai addict, I had to try theirs. Definitely tasty! If you like Thai food this is a must go

IL62boQmR7lwyvdMw-aZ-A.text: We decided to get the heck off of the strip for our last evening meal.  Best decision ever made.  We found Nittaya's based on decent Yelp reviews, hubby's choice, and he hit it out of the ball park again. (so far, all of his out-of-town Yelp food picks have been winners so I suppose I'll keep him around!)  Bulletted thoughts: -Super tiny space, fills up fast, definitely make reservations even if they are last minute.  We did and got two seats at the bar (we're not picky, we're there for the food!) -Great service, even sitting at the bar  We Chose Tapas Plates All Around: -Avocado fries---Yes -Spinach Salad---Hell Yes -Beef Jerky---super salty/umami chewy chunks of beef--do it for something different -Mango Shrimp--Yes  -Coconut Sticky Rice Dessert had some of the freshest, softest most wonderful mango I've ever put in my mouth.  (Probably because I live in Buffalo NY and the only mangoes we ever see are hard-as-a-rock, funky, nasty, bitter things.) Hell-to-the-yes!!!  -A must-eat if you're into Thai.  We will recommend this to anyone traveling to LV who wants a taste of life outside of the strip (read: much more reasonably priced food done by someone whose not a rock-star celebrity chef who likely has no idea what's going on in their corporate kitchen)

BzIFw8mCQnmO62YS6aI5UQ.text: Oh my goodness... So enjoyed everything on this little Thai gem, place is small but very nicely decorated,   Food was amazing I had spinach salad and steak avocado curry for lunch and it's delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado steak curry
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach Salad

y_-aTsiDYkXxKSDrUfvlVA.text: We eat here on a regular basis.  The food is ALWAYS outstanding.  The service is ALWAYS outstanding.  The wine is great as is the ambiance.  These are all the reasons why we are regulars. Some highlights:  the tempura spinach salad is a must!  The green curry salmon or steak is amazing and not something you'll find anywhere. Glass noodle salad is great.  All the rice dishes are very good. Lamb chops are to die for!  Basil chicken is another great dish. Too many to list. The only disappointment is that Nittaya does not come out of the kitchen. We've been coming here for years and we don't know her. Otherwise amazing place. Need a reservation in advance, especially on a Thursday, Friday or Saturday.

ueAosF5voZK6tcKSi3b31A.text: Absolutely loved everything!!! There was not one dish that we got that was not delicious. And, the Secret Sangria was excellent, and obviously a favorite because I had four. Definitely a MUST if you're looking for an out-of-the-way spot, with an intimate setting. Perfect for a date. It was date night with my husband, and Nittaya's was totally his idea. I was so pleased with his selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Secret Sangria

i14eKozMp72hrzLr0b8z7w.text: Epic!!! Tapas are incredible! I love them all! Spinach Salad is a must order. I think the Massaman Curry is the best Curry I have ever had. Also love the Green Steak Curry Avocado!  Everything is Incredible! I would fly from Roseville just to go to this restaurant. Best Ever!

wONyzWsW5CzjwazOB08S5A.text: What ever you do you must order the spinach salad!!! Thank goodness my mom lives down the street... I always have reason to visit this gem. One of the best Thai restaurants I have eaten at. Don't expect to leave with a left over bag, you will probably eat everything on your plate since the portions are just right.

iPpXmwItKfSnrgoJGTVNgA.text: Super cute place. Have lived in this neighborhood my whole life and wish I found it sooner. Very intimate. Would love to come back and do a date night on Thursday when wine bottles are half off. Kinda pricey other than that no complaints. Had the drunken noodles soo good!

aTRFs_DuDCQ01hh3uS3lSQ.text: My favorite Thai food restaurant has always been Kung Fu Thai, but now I have another favorite! I love their Angel Wings and their Pad Thai was cooked perfectly. Not too sweet and saucy, just right. They have a great lunch special variety for just $11. My boyfriend ordered green curry and that was good too. Can't wait to come back for dinner. I want to try the Avocado Steak Curry and the creme brulee trio!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai lunch special portion is huge. Just $11.
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Chicken Curry lunch special for only $11.
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Angel Wings

k2eD1wvmYlobi3-6WtQs5A.text: Between 4 and 5 stars.  Everything was so spicy.  Great flavors.  Especially loved the fried avocado! yum yum yum.  I believe the owner was taking care of us and she was super friendly and had great suggestions for a Thai novice such as myself.    Wine was half-priced on Thursdays and we took full advantage of this :) We stayed for hours, drinking and munching on the appetizers we split.  This is a small restaurant and it was packed.  There are apparently a lot of people in Summerlin who love this place and for good reason: It was delicious.  Beautiful lighting too.  Don't let the strip mall location fool you.  Great for a date spot or happy hour with the girls.

240SwU_6qDEtcmp5NFPrAg.text: Definitely NOT ever going back! We ordered the basil chicken pot stickers because our waiter recommended them, but they were awful!  The basil is totally over powering and they are fried!  NOT good at all. Then we order the fried rice and since we don't like egg we asked for it without egg. The rice was completely mushy and flavorless!  We sent it back and ordered the chicken Pad Thai (which is actually really good). When we got the bill we were told that since we "modified" the fried rice it would not be comped and we would have to pay for it! Because apparently no egg = no flavor ?!? Also the waiter was not nice about any of it. Not happy at all and will not be returning!

EtX_vM99QpGrc7vxJzzDlQ.text: The food was absolutely amazing and so delicious. Service was great. Food came out quick and hot. The coconut shrimp soup is a must. Highly recommend this place. The place is also decorated nicely and feels very homey.

C7zjk20TXMSHI_O8NXOADQ.text: Food was very tasty. We started with the tempura battered spinach that was served with a side of wonderful citrusy dressing. Delicious and a must have. I ordered the massaman curry, which was outstanding. They list it as a spicy dish, however I don't think that is was spicy at all. The flavor was amazing though, didn't miss the heat at all. My husband had a salad with beef, the name escapes me, that was good.  The water is infused with strawberry and I want to say rose. Loved it.  I wish the restaurant was a little more child friendly. My little one needs to be able to sit up in a highchair, which are not offered.

CPDXnTFg43cv3X7LIxDvOw.text: The food was very good as was the service. I enjoyed the tamarind shrimp for an appetizer (although I would have loved if it was served with a small salad or garnish of rice or vegetables). I also had the pad see ew, which was very tasty and hot when it came out. The only downside was it got cold before I could finish it because it was on a plate. It wasn't as good cold. The service was also very good.

asm3CzvBEWDt9DSOs42_OQ.text: Good food, service was okay. I like the ambience but the space was too crowded. Hence, will still come back to try other stuff!

c0JzScT9HToiJ92k6ST18w.text: The food here was incredible.  We ordered the Phuket Poppers, Duck Breast Curry, and shrimp curry.  It was all fantastic.  My reason for rating 3 stars is due to the robotic and unfriendly service.  Wasn't even asked "How is your day" or anything to that effect.  All the employees basically just were trying to get the job done.  Part of the reason why, us as customers, come to places like this is the ambiance and the environment.  It was just a buzz kill.

MktaKXvddopHOUMP3nzMIg.text: Food is good. Authentic Thai food, freshly cooked as you order them. I love their spinach salad. The place is a little small and cramped, so you might as well make a reservation if you're going in a group. Price is reasonable as the food are freshly prepared.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of my favorites. Spinach salad, only served here.

GnU2L5cqeqX1h4OjycLCfA.text: The fried spinach is heaven! I thought I've had good fried spinach before, but not even close.. Hands down, a must-try! Service was great as well, I wish I remembered his name but he was the bartender as well. Awesome guy with random useful facts!

fj3AnyubfS2TjsTg0vYAbQ.text: Food is delicious as always but waited one hour 23 minutes to get our food. When we inquired at an hour and fifteen they said the chef said it's coming. Acted like it was no big deal. An off-hand apology that wasn't convincing. For the price wen paid for dinner I expect more!  Very disappointed tonight. Can't decide if it's worth coming back.

clb8oe8e6o4OJW5lkP4uVw.text: This place was fantastic. Everything we had was prepared with great flavor, and presentation. The service was on top if its game too. I suggest trying everything especially their dessert. I love pad thai, and this place made a wonderful pad thai too. Will defiantly be back again.

GFl5qjKXJfN-4c8vfgRcRw.text: Our first visit was on a weekend. It was good. Food was tasty and server (female) was attentive. On the second time, we went there on a Thursday. The restaurant was quite full. We waited to be seated, but servers went by without a word. 5 minutes later a bus boy finally acknowledged our presence and said he would seat us. Another 3 minutes went by and we were still standing there. We left, and we would not return to a place that could not provide the most basic service.

1p6QEMQxH9lfzYu255oQkA.text: This place is pretty amazing.  So far I have ordered from it twice (to go) and eaten at it once. I'm hoping to eat at it again (hint hint :-)) I absolutely love the spinach salad which to me is more like spinach tempura.  I also love the Tofu Masamam Curry - I am not a big tofu person but my sister is and so I reluctantly tried this.  SO good! I have tried the Green Curry with Shrimp but it was too spicey for me (regardless I ate it but my mouth burned).  Their prices are a bit high but definitely worth it and I tend to be kind of frugal when I order food - but hey - this place is worth it.  Friendly enough staff (whenever I ordered my to gos, I chatted with the bartender) and pretty ambience - didn't take pics but it has a nice cozy feeling inside.   There is a main room with a bar then another room behind it that is bigger.  There is also wonderful art work around the restaurant by a local artist who's named I forgot (sorry) but he does beautiful and bright abstract paintings. Outdoor seating is available when the weather is nice - keep in mind that Nittaya's is in the middle of a parking lot but Nittaya's does a good job of having beautiful outdoor furniture with high surrounding bushes to distract you from that not too far places like Bank of America :-)

haSiRFGVA6MshBG8F8FAwQ.text: Had dinner at the bar. Although it took longer than expected to receive service, it was worth it. Great menu selection and friendly staff. Food was excellent. Look forward to going back as the menu has many great options.

NxmFZenFqUet-liJwXEDyw.text: This place is a hidden gem! Everything is so fresh and the flavors are unique with each bite. I would recommend the lettuce wraps and the Siamese egg rolls. Also , the island potato bites. The sauces are so flavorful that  they give you to dip your food in. The tapas are huge portions and over filled , which is great!  I saved room for the banana and chocolate crepe dessert..yes, it was yum..

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato pork
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lettuce wraps

AxiG2I7GguqNB99O3UWdng.text: This place is dope af.  Im stuck on the avocado skirt steak curry, that gets the 5 stars all on its own. The crying tiger app was great also.  Have had the bacon wrapped shrimp, chili lime squid (?) and pork belly. Those were good but nothing crazy.  Try the first two dishes i mentioned and youll be set.  Reservations for dinner time, small place.

unSCA3wsfzW74OfdTsiiQw.text: Very impressive food. A must for any Summerlin visitors craving Thai! Kai Soi was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Volcano Shrimp.Appetizer

YeNWVzhLNIhDybh_68gPDA.text: The restaurant serves very small portions when it comes to the soups they have. The waiter said that it would feed two people and when my wife filled her small bowl up it was all gone. As far as the main course is concerned, mine was way too salty. The feel of the restaurant is nice in the inside, I just wish that they would have Windows that you can see out of. The whole thing is enclosed.

a4iq388iLbrD3Kke3IzDPA.text: Always crave the spinach salad. Finally tried the garlic rice minus the cilantro.  Nice wine variety. This is my new favorite and must have this at least once a week:)   This is my 4th time here and finally ordered dessert! Fried banana and coconut ice cream WITH caramel rum sauce. Now, the coffee served French press style! 4 stars, place is a bit tight.

H_wq2h7j9IGUwIwZypoxNQ.text: Great place! We come here frequently, it's pretty much our go to in mid/north Vegas. The service can be slow if they are min manned but generally it's great. I recommend calling on weekends to see if there is a wait, weekdays are best. Also get the spinach salad and tapas! All are absolutely excellent! The currys and entres are great too!

D7R9hQfXpCiLOsFRNo-fGw.text: Spectacular Thai food. It definitely beats the hell out of Lotus of Siam. And the wine selection is superb too, specifically the Pinot Grigio by the glass. The Panang Shrimp dish was super. Ordered it at five, which is their spiciest level, and Nittaya certainly delivered. The chicken satay was excellent too. Great Thai food in Summerlin is always fantastic to find.  Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can&#39;t say enough about the Panang  Shrimp!
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nittaya&#39;s chicken satay is superb.

kl5XE2gPuqnlSrfQJ53Ggg.text: Fast and friendly service. Get the friend spinach (it's like spinach tempura). You dip it in this tangy vinegary dip that has cashews, ground chicken, green onions...it's magical just order it.   The drunken noodles are a must also. Perfect every time.  Consistently delicious. Nice atmosphere. My family and I love it.

3IobFQFTSywDd_TuTf1LCQ.text: I eat there all the time food is very good ... this time I decided to order to pick up .. got home the food looks horrible, dressing to the salad is definitely reused looks like a threw up . I called them and the manager was so rude and hung up on me .... I would never recommend this place to anyone that

TKhlt0jPUhJt10jgEKdWXg.text: Nittayas is by far the nicest, classiest...and most expensive Thai food restaurant I've visited!  I'm pretty sure this was the first time I've ever been asked if I had a reservation...for lunch...for Thai food lol.  And it was the only time I've ever felt self conscience for my 2 year old Little Foodie Dude eating with me during lunch!  It is very chic, glamorous and date night appropriate! Service was great as well...and food was outstanding...but you'll pay for it!  Coming here during lunch is a great deal! They have $11 lunch specials (yes, expensive compared to others around $5-7 range) but they are packed with flavor and use quality ingredients...you really can taste the difference! The lunch specials also come with a house salad and pot sticker which were both pretty good.  Portions are decent as well, so you should leave satisfied :)  I went with my standard Drunken Noodles aka Pad Kee Mao. This was an excellent rendition, with lots of flavor even with chicken instead of pork! I love chinese broccoli, so I was excited to see it in the dish! I asked for it extremely spicy though, and what I got was a 1/10 on my scale...I should have sent it back, but it was soo good even without the spice!   Also tried their version of Pad Thai. Surprisingly, this was more spicy than the request for 10/10! I really liked their version of this dish, and is probably the best Pad Thai I've ran into so far, although I don't often order this dish.  But what if you don't come here during lunch? Expect to pay $16 for drunken noodles ala carte. They had $15 desserts on the menu. Yes, there are some cheaper alternatives, but I don't even remember seeing $15 desserts in some of the best steakhouses in town!  But you need to check this place out if you are a Thai food lover...just go during lunch IMO!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary Sangria with Yelp Check in! This was yummy and was actually a little strong!
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai with Chicken, Bean Sprouts, Egg, Chive, and Crushed Peanuts. This was very good, slightly spicy actually
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potsticker, part of the Lunch Special. Yummy!

bwCdeouTqaR7SiOQb8daeQ.text: Absolutely phenomenal! Excellent customer service and food quality. Tried the lightly battered spinach appetizer and lemongrass soup. Excellent! Will definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas.

08sQkFPr0mSYkmQjcPktfQ.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat at!  I have loved all of the dishes I have tried and their red sangria is amazing!  Not too sweet and just perfect.  I would recommend to anyone that likes Thai food!

IQgZnLche78ri8SHJ2lGSg.text: Why haven't we come here sooner? This is the best restaurant we have been to since moving to Las Vegas. We ordered a bunch of small plates and soups. Everything was fantastic! We will be back!

ci4jW9zBluYTN_0U8EY1Jw.text: My go-to place to take friends. The spinach salad is fabulous. The curries are super tasty. The Thai basil chicken is defaulted to hot, so make sure to give a rating on the spice level. The lava shrimp are a must have. They renovated and expanded a few months ago. Love this place!

xk5QoX7aPYZ9u6tBNPbWRQ.text: I love the spinach salad it's amazing!! The drunken noodles were awesome too. I ordered a 5 heat level didn't really feel like it was that hot but I know I tend to eat spicier than most people.

LpIRy21Xx4_9dHu4hjTbVw.text: I had been wanting to come to this restaurant since I moved to Vegas. I finally got to have dinner here last night, and it exceeded my expectations. Hands down the BEST Thai food in Vegas that I have tried. The restaurant is small, and cozy, nice ambiance, beautiful lounge music playing in the background tied everything together. The food was delicious, our service was great (our server, her name was boy, she was fantastic) and I will def be coming back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Family style coconut ice cream was made to perfection! Will come back just for this!

MK0j7tnFK_dAPnPsGcab2w.text: Everything  I read about the place was True, small, intimate,  beautiful artwork, just fun. The food all was so delicious except the sa uce that went withe Ribeye too salty.  Other than that Awesome I will go again & again till I have tried everything! Thank you for a great time guys!

Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Fried Rice
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye Steak

7nVHM0x4Qz-8m-BnSRolmw.text: This little place is beautiful, with just the right lighting to make it a special romantic hideaway. That also makes it a little difficult to read the price-gouging wine list, where a glass of Riesling goes for $12 for one brand and $10 for another. I think Nittaya has lost sight of the fact that this is a neighborhood restaurant nowhere the Strip.   The waitress, whose English made her nearly impossible to understand, did a good high-pressure job of pushing the Tempura Spinach Salad appetizer, and we were glad she did. It was outstanding, though it's now $11, not the $9 previously reported.  Our party of four also ordered the Fried Avocado  appetizer and the Shrimp Patties, but the waitress brought the wrong shrimp appetizer, saying they had similar names.  She changed it cheerily.  The avocado was very good, but the shrimp patties were ordinary and greasy.   For our main course, my husband and I shared a Chicken Musaman Curry, served with a side of jasmine rice. This was the only dish that didn't have an elegant presentation. It was good - not the best, but certainly not the worst Musaman I've had - but could have benefited from less sauce and more chicken. They didn't offer it with beef, which I like better.   The other couple had much bigger appetites, ordering Salmon in an Avocado Curry, a Crab Fried Rice, and Catfish in an unidentifiable reddish sauce. She liked her salmon, he hated his catfish, and the fried rice was lukewarm.   With visions of Yogurtland dancing in our heads, we bypassed dessert here.   If we were to return, we'd probably order just from the appetizer/tapas menu. But then again, almost everything on that menu is either fried, stuffed with cream cheese, or both. We'd probably be best off leaving that kind of food for the younger set.

y7q_wsvqkhH8PEoERRTLVg.text: Food is amazing. Atmosphere is amazing. Customer service is amazing 5 stars all the way... best pad Thai in Las Vegas... the ahi appetizers are to die for

O7Te-9S2vBAr8MhxeEDfKw.text: More than excellent......superb! The salad was a pleasant surprise and the veggie pot sticker a real bonus! Can't wait to return .....

XwefExbOZvJl1FdE0imA5g.text: A Thai friend and I decided to try this joint out since it received such good reviews.  We went at around 5 pm expecting the dinner crowd but to our surprise there were only 7 people total in this place.    This place is so small that the person sitting the farthest away can hear your conversation.  If you have any form of Claustrophobia, please stay away.  The decor is very dark, but suitable for a wine/beer bar.   This may be considered "hole in the wall", but its nothing close to that description.  Its located at Rampart & Lake Mead which has huge plazas at all four corners and a lot of traffic.  The wait staff was 2 young White males who had the attitudes of, "what time is it, and when can I go home?"  But what can u expect from kids who have no idea what customer service is about.  The other was a young Asian female who took our order.  She was very nice, but the language barrier came into play when asking questions.  The Food:  We had to try this "famous" spinach salad.  Ummm people, its fried battered spinach with a salsa sauce that tastes like the dressing for papaya salad.  Only in 'Merica can we take something healthy and ruin it.  Think of potato chips and dip people, there is no "Salad".     My entree was Green Curry, vegan.  I asked for more veggies since im not eating any expensive animal protein.  That was not the case or (language barrier).  It tasted like plastic and was basically a bowl of bamboo shoots.  There was only 7 little pieces of bell pepper in it.  Why am I paying 15$ for this again?  When I asked the waitress about it, she got very defensive/annoyed, and did not even try to see my point of view.  I also chose brown rice (which is an extra charge) but it was too mushy. (Used too much water cooking it).    My friend's entree was pad-Z-U, vegan, which was just as bad.  Swamped in oil even after asking to use smallest amount of oil.  Very little veggies that had no flavor.  it was also too spicy for her, but then again they never asked.  They never asked us how spicy we wanted the dishes...wow seriously?  THEY ARE NOT VEGAN FRIENDLY!  We did find out Nittaya's Secret though!  Its called charging a fortune for low quality bastardized Thai food...and then retire and laugh at all you suckers!  The prices are just silly...I dont mind paying 15$ for green Curry if everything is organic, but for a small bowl of spicy plastic, no thanks.  I just wanna know why am I paying this price?  Oh the "Tapas" ripoff idea....yeah so their tapas (very small) portions are the same price as a normal size entree from any other asian foodie place.  There is no reason to pay these prices.  WARNING: Although we voiced our concerns to the waitress and we only ate a few bites of each item, they never offered to to remove them from the bill (other than the mushy brown rice) which tells me they are all about the dollar.  They just don't seem to care  Most other Thai takeout is way better than this place.  Quality of food, service, and price.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The worst Green Curry ever, tasted like plastic, bowl of bamboo shoots.  This garbage is $15...seriously stop ripping people off
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The worst Green Curry ever.  All bamboo shoots and a few little pieces of bell pepper. Tasted like plastic

kjKKNZfYE5ImcJ4MZhBvDw.text: I came here for dinner solo and enjoyed myself quite a bit (I am good company!) The garlic rice was delicious. Very very tasty. I would absolutely get that again. Very flavorful, and the rice was cooked perfectly. I also ordered the steak skewers. Eh, wasn't super impressed with them. The flavor was Ok, but I guess it was the cut of beef they used.  Service was excellent. Menu seemed a touch pricey however, l will return to try some other stuff again.

yuqdMsq9XrJmubdHMApTUA.text: Everything we ordered was outstanding. The service was great as well. I'm not from Vegas but this restaurant will be on my list of favorites when I return.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Gh9QuZrv0UuqONjaccAW8A.text: Amazing, love this place, one of the best restaurants in vegas,  Try the salmon curry, delicious! !!

UfBhBn1A6-VdBc0RXPIsvw.text: Amazing food! Wonderful, attentive staff. I tried the pad Thai and drunken noodles, both were spectacular.

_cve_WZFl1UdZyNM36Xriw.text: I unexpectedly found this place on yelp, I didn't know what to expect but I was optimistic. As I entered it was a quaint and cozy place. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. I ordered the tempora style spinach, ( not sure of the name) but it was absolutely amazing, crisp and delicious the sauce was to die for. I also ordered the basil rice and the Mah Thai rice which was also delicious. It's seldom I give anyplace top billing, but if you like great service, delicious food at a reasonable price... this is your place. Bon appetite!!!!

-uP2uUIVkKh5M3ttFfT-Hg.text: Nattaya's never fails to be amazing.  Simply put, this is the best Thai food in Las Vegas!  My favorites are the spinach salad, crying tiger steak, avocado salmon.... and there is a special "off-menu" item that is made with clear noodles which may be the best thing at the entire restaurant.  Also, the soups and salads are amazing - particularly the lemongrass chicken soup.  Thursday's evenings are a bonus since wine bottles are 50% off! And I'm not sure how below reviews say service is not outstanding; I've always received top-notch service at Nattaya's.

1GRGAq4in7nllkJXF67XHA.text: If you are looking for an intimate setting for a  date night with your significant over or just a fun girls night out on Thursdays for half price wine night and LOVE Thai food, this is the place.  I've heard nothing but fabulous reviews about this little restaurant, and Nittayas did not disappoint. They offer an array of tapas and thai entrees. The Ahi tuna was fresh and melt in your mouth delicious. The soft shell crab and green apple salad was refreshing and a new dish for me, but I loved it. I also had to try the fried avocado which left me wanting more with its creamy, crunchy texture. By the tune my spicy basil eggplant entree came out I was stuffed and only able to eat a few incredible bites before throwing in the towel.  I cannot wait to go back to this little gem. Oh and did I mention their staff is delightful?!
