Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried avocado

uEtsIuWQL_mI2VChxKhBbQ.text: Was in Vegas for a conference and it had been a long day - 6 hour flight followed by a drive to Death Valley. On the way from Death Valley to my hotel, I called the the restaurant around 9:15pm and they said to come on down, even though they close at 10pm.    First, the excellent customer service - I got there at around 9:35pm, but they were very welcoming and not for a moment did I feel that they were in a hurry for me to leave. Very nice!  I ordered a green chicken curry but with extra vegetables - they were happy to oblige. The vegetables were actually the star of the show - perfectly cooked, for each type of vegetable they put in - perfect balance of firm and tender.  And they did not skimp  on the quantity or variety   - mushrooms, green beans, carrots, broccoli, egg plant.    The curry itself was of just the right  consistency-  not too thick and not watery, with just the right amount of heat and deep, complex flavor.  Just to note, the quantities are very generous- enough for two.     Finally, I ordered the donuts which had just right amount of sweet to end the day.    Highly recommended and well worth the money.

hEMg6ebW-a0PGlIzNWXCmA.text: I like to start off with the coconut shrimp or the crab wontons! my favorite dishes are the green/red curry, pad z ew, the slow braised pork noodle dish, and the eggplant shrimp!!!!!!!!!! seriously soon soon good. A little pricey compared to other places but super clean and authentic. I spent a couple months in Thailand and have to say this is pretty dang close!!!!

xhV4Fl4nu8pwRznj6E226A.text: Fabulous first experience!   Wine is quite pricey.   Tofu lettuce cups are yum!  Service is friendly and fast.  MUST TRY: "World Famous" spinach salad --- tempura spinach?!  YESSSSS!  Love this place. I will be back! I will be bringing friends!

jWZ8yGXlbijoubKYjlJKkA.text: Delicious and fresh Thai food! The fried spinach salad is a speciality of the house-- it is very unique and delicious! Highly recommend the chicken lettuce wraps and Bangkok fried rice as well

E6e3RND775wKuEb-NV90dg.text: The absolutely best food and customer service! The mix of fusion foods and flavors are incredible... make a reservation, seating is limited. This is a hidden gem

vy-azQiUE4QX5ZwGdZr1_A.text: Be careful! Yelp says this is a 2 $$ restuarant, but its a 3 $$$!! Food was delicious, but my family had to share entrees because it was so expensive.

HCRKhVSAbdOFrCI9lKyaRQ.text: It's my favorite restaurant in Vegas, it is a True hidden gem.  If you like great food and a great staff go here.  Their happy hour is super inexpensive but it doesn't matter what time you go the food is always going to keep you coming back. Highlights of the menu: "beef jerky", served with a side sauce that is to die for, spiced edamame. no idea what all is in the seasoning but it will make your mouth happy, spinach salad is great, it's all over reviews but it's the dressing that makes the dish, you could put it on anything.  The staff is pretty fun, Lea is our favorite but everybody is super helpful and good spirited. One more note, this is an all events restaurant, date night, yes, family dinners, yes, dining with friends yes.  There isn't an event that wouldn't work here.  Call ahead for a large party would be the only tip.

SCoGPn6y7iI3dCJrurEIxA.text: Great food and at a reasonable price.  Pretty amazing, considering the atmosphere is so fancy.

xPygyw4A7i_duuYJHuPgow.text: This place is AMAZING!!! The food is out of this world! Every dish is bursting with flavor and the presentation is awesome! I love how small and quaint the restaurant is! I love the ambiance! The staff is very friendly! This place is definitely a hidden gem here in Las Vegas! Must try the Famous Spinach Salad!! I love the sangria! This was my third time here and it was just as amazing as the first time! I can't wait to go back!

e50HNsyA42HbamKogQ7wmw.text: Great hidden spot.  They have an excellent happy hour also. The mussels are absolutely delicious.  Pretty great wine selection also

vifdXprTEydD6zaOZr6QAQ.text: THEY DIDN'T HONOR MY YELP DEAL-BOO  My girlfriend Jesse and I stopped by Saturday night just for a cocktail.   We ended up ordering the signature spinach leaves appetizer and some red curry shrimp. Spinach was greasy and shrimp was too spicy.  Service at the bar was very formal and attentive but the restaurant was quiet and everyone was on a date night.  So we probably didn't pick the best place to come and have a girl's night.   When we were waiting for the check I decided to "check in" on Yelp.  I usually check in after I leave a place and I noticed there was a Yelp Deal.   One free glass of Sangria with check in woo-hoo! Right?  WRONG!  Mr. Four-Seasons Bartender suddenly turned Motel 6 and wouldn't honor it.  (He's the blonde guy with glasses) He said I should have told him that when we first got there. Huh? Just for that, I won't be back.  UNACCEPTABLE!

rx_VQ11NkmWF2CBm4g0tZg.text: I tried this place recently and loved it.  I went there with a group of friends and We usually just go to the same chain restaurants over and over so we decided to try something new.    We were very pleasantly surprised with this restaurant.  We split several dishes, like Tapas.  The food is amazing.  Each dish was unique and we enjoyed trying a number of different dishes.  The prices were also reasonable. We will definitely be back.  Tip: make a reservation.  The restaurant is small and popular, so it fills up quickly.

OjRNBrVWqJyxIY_pANO3_w.text: I've been to many Thai places in Vegas and this is by far the best. From appetizers to main course and desserts all have been exceptional. Clean and classy as well as more seating room then traditional Thai restaurants. Great wine and bottle specials. Plum wine is inexpensive and sweet great starter drink. And their infused water is so very refreshing on these hot vegas days! Nothing bad to say five stars all the way!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Coconut Curry. Mmmmmmmmmmmyummy

qfy0priXH7ZODh0gkdefCg.text: 4 stars only because I'm not sure if I would go out of my way to go back. The restaurant is very cozy and clean. Service and food was good especially the spinach tempura salad! I'm glad I tried it and it was definitely worth it so now I can move on. The other dishes were pretty much typical in flavor of any other good Thai restaurant.

d18I2lJyO1phhwEWvUVK5A.text: Food was not fresh, over seasoned, loaded with salt and with MSG, not authentic Thai food. This is American Thai restaurant. Look around you don't see Thai people eating here.  We ordered drunken noodle and cashew chicken. Cashew chicken does not even taste like cashew chicken. Not even a cashew in sight.  Flavors were off and had to ask waiter where was the cashew in the cashew chicken. Ask why cashew chicken does not taste like cashew chicken. Waiter said this is how cashew chicken taste like here. Major dehydration afterwards. Prepare to drink lots of water.  Ask waiter how much it was to substitute shrimp for chicken.  He said 2 to 3 dollars. End up paying more than three dollars to substitute the meat. Asked him why it was over three dollars( despite asking him in advance )he said it could be anything.   I guess you should have him write it down on paper before substituting any type of meat here. They will charge you whatever they feel like. Don't come here if you don't want to get rip off for unauthentic Thai food and overpay.

_93GUuhVR9u0DC9KFg7lRQ.text: The Thai food here was nothing special and I expected more for the inflated prices. I stuck with the two dishes I normally order when first trying out a Thai restaurant which is pad Thai and yellow curry. The pad Thai was solid but like most Thai restaurants the chicken was chewy and dry. I wanted a yellow curry but did not see it listed on the menu so I asked the gentleman serving us. He said the yellow curry is the Massaman curry. I have been to ample Thai restaurants and have never had a Massaman curry that is yellow in color. Another thing I did not understand is why brown rice substituted for white rice that comes with an entree is the same price as a side of brown rice. This policy does not make sense and the quality and taste of the food I have tried does not warrant the high prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pad thai
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Massaman chicken curry

31S-0JErDm0GCUXG1pIsvg.text: I can't believe I have lived nearby for years and just tried this restaurant.  My wife and I came in for a late lunch and upon first impression of the interior of the place was it was tidy, quaint and pleasantly decorated.  The soft lighting brings you into an atmosphere private dining.  Many things sounded good to me but my wife is a vegetarian so she stayed away from the dishes that included meat.  I nearly ordered the FOB Rice (Fresh Off the Boat pineapple rice) - which after speaking to someone about the place later found out is awesome, but I decided to try the chicken satay and the cilantro beef skewers.  The Chicken Satay was very good while the beef as good, but nothing to write home about.   My wife had a spinach salad that had tempura battered spinach and a citrus/cashew dressing sauce on the side.  I should point out that this dish normally comes with chicken but they told her she could elect to have it with tofu instead or without either entirely (which she elected).  I tried it and it was very interesting and tasty.    We also ordered Garlic Edamame which was fantastic.  It had a great garlic flavor and they put in Serrano peppers as well in there which is a twist we had not tried before.  That waters served were infused with flower and strawberry very lightly- which gave it a hint of flavor and I had also ordered a Tropical Iced Tea which was great.  Overall, a very pleasant dining experience for about $20 for each of us.  I am definitely coming back.

Ms_qikTFkCdNluuDZbShrg.text: The service was exceptional.  The food was okay, nothing special. It is pricey. Good decor and ambiance.  We had the lunch specials which came with a vegetarian dumpling and small salad with house dressing. Both were good.  Our Lunch Specials:  Drunken Noodle, chicken: Good Pineapple fried rice, chicken: Good Cashew Chicken: Below average

BQNrFVbUlLKWqy3IeuKwVQ.text: Surprisingly very good food in a casual but almost upscale atmosphere. The food was plated nicely and brought out super hot (temperature), which I really appreciate.  I'm giving it 5 stars because the extra service I got. I forgot my credit card and called from the airport on the way back home to CA. They agreed to put it in the mail for me the next morning, which saves me the hassle of requesting a new corporate credit card. Thank you!

cxp8hxwwc9XFZyDX1NUF9Q.text: This is a hidden gem in this town,  ten tables,  elegant and romantic atmosphere,  amazing food  great service.  This is one of our favorite go to spots. , me and my daughter had date night tonight and we had their signature spinach salad and it is literally one my favorite dishes,  I can't come here ever without ordering it,  you must try!!!!!!  We also ordered the shrimp padding Thai was amazing and the mango sticky rice for dessert, wow now that's what a mango should taste like,  warm,  sweet,  tender served with sweet sticky rice  yum!!! I have tried Alot of the dishes on menu  drunken noodles,  garlic spare ribs,  the curry   you really just can't go wrong here,  you will add this place to your favorites too!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango sticky rice

4J4f99pQ59u7Z40vIh-F8g.text: Wasn't really a fan of their food. The actual restaurant is cute but that's it. We went for lunch and I wasn't impressed. I ordered my soup spicy and it was so mild my baby ate it. My husband ordered the pad Thai and it seemed watered down. We will not be returning.

KWO_GdXfbMXWrw4-QhWnzA.text: The food here is AMAZING.  Haven't tried anything on the menu I didn't love.  Tiny but very pretty restaurant so I recommend getting a reservation.  But this place is all about the food.  Love, love, love, I go anytime possible.  And everyone must try the Spinach Salad.  It's not a salad - it's too much deliciousness to be a salad.

iDnW35yLHFssQE7Na_OHrQ.text: So disappointed, this was my second visit, the first time was great. This time the food was cold and the noodles in the pad Thai weren't cooked enough and we're almost crunchy. Two entrees and a pot of tea: over $50, so not worth it.

GDmfwVhq0qHXFwtc-rJAvQ.text: This has to be the best Thai restaurant I have ever enjoyed. We ordered the crab rolls that came with a nice sweet sauce, eggplant panang, koi-soi (with pork shoulder), and lemon grass soup. We loved all of it! Service was friendly and ambience was warm. The strawberry infused water was a good touch. I look forward to trying some wine on my next visit. All around 5 stars.

Wght7JPtUwKXcPjFSwVYEg.text: Last night we dined at Nittaya's.  The food was good but I did not leave "in love" as usual.  We started off with our usual-"THE" Spinach Salad.  The Spinach was light & crispy but the dressing seemed different-I can not exactly identify what was different.  I usually can not stop eating it but after 3 bites I was satisfied.  We also ordered the Fried avocado appetizer which was very tasty-the avocado was smooth and buttery and rich.   I ordered the Beef Pad Z U (their spelling).  It just did not taste "right" to me (not bad, not horrible though).  My husband tasted it-thought the meat was chewy but declared it "ok".  We took it home.  He ordered the Duck Curry which he declared "pretty good".  One friend ordered the Salmon Curry which she liked.   Our other friend ordered the ribs which he loved.    One con about this otherwise delightful place is the seating.  I am not a tiny person and have no one to blame but myself.  That said, the tables are so tightly placed as is the bar "area".  People generally will scootch their seat back and the people at the bar scootch their seat back.  Our party was already seated in the back and all avenues to get to our table were blocked with patrons having their seats back just a little BUT since the tables are so close together it was almost virtually impossible to get to our seat.  I noticed all of the very slender servers and staff having to turn sideways and such to get back and forth between the tables. (So of course my sizable ass was not getting through without a chair or something being moved).  After dinner we felt almost trapped at our table and did not feel comfortable trying to leave until the table behind us cleared.    The service was wonderful as usual.

rBH0gXlpFbxTobfZ7t2nYw.text: Absolutely amazing. Everything i had tapa style was to die for. And that bread pudding with coconut ice cream. Ohhhhh heaven in your mouth. So good. I'll be back to this gem.

jFewdTBVYHbsxal-FnGAjQ.text: Good food! Great presentation and customer service! Will definitely return and try out their other dishes!

GyUEQTZTESBJ7U6wHEqZVQ.text: Anyone who doesn't give them 5 stars is out of their mind. Seriously. This place rules. I am there at least once a week for lunch meetings and they consistently execute at a high level on every dish.  My go-to is Red Chicken Curry. The sauce is so delicious and combined with the perfectly cooked rice makes quite a tasty bite. The chicken pad Thai is also the best I've ever had.  Even if you're not into Thai, try them out.

w5Kbg0SJTM5qhSegi_7kig.text: One of my favorite thai places in town. A little pricey, but perfect ambience for date night.  Thursday is half price bottle of wine night and I love getting different tapas. Try the spinach salad!

nd9MnsQ_ezT9GZHggaFZhA.text: Tapas were good, ambience great, i love the rustic/vintage theme of the restaurant. I just didnt like the Seafood Madness but i have yet to try their other main entrees. Im gonna bring my friends next time.

bOt7n4Vbm_CGJbLBvQi9OA.text: On the way back from DTLV, I stopped at Nittaya's for linner.  It was about 1 PM and during the time when the lunch specials were in effect.  $11 for a variety of lunch dishes that includes a pot sticker, and salad, and the dish of your choice from the list of noodle or rice dishes.  I opted for the green curry chicken with rice.  The menu had a notation that the dish was one of their spicy dishes--just what I wanted.  They did not ask for a hotness number I wanted such as a scale of 1-5 or 1-10.  It was made the way they make it.  First up, I was brought a pot sticker and a small salad.  The pot sticker was OK.  Nothing special and a bit soft on the bottom from the sauce on/under it negating the frying of the dumpling.  The salad was great with the flavor of rice wine vinegar being very prevalent.  The curry was very good and I was surprised that it had the zing it had.  Most places that indicate a dish is spicy with a small pepper or some other notation aren't really my spicy level--they're too mild.  This had a bit of zing. More would have been better but this was OK.  Service was good throughout.  I had never been here before, so when I walked in and saw the bar, I sat there because I was dinging solo.  It was only after my eyes got acclimated to the darkened interior that I realized there were two rooms.  It's quite a nice restaurant.  Service was very good.  As other reviewers have mentioned, the lunch special pricing at $11 is higher than other Asian restaurants doing lunch specials and I didn't see anything different about the quality of my lunch compared to other places I've been.  Nittaya's is worth another try for the evening menu.  There are some good sounding items I need to taste.

ctCmbb8GBpcCmFmj6ssvEQ.text: Really enjoyed this little jewel. Tapas style Thai at its best. Great service to boot.  Presentation was outstanding as well. Visit, soon!

zdh2WiIUtnuNoCQw6rmJKQ.text: Loved our experience at Nittaya's. This restaurant had been recommended to me by several Vegas locals. We loved the food. The selection is amazing and the food couldn't be better. The service was outstanding, probably some of the best that we have ever had in the city. Would highly recommend.

e6ymnls7zt62VzaMvT2r0g.text: So I walk in guy server walks right by me, no greeting. Lady comes to seat me because I'm waiting so long. I'm seated and waiting, another woman comes tonoffer me water with an apology. My server went to two other tables still no greeting. In fact he crosses my table to one that got to the restaurant way after me. He goes in the kitchen, back out and takes my order . Smh  The restaurant wasn't that busy, only like 5 tables filled, sooo  My food finally comes out, only for the server to take it to the wrong table  Seriously, I am writing this stuff as it happens. I can't make this stuff up.  My check comes, yep you guessed it, the guy server tells me he put in yhe incorrect server number so I will be charged twice! But dont worry because it will just fall off Let's get the service together, acknowledge your patrons.

9TIPw6vul2SFbPJA_G2jMA.text: Delicious Thai recipes with beautiful presentation.  There are so many good Thai food options in Las Vegas, but Nittaya's is truly special.

adLArUKrvEWJK-ygKsElmw.text: Very rude on the phone.  Won't give you a straight answer.  Food quality had also diminished since we started going here.  Sad.  We used to really like this place.

9rKXLOdLHmHIl5mToL7ahg.text: Very authentic Thai food! The service was great and the food was delicious. The decor inside is very elegant, upscale, and Contemporary. My only thing is it's a bit pricy for the portion size.   We ordered Basil beef 5/5 stars Pad see eww, chicken 4/5 stars Potstickers 5/5 stars Egg rolls 4/5 stars

Lr38u7FT4yDofo2Fw0m6cQ.text: Fantastic food. Meals have complex levels of flavor and fresh ingredients. It is more expensive than the typical Thai restaurant for this reason. Innovative, flavorful, and not too oily - there is an emphasis on taste as opposed to churning out cheaply made Thai staples. Vegetarian friendly restaurant.  I'd recommend:  Glass noodle salad, spinach salad, shishito peppers, coconut soup, salmon green curry, thai bouillabaisse soup, FOB (pineapple) rice, and their iced tea.   The atmosphere and service is also top-notch. So friendly, quick, and a genuine camaraderie among staff and restaurant goers.   I'll never tire of going to this place!

Yw3DE0LtR4t-XAqU25rDWA.text: This restaurant is AWESOME!  I've been several times and recommend it to visitors when they are in town.  The fried spinach salad is to die for and my husband loves the curry.  We always do family style tapas and there is enough food for everyone.  Good place for a date  as well.  Enjoy!

wSU1nXWCFvZE39KAOTIJmQ.text: This place is amazing! Came here twice already and planning my third one already! This is probably the only restaurant I prefer to be at the bar, not just because it's a great atmosphere it's also because the bartender (josh) is always friendly and gives us amazing recommendations to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lMoSmw2IUbL7LZmyia1u-g.text: To start the food was decent once I got it .  I went to the bar to order it to go I proceeded to wait approximately 5 to 10 minutes for someone to acknowledge me. I placed my order and after waiting for 45 minutes I asked the bartender how much longer would it be he said he will go back and check he later came back and said that they were just about to make my food after 45 minutes either he forgot to put the order in or they purposely put my order at the bottom of list.   As there was a couple next to me that ordered shortly before me but receive their food and was packing up there to go bag and paying to get ready to leave.   Overall the customer service there was very poor I would not be visiting this establishment again I had better food with faster service in the Las Vegas area then to drive all the way to Summerlin for poor customer service

Q1BMiPobk2HAmTUN_fqo4g.text: My friend and I were looking for a new place for a light snack after her flight into Las Vegas, and we happened upon Nittaya's.  The tapas we ordered was terrific.  We tried the vegetable rolls, garlic edimame, garlic jasmine rice, and bacon wrapped shrimp with pineapple puree.  All four were delicious.  The service was top notch.  The water served was a orange/strawberry infused water, which was just a "hint" of fruit and complemented the food.  We look forward to coming back for a full dinner!

Ljmj4syP1toKW-MFA7TeCA.text: We were vacationing here on the Strip in Las Vegas and we love Thai. It's hard to find quality Thai food and I wanted more of a romantic setting. This place hit the spot. You walk in and it's cozy, inviting, and felt more upscale than any other Thai restaurant I've been to. Our service was flawless. This place has THE best crab wontons with dipping sauce. Our lunch entrees were perfectly paced and service was personable but left us to just enjoy each other and our date. Poom, who also manages, took exceptional care of us and this is one of our top 3 restaurants in Vegas. Can't wait to come back!

MXm7OSPxHGu24aBvSPY0og.text: My friend and I tried this place out for her birthday luncheon yesterday. What a surprise - it IS a secret kitchen!  A Wonderful place with fabulous food! I especially love the ambience, and will be back here many times in the future, I am sure!

qpCcbO0qXjT85mCRr9sy9w.text: First time trying ! We will absolutely be back  the food was amazing. We just ordered off the tapas menu and everything was perfect. The ambiance was so nice.  We will absolutely return

7RYeGenRO-N5KQzgHvjXAA.text: You want to empress and make a mark this hidden Vegas gem is the place to do it. The food was on point and the service is amazing. The closeness of the Tables was awkward at first but it become normal after awhile it's a Vegas must try but bring the card cause you will need it

4PNEb4xzoXf7o0OzAR1pQg.text: Great for lunch! They make a delicious green curry. Their fried spinach salad is absolutely delicious. Just don't expect authentic Thai food, this very modern and Americanized.

om2RQi49qm4QZRJvv1EoLQ.text: Wasn't acknowledged when walked in the front door, so we decided to sit at the bar. Lettuce wraps were not good and I bit into a hard clump of rice while eating my Currie.

BlMl9BR2tZlCvLFFQwdNcQ.text: The reviews don't lie! I came here for lunch with friends and we shared the following: -crab fried rice (not my favorite among the dishes, we didn't even finish half of it) -drunken noodles chicken (yumm!) -chili basil chicken (the best!) appetizers were spare ribs (waiter suggested this but there was barely any meat and I just didn't like it) and the fried tempura spinach (who would ever think this could be so good!) -homemade coconut ice cream-wonderful -lemongrass creme brulee-could barely taste the lemongrass and it was too thick  Service was great. The inside is very dark and I highly suggest not sitting by the door like we did. I was blinded by light every 3 minutes and someone entered and exited.

dfOy277LMmE8P1vB8N3pmA.text: Really nice.  Best thai food on the west side. Small place so call in advance cause yhey are always budy...even on a Tuesday night. Highlt recommend the spinach salad and eggplant tapas. Excellent wine list. Will be back for more

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desser...pot de creme and sunday island
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach salad...loved the dipping sauce

XQuCaHTLw2NEkP9XkaofqQ.text: Just got a take-out order from here, was recommended by a friend and definitely realize why, besides loving every dish We tasted, when we got home the pad Thai was missing from our order so we called them up, apparently they didn't have that we ordered it....  So they delivered the dish to our house, free of charge!   We kinda expected to pay for the dish and was just happy they were delivering it, so that was a pleasant surprise....   Not just going out of their way to make customers happy, but this food is awesome, try it if your nearby

adOIdQ2dJJNcf1D6Wd117g.text: Love! It's small and intimate and the food is delicious. This is not one of the noisy "hip" places with overpriced crap on the menu. This is a place for food lovers. The decor is very nice as well.   Everything we tried so far is excellent. But there is one thing that's to die for: the creme brulee trio!! Chocolate, coconut and lemongrass. You may not think these sound so great but they are all absolutely delicious. Mmmmmmmmmmm!!!!

yomrqYzBvhM6w9t3x3cKjg.text: The best Thai food in Las Vegas. Food is excellent, service is excellent, and the decor is classy.

9I4GCgQnLfbmlcpTQWBGYA.text: Fantastic place!  Small, intimate dining, with a nice bar.  Incredible food, with complex intertwined flavors and world class presentation.   The service was quick, but un-rushed. Very attentive.  No bum's rush with the check when we were finished.  Simply the best Thai food in the Las Vegas valley

UWoQqcn5ijTiMj64z9_TvA.text: I'm not very generous with five star reviews, but Nittaya deserve's each and every one.  From the general atmosphere (intimate and romantic) to the hibiscus lemonade,  the bacon grilled shrimp to the pad thai, everything is done with skill and flair.  Each item on the menu marries traditional with experimental and results in a fusion of pure flavorful bliss.  Nittaya's Secret Kitchen is a secret gem tucked away in Summerlin that I will continue to visit as long as I'm able to.

f4L96NFSzSfZBCqpevQ_7A.text: I had the fried avocado, steak skewers, chicken satay skewers, a shrimp tapas, pork pot stickers and shishito peppers. Everything was delicious, but I could have done without the pot stickers since they were nothing special, but they were well-made if you like them.  I came in here thinking it was just a good Thai place to stop by for a quick lunch, but was surprised to see that it was more of a classy establishment. I considered leaving due to time, but I'm glad that I stayed and will come back again to try the rest of the tapas menu and the entrees.   Yummy!

CWp2VpEuuNTipG5gl26WPQ.text: Cute little spot about 20 - 30 minutes from the strip.   The place is small, cozy, and very cute. Love the design.  The service is excellent. The menu extensive (including vegan options.)  We devoured everything thrown our way and I found myself eating stuff I'd normally never try.  The price was pretty nice considering how well we ate.  I highly suggest trying them battered spinach thingies (forgot the name). They are ridiculously good!

CYoA85nkDgFISnhhPQ59GQ.text: The atmosphere is wonderful. The employees were very friendly and  great at providing serve.  They make you want to come back.  The food is delightful.  I was there for lunch and I had so many excellent choices I had to solicit help from another customer. I will be going back very soon.  Forgot to mention the most important part..... Fabulous selection of wine.

A-YSafoibue3ucphyJy0Vw.text: Joy and Josh were amazing! The spinach tapas was a fabulous starter.  The lunch specials... Drunken noodle, chicken pad tai and basil chicken were all delish... Our team celebration was a huge success at our new find.  Thank you Yelp for leading us to our new yummy restaurant.

ay2pjr2sE8GCLhJcH3rh0Q.text: Great quality, flavor and presentation! A very cozy location.  It's must if you're in the area.

jKDDWMfRJYBMVNs44raW2A.text: The restaurant is small and intimate.  The service we had was excellent. Very attentive but not to the point where we felt they were interrupting us.  The food was fresh, hot and very tasty.the Tapas selection is great and Curry dishes are delish.  Great wine selection.  The first time I've been to a Thai place. Very enjoyable time. Looking forward to a return visit

kHNOo6J7CTo2zT2a27naMA.text: Great curry dishes and atmosphere. I highly recommend the Thai donuts.  It is a bit small so you're cramped or you're "more intimate" which is either good or bad depending how you look at it. It didn't bother me that much.

kfvWPaR8E63Xmnnw6WdF9g.text: BEST. THAI. FOOD. IN. VEGAS! I've been to soooo many and am a tough critic with thai. I crave their fried spinach salad often and their curries are great, the drunken noodles are my FAVORITE!! Wish it were closer to my house, open more locations!

8Tti-l18PHJ2UEOOZmyISA.text: Unfortunately my family and I didn't get a chance to try the food. So I can only speak on the service we received from a hostess over the phone. We called to make reservations the hostess initially said no problem but after she found out we were bringing our 1yo daughter she then said that the wait would be really long and that they didn't have high chairs for children!!! (I guess they discriminate on children)Then quickly got off the phone. I will never eat at this place. If you have a family save your money and go to DW bistro where the food and service is always top notch!!!!

X5ApSb8v_-IDWWQ_XK_gFA.text: This is the most romantic Thai food spot we have found in Vegas.  Were making this a monthly location. :-)

AfdnLeFID36HQu3NEHX04g.text: We went with a big group, and although this restaurant is quite small, they accommodated us well!  We started out with a bunch of tapas...the best one was the spinach salad with tempura spinach (so unique!) that came with a chicken lime dressing.  The tempura was not overly greasy and paired well with the dressing.  The fried avocado was also very good, creamy on the inside and perfectly crunchy on the outside.  For our entrees, the green curry with chicken and penang curry shrimp were my favorites.  The flavors were excellent, and there was some definite spice to the dishes.  The chicken pad thai and pad Z-U were standard.    The restaurant itself is very pretty inside, with low-lighting for a more romantic atmosphere.  Definitely give this place a try for a more upscale Thai restaurant!

i0Cvz9tiUyd2rmRdh4OEfA.text: My sons took me here for Mothers Day, food was excellent. I had the duck curry and it was so tender it was like sweet butter melting in your mouth. The flavors  were rich but not overpowering! I think I had a glass of plum wine which I would highly recommend as it complements the curry magnificently.

VO9C07Y0jzkRnTuMJrO6Mw.text: This is hands down the BEST Thai restaurant in town! The firecracker shrimp & spinach salad are amazing !!

rL4pYdqnNTj39TEiAhtaeA.text: Delicious food and friendly staff. If you're in this part of town and want Thai food, this is the place.

SaIkHpZcyXERpq8jB0dVxQ.text: I have had a few Thai restaurant experiences, but this one was by far excellent. The restaurant's ambience is great,  the staff is friendly and attentive, and the food is delicious. The lamb chops were done superb. The basil and garlic sauce was perfectly done and the meat melted in my mouth. I also tried their pot stickers as appetizer, they were spectacular. The only thing that could have improved the experience would have been bigger tables and chairs. As a guy who is 6'5" the seats were too low and soft and the tables appeared to be below even standard height.

Q12eiaHt7RbDWLdA0FSXGw.text: This place sucks horrible service and that's the secret I had to open a yelp account just to post this

uKD_wQv33__0FItDRdtD_A.text: My girlfriend and I had an amazing meal at Nittaya's once again. We shared the Tempura Spinach and two wonderful entree's. The avocado ribeye and cashew shrimp. What a delicious combination to share and the service was excellent.

8N-hC9xGuxbsSivkJoWvwg.text: Amazing! Very good food! Service was fast and friendly and very attentive. Spinach salad is a must have!!! First time here and definitely won't be my last.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UdpfsPy_hiEckD6jNNtFqg.text: It was so good. I will be back again and again. I have anointed this place as my LV Thai spot. I have been looking for my go to and I got it.

aI1UDjg9GIubNonkKLtJnQ.text: This place was amazing. Decor and atmosphere are very fun. The waitress was very helpful in us picking a wine we like and even brought us some samples! The appetizers were great and the salmon avocado green curry is to die for!!!

8wPOGabZpAuYCvVoPGofmQ.text: Love love love Nittaya's kitchen. It is wonderful to have such a good place that is close to home and convenient! The food is delicious and the service has always been great. The atmosphere is pretty and cozy, definitely feel like staying awhile and sipping a cocktail or a glass of wine! It's a must if you love Thai food and it's a great date night spot.

uq_qD-KF8ILy6f8Uzm9J-g.text: Food: Food was wonderful, the curry we tried was the green curry Avocado with Rib eye steak, and the  tapas has a different  take on thai food. The crispy spinach was good, the dip made a huge difference  on the dish. The calamare and the ribs that we got from the tapas were savory.  Ambiance: The decor and how the place is arranged in a way that creates a cozy dining experience. The restrooms are very clean. Definitely do a reservation before dining at nittaya's. They have a bar which is good for get togethers after work, and also has al fresco dining.   Service: Service is pretty good, the waitress was very knowledgable in the foods that are popular in the menu. If you like thai food, definitely try this place out. It is Nittaya's Secret Kitchen after all.

4U0udijGgQTHsYkG_SD5Pg.text: We come here regularly and we appreciate the consistency of good service and flavourful food. Wine pairing suggestions from our server and bartender were excellent. The garlic spare ribs were perfectly crunchy and flavored. The best salmon green curry in town and  flavorful lamb chops were simply delish.

1A29qfpHxAl25jKEUigxlw.text: I know this going to come off as Biased since I work here but I honestly mean what I say. I have worked here for 5 years and the food is so amazing that I have yet to get burnt out on eating it. The flavors are incredible and the menu is huge! I am not a fan or steak, onions, lamb, and duck typically, but Nittaya makes all of these in a way that I really enjoy. She is very talented and puts hard work into every dish! So it is for that reason I am going to give this place 5 stars and review it as if I were a guest that came here for 5 years!

seu_UP3MmMEGUk4SKVZw3w.text: Food was excellent. Service is friendly and fast. We ordered the spinach salad (a must try), pineapple fried rice, skirt steak with the avocado on top, loved it!!! The bread pudding was ok, but we were full! Great place would definitely come back.

wro6HlHI0oDbXtrIYqPzww.text: Excellent....the garlic edamame was fantastic.  Kale salad was a first and I loved it. Everything was so fresh and cooked perfectly.

mOotqiInkPv4VRnQToSxcQ.text: A beautiful restaurant in Summerlin.  Great ambience and perfect for date night but but BUT, make a reservation as this place is tiny and has limited number of tables.  I went here for our lunchthey're not too busy for lunch. We got a free sangria with our Yelp check-in.  They have a great lunch special menu which comes with a salad with ginger dressing, pot sticker and entree for about $11.  I got pad thai spicy 3 out of 5,drunken noodles spicy 5 out of 5.  My pad thai came out really spicy and the drunken noodles were milder so we swapped towards the end when I was covering my nose with tissue.  Despite that, I thought the food was delicious.  Service was great.  Our server was attentive.  The food is more expensive here than other Thai restaurants but this is more upscale Thai cuisine.  I'd have to come back here for their tapas and I know I will be back.

P29PlzCjLqPISfU4gCZ3tg.text: One of the best Thai restaurant weve visited here i n LV. We love the bacon shrimp wraps with Apple sauce. Lemongrass soup with shrimp, mushrooms and cilantro, super duper love it. Steak salad, oh my oh my love it the spiciness is just perfect. My daughter love love love the chicken Satai and Angel Wing with steam rice. You must call for reservation before visiting the place because it is always busy.

4U5OQG7FjLC4m0n1zGNwfQ.text: Excellent service by Leah, she was very nice and had great recommendations. I had the green curry and gf had the Massaman chicken curry served with brown rice. Both were fantastic! I wish I lived in Las Vegas to come to this spot. They will make any dish with Tofu for vegetarians. The lunch special includes the brown/white rice, a salad and fried vegetable dumpling.

bvT_jSJ_dL0mh8dpGB1aFw.text: Greatest sliced poke tuna lunch salad I have ever had before. Luckily my friend Ernie took me there after he tool me what criminals health plan of Nevada and united Healthcare was and had me enjoy one of the best lunches of the year. Kudos to nattayas and thanks.

R9VHTEkVx5e7MFxMSUDRcw.text: The love for Nittaya's is above and beyond. This quaint thai restaurant nestled in Summerlin is well worth the experience. The food, people, atmosphere, experience are superb.   The spinach salad- NEXT LEVEL good. The Avocado thai Salmon- dream worthy Everything else- excellent.   Keep up the great work Nittaya's!

jl14FPgboxexrDxMR5K64Q.text: Amazing Thai food, had the shrimp with red curry and it was delicious. Also i tried the papaya salad and crab fried rice garlic ademame and curry potatoes dumpling everything was excellent and we will be back.

cvBeF4B56m-jWKD6oOTJYw.text: We ordered a few apps and the drunken noodles. All were so yummy. Perfect amount of spice! Service was great and the atmosphere is so cute and quaint. I'll definitely be coming back!

zNfm52tux8W_vI9VI-15fA.text: I can see why this place has such good reviews and is booked out so often! We arrived at 5pm for an early dinner without a booking. We were seated immediately and had the table available til 7, which suited us as we were off to a show. The staff were polite and very efficient. Our water was topped up after a few sips every time! The food was absolutely delicious. Very well presented, cooked perfectly and authentic, dynamic, balanced flavors.  The venue is well stocked with wines and very ambient and cosy. A great location for romantic dates, but also popular for larger parties. The waitresses were very attentive and made sure we were happy with everything. This restaurant is a surprising and impressive hidden gem in Summerlin! We can't wait to eat here again and will be taking our visiting families here soon also.

zq7I8OPq3uVyMjj7YyeouQ.text: Nittaya's was the perfect backdrop to a rendezvous with an old friend. The decor is quaint and quirky, the venue itself as small as the waiting area of a Cheesecake Factory. But these qualities were what made it a memorable experience to share an intimate gathering with.  We split an array of seafood-based tapas, as well as the tempura-style spinach, with white wines of our respective choosing. Their vino selection was so pleasing to the palate, and the bartender, an interactive treat of a host.  Left so satisfied, so full and so relaxed that I'm thinking about it a whole week later!

0zX8W95kNX9KjesIzxAw_w.text: I had the pleasure of dinning at Nittaya's Secret Kitchen last night after hearing great reviews from three other people. I consider myself a foodie and thought the secret is out now. You may want to make reservations. This small and intimate place has limited seating and fills up fast. This is not your ordinary Thai restaurant.  Each plate is a work of art served in a progressive style of unique combination of food to tantalize the taste buds.  I shared several delicious plates, tender Lamb Chops, a tasty and colorful Salmon-Eggplant with Avocado dish, a crunchy and clever Spinach Salad, and a tapas Golden Pouch that looked like a wrapped gift.  Everything was a culinary delight.  By far this is one of my favorite Thai restaurants.

CWA0vW3V7LC83bHz4xqbAg.text: Tried Nittaya's last night on the recommendation of a friend. So GOOD! After reading Yelp reviews, we called ahead to reserve a table for four, which turned out to be a good idea, even on a Monday night. Great service, great food. Fried avocado, beef salad, angel wings, duck breast curry, combo pad thai, coconut ice cream. I look forward to the warmer weather so we can sit outside and sample more delicious dishes!

BfH2O2nhPNLI2FA1ODdQ0Q.text: Nittaya's is a Beautiful little secret kitchen. Call and make reservation in order to guarantee your seat in this small intimate dining area.....once you do, you will be pleased you did. They serve so many wonderful dishes that you must return to try them. Some of the must haves are the Spinach Salad and Beef Jerky tapas. The tastes are amazing. Move on to the entrees and you will be pleased with the freshness and the tastes that come. Service is great. Atmosphere is unique and sexy. Food is top notch. My favorite Thai!

5oYiJ6Iy_yog7jZ7vbCGEg.text: Such a great place! Small, cozy, and intimate atmosphere. Food is superb! Every dish is so creative and unique from other restaurants. Try the spinach salad or volcano shrimp. They are delicious!

ZsFeqAuk2PRX-tx36I5rZw.text: This is an update from my 3 Star review back in September of 2016.  First the food.  Like I wrote last year, the food at Nittaya's Secret Kitchen is exceptional.  When I wrote the review last year I was so upset about the service I really wanted to give the review a 1 star, but because of the food gave it 3 Stars.  Since September 2016 I have been back to Nittaya's six times and all six times the Staff has been really good, no GREAT!.  First they seem to remember us now.  Second, the indifference we used to experience when we walked in is gone.  Third, the Waitresses and Waiters seem to really care about providing good service along with the exceptional food.  The staff has improved remarkably and they truly seem to care about what they are doing and making sure their customers are completely satisfied.  This is a great restaurant and the staff have become professionals in their craft.  I highly recommend Nittaya's and want to thank everyone from the Bartender to the Waitresses, to the Waiters and most of all to Nittaya for running one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas.

9YtOdtBFiD2R7_x10Zmvvg.text: We come here often. This is our favorite Thai place in town. Small and intimate. I suggest reservations. If you ask for Thai hot, you will get Thai hot. That's hotter than their 5 on the 1-5 scale. If you are really brave you can ask for it to be as hot as the employees get when she cooks for them.

iYpxUymAm4yzmJibQWS8tg.text: Not bad, but other nearby places offer better bang for the buck. Ugh- and the skinny white chair was extremely uncomfortable- not ideal for dining out. The seat of the chair had no padding and was too thin. A rethink of the chairs are a must and should be made an immediate priority.

4WiYxoEZqK-MRWNAQP9hOA.text: Updating on my Nittaya's Secret Kitchen! I got the Fried Tofu, Phucket Poppers and Tofu Curry as my dishes.  While I don't normally EVER order Tofu, the Fried Tofu is amazing, but I wish the Poppers had more of a kick to them. They were supposed to be quite SPICY (it had 3 little jalapenos next to them on the menu indicating their spiciness), but they fell a bit short. The Tofu curry was good though, but it also wasn't the best I've ever had.  Overall, I still love this place. Will be back again once I'm on that side of town.

G5fNbgxSlyTC25GWuy8v3w.text: Excellent food. Excellent ambiance. Excellent service. It reminded my husband and I of the best Thai food that we had while visiting San Francisco. I can eat here every week!

0lUp_xRzKM4kSVsgLEHxug.text: Outstanding food, and my man Bank is an excellent server.  The chili lime squid is superb. Love this place.

CRYjG7RJIzdXXynFrGNskg.text: This is one of my favorite places and my husband and I always order the same things: mango grilled shrimp (normally I don't eat shrimp or bacon), chicken satay, and the chicken pad Thai.  I would give them five stars but although the service at the bar is always good, I think the restaurant is under staffed.  Nittaya - please hire more staff!  My second complaint is they don't offer any salads without meat.  I love the atmosphere - warm and cozy, kind of SF-isn

_T4aphN0jsjduFtvdtq3Vw.text: Love this little quiet spot!!!! Tapas/appetizers are boss!!! Definitely one of our favorite "date night" spots. World famous spinach salad the best! Thai wings... Yum... Lemongrass soup...heaven... Coconut ice cream... Hit the spot Service is perfect.... Amazing job Nittaya!!!!!

Y63cCQbgr8LSgHUrmnLpUQ.text: Great Thai in a romantic setting. Perfect for a date night! Make sure to call ahead for reservations, this place isn't very big and it's popular! The Spinach Salad was GREAT!

ruIVBGCOByhYZiqhJUkxHA.text: We've eaten here several times as it is in our neighborhood. However, they have a strange way of turning away business. Every single time we've gone, no matter what the time, we are asked if we have reservations. We do not. We then get a very confused look and told that they are booked - when the place is empty!! I actually laughed one time & they sat us & we enjoyed a full dinner with only two other tables being sat the entire time we were there. Not going back.

3Uj8bupny-489F1JxnwlFw.text: Great restaurant. Very cozy. Excellent service especially Josh. The food was amazing. Our waitress recommended the spinach salad. It is tempura spinach (how do they do that) and it has great flavor and the dipping sauce was perfect with it. We also tried garlic ribs, potstickers, pad Thai, cashew shrimp all were excellent. Desserts were just as amazing. Try the Thai donuts and the crime brulee trio.

zOPRNfZSvHQoYS6aJgpLpw.text: When I am sick, their coconut milk broth is the only thing I want.  Owner is always there, cooking, placing fresh flowers.  Food is great, a little higher priced for the portions but sit at the bar, there is always someone nice and interesting to talk to.  They are closed on Sundays, and do zero advertising - it is all literally word of mouth so that tells you a bit about the place.  Great place to take family in from out of town or just get out for a night.  Nittaya makes the best mango sticky rice, but only when mango is in season.

PSAvhF24jJxVWSSDjB239w.text: Wow. That is some damn tasty Thai food.   Loved the tofu pad thai (our group of four ordered two plates!). Loved the eggplant drunken noodle. The papaya salad was crispy and refreshing. Nothing was overly sweet, which I find a little annoying at other Thai restaurants. Nice restaurant decor, too. It's an intimate place, so noise isn't a huge factor, and it's definitely good for a romantic night out.   I only wish I could've fit more food into my already overfilled stomach. I am definitely coming back on my next Vegas trip.

KSQIinIYoK4rzDkkbU4bFw.text: I love this restaurant and have been there three times now. The first two times were really pleasant and we had a great experience. So I should certainly rate this with five stars.   But last valentines day I reached the restaurant and had very poor service. Not only was the service too slow ( which can be expected on a busy night) but the food was extremely spicy. When we told the staff about our experience they started arguing. It's only when I said fine, we can't eat this just get the check and I'll leave did the staff agree to "add some coconut milk" to make it palatable. Not a fun place to be on a romantic night. And that's why it gets 3 stars.

XEs_Dm7bWSg8t7abFmvrnQ.text: I am slightly hesitant to give such a great review because the place is so small that if it gets too popular i will not be able to get a seat, but with this many great reviews, i would say the secret is out. Absolutely wonderful. I am always pleased when I eat here. By far and away the best item is the famous fried salad. It has a tangy vinaigrette with cashews and even a little bit of savory cheese. I really like the Panang curry, a little spicier than many places but by no means Thai spicy. This is a really small place, I recommend reservations. Highly recommend.

yow-lz3K9mbgUkVotdiznQ.text: Ate here a few weeks ago for my gf's birthday. Food was amazing. Service was great. Will definitely coming again.

CVgYCViFtPDQDivQvzogXA.text: My boyfriend and I always drive by this Thai place always saying how we wanted to try it, well we finally did!  The restaurant is very cozy with a rustic feel to it. We went afternoonish so it wasn't busy at all, two other couples, so it was very quiet. Service we pretty quick with seating us and taking our orders, but again it was a quiet afternoon.  We ordered 3 tapas dishes and 2 main dishes and it was way more than we had expected for just the two of us, but the more the merrier right?! We started with the shrimp jalepeno poppers, crispy pork, and the stuffed chicken wings.  For our entree we ordered the home style shrimp pad Thai and the drunken noodles. I love when Thai dishes have a good kick to it, but was a little disappointed when I didn't get just that. The shrimp jalepeno poppers had maybe the littlest kick to them. I also ordered my drunken noodles with spice and was more overwhelmed with the amount of basil in it. To be fair the menu description clearly lists the main ingredients as egg, chicken, and BASIL. All in all, I really did like the restaurant and the food as a whole and would definitely come back! Maybe just ask for a bit more spice next time :)

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed chicken wings
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed chicken wings
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy pork

_em59X8p9NGk8R0pO-BgQw.text: Wow!  I'm in town for business and I wanted something different. I love Thai food and thought I would try Nittaya's Secret Kitchen.  The service was amazing and the food was even better!  I asked the server, James, to just "feed me" whatever he recommends. James brought me a tapas plate of deep fried pork belly with a sweet chili sauce for a starter. The pork belly was cooked just right and the sauce was spicy hot but I couldn't get enough of it. For my entree I was served curry steak with avocado. The curry sauce was fantastic!  I refrained from licking my plate but I managed to clean the plate using the steak, eggplant, and rice.  Great recommendations James!  I can't wait to visit again. Yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ECjeroLTpjj7uU6LrukJVQ.text: Went with friends. Place is tiny! They really pack the tables in there. Thus the noise level is pretty high. The appetizers of the lettuce wraps, beef jerky, and the spinach salad were good. The green curry was marginal. Had better other places. Pad Thai was ok. The pineapple fried rice was great. All in all is was ok. I like other Thai places later.

71MZw_kY5fFh8RrMJn9J8A.text: One of my all time favorite spots! You just can't go wrong with the exotic mix of flavors! We try to mixing up every time but the spinach salad and the avocado curry are just a few of our favorites! You won't be disappointed! Ever!

WzIHblJPm12D-fyQ_5sMjw.text: Love this place. Yummy, creative food. We have brought many out-of-town family and friends here and always love it.

nf53PUDo6anrJYMzCbvEZw.text: Never wrong! Always the right choice for an intimate dinner or a small group of friends. They changed the decor since I last visited but the food remains consistent and is a little celebration with each bite you take. If you do a little dance with the first (or every bite) it's okay and expected. Try, get addicted and return!

QBx5GSHbgPlELoqR8hcjog.text: I and my friend came here for lunch. At first I thought we went to a wrong place because I didn't realize the tables and chairs I saw in the pics were back in 2012. Haha. Anyways, this place got good reviews (That's why I picked this place) so, I had a high expectation of customer service & quality of food. It turned out that the food wasn't as expected. I was surprised Tom Yum wasn't listed on the menu. I asked the server who told me it was called "Lemon Grass soup" in the appetizer section.  Anyhow, the server could have been more pleasant. He looked like he didn't want to work there.  The Seafood Madness I ordered was way too salty. I didn't feel it was worth the price. Surprisingly, they brought a (small) bowl of rice for me & my friend to share. I would have preferred to have my own bowl of rice instead.  Not sure if I'd return......

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Madness
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forgot to ask what my friend ordered. Lol

sypn470YBiIOe4LXjbAouQ.text: Sooo delicious. Pretty expensive for thai food, but it's well worth it. The pineapple friend rice is delicious and served in the pineapple. The curries are delicious too. Honestly there isn't one thing on this menu I wouldn't eat. Love love love!

pWL5ZBUuruMsTjkqmEm91w.text: Great Thai food here. It's definitely on the pricey end for Thai food but it's worth the extra couple bucks. Not he most comfortable restaurant to dine in because it's a small space, but if that doesn't bother you dine in. Otherwise their carry out is spot on. They even put items on the side that are supposed to be crunchy instead of putting it in the liquid of a dish. I enjoy their attention to detail.

N_zCr3O0aC-MiU72w8Djtw.text: Had reservations for a Saturday night.  Great food and great service.  Had some small plates and one entree to share.  And hen dessert.  You must see and taste the dessert menu.

d2yGfhKA8TubygJB8ToB5g.text: Looking it up I thought it would be a lower-end Asian restaurant but Nittaya took me by surprise at how fancy they were.  The water they serve was infused with Strawberry and another fruit (can't remember). I could taste it a little in the first sip, but ultimately it's just iced water. Still, it was refreshing   Half off bottles of wine on Thursday evenings; if I wasn't leaving the city that night I would've taken them up on it!  All the menu items sounded really good and authentic. Prices are slightly higher than normal but their lunch specials are really good deals (salad, a potsticker, and your entree for only $11). After eating their lunch, I want to say their prices are justified. I guess I'll have to come back again to find out.  Service was also very good, water was refilled consistently and staff was very friendly.  I got the drunken noodles which came out with a small flower, cute. Flavor was solid, and meat was great. The chicken was minced into small bits, it was juicy and full of flavor; I almost thought it was pork! My only gripe is their spiciness is toned way down. I wanted it to be super spicy like many Thai dishes are so I bumped up the spiciness level to 4 (normally one). Unfortunately it was only a ~2 in terms of heat in my opinion. Besides that, this place was a terrific choice for a nice lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken Noodles with a flower to go with it

XKxBWXD9l0JtBnmvnnM3tg.text: My wife and I have been coming here for a couple years now, so I can't believe I haven't given a review yet! Honestly, Nittaya's is the best Thai food either of us have ever had.   Nittaya's is definitely an elevated and more stylistic type of Thai: seriously tasty and satisfying dishes with a modern tapas flare. Deep and unique flavors in every dish and sauce. Even if you are the type that only gets a common dish like pad thai (like I used to...), you will love it, but I recommend branching out if you come here. The quality and taste equal that of the presentation, which you can tell by the pictures!

wEZbcY-3zwmn_3MxdPULmA.text: I mentioned this restaurant for a business meeting, I had eaten here before many times, as we had dinner and it was the worst experience I could have ever dreamed of. The bacon wrap was dry and so were the crab cakes. The service was super slow, one of the members of our party asked for a steak, and it did not come out until we all had finished eating. The gentleman ate his steak, and the rest of us, having finished, just sat with him. Then, the server came out with a salad they insisted we ordered, and we had not! We had all finished eating! We had to pay for the salad, they never offered to pack up for us to take and charged us for it! That salad went back to the kitchen and guaranteed, they served to the next person that ordered it! Will never recommend them again, or will I ever eat there again.

VN-JmXwJwCaErXtHyGWZFg.text: We did not eat here so I can't rate based on food, just our experience. We stopped by on a Saturday evening unaware that reservations were needed. The hostess, while not super friendly was willing to accommodate us if we promised her we could be done in an hour. I was happy they would accommodate. Unfortunately, I have a one year old and there are no high chairs in the establishment. They clearly don't want families dining there with younger children which I found extremely disappointing. We might give it another shot for just the adults, but the experience left a bad taste in my mouth. It's also as incredibly small restaurant, on a busy night like we were there, you feel very crowded. Definitely not a romantic atmosphere when you can't enjoy a private conversation.

dLiTzykYgGMyqaNfB9rmHQ.text: I've always come here for work events and during lunch time. I was recommended the "world famous spinach salad" this was really world famous. When people say deep fried things are amazing they weren't lying! This deep friend spinach is crunchy and filling as far as the sauce that comes along with it it's amazing. I always stick to the drunken noodle which I really recommend. I feel like lunch time sizes vary from dinner sizes and that there may also be the price difference. My boyfriend decide to get the Duck curry I believe and I'm not a huge fan of curry but he said it was delicious, the meat was definitely soft tasted really good.  I didn't try any drinks this time but they have a wide range of wine options and some unique beers, my boyfriend decide to order the Lucky Buddha beer which comes in this really unique glass.    It's a small place yet the service is great. I can honestly say that my glass was always refilled with water and someone always came to check up on us and not in an annoying overbearing way either.  If you're in the Summerlin area definitely check out Nittaya's Secret Kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizers

vibsrQlkEhzE2mPlagsV8A.text: This place is too cute. It looks like any old restaurant in Vegas from the outside. Once you step in, it is such a cozy vibe! We ordered mostly appetizers and they were all delicious! Great place for an intimate date or just a place to drink wine, eat and hang out with your girls.

uqqXN-WKGwtSgtsTKTe5hQ.text: The food is AMAZING and the staff is great! This is our go to restaurant,especially when we are in the mood for Thai. They are a little pricey but you definitely get what you pay for. The quality of their ingredients comes through on your tastebuds. Even the water they serve you is infused with different fruits and taste filtered. I can't say enough about how great all their dishes I've tried are. They have affordable lunch options as well. Go to Nittaya's Secret Kitchen!!!!

qnl00sboCqUNVfxpGQySOw.text: 11/30/18 Staff knew nothing of my lunch reservation for eight. Server sloppily poured liberal amounts of water and bouncing ice cubes all over the table with no offer to wipe up the spills. Three entrees arrived, the remainder of meals came twenty minutes later. Server was rude and said the chef had to take care people in the bar area too. One tea never arrived. Had to beg for the checks. Tips were automatically added. Restaurant is short staffed and in need of serious training. Most of the food was good but will not return because of poor service.

xz-3t4Kc7VOVeg2prcRdFQ.text: Amazing. Amazing. Amazing. Thanks Yelp! Just searched and saw amazing reviews and took a leap of faith & found a gem!   An overall great experience from the moment we arrived. First off, this place is a very small restaurant. When we walked in they asked if we made reservations. Of course we didn't because we were first timers. But luckily there was seating outside and Mother Nature was being kind that day.   Someone automatically brought out our Lemon & Cucumber infused water. Fancy? The best water I ever had in a restaurant. Did NOT taste like tap water like most restaurants. I pay attention to the waters! I can't stand when waters taste like unfiltered tap water.   Our waitress, Devynn, was amazing. She gave us great suggestions on what to order.   World Famous Spinach Salad $11- this is a tempura spinach salad with a lime dressing that has ground chicken, onion, cashews, and carrots. This is probably the most unique dish I have ever ate in my life. You can either toss the salad with the dressing OR eat it like chips and salsa. We went with the chips and salsa method so we didn't drown the spinach tempura. It is a MUST GET. They are famous for this! I ordered it and the beau finished it! Lol that's how delicious it was.   Beef Jerky $8- bomb! It actually wasn't too jerky if that makes sense. You were able to chew it and not struggle. It came with a roasted chili sauce that added the right kick.   Shrimp puffs $8- they were like wontons that had shrimp, cream cheese & curry mixed inside. This was probably my least favorite in the meal we ordered BUT still had a good taste to it. I honestly could not taste the shrimp..   Chicken Pad Thai $16- BEST PAD THAI in town, hands down. They have really good spices so we ordered it as a level 2 and oh wow it was amazing. Spicy but not too spicy. It was a large portion which was appreciated. The noodles were cooked perfect. Everything about this dish was perfect.   The presentation of the dishes were beautiful too. They added an Orchid to each plate. How did they know that Orchids were my favorite!?  Highly recommend this place if you are in the summerlin area!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite flower! How did they know?
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp puffs
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pad Thai -- spicy level 2

Qg60om6pQHwznmAbIhvGaw.text: LOVE this place!! Food is always flavorful and delicious. You can tell that the ingredients are always fresh and the preparation is always consistent. My favorites are red curry chicken, drunken noodles, and the crying tiger steak.

J-7aB9Hzz4xQzKtilTl6kg.text: This neighborhood gem offers a great bounty of Thai favorites. I recommend the spinach salad if you've not tried it yet! If you enjoy spicy, the volcano shrimp also makes a great starter. My favorite noodle dish is the drunken noodle. It's also known as pad kee mow. I substitute noodles for the chicken to give it the flavors I had while traveling in Thailand. The coconut curries are delicious and you can adjust your spice level to your liking.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodle with shrimp
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut seafood curry
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic spare ribs are tender and delicious.

sJKtQwh6j0x8ZMXDeLE04w.text: Went here with a group of friends and we all had a really great time.  It was very tasty and there was a lot to choose from.  Also the day they went they had a deal where certain bottles of wine were half off so if you were cheap you could potentially get a bottle of wine for like 8 bucks which is always a nice deal.    The food was very good and there was a lot to choose from.  We had an assortment of  a lot of different foods to choose from because we all ordered something different.  Nothing I had was bad so if you want some good thai food then I highly recommend coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CYdX1_p-TxogJ9CQN6CSqw.text: This Place is everything. I love it here and to me it is my favorite and the best classy Thai restaurant in Las Vegas.  Everything from decor to wine selection to presentation to flavor is perfection.. It's all about the detail and it shows here. I've been here over a 100 times and have pretty much tried almost everything on the menu. I just keep always going back to 3 of my favorite dishes drunken noodles, chicken basil (add eggplant) and the amazing salmon avocado eggplant green curry .. This restaurant has been around a few years and has since expanded ... I love to support quality local chefs and owners and this place is a True reflection of what Las Vegas offers and a must go to place... I didn't even get to dessert.. I'm always stuffed but I still order dessert .  .. the bread pudding is amazing but I always order the creme brulee.. Nittaya makes an amazing trio with mini lemongrass, green tea and coconut creme brulee amazing ...

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iM13NIuZj1QeQX7KnPg9aw.text: From the million items on the menu to the soft indie oldies covers, I was smitten. We got a million things to share, and each was p dank. We ended up getting two orders of the tempura avocados. Who knew breading avocados could make them 10x better? It seemed pretty expensive with all the small plates, but if were being honest, I didn't pay the bill, so I didn't really care. This is a perfect third date spot - the one you go on when you're expecting to get laid. Loud enough for pauses to not be awkward, but quiet enough to have nice convos.  They also last-minute put together a bunch of tables to seat all 8 of us in a rather small restaurant, so that hospitality is greatly appreciated. Oodles of pescatarian options, many could be veg if requested. Not that I am, but just so ya know!

WOg-c5k38kM_9Yk6W480Uw.text: The drunken noodles are amazing. The ambience is amazing. This is the best upscale Thai in the city.

tr4MVTFF6aCbuw9RFaOocg.text: Wish I could give it 1 star so nobody else comes here and never gets busy. Best thai spot in Vegas hands down.

EkvG_N6YaIjEMdqC_o5IXA.text: The food at Nittaya's is delicious and the bartender is really nice. The whole staff was great. The food was amazing. Definitely one of the best Thai places in Vegas.

SUm7jRFV1gCeoKcXy22y7Q.text: I went because I saw the reviews. The place have nice ambient. Good services.  Food is decent but portion is extremely small. The prices are unusual high. I would say this place is catered for less authentic Thai food preferences.

0YUPudICsp3E-4vh4cUL6w.text: The best places are hard to find!!! Making THAI FOOD GREAT AGAIN!! The best Crab wontons ever!!! Tapas are the way to go here!!! Great service and staff is very friendly!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N9NGVpN4p4xsNuGqjnQRzA.text: This was easily the best Thai food restaurant I have ever been to. We moved to summerlin about a year ago, and this is now my new favorite restaurant. I'm sure glad Nittaya brought her secret recipes to Las Vegas :)

K4OwUFFBUBxWTHUfJMTo-Q.text: Positive energy flows freely as diners soak-up the atmosphere, share palate-pleasing tapas plates of the most amazing Thai ingredients (Tempura Spinach, yummy! Shrimp Satay, delish!), bottles of delightful wine (Benton Lane, Pinot Noir is fab!), scrumptious Thai entrees (Avocado & Salmon, Green Curry ** order it spicy!), and if you have room for another morsel, order dessert (coconut ice-cream and sticky-rice in young coconut **all-time favorite). Super-attentive service and always friendly. Owner is super-pleasant and a joy to speak with. She is always making the rounds to check on guests and assist in any way. Most importantly, make reservations!

Dx8Fk0ffe8PXlHnzABfeLQ.text: I do love this place, the flavor, the service, the interior decorations except it's really salty and on greasy side for me.   I am assuming most restaurants are like this unless I request other wise.  But the reason for the 3 star is because this is also not authentic enough.  The dishes are on sweeter side.

cNV1TxfJA0xmjd8_PaxRiA.text: Flavor = excellent  Service = efficient (phone order/takeout) Value = excellent   We've only done takeout and tried curries and pad Thai. Weve tried all four curries as vegetarian options (green, yellow, red and panang ).  Excellent flavor. Our favorite was the green curry. We've now ordered as lunch options and dinner options. For us, the dinner size can serve two smaller appetites (or one very healthy appetite!) and the lunch is better for one.  I always have leftovers if I get the dinner portion for myself. The pad Thai was also very tasty and on the spicy side. We like chilies and spice, and the "medium" or "three" (out of five) rating for spiciness was more than enough spiciness for us.

HYSr7PwmnbyEMKPNl-uZBA.text: I found this place on Instagram. And when I checked the reviews, they were all good. This place is a very cute hidden gem. It is beautiful on the outside with the vines. And, it is very elegant & intimate on the inside. It is dark but not too dark. There were candles on the table and dim lighting. The bar was very pretty also.   The food was good. We asked for the shishito peppers as an appetizer, but unfortunately, they were out. So, we got the spinach salad as an appetizer. I still don't know if it was fried or dehydrated spinach, but it was pretty good.   He got the tiger steak which he liked and I got the Pad see yew with shrimp. My Pad see yew was pretty good. I have had better, but it was still pretty good. For dessert, we shared the mango sticky rice. It's a very simple and refreshing dessert. Basically, sliced mangoes and rice. It's very pretty to take a picture of it. I like the way that they put flowers on every dish. Orchids, I believe.  Overall, I like this place. The atmosphere was just perfect. I will definitely have to come back to try their shishito peppers. And, I would try a different entree.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango sticky rice.
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad see yew and Tiger steak...
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach salad...

9KqbXF77pYDhhjhr_Ol6oQ.text: We stopped in for Lunch on a Sunday. Nittaya's has a Nice atmosphere and pleasant knowledgable servers. On our first visit We tried Thai egg rolls, citrus steak salad, home style shrimp pad Thai, each delicious!   Update: I've been to Nittaya's multiple times, although today was the worst! We stopped in for lunch on a Monday at 2:30pm.  My main dish- Combo Pad Thai off the full menu not the lunch special arrived with egg ( I ordered without/ allergic) so..I sent it back, of course! (The exact thing happened on my last visit to Nittaya's as well). Both times my server didn't notice,  I had to point it out:( When my food finally arrived my husband and daughter were finished with their lunches! I also asked for a 4 out of 5 on the heat ( my dish arrived with no heat). The most upsetting part: place was empty- not busy at all!  No apologies Paid full price  Last visit!

VTc_CfxdfJW5wD0OKGPKJQ.text: I don't know how this place has 5 stars. It's one of the worst thai restaurants I've ever dined in here in town. My friend and I went to Nittaya's for dinner on a Sunday. We walked in and the place is packed, so we chose to sit at the bar. I noted that my friend and I, along with some of the waiters, were the only asians in the house and immediately, i had a bad feeling that the food wouldn't be good lol. My intuition was proven to be right. We ordered the glass noodle salad and the kao soi. The glass noodle salad was so mildly flavor to the point where it's borderline tasteless. Tasted very watered down. This dish has 2 chili signs and there's no heat whatsoever. The kao soi was too salty. Supposedly, the pork shoulder meat that came in the dish was slow cooked, so i was expecting tender and juicy meat, but nope, it was dry and stale. To top it off, both dishes were quite overpriced. I don't mind paying for more if the tastes match the prices. The glass noodle was $15 here, whereas other thai places charge around $10. The kao soi was $19. The only thing that was right about our dinner was my beer lol so yeah, never again will I be back to this place. Go to chuchote, weera, table thai, arawan, i am thai, pin kaow, anywhere but this place...

-zDw0oUYEZPSyAW7WO0uSQ.text: Nittaya's is a great neighborhood Thai restaurant that's cozy with delicious food! My friend and I went for her birthday and ordered alllll the food bc we are hungry little monsters. We got the fried spinach thingy, calamari, emerald fried rice, and pad see ew. BETWEEN 2 PEOPLE. I know, girls can throw it down.   The deep fried spinach thing as interesting but delicious. It's literally deep fried spinach. They deep fry each leaf. EACH LEAF. How long does that take? Sheesh. Anyways anything deep fried is delicious so this is an A+ in my book. Would I eat it every day? Probably not, my family has a history or heart disease and diabetes. Would I get it maybe 1x every 2 months? Hell yes.   Calamari also deep fried. So can't go wrong. Pad see ew, is the same as every other Thai place. Can't go wrong ordering this either. Out of everything, I probably wouldn't order the emerald fried rice again. I mean it was good, but it just kinda seemed like green curry with rice but without the saucy part. Does that make sense? Like why would I order this when I can just order the green curry, is what I'm saying.   Anyhow, other than the waiters constantly trying to take our food away, it was a delight like always!

vXWjP4J6SoHVGb-1QTwUNA.text: My husband and I go at least 2 times a month. Lunch or dinner.  We love this place.  Very cozy.  Drunken noodles, vegetable egg rolls, spinach salad, pot stickers are our favorite. The sauces they put with the tapas is phenomenal. Great food.  Highly recommend. Staff is very friendly and  efficient.

LtxiwmTO_7A0idxLmPMSkQ.text: Small hidden treasure on the edge of Summerlin. Best Thai food in Las Vegas (in my opinion). My favorite is the beef jerky and drunken noodles. Nice selection of wines too. Enjoy!

1XhSJlb7BYoH9Ame-Gu5xQ.text: This is by far the best Thai restaurant in LV. I'm so happy I was able to try it out. Everything we ordered was delicious and the ambiance is also great. It's a quaint, intimate restaurant full of flavor! If you like spice, this is your restaurant. The service was also great and staff was friendly and attentive. Will definitely be back

swocOeHA0BQMqIHByuSDhg.text: Called to reserve for a group of 20.  Lady answered and said it's a small restaurant and therefore they can only accommodate a "large" group of 8. She then continued, "yea that's that so we can't do anything about it."  So I asked what if I reserved for 2 tables of 6 & 1 table for 8 people. I was told they'd ask the manager to see if they can accommodate that.  We called twice to see what their response was. No response to this day.  And we haven't received a call back to deny or confirm our request.   This just leaves a bad taste for us. Poor customer service from staff & management. A call back would have been appreciated
