I3VTKeKz6OA1zHj6ljqdig.text: If you just walk in, you wouldn't know this is a Thai restaurant.  You would think a wine bar with it's decor.  We walked in and there wasn't anyone to greet us, though we entered during an off hour.  There was one table that had guests waiting for their food.    We had the crab fried rice, chunks of crab meat all over, not salty at all and full of flavor.  It wasn't dry either which was a bonus.  The pad thai was not the variety with ketchup or very little ketchup so it was very welcomed.  I don't tend to like ones that are on the sweeter end, I prefer this one which is browner on for the noodles.  Very enjoyable.  Asked for water, it's infused so bonus!

AVMUd1PD45u8dd8_YcEwIQ.text: Not impressed with the flavors. I paid $38 for 2 take out dishes, which felt VERY overpriced. I wouldn't mind if the food was good. The Tom yum (or lemongrass soup) was marginal. The broth tasted canned and didn't add much to the dish. We also ordered the pineapple fried rice, which had an overpowering curry flavor. Not what I was expecting.   I prefer the Thai food I have found at hole in the wall joints. This place feels Americanized and lack luster.

2d799hxRi3F-bGXGorIckQ.text: The food is just ok not great. There is so much better Thai food out there for a lot less money. Bbq Thai wings $9 just 6 half wings no taste very plain, $5 for herbal tea, nothing special just tea. Crispy pork belly was breaded & over cooked (deep fried). Pork Belly should be crispy with its own pork skin, not breaded. The Spinach salad is breaded deep fried Spinach  (like eating spinach potato chips) not healthy as you might think being Spinach but was good. & finally muey-Thai fried rice was very sweet but maybe it's suppose to be?  Portions not big , prices big, food so so. Sorry 1st time their & will not go back. Don't understand the great reviews I read about this restaurant?  Love good Thai food, this isn't close. I forgot the beef jerky which was good but not enough for me to return. Can any one recommend a really good Thai restaurant? Pin Kaow is great, any others as I'm searching?

zWx54FyWKOF1S1i6F08DQg.text: Absolutely love this place and want to bathe in the chili lime sauce! Everything is delicious! Such a beautiful place to dine as well.

BCe4nij5AmyD2oh_o62KZw.text: I have a favorite cuisine and everyone who knows me knows I love Thai food. My husband has been trying to take me to Nittaya's for over a year now, we finally made it there last weekend and all I could think of was the many dinners I've missed out on and how I'm going to make it up. We started with the Chicken dumpling/puffs ?  I forget the menu name, it was reminiscent of basil chicken stuffed in pastry dough. Volcano Shrimp and the Spinach Salad. The Spinach lives up to the hype people don't mess up your opportunity to order this delicious item. For our entrees we had the Pad Thai and the seafood coconut curry. I'm about to say something crazy but this was the best Pad Thai I have ever had ! Hands down it's amazing. The seafood coconut curry has an egg cracked inside of it which changes the texture from a smooth curry to one with a little chew. I thought it was delicious but we agreed we would probably order something different next time. Since I have a year of catching up to do next time may come sooner than my husband realizes :)

UNoiiDQTSLdBMyvMcAOg1w.text: I love the atmosphere and the food presentation is amazing! We always order world famous spinach salad, golden pouches, garlic basil lamb chops, and there pork spicy green bean dish. Ingredients are local and fresh so don't panic if it's not available; that's just how good this place is!  Thanks Nittayas for the past 5yrs I always go here for my birthday. I bring all my out of town friends here!

9UVrnaz1HJx46QgIZQJ7IQ.text: This was our first time. We had 3 people and chose to sit outside. Small seating area but nice when the weather is good. Our waiter was a nice, polite young man.  We ordered our drinks and placed an order for 4 small tapas. We waited, waited...watched people come after us, order, eat and leave and we still had NOTHING. Our waiter said our ticket was lost in the kitchen so it will be right out?? 48 minutes after placing our appetizer order we finally had something to nibble on. By this time the entire patio was empty and the staff began to clear the table cloths, etc. Not once did someone from management even stop by the table. We had to wait again to place an order for dinner. We ordered the Shrimp Pad Thai with a level of 3 of 5. It came out Zero of 5. Absolutely no spice at all. If we had a spice tray we could have tried to add some flavor.  After 2.5 hours it was a long process. The food should have been much better based on all the reviews.    We will give this one more shot but they will need to seriously step it up. The food (will post pictures of each): Phuket Poppers: Jalepenos,  stuffed with cheese, breaded and cut in half. It has 6 but size pieces which equals 2.5 jalepenos for $9, 5 spice Ribs: ribs were spiced nice but were tough and not much meat at all. Presentation was nice. Would have preferred tender meat and more meat than bone. Larb Chicken Cups: romain lettuce leaves with chicken larb on top. Needed more lime, a few more slivers of red onion and the spice tray. Volcano Shrimp: bowl of butterflied shrimp, breaded in a bowl with sliced jalapeno slices that are presented on fire. Presentation was nice but only 4 shrimp and again not a lot of flavor. Yum baked shrimp ordered spice level 3. 5 shrimp served on a bed of romaine lettuce in a sauce. Forget the sauce. This came with the most flavor of any dish. Pad Thai shrimp: OMG this was just a bowl of super slimy noodles, NO and I mean NO flavor and 5 shrimp, few bean sprouts and tablespoon of crushed peanuts on the side. Two of us took two bites and told the third person they could have it.   All three of us were just shocked and out evening. Again not once did the manager stop by our table. We weren't sure if our nice waiter had screwed up with our ticket or if management is just poor. But either way. The food we ordered should have been better all around. When we received our bill we would have thought they would have at least comped our Thai iced tea or something but Nothing at all.  We will try again and update pictures and review. Hoping for the best.

XDAUoN5oan1ZSfCghWSuUA.text: We have gone to this restaurant for years.  Tonight we were having dinner and had not even been their for an hour and were asked to move from our table to continue our conversation at the bar.  Really.  Then the manager said two hour time limit.  So I suggest that people do not go here if you plan to have a relaxing dinner.  We won't be back.

JdnY4IdFZbplEgnpx8YonA.text: I can not believe I didn't write a review for this place. My husband and I have dined here about 25 times in 4 years (no joke!) We bring a different group of friends or family with us most of the time. First off let me just say that this place is about a 25 minute drive from our house but definitely worth the drive. It is a small intimate restaurant with servers that are very knowledgeable about the food menu as well as the wines that they offer. Thursdays it is 1/2 off bottles of wine all day and night, so plan on taking a Lyft to and from (we do)! Servers Devyn, Poom, and Josh are extremely friendly and always remember our favorite wines and dishes. The five spiced bbq ribs, seared ahi tuna, the green apple salad with soft shell crab, the crab rolls, the bacon wrapped shrimp with pineapple-chili sauce, volcano shrimp, and crispy pork belly are great tapas/small plates. If you like soups and salads try the Thai bouillabaisse and the Thai beef salad but with the salad ask for some cashew-lime dressing to add to it YUM! As for the entrees, you can not go wrong. Every dish is so flavorful and unique. Nittaya really put her heart and soul into her recipes. The garlic-basil lamb chops, the duck breast curry, crying tiger ribeye, and emerald fried rice are amazing. Save room for dessert too which they call "happy endings"! The Thai donuts with coconut rum caramel sauce and the Family style coconut ice cream with coconut sticky rice and served in a whole young coconut are two must haves. If you like a good sweet riesling with your spicy food, I recommend the Monchhof Mosel Riesling Spatlese.

ASJZOJcio3ME8D4YFkZiBA.text: Their curries are really tasty. I think they do a great job in keeping the authenticity. I really enjoyed the choice of wine and my favorite the pad kee mao.  Will definitely return here for some delicious Thai cuisine.

K2F86XyYT5BJjCevzoHZ4Q.text: I have spent a lot of time in Northern and Southern California where there are big Thai communities and the restaurants work very hard to be the best in their food genre. This place is cute and they worked very hard to make it look amazing...which it does. The waitstaff is awesome. They are attentive and they are friendly.  The food is Thai food for people who haven't had real Thai food. Thai food should have layers of flavor all working together.   For example..we ordered the Coconut Soup and the FOB Rice (Fresh off Pineapple Boat). These items were tasty, except the chicken that is being used for this was cooked in such a way that they could use in in both dishes. These means that the chicken has to be cooked with no discernable taste. Although the soup and the Rice were really awesome, when you get to the pieces of chicken, they haven't been able to develop any flavor and they are extremely bland. This takes a potentially awesome dish and kills the awesomeness.  We did order a few appetizers, Curry Puffs, Secret Stickers, and Edamame. The Curry Puffs and  Secret Stickers are interestingly enough cooked in what seems to be a Bisquick-type dough instead of the typical Thai-style dumpling shao-mai wrappers. The Edamame had the layers of flavor and heat that I was looking for.  When I expressed to the waitress that I wished that the food was a little hotter, she did bring me three things to add to my meal. The first one was a dish of pepper flakes, the second was something that may have been sriracha and the last was the sriracha with the pepper flakes in it. Thai sauces should vary, not just be about heat but should be about traditional Thai flavors.  We also ordered 2 entrees, the Crying Tiger Steak and the Kao-Soi (Pork Shoulder). The steak arrived cooked perfectly but cold. (This is why many restaurants will tell you that a plate is hot when they serve your food...a room temperature plate will lower the heat of your meal by 10 degrees or more by the time it gets to your table) and the Kao-Soi in this bath of really tasty but a sloppy mess of slightly overcooked egg noodles. The pork was cooked perfectly. All was tasty.  WIll we go back? No. There are so many places in Vegas that we will only return to the ones that have memorable food...and there are a lot of Thai restaurants to visit.   Secret Garden, thank you for the wonderful memory...but for us, it's .

3G7a0xWns9LvRE-rCmOOrg.text: What a great place! I can't believe I've been living in Summerlin for 3 years, and just started coming to Nittaya's...   The food here is not exactly authentic Thai, but the flavors and the dishes are incredible! The noodles are delicious, but come here for the appetizers/tapas! Tapas are good for sharing, and I've heard their potstickers and wings are delicious!  I ordered the Secret Spinach Salad....which, despite the name, is not at all a healthy dose of spinach. It's crispy fried spinach with an awesome tangy light dressing that is just a tad bit spicy....it's incredible. I also ordered the Crab Meat Fried Rice, which was very tasty and had some good chunks of crabmeat :)   I will definitely be back to try some more dishes.  Decor is dark & romantic. Service is solid. Only thing is they don't really like to make substitutions/changes to the menu (ie we asked to remove the fried egg from the bangkok fried rice, but the waitress said no).

2S49_cgyvP8aq95_ba3tSQ.text: Everything was so good. The pad Thai, bbq ribs, spinach salad (best spinach I've ever had in my life), and the pork & vegetable egg rolls were all delicious. We showed up at 9:30pm, which is 30 minutes before closing, so I can understand why the service wasn't the best. The staff was still very friendly, though.

drDtTDi-UPlt88Ym6W-ROQ.text: Amazing food and service! Very nice ambience. We had the secret potstickers, tempura spinach salad, shrimp curry, pork green bean curry, and the bread pudding and everything was delicious. So glad we finally tried this place, will definitely be frequenting!

PF2OZVWVkT0RL-B2JxWA1w.text: Food was VERY spicy... usually they will identify what is spicy or not.  Expensive for what you get.  $14 for Fried Rice on lunch menu.  Had ordered a dish and then decided to cancel before dish was served.  Owner insisted I pay for the dish even thou I had not received it yet.  Overall nothing special for the price. hF1vpd4asP52CG-NH48lUg.text: Another 5 star Thai place, in the desert!    This one is a small little place in Summerlin, but its stellar.   Great service, great food, some specialties here that are pretty yummy.   The fried shrimp with peppers is insane.  Pad Thai amazing, they have it down.  The other dishes are just sublime.  Get jiggy with it and check out Nittayas secrets....they are secret, and they work wonders for your thai loving tastebuds....mmmmm   5 star stuff here!

WcQvl6xSceDqRptSRVoIrQ.text: Generally, I find the trend of fusion restaurants to be an empty fad.  Most of the time, one restaurant blending two culinary traditions simply fails at both of them, rather than creating something interesting.  So I walked into Nittaya's Secret Kitchen, which offers a fusion of tapas and Thai foods, with a heavy bias.  But I left pleasantly surprised because Nittaya's has mastered the art of juggling -- offering a wonderful selection of Thai and tapas fusion dishes that are often better than what you'd find in Thai or tapas restaurant.    When we were there, we had the fried avocado for an appetizer.  It's the only time I've ever used the terms "airy" and "fried" to describe the same dish, but it really was an inventive combination with the delightful fried crispy shell surrounding the soft tastiness of a fresh avocado.  If you head over there, I'd put the fried avocado on your "must have" list.    We also ordered the spinach salad, which was tasty, but not quite as magical as the fried avocado.  The spinach salad also comes with fried spinach leaves, which are tasteless on their own.  But dip the fried spinach leaves in the sweet cashew sauce provided on the side and it's fairly tasty.  A distant second to that lovely avocado, but creative in its own right.  For the mean course, we stuck with a more traditional Thai and ordered the red curry with chicken.  And kudos to Nittaya's for not dialing back the spice.  The red curry was spicier that I was expecting and super flavorful.  And they treat the ingredients right.  The vegetables?  Cooked and crisp.  The chicken?  Tender.  And they didn't skimp on the vegetables in the curry.  All in all, one of the better Thai places I've eaten in Vegas.  The prices are a little steep, but creativity doesn't come cheap in culinary land.  4.5 stars overall.

RmNH7UEzEcvgZyCu9SdnOA.text: This is my absolute favorite restaurant in the Summerlin area bar none.  Nittaya's Thai food is exquisite.  The decor is lovely and the service is always good.  This was the first place I ever experienced dishes such green papaya salad, seafood prepared in a coconut husk, seafood madness or "spinach salad."  I could never be satisfied at a run of a mill restaurant such as Archie's again.  Pad thai and yellow curry seem so boring now!

jVEN8nBKGlntYTuJ6bsTJg.text: spinach salad is awesome! Lunch specials are affordable which includes a small salad, gyoza and entree. Tried almost everything in the menu and so far not disappointed at all.

b-d8kTQvveqCvjYzs3p2CQ.text: This is a beautiful little restaurant with delicious food! Everything our party ordered - including the vegan dishes my husband and I chose - was excellent. The servers were quite knowledgeable about what menu items are vegan, and were happy to find out for me when they didn't know. The food presentation was also lovely, though I'm used to less expensive restuarants, so the menu seemed a little pricey to me.

hKp8ZSLkB7jFwXfLkLPo5A.text: Restaurant is very small. I suppose that's the new fad. The food is superb. It is very pricey so be prepared to spend about $20 per entree.

aSxa-rs4CQlXQNFpLeXo6w.text: I took my sister to Nittaya's Secret Kitchen for dinner.   Thursday is half price wine night, but we were already looking forward to their delicious fruity red Sangria.  We had the charred shishito peppers  - sweet, salty and delicious.  I had to have the spinach salad - the lime dipping sauce is a perfect compliment to the crispy tempura shrimp.  The coconut shrimp with mango pineapple was our third pick.  The shrimp were large, firm and flavorful.  Another great night at Nittaya's!

FGcMeqcZ4QPWSHMkChvw8g.text: In a city of many fine Asian restaurants, this one is a gem for Thai food.  The food is original and delicious.  Pad noodles, salmon in green curry, lamb chops, appetizers--all good.  Service and ambience are fabulous.  Small intimate dining in a hideaway location.

Os57SJt9jU3Xsb7lv-5qQQ.text: OMG!!!!   What happens when Thai food meet AMAZING? It's Nittaya's Hidden Kitchen.  This small local restaurant is a pleasant surprise!!

My1QEA3C26ndzWEaNgLvyQ.text: To begin, I am not the biggest fan of thai food to begin with, but this place was great.  We went with another couple and seemed to order everything on the menu.  I don't like spinach, but they got a spinach salad that was great, the lamb was excellent too.  I would make a reservation if going for dinner as it was super packed and the place is relatively small.

mWVJ4ELO6oP9z8gbgGD2cQ.text: My wife and I found this place a few years ago and always make it a mandatory stop anytime we're in Vegas.  It's small without a lot of tables, but we've never had any problems getting in with large parties . . . even up to 11.  I don't have the menu in front of me, so I may get some of the names wrong, but these dishes are always on our list...chicken satay for the kids...they even love the peanut sauce.  Garlic rice and the pineapple rice.  The coconut soup is awesome and all the other chicken and beef dishes have never disappointed.  Hopefully the Secret Kitchen will always be a secret...

1PJpo48hSChCbriXEHGSjw.text: This should be kept a secret so that no one has the terrible food I had.  There are many great Thai places in Las Vegas and there is no need to eat here.    The only plus is that the tiny dining room is cute.  Hopefully this bodes for them going out of business and someone who can cook can come in.    Firecracker prawns were deep fried breaded shrimp with some sauce drizzled on, really would a ramekin of sauce kill you?  Normally I am used to prawns in yummy egg roll wrappers.   My husband sent back the drunken noddles because it had eggs, which we have never had in any Thai restaurant ever.  He then got a very unremarkable basil chicken which was had so much gristle he had to spit it out.    My crab fried rice either had fake crab or really terrible crab.   The only okay thing was the chicken satay we ordered for the children.  The water was infused with fruit, that wasn't bad.   The presentation was all stick on a slice of pineapple.  Either figure out some new plating or serve it family style.

_xAr5WkwEDVgqOR0GsNNng.text: Love this place! Food has always been excellent and it's a great place for a date because the atmosphere is cozy and trendy. Make sure to get reservations on the weekend because it is very tiny and fills up quickly.

cz--s_mcEE1FW4fcdhC8TA.text: This little place has been a couple of different restaurants that haven't made it, but I sure hope this latest reincarnation lasts.  It's another place right in my neighborhood and I'm happy to report that it was a fine dining experience, as in great!  I had the spinach salad, which, as other reviewers have said, is a must:  it's tempura spinach--where else can you get that?  I also ordered the grilled mango shrimp, which is shrimp wrapped in bacon with a mango sauce: I did not share this dish.  My date had the  grilled salmon-avocado curry, which he loved and ate all by himself because I'm allergic to fish, but it gave me a good excuse to hoard my shrimp.  We finished off the meal with the fried bananas with coconut ice cream--wow!  Service was excellent throughout, but it's hard to be neglected in such a small space--I would recommend reservations if you go.  This place shouldn't be a secret because I want it to stay--check it out for yourself soon!

LqDsou2kAp9LYtsv_Y22jQ.text: We went there Christmas Eve on the recommendation of friends who love this place. I would recommend reservations, as the room is quite small. One of my companions and I split tapas of beef jerky and egg rolls. The jerky was quite good, but the egg rolls seemed pretty standard. The spinach salad is amazing, and as I live close by, I drop by frequently to pick it up at lunch time to go. The entrees we had were very good... just the right amount of "bite" in the items that were supposed to bite.   A couple of downs that kept me from giving it a fifth star. First, the room is *really* dark; so much so that my 17-year old couldn't see the menu, and he can read the Lord's Prayer off the head of a pin. The manager told me they'd had a few comments about this, and may invest in some penlights to help patrons. Since the menu is eclectic, it really helps to be able to read it. The second thing was that two of my companions are vegetarians, a fact of which I made very clear to the waiter when we came in. One of my companions ordered the Tofu Pad Thai, which she said was quite good until she was about a third through it and found that in addition to the tofu, it contained... chicken. Buzz kill. They were very apologetic, but this should *not* happen, ever, and it was exacerbated by the fact that the restaurant lights are so dim that it is sometime hard to discern what you're eating.   Overall, I thought the food great, the service acceptable, but the ambience too dark.  That's just my opinion. I coud be wrong.

FYbvD-ImCQR3F0LcNQuX0A.text: We went here a few weeks ago, wanting Thai food and after reading the Yelp reviews deciding that this looked good.  Let's just say we were blown away.  We had the best server/bartender that was beyond helpful!  He helped us with recommendations and led us to a great meal.  We had the spinach "salad" which was amazing!  We also had the pineapple fried rice served in a pineapple boat and chicken pad thai!  Everything was beyond our expectations.  We cannot wait to return again with friends!

nebvHIzPmvKg845gZc59Qg.text: Interesting menu and tasty, but has small portions that are overpriced. No exaggeration.

2Go2NcLGKnt2n3Ov39tFKg.text: Probably the only Thai place in Summerlin that I know.  I don't know maybe. I'm not an expert or something. But the food was decent for a Thai place. If you want real good Thai place  look up noodle house and pin kaow pretty good places.

K02HZJ7YBrZ1th1S50Q_9w.text: The restaurant was clean and comfortable. The food presentation was beautiful.  And the taste was delicious!  We came in just before the dinner rush but the service was just as good, even when the restaurant filled up. The prices were reasonable and there were enough leftovers to enjoy the dinner again.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado salmon curry.  Just as beautiful as it taste!
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut seafood curry.    Delicious! Just the right amount of coconut!

Vkb6LnxjlhnKONVEPSEZnQ.text: One of the best Thai places in the world! The unique twist on some of those dishes leave your mouth full of confusion yet completely satisfied. The flavors, presentation, portions and service top notch! Next time I'm visiting Vegas I'll definitely find the time to grab drinks and delicious Thai Tapas.

W6l0LzgPmiRZIFeYstO_PQ.text: Nittaya's Secret Kitchen is just that (a secret) it definitely is a diamond in the rough in regards to location. It's a little hard to find if you don't know the area well. It's tucked away behind all the buildings on the Southeast corner of Lake Mead Blvd. and Rampart Blvd. I had to bring the crew here because I've been telling them about it for a while. They were blown away. They absolutely loved it, it was good to see how much everybody else liked it. I feel like I'm always biased because of how much I like my favorite restaurants but this was different, everyone at the table couldn't stop talking about how good the food was. So I knew it wasn't me being biased. The staff is extremely friendly and kind. The restaurant itself is decorated with style and class. It's very clean inside and they pride themselves with running a tight ship. Anyway if you decide to make the trip down to Nittaya's Secret Kitchen just order your favorite Thai dish and buckle up because you're in for a treat..! Ciao

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GrwhpXEpb-jqVOOzLtNyJg.text: The atmosphere here is top notch and the food is delicious!! Totally random, but one of my favorite things to do here is to eat the orchids that garnish the plate. First off. This restaurant taught me that orchids are even edible. But secondly I was shocked to find they actually taste really good.  More generally though, the food here is all top notch. Flavored well. Delicate and rich flavors. Good ambiance. Everything is top notch.

aqu2hergx4VaMVPlHiNPsg.text: Found another hole-in-the-wall in town I like!  Came here for a work dinner, and was a bit surprised that it only had about 6 tables, very small. Intimate and contemporary ambiance with a nice fully stocked bar off to one side of the restaurant. We ordered an appetizer and 2 entrees and shared. The food was hands down Thai Fusion done right. The avocado curry was amazing, not something you will find in Thailand but nevertheless very delicious.  Our Thai waitress was very sweet and attentive, and so was the bartender who served our drinks. Our dinner came out to be a bit over $100 for 2 people.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rice pudding with ice cream
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado steak curry
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Papaya salad

SrnpN1FXzdYbTAKjBGBT7w.text: I had eaten here years ago and was honestly not impressed but I was convinced to give it one more try and I'm so glad I did!  Everything was cooked and seasoned  to perfection. The one down side is that it's pricier than most other Thai restaurants BUT you're paying for the atmosphere so it makes it worth it. It's quiet and relaxing in this restaurant, something most other Thai places aren't. On top of that the servers are friendly and helpful. I will definitely be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UaFJJc44_aQfZ5y_fOspgw.text: Took my parents there who have never had Thai food and can handle a little bit of spice.  Spinach tempura is amazing. Garlic spare ribs were crispy and tender... Well seasoned. Lamb chops melt in your mouth cooked medium... Sauce to die for!  Panaang shrimp curry was creamy and nice.. wish I ordered it spicier but wanted to share with my folks.  Nice atmosphere, service was attentive but not overwhelmed.  Would definitely recommend.  A little pricey but they can stand behind the quality of the food and service. Good job!

1Ewnk5AyZ1YX93WUI0rbOg.text: A few weeks after our initial visit, we came back and ordered takeout. which took 30 min after placing our order, Food was still amazing and 2 dishes was plenty to share with 2-3 people and have leftovers.  The fact they do take out this quickly is a game changer. It wasn't too much more than ordering take-out from another place that focuses on take-out/delivery.  If you don't have the time to dine-in or want something catered, I would highly recommend trying take-out. It'd be hard to find quality this good at most take-out places.

UlBUsVIdEZ6IS3uVjTv6BA.text: My previous experience was absolutely wonderful but last night we went and two of us had Cornish hands which were dry and two of us had shrimp dishes and the shrimp was kind of rubbery meaning it was overcooked I was very disappointed. I didn't say anything last night but I really should've sorry to give you a bad review but I've always liked your place in the past but last night was not up to par. Did you get a new cook?  We brought two new people with a set of never been and we told them it was fabulous they were disappointed. Very unfortunate.

R2Ok47D54Jyfyv51xX7GXA.text: I like this place when I go to Vegas. It's the bomb. The quality is amazing and they care about their customers. I get the pineapple fried rice with gf sauce.

Ag6ImdMFPCPWSapKhwhYhg.text: I went here to celebrate a friend's birthday. Didn't really know what to expect except I heard that it was fabulous. Believe me. It lived up to the hype. Absolutely delicious. Fried spinach and corn fritters are a must. Shrimp Pad Thai was one of the best I've ever had. The drunken chicken was outstanding. Highly recommend. Btw. We had reservations. It's a small (adorable) place so I'd suggest making them before hand.

F2MEMRhDyuzmkaxsCLfIMA.text: We came and sampled 6 tapas and two desserts and all we ate was delicious. We sampled the beef jerky, crying baby tiger, chicken satay crab rolls golden pouches and pot stickers from the small plates and the banana chocolate beignet and mango rice desserts. Highly recommended.

386YmoD31fhWRwq2rX8ktw.text: I love the food at this Thai restaurant. One of my favorite dishes is the coconut Seafood Curry. It is served in a coconut with Jasmine rice on the side so many different types of seafood in side the coconut with wonderful Curry coconut sauce delicious. I always love going back there to see what's new and on the menu so many wonderful things to try.

x93bLVQOAxkfNCsKzmEcIg.text: This place designed very nicely, but the best part is not only the design, their food is great! Until now it's the best Thai restaurant I ate, especially in Las Vegas.  I love their "happy nooners" menu, great value for your money! The service was good, restaurant was clean and because of yelp - another great find (I found this restaurant few months ago).  For desert I tried the mango coconut rice, I enjoyed it :)

0q4PRVUJlcnfMAi0Sq68kQ.text: I ate there for the first time last week. Excellent service nice quiet place. Great lunch specials, food was delicious and quick. Friendly staff.Ill be returning again very soon.

y8wSUJBiG3tIyLRqr1SI-g.text: Came here with a girlfriend- her recommendation. Wow- impressed! It is charming and has an attractive dining room and good vibe.  Food was presented beautifully and was delicious. Cannot wait to go back!

YOOWvXnoxyKIHM8lFxh8-Q.text: I notified the waitress that I had a severe allergy and inquired if they could accommodate it and she said "yes" and would let me know what dishes I could eat. Long story short, she was very busy between other tables and seating tables so I had to ask other servers passing by about the dishes to ensure they did not contain shellfish.  Somewhere along the line there had been some cross contamination as I had an allergic reaction. When I later called to speak w a manager about my frustration with the poor communication and/or execution of handling food allergies, they apologized and said there's nothing they could do but would like to offer me a free desert.   I understand not all restaurants are able to accommodate allergies and that's not the problem as long as that expectation is set in the beginning.

88UwdoBVT6PnW5zExqNG5Q.text: The food is sooooo yummy!! The atmosphere is so comforting and chill as well. My favorite part was the Bangkok tea and how they served it in a cast iron kettle. The waitress was so sweet and helpful! I had no idea what I was doing or what I was ordering and she picked that up quickly and explained things to me/suggested things for me. She rocked!

SBvj6M9-5L1fxvNTzPAnUw.text: Wow I'd have to say that this place is a hidden gem! Romantic ambience and authentic Thai food is the theme. I started off with a beautiful white sangria that had a flower in it. Be careful, these are dangerous! They are very sweet and go down very easily. We tried multiple tapas including the golden pouches, fried avocado, and Siamese corn fritters. My favorite of these were the corn fritters. They had a crunchy exterior with a soft stuffing including kernels of corn, pork and spices. The sauce that came with these was delicious! It was sweet and had peanuts floating in it. The golden pouches were also very tasty. I got these to try their curry sauce which was excellent. These pouches were so pretty I didn't even want to eat them! The fried avocado was also very tasty and an interesting concept. At last I tried the chocolate banana beignets. OMG these were divine. They were stuffed with a deep dark chocolate and bananas in the inside. They were then drizzled with chocolate on the outside. They came hot and freshly fried. This place serves a multitude of wines and had two beers on tap.  It did not appear that they serve any type of mixed drinks or hard liquor. This secret place is definitely a restaurant that should not be kept secret!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White sangria
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried avocado
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gUHKjf3IFLUEkMsyYIsC3Q.text: Returned to find the expanded space as Nittaya's Secret Kitchen took over the adjacent suite and added more seating.  Closely-arranged tables and chairs make for close quarters and careful navigation.  Service was friendly, courteous, and helpful with gluten-free and vegan options.  The vegan coconut ice cream is a wonderfully sweet, refreshing treat.  Tofu green curry was tasty with a light coconut broth.  It's a good idea to make dinner reservations.

NidAau8UKn8ZXIsnkScuug.text: Ate in this place many times but noticed that they are not keeping the same quality. The food is expensive, but not enough food. Brought chicken green curry and there were no chicken. The same with the salmon. Last time I ate at this place for lunch, I got super sick. I still trying to feel better but my stomach and my belly hurts no stop. Not sure what was in that food that made me so sick. I will never go back there again.

D73-47TflYss-ZKEpmDWFg.text: Beautiful and intimate little restaurant. The service was stellar and the food was delicious. Nice wine list. The only drawback is you are very close to to your neighbors.

SUmbmnH_f1zOipq1SXrfgg.text: I can make this really easy: if you like P.F. Chang's, you'll like this place. It's good food, don't get me wrong, but it's not stand-out. The place is really small and we had to eat at the bar, no biggie, but it filled up quickly and we were lucky to have gotten seats. Make reservations if you want to try it out!  My fiance seemed to enjoy this place much more than me, and she holds it in a higher regard than P.F. Chang's for sure.   I ordered my meal 5/5 spicy, and extra spicy if he could do it. To me, not spicy at all. My lady took one taste and started coughing and downing water. Sooo...depending on your tolerance level.  I ordered the Panang Curry with chicken instead of shrimp, flavor was pretty good. I also got the spicy chicken fried rice. Also tasted pretty good. But like I said, it was just P.F. Chang's quality, nothing special.   Definitely lost a star for being as expensive as it was given the food quality, but it'd be a solid 4 if the food came up a bit or the price went down.

M3qn_6tQ6wh6Qoidhjpksw.text: I came here a few months ago for a pick up order in the evening. The lad who took my order was nice and very helpful, as I was trying to make wise food choices for being a Nat noob. Upon his recommendations and my own inclinations, I ordered the bacon wrapped shrimp with mango sauce, red curry, and pad Thai (had to, it's my guiding light for Thai food judgement). Total: $43.24. Bam.  The space is cozy and intimate, and you can tell it's a local's spot. When I walked in at precisely 9.54 pm to pick up my order, there were 3 people seated away from each other at the bar area, chatting away. Very cool. It kind of reminded me of DW Bistro.  On to the fooood.  Bacon shrimp was not as awesome as I thought it would be. I couldn't taste the shrimp, but I certainly got the texture of chewy shelled animal. The bacon was good because bacon is always good. Mango sauce? Good not great, not particularly sweet. I was expecting a great flavor, something like a bacon wrapped date gives you. But this one was lacking in the flavor and texture department.  Pad Thai was very yummy. Great flavors, just enough heat, and plenty of chicken and egg to beef it up. I also appreciate that it didn't have that weird red dye color from the sauces most places use. Yay for quality ingredients!  The curry was overwhelmingly spicy. It overpowered the delicious coconut and spices underneath, of which I caught glimpses. It had a nice mix of bamboo shoots and red bell peppers. The jasmine rice it came with smelled divine and tasted great with the curry. No weird hard bits. They know how to make rice.  I would certainly go back.

UjdIfC-NCbZC-rL3G-uwLg.text: Nittaya's is the best Thai restaurant in Las Vegas.  I highly recommend this place.  I not only love the food, but the atmosphere is fantastic.  There is also a great Wine list.   My favorite dish is the Green Curry Salmon with egg plant and avocado.  Delicious!!! Crying Tiger steak is likewise fantastic.  Service is right there anticipating you needs.

wQiCA7l1G79bmWcix6YVzw.text: delicious fancy Thai food at a slightly higher price point than traditional Thai fare. But great service, friendly staff, good wine selection (50% off bottles on Thursday!). The infused waters are a nice touch. Fried spinach "salad" and the avacado salmon are my fav dishes!

OWSZcRO5UkzVLA8WgJ9mbQ.text: If you like Thai food, or if you're the kind of person that likes to try new delicious things, this place is amazing. A member of our party ordered the tempura spinach leaves for the table, which were great. I had the coconut soup to start with, played it safe with the chicken pad thai, then had the coconut creme brulee for dessert. Everything was absolutely wonderful and I can't wait to go back and try the Thai Donuts!

oB2YqbQ6_A1mzfRbhupqig.text: So, we drove from my house(east-side) to Nittaya's to take pictures since my BF is building their new website.  After about an hour there, we were starving so decided to stay and try out the food. I'm going to start by saying that I have had Thai food plenty of times in SF but will admit that I am not an expert, although, I will say that Thai and Vietnamese share a lot of the same flavors and herbs.  Let's start with the atmosphere, it's very quaint and has a very mellow vibe.  White table cloths and lit candles- lovely place for locals to have a "date night" away from the kids.  The menu has Thai Tapas- smaller plates/appetizers that range from $4-$8 a plate as well as a good selection of entrees as well as a beer/wine/sake bar.  Wish I didn't have to work the next day otherwise I would've had a nice sake with dinner.  Okay- so we ordered a few different entrees/tapas.  Here's the low down: Chicken Satay- nice and moist, slight char from grilling (which I like) and peanut sauce  Lemongrass soup-reminds me of hot and sour soup(which I love) but slightly salty. Normally I would eat it with white rice to balance out the saltiness, still still good nonetheless with great flavor  Spinach salad- the BOMB!! hello, not like a typical spinach salad!! The leaves are individually dipped in a tempura-like batter so is very light and comes with a ground chicken larb. It was SOO good! This dish alone would bring me back all the way to the other side of town for!  Green Curry with chicken-again, since I am not an Thai food expert, it was good but a little on the sweet side for me.  I usually have curry Indian style so am not used to the slightly sweet coconut flavor but the vegetables were perfectly cooked.  Combo Pad Thai-again, slightly sweet but nothing a few lime wedges and some sambal can't cure.   We finished with the coconut sticky rice and sweet mango.  Loved the coconut sticky rice but wish it was a little more moist. Mango was perfect, sweet and ripe.  Overall, A+ for me, will definitely be back to try the other dishes on the menu!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach salad
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemongrass soup
Photo of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HYdjLut6FOatav84B78Rig.text: The food quality was good, not excellent. We did order pick up, I'm sure the ambiance of the place was great. Since we only ordered 2 entrees and it was $50+ Too expensive and not enough food.

bRR1wQ8TrDaDOp1Wo7Z3eg.text: Have I written about how expensive they are?  If not, you can go to any other Thai place in the valley and get double of what you will get here.  Check your Ferrari at the door.

-8g-n7MHDk0EIC8HISZmWw.text: This quaint place has the perfect small RESTURANT atmosphere Food was excellent too

jr_VmQRUsD4tyTKLhbiYsw.text: Went there for lunch recently.  When I first walked in, the decor, music and ambiance got my attention - in a positive way.  The service was fast and excellent  - they even flavor the ice water with fresh citrus fruit. I don't know how they are able to make it so the pot stickers don't leave a thick greasy residue on your fingers but they succeed.  The basil eggplant had so many different and wonderful flavors that I almost forgot that I was having a vegetarian meal.  Overall great food, service, beautiful decor and you can tell that Nittaya put a lot of thought and care into the restaurant. Kudos!

uIGjV0MbhSLLzieGVrZqUw.text: I had a pad Thai craving and headed out for this place. I had a perfect meal with a tasty wine and sat solo at the end of the bar with my kindle, enjoying every bite.  At first, it seemed a bit pricey, $17-$18 for pad Thai (usually around $10-$15), but then I got the dish and damn, it was worth every cent...I would gladly pay that, even more, again.  The bartender/server was super helpful with wine (offering to let me try before making a selection) and food recommendations.  I'll be back to try the infamous spinach "salad" for sure.

qv9QHczFvScosvd2Gn6YsA.text: I have high expectations when it comes to Thai food and how spicy it should be and this place is beyond amazing. You can order your dishes on a spice level from 1-5, I got soup and the catfish curry at a 4 and my scalp sweated, which is how I like it. Major thumbs up. Will always make this a must when I'm in Vegas.

U0tL5xP-XwIhwC_pNqvxsg.text: ooo I think about this place all the time. It is pricier than I would want thai food to be but I just crave the spinach salad. It is not what you are thinking... this is actually no salad at all. It is lightly tempura battered spinach leaves served as chips with this delicious dip made from ground chicken, cashews, cilantro, carrots, and onions. mm mm good! That is a MUST order when going here. I love the feeling of being in there too, they set the mood for Thai perfect.  Get off yelp & go!

Y-5gciojMESdATqON3tzdg.text: The most amazing Thai food!!! Great ambiance , music and staff is amazing!! Josh was our bartender and he rocks too!

QGAAaN511u6IHObuBydwgg.text: One of the best experience I had with all the restaurants I have ever been in Las Vegas.  Tempura Spinach Salad was the so good, when you eat them, you want to order another.  The best item of the night was the dessert, home made coconut ice cream, the dessert was served in a whole young coconut shell, warm sticky rice inside of the coconut, home made ice cream on top to melt into the rice. The creaminess of the ice cream and the chewiness of the rice was the perfect mixture of texture and feelings  The ice cream was also the most expensive item of the night. But I think it was totally worth it.

MJTV6r_mVzvGShyvr0OcRQ.text: Amazing food great service,  and wine specials that are priced so well, you will buy the bottle.

0uNrU11QTGKBxmcqZ8N23Q.text: Love this place - the food, the ambiance, the SERVICE and the food again! Just perfect. Ask for Devynn if you go! She's fantastic.   This is an upscale place where you can either dress a little nicer for a great date night or a little more casual.

ZGAmM5UXjhmy6uK9wMKnBw.text: Came here to dinner with great friends and the food was awesome! Had appetizers, the spinach was great. Then had spicy basil, spicy catfish, Papaya salad and they were all amazing. If you're lucky enough to get a table you're going to live it.
